description:
Perilla is especially known for their garlic noodles, which is what I've ordered the two times I've been here. The first time blew my mind- I got the five spice chicken garlic noodles and was thoroughly impressed at the crisp and flavor of the chicken (especially when dipped in the fish sauce)! The noodles themselves were very buttery and garlicy with a nice bite to them. And I was left with enough portion for another meal to take home!

The second time I ordered the five spice chicken garlic noodle with imperial rolls, which is worth the extra dollar (because who doesn't love crispy egg rolls). However, the noodles the second time around were notably tougher, maybe due to over-sautéing it in the pan. Nonetheless, I'd totally recommend Perilla. It's top of my list for restaurants in Inner Sunset!
author: Vickie N.

description:
#27 Imperial Rolls and 5-Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle (11.85) is all you need to order here to walk out satisfied. The noodles are buttery. Boneless tender pieces of juicy chicken. Crunchy egg rolls. Yum.

Casual spot with high quality Vietnamese food!
author: Raymond W.

description:
Forget everything else on the menu except the 5 spice chicken. My mind was blown at how delicious the 5 spice chicken was! The chicken itself was juicy and flavorful, but the skin was amazing. I typically tend to stay away from eating the chicken skin but this was too delicious not to! The garlic noodles were also really good, but it was pretty standard. I usually prefer to have my garlic more fried for the garlic noodles. I also tried the rare beef and meatball pho, which was just okay. The broth had a "meatier" flavor that I was used to. Like I said before, stick with the 5 spice chicken! 

One of the perks of this chain are the prices. The food was very reasonable priced, especially for San Francisco with most dishes priced around $10-12. I would totally recommend this place to anyone visiting SF!
author: Hollie W.

description:
Came here because it was a cold day (when isn't it a cold day) and wanted pho, stayed because of the garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken.

Coming from Little Saigon in Orange County, I've had better pho, but mad props to the noodle dish and its generous portion.
author: Cam C.

description:
I went here for an early dinner with 11 people. Most of us got the garlic noodles with five spice chicken since we heard that's what they're known for. One of my friends got the chicken curry with rice, which was still good, but the curry was very thin and watery.

The garlic noodles were very good! Not too garlicky, but also not too plain. I loved the 5 spice chicken. The chicken wasn't hard to chew, not dry, and was very flavorful. I'd recommend this place for their garlic noodle plates.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I love this place! I've had better vermicelli bowls but their 5 Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles are to die for (I really like the Imperial Rolls as well because they have bits of taro in them). The chicken is perfectly juicy and the skin is lightly crispy, and the noodles were chewy and tasty! The portions are huge, and I can usually only eat half and get to save the other half for later (still tastes just as good after microwaving). The waitstaff are so sweet, and I always take people visiting the city to eat here!

I prefer this location to the one in SoMa because I feel like they give bigger portions and the chicken is not overly crispy.
author: Alice C.

description:
I had to look up what Perilla means and discovered it's an Asian plant belonging to the mint family used in various Asian dishes, particularly in Southeast Asia. I also found out Perilla has several stores in San Francisco and Bay Area belonging to the PPQ family enterprise. 

Any mention of PPQ and they are known for their famous Garlic Noodles. Wifey wanted to eat here this Friday as I picked her up after work. It was on the way home and this restaurant is located on Irving in the Inner Sunset, and area that we haven't been much to in a long time. 

Parking is always going to be a challenge coming here and it's gonna take a lot of patience. The area has changed from what I could remember when we would frequent this area when Wifey was taking lamaze classes at UCSF. And speaking of patience, I've never seen so many drivers honk their horns in this particular area as we were exploring and rediscovering this neighborhood. 

We got here just after 7PM and even though it was busy, we managed to snag a table before it quickly filled up after. Checked the menu and I ordered the # 29, which comes with Garlic Noodles, Imperial Rolls and Beef while Wifey got the Garlic Noodles, Pork and Imperial Rolls. Yes, they're pretty similar aside from the choice of protein and I also got a side of broth for good measure to warm me up on a typical chilly San Francisco night.

The food came out fairly quickly, which we appreciated and the portions were definitely generous. I tasted the Imperial Rolls first as I dipped a piece in the sauce and was satisfied. However, I noticed that every subsequent bite was a repetitive monotone notes in flavors and texture that culminated into a lot of mushiness. The rolls appeared to be somewhat crispy and borderline soggy at the same time. I tasted Wifey's rolls for comparison and I had the same conclusion. 

My order of beef had a good marinade to it as it had both sweet and salty notes for added kick. I tasted my Wifey's pork and they were better than the beef, in my opinion. As for the Garlic Noodles, I expected it to be the same as PPQ, but it was a bit of a disappointment. Yes, it was nice, but it was lacking the garlic and sweetness that is the standard for garlic noodles. 

But overall, it was satisfying and the dishes were fairly inexpensive and generous servings that we had leftovers to take home. I'd like to try their other dishes and the Five Spice Chicken is on my next list. 

I'd give it a solid 3 1/2 stars on our first visit. Hope it'll make me change my mind on my next one.
author: John G.

description:
Perilla's is always my go to spot for a quick lunch or dinner.
They are well known for their garlic noodle dishes in which is my usually go to when I visit Perilla's.

When we Arrived the restaurant was filled but we were readily seated right away for a table of 2.

They offered waters and napkins with a menu, but right away me and my Girlfriend knew what to order. So we waived the waitress down to get our orders in.

My girlfriend order the #9 which is a curry chicken vermicelli soup dish extra tofu for her please, Perfect on  a cold foggy  SF day! The curry soup  was rich and flavorful with coconut milk, For a curry soup it definitely had a lot of chicken which is good in my case! The tofu and vermicelli were perfectly cooked and very enjoyable.

I order the #27 which is the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The 5 spice chicken was cooked just right nice and crispy dipping in with the fish sauce, the imperials were nice and crispy not too soggy like some places that just reheat them to order. Garlic noodles definitely had a lot of flavor compared to what i was use to and generous portion at that.

Perilla's will always be a go to for those dishes if not the Pho. Sometimes I'm so hungry i order the Pho Dac Biet, With 5 spice chicken garlic noodles just to have the best of both worlds!
author: Timothy C.

description:
Perilla checks most all of my boxes when I'm looking for a "go-to" place to eat; cheap (relatively), tasty, and good portions.

We came in on a Monday evening around 5PM and were seated and served quickly (always a plus). 

After reading countless Yelp! reviews about their garlic noodles, I decided that whatever I ordered it had to have noodles with it. I ended up going with the five spice chicken/ imperial roll combo with the garlic noodles and boy was I happy I did. The chicken looked similar in portion size to just the regular 5 spice chicken and noodle combo, and the imperial rolls added some necessary texture change when my mouth got tired of chewing on noodles and chicken. The noodles themselves had just the right amount of garlic in them as to give it a great taste and not completely kill your breath for the rest of the day. 

The meal was about $10-$11 sin tax & tip, and at that price in the city you can't really ask for much else. The meal got me really full, and if I was trying to be extremely frugal I probably could have split it into two meals with a protein shake as a supplement. The waiters at the restaurant were very kind and promptly addressed anything we needed. 

All in all, a great place to go to if you're in the area and you need to get a full stomach on a budget.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Mouthwateringly delicious garlic noodles, attentive and speedy service, and wallet friendly prices make Perilla a winning choice!

My dad and I stopped here for lunch during a recent trip to San Francisco, after a hike in the nearby hills.

The restaurant's atmosphere can be best described as hole-in-the-wall, and appears to be a local favorite, as it was almost fully occupied at 4:30 PM on a Monday afternoon. 

We both got the garlic noodles (thanks to my fellow Yelpers who had enthusiastically recommended this dish). I picked the spicy curry chicken with mine, and my dad opted for the charbroiled shrimp. We also got one order each of the Vietnamese coffee (both iced and hot).

The garlic noodles were delicious - made with oodles of butter and garlic, fragrant and filling, without weighing us down too much. The chicken curry and the shrimp we're both flavorful as well, though I'd have loved to see some vegetables included in my chicken curry. If this is your first time at Perilla, DO NOT SKIP THE GARLIC NOODLES!!!

The Vietnamese coffee is served in quite a unique way (see pictures), and you can customize it to have as much or as little of the condensed milk as you want. I'm all about the condensed milk, so I swirled my coffee to scrape out every last bit of it. The coffee is smooth and spiced deliciously.

We were served our food in under 5 minutes, and the servers were so kind and attentive. I accidentally ordered both our coffees iced, and when I requested that he replace one with a hot coffee, our server did so with a smile and without any additional cost.

Lunch for two was under $40, including tip, so while this place is a bit pricier than your usual hole in the wall the portions are HUGE, and I was able to make a second lunch out of my order.

My only gripe is that Perilla is SO FAR from where I live (i.e. Chicago). Booo!
author: Shivani P.

description:
Lovely pho, lightning fast service, and reasonable prices. What's not to love?

I came here for lunch after a breakfast that wasn't very filling and ordered the combo beef pho that comes with rare beef, meatballs, and brisket. The brisket in particular was super tender and delicious, and the meatballs were flavorful. The broth was also delicious! The soup was noodle heavy, so if you're into that, you'll love this pho. The price was also very decent--less than $10 for a huge bowl that filled two people! I also have to note that their Thai tea is wonderful.

We waited maaaaybe 5 minutes for our food, probably less than that. The servers were friendly and attentive. I can't wait to come back here to get my next pho fix!
author: Claire C.

description:
Ordered #27 - combo with garlic noodles, imperial roll, five spice chicken, and some steamed veggies. Garlic noodles are super garlicky and chewy, which I love. Imperial roll is crispy, not too oily. Five spice chicken is great - tender and flavorful, skin is crispy as well. And the veggies are a great bonus since the other three components are pretty heavily flavorful. The portion is huge! I usually can't finish, but the garlic noodles taste just as good heated up.

Definitely try this place! Delicious and very decently priced.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. Food is good. Everytime I come, service is good. However, my take out from last night changed my perception of the restaurant. I ordered an imperial roll and pork with garlic noodles. I ordered on a Friday night 10 mins before 9pm, which is their closing time. I asked if I can still order take out. Since I've worked at a restaurant before, I know how annoying it is when there are orders coming in if they have started cleaning the kitchen. They said it's ok and should be ready in 10 mins. 

They charged me as 2 separate orders for about 20 dollars. Then I checked on yelp to confirm that the exact same item is $11.25. It's not like the separate order had extra egg rolls, so I'm not sure why it was charged separately. That wasn't the main issue. The issue is with the inconsistent of their food. I've ordered the bbq pork with garlic noodle before. It was 3 pieces of pork attached to the bone which each piece is about the size of the palm. They cut up part of the pork for your convenience but the whole piece is still intact to the bone. Maybe because I ordered around closing time, the food I received looked liked scraps. It was just small dried pieces of pork put together in an order. (See pic attached).

I really like this place and it was a disappointment. I'm not sure if I would order take out here again especially before closing time.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
First time here and service was quick and prompt. Got a seat right away even though the restaurant was packed. 

My friend recommended the garlic noodles  omg this dish was so good!! Comes with a juicy pork and 1 broccoli  lol (just one to even out the food pyramid). 

I'm definitely coming back for a second round.
author: Kent B.

description:
I had #29, which contains the famous garlic noodles that everyone loves. The pork was thinly sliced and just slightly charred. Flavoring was great! The imperial rolls were just as good as the hype. I wish the dipping sauce that they gave was a little stronger in flavor though. The rolls were perfectly crispy as well. And of course, your meal comes with a HEAPING pile of garlic noodles! The garlic wasn't overpowering- instead, it was quite fragrant. And on the up side, this place is very generous when it comes to portion sizes. 

Perilla is a good choice for a satisfying meal. Of course, parking isn't ideal, so I wish you the best of luck. I don't know if I'd be dying to return soon though. The food didn't knock my socks off, but I did enjoy it.
author: Amber T.

description:
Can't go wrong with five spice chicken, garlic noodles and imperial rolls.

What I tried:
*Five spice chicken, garlic noodles, imperial rolls

Overall thoughts: 
*I order the same thing everytime and usually share the imperial rolls with a friend 

*Four stars for the food even though the staff was arguing loudly with each other that all the customers turned their heads

*Usually a full restaurant of customers but still get seated right away 

*Parking in the area can be hard but its worth it!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Best Garlic Noodles in the City!!!!!

I always get the Five Spice Garlic Noodles and its always delicious. The customer service is fast, quick, friendly, and accommodating. The Five Spice Garlic Noodles (see picture) is served with egg noodles, chicken, and an amazing sauce. In the picture I got the Imperial Rolls for the first time. It was good, but they offer the spice garlic noodles without the Imperial Rolls. Just in case you don't want to get. 

It usually crowded around dinner time. The business is located also locin a great neighborhood. And if your up for dessert, right across the street is Honey Creme, an ice cream shop.
author: Anita T.

description:
What ever you get, make sure it comes with garlic noodles or order a side of it! Delicious garlic noodles - made even more delicious with barbecue chicken (or whatever meat you want). 

Usually, I find that dishes sometimes aren't quite the same when ordered for delivery, but not the case with this Perilla. I have eaten in the restaurant a couple of times and have ordered delivery a bunch of times. I am happy to report that delivery is just as good and probably more convenient. 

The soups have are good, but honestly I've had better pho. They generally shine on the grilled meats. 

I would avoid the three color drink here, 1) it's not three colors (last one I got was missing the green stuff) and 2) it was a bit watery for my taste.
author: Angelito R.

description:
A few of my friends who live in the Sunset area recommended this place, and they definitely knew what they were talking about. Perilla has THE BEST garlic noodles I've ever tasted in my life! The noodles are so aromatic, buttery, and garlic-y. If you're looking for delicious comfort food, this is the place to go. 

The meal is also a great price, and very filling. I ordered the BBQ pork with imperial roll, which was about $12. None of us could finish our meals, so we got to eat them again for dinner! The BBQ pork was juicy, and had a sweet BBQ flavor. My friend got the five-spice chicken, which was delicious as well. 

The service was stellar. Our server was sweet and attentive. Whenever our water cups were less than halfway full, she would come by to refill them. 

Overall, delicious food and great service. Will definitely have to stop by again!
author: Evanie H.

description:
Came here for pho after seeing they have a vegetarian pho with vegetarian broth. Sometimes can be hard to find the vegetarian broth so I'm always down to try it where places have it.

Ambiance: The inside is pretty small but has a good amount of tables. It was very clean as well!

Service: We were greeted and seated immediately. They let us take a seat anywhere we wanted and were quick to take our order. 

Food: We started with hot tea and vegetable summer rolls. The summer rolls were ok, they kind of fell apart when we were eating them. For my main dish I got the vegetarian pho with vegetarian broth which had tofu, mushroom, and broccoli in it. It was good- hard to compare to yummy yummy but it cured my pho fix. I'd go back if I was dying for pho and yummy yummy wasn't open- but it was just a little bland and they I thought they could add more veggies since it's vegetarian.

Great service, average food
author: Hayley D.

description:
We were looking for a place with affordable prices. I saw this restaurants on an article " best cheap eats in SF " and the idea of garlic noodles got us going.
We loved it! Prices were good (ranges around $11 for a good amount of food) and the food was yummy! We got the garlic noodles, pork chops, imperial rolls, and a noodle soup. Afforable sides too, we added chicken broth and rice for barely 3$ total.
We will be back!
author: Melissa G.

description:
I came by for lunch with mom and aunt because I was craving some vietnamese food, especially after just moving back from NYC where I had to search high and low for a decent vietnamese place.

The place was already bustling a little before 12PM with the lunch time crowd, but we were able to get a table within 3-5 minutes. By the time we had ordered, a ton of tables had opened up as well. 

I wanted some noodle soup so I ordered the brisket pho. It was fantastic, and portions were great for the price - especially since a bowl of that size would have cost at least $12-15 in NYC! I guess that makes me a little biased when it comes to price, but I was definitely satisfied after my meal! 

My mom and aunt both ordered the five spice chicken with the garlic noodles. As everyone else has already mentioned, it is an AWESOME option. The chicken is super tasty. It is well seasoned and tender with perfectly crisped skin. The noodles are a tad oily, but done well, and portions are good sized. I think both my mom and aunt had enough left over for another meal!

Will definitely update after more visits and delivery service!!
author: Sherry L.

description:
My friends younger sister was ready for some garlic noodles so we decided to try Perilla. I ordered the #27: Imperial rolls with Five Spiced Chicken Garlic Noodles. It was SO good, the noodles had the right amount of garlic and the chicken was properly seasoned. The amount of food on the plate is overwhelming which made me very happy! I took half of it home and ate it for dinner. 

My friends and I got seated right away and the staff was welcoming and attentive. Definitely coming back to eat more garlic noodles!
author: Yenni H.

description:
Typical vietnamese restaurant service, if you ever been you know what I mean, food was worthy to over look the service.

Chicken curry noodles = BOMB!
If you prefer a lighter note of curry + consistency then you will love this dish. 

Spring rolls were great, crispy flavorful, not over baringly greasy. Which is a plus in my books!

Garlic noodles w/Grilled chicken
Yum! Noodles arent as garlicky as Bentre (another vietnamese restaurant), but still smooth and good. Chicken is tender and juicy.

Highly recommend if you tired of Kevin Noodle house. JUSSAYIN
author: Eva H.

description:
This is a solid place in the area for their delicious garlic noodles! Their five spice chicken and charboiled shrimp and beef options are all really good! On warmer days, I've gotten it in cold vermicelli noodles and it's so refreshing with the veggies that come with it.  They have pho too but it's their garlic noodles and vermicelli that keeps me coming back for more!

It's pretty casual, clean and can be busy but rarely is there much of a wait which is really nice for a quick lunch! I also love how the staff is consistently prompt and friendly each time that I'm there.  Definitely try it out!
author: Holly H.

description:
Thank you Yelpers! 
Never would have thought to check this place out but I snagged the 5 spice chicken with Garlic Chicken (approx $11) and it was delish!

Well cooked and savory chicken with Garlic noodles that are delish. I brought the noodles home since I try to watch my carb consumption and the wifey agreed that they were pretty darn good.
author: Rod M.

description:
You can generally tell how stressed about school I am by my my ordering habits at Perilla.

If I'm chilling here with friends on an evening in the weekend, it's likely vegetarian pho.
If it's been a long day and I'm picking up a hearty take-out dinner, my staple is the five spice chicken vermicelli.
If I'm really stressed out and ate nothing but snacks and coffee all day, my guilty pleasure comfort food is the grilled pork with garlic noodles and imperial rolls P:

(+) Perilla is probably my favorite go-to within the UCSF vincity. Nothing beats a heart-warming bowl of pho in typical chilly SF weather, and you can't say no to all the other options of carby goodness. They don't skimp on protein either; the five spice chicken comes with a decently sized slab of chicken on the side. Not to mention, the imperial rolls are among the best I've had, delightfully crunchy, flavorful fillings, satisfying and not too greasy.

(-) Some may complain that it's not authentic per se, given that there is only one size of the pho and they seem to cater to more American tastes with specialties such as the indulgently buttery garlic noodles. But SF has plenty of options and you have your pick if you really want your generations-old secret family recipe pho brimming with anise. I think my one suggestion would be to incorporate more veggies than the few pieces of broccoli, though their sauteed broccoli are rather delicious. 

Tips and thoughts:
- The portions are generous, and prices are accordingly very reasonable with entrees between $10 and $20 that can easily last 2 meals. 
- The service is friendly, and you can always count on being cheered up by their smiles here. My favorite memory is once when the server ran outside after me because I forgot my take-out container.
- The online ordering system is a boon for all the semi-neurotic, busy, tech-oriented people of SF who appreciate this efficiency.
- While not super ambiancey, it's clean and there's a sort of simple elegance to the space. Perilla fits right snugly within the local business restaurant scene of the Inner Sunset (and I'm sure those garlic noodles have fueled generations of UCSF health care providers.)
author: Edna C.

description: Thanks for allowing the delivery service to charge me 60$ and make errors on the food delivery. Only when I called to rectify the order the business (Perilla) told me to call the delivery company (GrubHub) both which kept my money and gave no ends to figure out the bill. Thieves and I'll never order from Perilla again.
author: Gregory F.

description:
A stable go-to that'll never fail me. Unlike San Tung who closes in the middle of the week (OR SAN TUNG 2 THAT LIES ABOUT BEING OPEN ON WEDNESDAYS AND THEN ISN'T). 

I really like this Vietnamese place for having a simple yet delicious menu with all the usual favorites. Pho, vermicelli, rice plates, and my usual imperial rolls. You really can't go wrong here with any of the usual stables with less than $12 prices. Although it's a favorite of mine, there's nothing that's absolutely amazing that makes me crave Perilla. For that, it's not five-star quality. The kitchen area is also sketch lmao... even though I'll always wave at the ladies folding up spring rolls on their stools.
author: Lucy Z.

description:
Randomly came here for lunch since our original lunch plans fell through.  We were pleasantly surprise about the quality of food!  I went into this place thinking it might be a mediocre Asian fusion place, but it was actually really good!  

My friends and I shared a garlic noodle dish with beef and a rice dish with pork chops.  The garlic noodles were bomb! I would come back just for the garlic noodles!  The beef was so tender and perfectly cook. Not dry at all! The pork chop plate came with two large chops.  Also perfectly cooked and not dry.  I was so surprised about the quality of their food. 

The service was also really friendly. They had smiles on their face as the welcomed and seated us.  Also, happily asked how our food was and made sure our water was filled.  

I would definitely come back!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Alright, that's it - they deserve all five stars.

On top of the already delicious food, I was able to order take out from Perilla using my own containers. Appreciate their flexibility to help reduce waste.
author: Lexy C.

description:
The best garlic noodles in town. Definitely have to get the imperial rolls and five spice chicken as well.

Finally got to try to plum soda, a must try if you like sour drinks!! So refreshing and goes super well with the garlic noodle as it balances everything out.
author: Emily H.

description:
Perilla is by far one of the best pho I've restaurants I have been to. The quality of the food is superior with great choices of meats to be served with the noodles. I had the 5-spice chicken Soup. They serve them separate which allows you to enjoy the meat flavor on its own. The portions are generous and the the soup flavor was delicate and super. 

My husband had the garlic noodles with bbq beef, and his meal was equally great. 

I liked the fact that the restaurant did not smell of any fried food or bbq even though they have open kitchen. The restaurant setup is more upscale than the traditional PHO restaurants. 

Will definitely be back when in the area.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
The Place Where Sandy Goes When She's Homesick.

Ya'll, this Texan girl needs her Vietnamese food.  So far, SF has been a huge disappointment in that genre because trust me when I say I know my Vietnamese food.  However, my hubby was able to find me Perilla and it has saved me from my cravings.  

Perilla is known for their garlic noodles, but let me tell you what I really like here: their vermicelli beef with egg rolls.  Now, the egg rolls are not like grandma's, but it's close enough to where I will continue to eat it here.  Not the biggest fan of the taro inside the egg roll, but it will suffice.  

The grilled beef... now, that is some tasty stuff.  The beef is not overcooked nor tough, in fact, it's very tender and soft.  It is also marinated well.  

I've tried their pho here.  Not exactly like home, but it was good enough.  The garlic noodles here are good, but super greasy.  My hubby enjoys their five spice chicken, which is pan seared with the skin on.  Not bad, but not the dish I run to.
author: Sandy H.

description:
3.5 

I wanted to like this restaurant since the waiters are super nice and it's a clean venue. However, the food was average. I got their #21 Five Spices Chicken Garlic Noodle. I couldn't taste the five spice flavor on the chicken but I did like the crispy chicken skin. The garlic noodles were a little disappointing - a bit dry and underwhelming for my taste. 

My partner got their Charbroiled Pork Vermicelli. I thought the pork was super delicious but the other ingredients were lacking such as fresh lettuces (and more of it would've been nice). 

We also ordered a cup of their broth and it was so salty. My partner tried to dilute it with water but it didn't help.
author: Chariya S.

description:
TL;DR consistent mouth watering garlic noods to feed the soul

I've been to Perilla 10+ times, and each time never disappoints. The best item on their menu is the garlic noodles, and if you're new to Perilla, garlic noodles are a must. They have the perfect amount of garlic, that is heaven in your mouth, but not over powering. Pair it with the imperial rolls because they are crispy, beautiful, golden rolls of joy. If coffee is for you, get the Vietnamese drip coffee. Smooth and nutty, you can mix in your liking of condensed milk for your optimal sweetness.

If you are in the sunset area looking for a place to eat, you can't go wrong with Perilla.
author: Sophia L.

description: This is my favorite place to get garlic noodles in San Francisco. The portions for this dish are always huge and you can go wrong with the chicken, beef or pork. It also comes with a good amount of egg rolls. I will say that the water there isn't the best, which is why I always ask for lemon to put in or a Thai tea. The service is always spot on and the people are very friendly. If I'm craving garlic noodles for lunch, this is the place.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Amazing service as well as food. 

Pretty much just go for their "5 spice chicken garlic noodles" that's what they are really know for. It was really tasty. The noodles by itself can be a bit too cheesy but with the flavorful chicken together, it goes really well. 
Their imperial rolls were really great as well. 

We also got their Pho Thai, their meat was very fresh, different from the other pho places i have been to where they use frozen meat. The broth was really flavorful as well. I really highly recommend this place. 

Parking can be a bit tough as you need to find street parking, but for us we were lucky to find one near by. There are some great coffee shops around the area as well. This place is great for smaller parties as the restaurant itself is a bit small. 

Will be back again soon.
author: Chul L.

description:
Those garlic noodles!!! The combo plate is enough food to be both my lunch and dinner. My friends and I came right at 12PM on a Saturday after a hike and were the first to enter. The host/waitress was the sweetest woman, and the whole time she took our order or served us, she was smiling and making sure we had everything we needed. Very mom-like, in the best way.

It's a really good value and fantastic quality. A little surprised that it's still around $11 per plate these days. Super clean place, delicious garlic noodles and grilled/BBQ chicken.

Parking's not easy but doable (metered and some free parking further in the residential side or Lincoln).
author: Colleen M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of their pho, but their five spice chicken and imperial rolls with garlic noodles has been my go-to here for years!

Their garlic noodles are so chewy, buttery, and garlicky. The chicken has a crispy skin and isn't dry, and the imperial rolls are crispy and yummy. I definitely feel like the portion sizes have gotten a lot bigger from a couple years ago. I used to get the dish and still be hungry after, but now I'm able to leave satisfied. I should try something new and go for their charbroiled pork, but the chicken is just so good!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I thought it was really good, a fresh/hot plate of veggie-garlic noodles.
Happy to see the place almost packed, and so I had to jump in and try it.
author: Henry K.

description:
Love their vegetarian pho I also order the grilled shrimp on the side, so good!
The BF got the lunch size garlic noodle plate with the pork and spring rolls. He liked his as well, he just isn't much for pork so maybe would opt for the five spice chicken next time. The table next to us ordered it, looked good. Big portions of garlic noodle.
Service: 
Not friendly, not mean. Gave us a side plate initially with condensation on it, quickly replaced it with a dry clean new one without us asking.
This is the kind of service I prefer, not checking on you a million times, but tentative.
author: Chela A.

description:
A little hidden gem in the Sunset...

Really great value and open until 9PM (sometimes 930PM; we're not sure why). 

I went with the charbroiled beef with garlic noodles and imperial rolls - a lot of food for about $13. Garlic noodles are really well-cooked though the flavor is not super garlicky. I guess some people would prefer that, but I really wanted to be punched in the face with garlic.

The beef, on the other hand, is really delicious! I wish there was more, but I guess they have to make money somehow. Also tried the 5-spice chicken which is very juicy and tasty too. And also tried the pork chop (takes 10min extra) and that was good too! I guess the meats here are all delicious :)

The imperial rolls are not bad though there's definitely better. I still get them every time :)

Overall, really like Perilla when I'm in the area. Parking can be a little rough, but it's definitely worth it once you find a spot!
author: Greg G.

description:
Garlic noodles with five spice chicken with imperial rolls is their speciality and MUST try! Savory garlic noodles that is not over powering. The five spice chicken is layered with light crispy skin and the softest and most delicious chicken underneath. Portions are huge and price is right. 

My other favorite thing to order is their Pho Ga. Broth is hot, with slices of chicken and a ton of pho noodles. I add some hot sauce and it makes a delicious lunch on a cold day. Their red bean iced drink is also another stand out item. Delicious food, quick service, can't go wrong with Perilla!
author: Annie L.

description: Got the curry chicken garlic noodle plate and it was huge! So much tasty food. Everyone gets the garlic noodles and I can see why. My curry chicken was v eyes tasty but kinda watery. Would still order it again. Thai tea also delicious! Great prices and the people who run the place are super nice and accommodating. Would highly recommend to anyone!
author: Sidney W.

description: I came here for lunch on a weekday and to my surprise it was pretty packed; no one was waiting for a table, but majority of the tables were full.  I didn't have any expectations going into this meal, so I just ordered what I saw on Yelp was pretty popular, the garlic noodles.  I was pretty unimpressed with the garlic noodles, they were basic and really did not have a lot of flavor or garlic taste. The star of the dishes were definitely the meat. We ordered the grilled pork and five spice chicken, and both meats were cooked well and flavorful.  Also I must mention that the portion size is quite large, we both probably only finished half our meal and were both stuffed.  I'm not sure I would recommend this place, but you do choose to come, you can definitely pass on the garlic noodles!
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
One plate of their garlic noodles and you won't have to eat for the rest of the day. You will have to clear the rest of your schedule because a long nap is much needed after finishing that bad boy. The serving size is huge!  

Good fuel for hiking Land's End afterwards.
author: Lianne W.

description:
Smaller than I thought it would be inside. When you go to the back to use the bathroom you get a strong whiff of their intoxicating garlic noodles. It smells amazing!

Ordered #9 chicken curry vermicelli 10/10!! So surprisingly good. Especially when you add all the toppings like basil, bean sprouts and lemon omggg it really brings together the dish. The chicken is so tender and cut up in bite sized pieces.

Of course I ordered the garlic noodles as well. 10/10. I really came just for the garlic noodles but instead of getting a plate I got the curry soup so I had to just order garlic noodz on the side. Very well seasoned and yummy. Not too greasy like how most garlic noodles are.
author: Madelynn A.

description: Amazing garlic noodles and pork chops. Second best is the five spice chicken with garlic noodles again. The place looks low key but not the food.
author: Prashanth C.

description:
Love their garlic noodles and the five spiced bbq chicken. Tried both location in SF, both are as good.
The only qualm for the one in the city is, when you need to go to the restroom, you needed to walk through their kitchen. Feels weird...
author: Stan K.

description: Aww yesss... the garlic noodles is soooo good here. Even as leftovers, just zap it in the microwave and taste just as good! Service is pretty fast, really no complaints. I need to learn how to make my own garlic noodles... hmmm
author: Janet H.

description:
Their garlic noodles are AMAZING! After my boyfriend's description of the plate, I wasn't quite sure what to expect besides garlic breath, but the flavor wasn't overpowering (thank goodness). It was so flavorful and he ordered me the chicken and garlic noodle plate. The chicken was crispy. It was hard to explain to my dad, because the skin seemed fried, but didn't have the typical fried flavor. It came with a fish sauce to dip the chicken inside. So delicious and I approve of this place! 

Definitely will be eating here more often when I visit the sunset area of sf.
author: Heather I.

description:
Let me just say that the food here is so delicious! My boyfriend took me here and girrrrrrllllllllll, its bomb! I got the garlic noodles and five spice chicken and he got the garlic noodles with pork. The portions here are pretty big, so if you're like me where you think you can finish all your food and then some, you should rethink. 

The food over all has lots of flavor and my chicken was moist. Although it was a little oily, nothing water can't fix. The place in general isn't gram-able, but you're here to eat so enjoy your food. 

Come here to get a nice lunch and then take a walk through Golden Gate Park and you got yourself a date!
author: Betty C.

description: Giving this place five stars based on the delicious garlic noodles I enjoyed for a weeknight takeout dinner. I spotted the place while walking home, and popped inside to place my order. My noodles were ready within ten mins, complete with a tasty dipping sauce for the meat. The noodles were great, but the beef they were served with was even better. Full of flavor! Would highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back and try more. The place was packed on a Tuesday night, so you know it's good!
author: Rich S.

description:
Boyfriend was craving pho and the original place down on Irving was closed so we found Perilla on Yelp to check out and satisfy those cravings. 

Started off with the imperial rolls. I was so amazed that for once our appetizer of these rolls came out before our main dishes. Loved the filling and the extra crunch and freshness from the cucumber; fried perfectly and great portion. Highly recommend. 

The boyfriend also wanted to try out their iced vietnamese coffee. For some reason, though good, it was not as strong in coffee flavor as other places we have tried back in SoCal Westminster area. 

He enjoyed his pho. It came with your usual basil, bean sprouts and surprisingly lemon instead of lime. The broth was clean and flavorful, just what you want from a good bowl of pho. 

I ordered the garlic noodles with lemongrass beef. The beef was definitely packed with great seasoning and balanced out the blandness of the noodles. Unfortunately, I was expecting a more garlic-y taste from the noodles but they just reminded me of plain spaghetti in a way. The portion was huge! I barely made a dent so thankfully its price made it worth for 2 meals. 

Service is great! We sat down next to the windows and the servers immediately noticed that the sun was shining down on us. They helped us bring down their curtains. Refilled our waters every so often, just super nice customer service in general. Loved the ambiance and decoration of the overall restaurant as well.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I am writing this review while eating the food I just picked up from Perilla because I literally CANNOT wait because it is just THAT GOOD. OH MY GOD, MY TASTE BUDS ARE IN LOVE.... For a mere $11 dollars, you can get a HEAPING PILE of deeeeelicious buttery, garlic noodles with PERFECTLY MOIST seasoned 5 spice chicken, and steamed broccoli (to add some greens). Really, the portions are SO generous. My sister and I shared it and we are both stuffed and completely satisfied. 

To go into detail: 

-The garlic noodles are a perfect chewy consistency with a really strong garlic flavor and aroma. It has a buttery, garlic taste but really compliments any protein side. Def do not get this if you are on a first date ;)
-The 5 spice chicken has a really tasty seasoned thin skin, and underneath that is a moist, soft chicken that's perfectly salted as well. 

The dish itself comes with extra fish sauce but I think the components of the meal already taste good together without the extra salt. 

I ordered on yelp + paid through yelp and got the food quickly and efficiently from their fast service. The person who gave me my food was also very kind. 100% satisfied. I AM SLEEPING GOOD TONIGHT. I LOVE YOU PERILLA.
author: Anna L.

description: I had the Imperial rolls and 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles. It was very good and worth the 15 mt wait that we had to get a table.
author: Sunil R.

description: Love this place! The service here is super fast and the people are all so friendly. The five spice chicken here is the BEST!
author: Kaitlyn I.

description: Spring rolls were tasty, 5 spice chicken was great, and pho was the best.  Servers were very friendly, coming back again....
author: Kelly C.

description:
First time trying this place. I bookmarked it to my collections to try when I'm in the area. Not going to lie the hubs and I said if San Tung doesn't have a line we're going there first. 

Deductions of stars
1) hair found in his egg rolls- yes they made him ONE egg roll to compromise 

2) we had to flag them down that we are ready to order 

3) the garlic noodle wasn't as good as I was expecting. Cooked with loads of oil and lack of garlic taste or flavor 

4) I had diarrhea instantly after eating here 

I'm not really sure what's the hype. Maybe the prices but we didn't try the pho. Just based on the garlic noodle combos
author: Tasha L.

description:
The five spice chicken heaven here!! My boyfriend and I wanted to try this place out after exploring the golden gate park! We came on a Saturday afternoon and there was no wait! The service here was good, they were attentive and brought us everything we needed right away. 

I got the five spice chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles and my boyfriend got charbroiled pork with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. We both shared a bowl of pho. Everything was great! Definitely recommend the five spice chicken! I also got a Thai tea was good as well!!

Parking can be hard to find so be prepared!
author: Katty X.

description: EAT HERE. Fresh, authentic, cheap, big portions and absolutely delicious. The service was fast and super friendly. I ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. My boyfriend ordered the pork with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. Everything was BOMB. And the portions are so nice that I took the rest of mine home and had a second meal later that night. The garlic noodles are very very garlicky but that's the way I love it.
author: Alex K.

description: This place is good, but I don't understand the hype over their garlic noodles... it's literally pasta noodle infused with garlic flavor. My boyfriend and I ordered what everyone gets and what Perilla is known for - the five spice chicken, imperial rolls, and garlic noodles (there's a pork/beef version as well). It was quite tasty, but not AMAZING. I reserve my 5 star ratings for places that have that WOW factor - this did not. We also got the chicken curry noodle soup, which was good as well. It was basically your typical Southeast Asian curry noodle dish. I like that it had tons of chicken in it, but it did need a bit of salt. Overall, a solid meal.
author: Angela C.

description:
One of the last honest meals in this city. 

This spot is always packed with people and tantalizing aroma. Fresh food, huge portions, terrific value. Plus, almost everything comes with imperial rolls!! What's not to like? 

Favorites:

- Charbroiled beef with garlic noodles and imperial rolls
- Five spice chicken 
- Vermicelli with imperial rolls and garlic shrimp 
- Pho with rare beef
- Traditional pour over Vietnamese iced coffee

The charbroiled beef is a definite crowd pleaser and one of their signature items. Everybody orders this. It's unbelievably tender. A child could eat that beef. Lightly grilled, thinly sliced, tremendously sexy flavor. 

Five spice chicken is both crispy and greasy in the best way- Almost like a roast duck. The crispy skin is unlike any I've ever tasted on a five spice chicken dish. The skin is magically cooked, looks fried but tastes baked. Very juicy and tender. I'm curious how they cook this. If you like duck and fried chicken, this is the protein for you! 

Pho really hit the spot. Hubs loves the rare beef. The broth is clean and light. Not overly salty. A nice bright soup. 

Plenty of solid options. No frills. Love love love!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Very sweet staff: the service is excellent, the menu is interesting, and the space is nice, but yikes the food is gross (coming from someone who has travelled throughout Vietnam and has Vietnamese food regularly). 

We really wanted to like this place because our friend likes it, but even after a long day of gardening, voracious hunger did not suffice to make us finish our meals. It's all so greasy, the vegetables are overcooked, and the "pho" was just salty water with mushrooms that may have been canned in something funky. With so many great Vietnamese options around, I'm surprised they are rated so highly.
author: Alex W.

description:
The service is nice and quick. Restaurant a bit small but clean and has a nice atmosphere.

Ordered the beef carpaccio on a whim and that ended up being a great decision. The beef was soft and fresh. It was an awesome flavor explosion in your mouth. Would definitely order that again.

Also ordered the garlic noodle with five spice chicken. The five spice flavor isn't as strong as I would like but the meat was silky soft and I definitely appreciate that. The type of noodle used is not my favorite type of noodle as I find that too chewy and dense but that's just personal preference. 

The Vietnamese coffee is nice and strong for those who need that caffeine kick.
author: Lily F.

description:
Exceptional service (read below) and really yummy food with good portion sizes!

FOOD:
- Garlic Noodles with charbroiled pork (4.5/5): Goddamn who would've guessed that something so simple could taste so good. The noodles had just the right amount of bite and garlicky taste without being overbearing. I also really liked that it wasn't really that oily at all. The pork was extremely tender and well seasoned and the spring rolls had just the right amount of crunchiness to provide some contrast in texture. Definitely get this!
- Charbroiled Pork chops with rice (4/5): When it first arrived, it looked a little disappointing because it literally looked to be just pork chops with rice...which it was. But the pork chops were absolutely amazing; just the right amount of sear while still leaving the pork extremely tender and flavorful. I just wish there was something more to go with it. If you're someone who needs some variety in a dish you might want to avoid this one.

SERVICE:
Okay, so when we arrived, we put down our name for 2 people like responsible adults. Immediately after us came a single man alone (let's just call him Bob). Now let me tell you, Bob looked quite impatient and when he saw the waiting list, oh no he wasn't having any of that. I watched Bob write his name above mine and another party of 5. Nope, not in my house (and by my, I mean Perilla's). I didn't want to make a scene so I told one of the waiters who diligently noted it in his head and seated the two parties appropriately. He was also our waiter for dinner and he was absolutely fantastic; full of energy, friendly and accommodating. I can only hope that everyone else experiences the same level of service.

Overall really great food and I had a great customer service experience here so I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Jason W.

description:
My boyfriend & I were waiting for a table at the Korean restaurant across the street, but we ended up going here a couple days ago because we've been here before and honestly the food never dissapoints. 
The only thing I wouldn't really recommend is getting the DELICIOUS five spice chicken with the pho, just because when you eat pho & there is certain pieces of fatty meats, the pho and its broth is more flavorful. 

Both first and second time coming here, I ordered the garlic noodles with the chicken & it's plain & simply delicious. Extremely flavorful & the noodles are perfectly textured (not too soft, not too hard). If you like to add a little spice on your plate, you can always use the Siracha sauce on the side, if not ask them to throw in some jalapenos. Life's good with jalapenos. 

Overall, quick and delicious meal, very very fair price. 
+ always a pretty big portion. I've never finished my meal here before, always need a box.
author: Jenny T.

description: I was super excited to try this place because I've had it bookmarked on yelp for awhile now. I've also read so many good reviews so my boyfriend and I gave it a try for lunch yesterday since we were in the area. First impression of the place was good, we were greeted by friendly faces and seated promptly. It's a pretty small space so it was a little crowded. Service was great! I am giving it 3 stars due to the garlic noodle being so hyped up! I expected so much more. The garlic noodle was bland in my opinion and it did not satisfy me. I barely tasted the garlic, it was not enough flavoring! What made up for my meal was the side order of imperial rolls! They were delicious and crispy, one of the best I've tried around San Francisco. I'd definitely come back for the imperial rolls and try other things on the menu! The meal we had seemed to be made fresh which is also a plus.
author: Karmela A.

description:
I'd heard great things about this restaurant from a few of my friends who live in SF, so I had high expectations coming to Perilla. To my surprise, it was across the street from one of my favorite Korean places in town, Manna--I can't believe I didn't notice Perilla across the street!

I came here with three other friends for dinner on a Sunday night, and the restaurant was completely packed. When we came in though, they rearranged a few tables so we could sit right away, which was sweet of them. Honestly, the service here was pretty good--definitely above average for an Asian restaurant (even though the interior was pretty spot on for a typical Asian restaurant), for sure! Our waters were constantly refilled, and our servers stopped by to check in on us every once in awhile. 

What I Ordered:

-Garlic noodles with imperial rolls and pork (5/5): Myyyyyyyy goodness, I swear I died and went straight to heaven when this dish was placed in front of me. My nostrils were immediately filled with the strong scent of beautiful garlicky butter, and I started salivating. This tasted just as good as it looked--amazingly rich, delectable flavors. I've tried very hard to find a place that sells garlic noodles on par with Perilla's and have struggled. I'm being 100% honest here when I say this--I'm sad that I don't live in SF almost purely because of these noodles. Jesus Christ. Anyways, the pork was also wonderful! It was juicy and grilled perfectly. The imperial rolls also get a special mention because they were some of the best egg rolls I've ever had! Honestly, I've never really been able to tell the difference between good and bad egg rolls until I tasted these imperial rolls.

As you can see, I'm a big, big fan of Perilla. Reasonable prices, good service, and AMAZING food. It's also on a very eatery-populated street, so you won't have a problem finding dessert options for afterwards! Come here--you will not regret it :)
author: Stephanie N.

description:
I come here when I'm starving for garlic noodles! It's my favorite place in the city for it and I love that it's big portions... I especially love their combo with their imperial rolls.

Don't be a noob like my boyfriend who went against my recommendations and ordered pho here.. he wholly regretted it and kept trying to steal my noodles all night!
author: Natasha S.

description:
Visited during a San Francisco day trip with some friends, and came in with high expectations -- Perilla did not disappoint.

I ordered the Five-spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls, and WOW was this meal was amazing.  I'm going to start with the garlic noodles which had a light garlic and rich butter flavor, not overpowering but packed with deliciousness.  The imperial rolls (for only an extra $1 compared to the non-rolls meal) were crisp and meaty, making a solid side item.  Last but certainly not least, the five-spice chicken was the star of my dinner.  The succulent chicken combined with the crispy, sweet-soy flavored chicken skin was the best I've had.

The setting: located in the Sunset district, Perilla is surrounded by lots of parking, making up the neighboring residential streets.  The place is small, but staff are eager to take your order and serve you food.  Pretty typical for an Asian restaurant, so no complaints there.

My plate was clean once I was through with my meal, and I left very satisfied.  Considering the price and portion size, Perilla is a great deal, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants great Vietnamese food in San Francisco.
author: Justin H.

description: This place is delicious, fast, and reliable. Curry chicken Pho is enough for two meals
author: Mac S.

description:
great vietnamese food, vegan friendly!
i got the garlic noodles w vegetables, which were beautiful and flavorful. The garlic was fragrant and incredible, and the noodles looked handmade! The tofu was very tiny and negligible.
My partner got the five spice chicken vermicelli bowl, which had the same issue as the tofu. But the chicken was spectacular! 
Our friend got the five spice chicken pho, which he really liked as well.
We all split vegetarian summer rolls, which were great except we wished there was peanut sauce instead of the vinegar-based sauce we got, which didn't quite hit the spot.

overall, want to come here again and see other options! 
wish that there was more tofu, and that the tofu was covered in sauce or bigger, and that the summer rolls had peanut sauce.
author: Becca C.

description:
I've been to the other two Perilla locations so I am familiar with the food they serve. 

This location was disappointing. 
The service was great, but the food was lacking in taste and quantity. I ordered some Thai iced teas, and they served it to us in to-go cups even though we where dinning there for lunch. I noticed other customers got their teas in glasses so I was a little confused on the plastic cups. I thought Maybe they where afraid my niece was going to knock the glass over and spill it all over the table. Who knows...

We ordered the famous garlic noodles. It tasted really plain; there was no flavor at all. And the servings were really small. For the price that they are charging, they should give us more food. We also got the spring rolls. Again, nothing special about the food here. The next time I'm craving garlic noodles, I will remember to go to the other Perilla locations.
author: Edie G.

description:
I love Perilla!! Perilla was first introduced to me by my SF friends like 4/5 years ago. I went to SF pretty frequently during that time to hang out with them. I hate driving in SF and they would take me here whenever I would crave Perilla. I haven't been back to SF as often as I'd like, but when I do, I try to go to Perilla whenever I'm in the area.

The BF and I spent our Saturday afternoon exploring Golden Gate Park. After searching on Yelp on what's nearby to eat, I didn't realize Perilla was in the area so I instantly wanted to go here! San Tung was also in the area, but I wasn't craving chicken wings or chinese food. Plus the BF never had Perilla before so I wanted him to try it.

Perilla is as good as I remembered! I love the garlic noodles here!! It's the right amount of garlic; not to garlic-y or bland, just perfect IMO. The meats are so flavorful AND the portion is generous. So worth it for what you're paying for. You will leave full!

Service is as great as I remembered. Pretty much everything has been the same since I was last here few years back. It's good to know that nothing has changed and nothing is worse; it has been consistent throughout these years. The only thing I find weird whenever I'm here is that the workers aren't Vietnamese so they won't understand if you speak to them in Viet lol. Overall, I would recommend tourist and locals to try Perilla out!
author: Ellen C.

description: Without reading any review ordered veggie garlic noodles and it was quite good. But it felt like a carb bomb.
author: Cristina Y.

description:
Why ?
Pro tip: Their garlic noodles and five spice chicken are the best. The skin on the chicken is always so crispy!
Keep in mind: The five spice chicken can be a bit oily.
Instagrammable: Not a typical place you go to gram. 
Atmosphere: It's a causal place.
author: Christina K.

description:
After an adventurous day in Santa Cruz, four friends and I decided we wanted to grab dinner before heading home. We were seated at a table quickly (a line began forming a half hour or so after we got there, so be aware that there may be a wait depending on what time you arrive) and put in our orders. 

The garlic noodles were amazing, the imperial rolls are crispy and delicious, and the meat we got (we shared each other's pork, beef, and chicken) was all flavorful and tender. For the price (~$12/person), there is SO much food - I'll be able to make three meals out of my order!
author: Sarah B.

description: I've gotten the pho (average) and the garlic noodles with pork and five spice chicken with imperial rolls (awesome). Very good taste, service, and portions. Would definitely recommend
author: JJ W.

description:
Solid four stars. Good food. Good portion. Drinks are not that good here. 

I always get the chicken vermicelli bowl with egg rolls. $1 extra to get two egg rolls is a GREAT deal. You'll definitely have leftovers.   

Their pho is ok but again, huge portion. 

Thai iced tea is way too sweet. Red bean drink is plain. Just stick with water.
author: Susanna C.

description:
Came here with the bf and a couple of friends because honestly, the line at San Tung was way too long and we were hungry.

This restaurant is medium-sized, so I'm assuming that there might be a line at times. I also saw a lot of people picking up take out.

Anyway, my review is for the pho. The broth was kind of bland and on a cold day, that's kind of all I want. The meat and the egg noodle were average.

I would recommend sticking to their plated meals. My bf really liked his garlic noodle!
author: Trina V.

description: Had perilla cater an event for me yesterday, and overall, the food was good. I say good, not great. I think the garlic noodles are always great, and we got a papaya salad, tofu salad, veggie and shrimp spring rolls, 5-spice chicken, a pork dish, and a tofu veggie dish. My favorite was the tofu veggie dish and the veggie spring rolls actually!! The chicken seemed a little greasy, and for catering, it was confusing what sauces to put on the salads, so they fell kind of short. However, the veggie dish was flavorful and felt like I was eating something kind of healthy. The pork also seemed to be a hit at the event though I didn't get to try any.
author: Sonia S.

description: Sort of Vietnamese. I've had Phó at about half a dozen places in SF and this one is middle of the road. It's not bad but it can be better given the price points, decor & service levels (all good). Better places use fresh chicken, proper noodles & nothing frozen.  The raw beef here is okay. The chicken - so so.  And they use Cambodian noodles. So close...
author: Leung T.

description:
I have been having occasional cravings for Perilla. I feel like this place never fails to satisfy my hunger needs. I usually get the charbroiled pork or beef with garlic noodles. My Gf sticks with the five spice chicken with rice or sometimes the beef. I'd say this place does a good job serving a satisfying portion size. Each plate runs around $10-12.

The food is served with fish sauce where u can dip the food in, but sometimes I like a good mix of hoisin and Sriracha. The garlic noodle itself is really garlicky and buttery. The best kind of garlic noodles. However, I do second think about getting the garlic noodles for health reasons. 

If you're feeling some satisfying and affordable food, then Perilla is the one for you.
author: Auden W.

description: The staff here is super nice and their garlic pork chop is probably the best in town. Most of the food here comes with big portion, so you will be really full after.
author: Tran N.

description:
You get more than what you pay for, which is great! They're super generous with their portions. I always have to take my leftovers to go! Everything on the menu is reasonably priced. I usually stick with the five spice chicken or bbq beef with either rice/garlic noodles. All super flavorful and not too greasy. They give you plenty of rice and oodles and oodles of noodles! After coming here, I have come to a conclusion that the Vietnamese restaurant I usually go to in SJ has seriously been skimping out on their meat! My only wish is that they served some sort of soup with their plates!

By the way, service is AMAZING here. The servers are always checking up on you! The only downside is that parking may be difficult, but that's kinda expected..  

Check this place out! They also have other locations around the city :)
author: Sydney C.

description:
This review is for Perilla's delivery service. I've never eaten inside because I have no one to eat with and I am self conscious about how normal social people would perceive me. I would also probably eat too quickly or awkwardly stare at my phone as if I was actually communicating with someone other than my mother.

I've been ordering from Perilla for several 3 years now, despite living only a block away for 9. 

Great food. Crispy legit spring rolls made with rice paper (not egg roll). Moist perfectly cooked 5spice chicken. Chewy not soggy garlic noodle seems to be the staple. 

Fast delivery. Convenient.
author: Dave K.

description: One of the best in town. Garlic noodles are delicious and the five spice chicken is on point. The Vietnamese coffee is a show stopper as well. This place is always solid and is in heavy rotation for me. Service can be hit or miss depending on how busy they are but it never takes away from the food.
author: Jordan C.

description:
I decided to dine at Perilla for dinner after seeing many good reviews about their garlic noodles. I was visiting the Presidio so it was a close Lyft ride to Inner Sunset. 

PARKING + AMBIENCE
Street parking is available on the street and nearby neighborhood vicinity. It's difficult finding parking since everyone parks on the streets, so it's likely you will have to park far from the restaurant. The restaurant is small, but there are a decent amount of seating inside. There was a wait when I came, but it was okay because my party didn't arrive yet. 

FOOD
I ordered the Imperial Rolls and Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles ($11.25) and it was a hefty meal. The portions are huge, so by the end of the meal I was stuffed, I couldn't eat more even if I wanted to. The imperial rolls are a nice side to go with the dish, but in hindsight, I probably shouldn't have gotten them since everything else was more than enough to fill me up. Dip them in the fish sauce for maximum flavor. The five spice chicken is tender and juicy and the garlic noodles had the perfect amount of flavoring, not too garlicky, just right. 

SERVICE
Service was friendly, there is a waiting list paper attached to the front door, they will call your name when a table is ready. They came back multiple times to refill our water and check up on us.

CONCLUSION
An authentic Vietnamese cuisine restaurant with garlic noodles as the highlight, it was so good! Everything we ordered was hugely portioned, so don't over order or you will have plenty of leftovers. The price is okay, cheap for San Francisco standards. Perilla is a great spot for Vietnamese food, especially the garlic noodles plates.
author: Vincent P.

description: This place looked so promising- but their Pho just didn't quite make it to the extremely delicious list. It also was odd that they took about 10 minutes to serve the Pho as well... most places that I've been to dish it out right away. In any case, if you're looking for a place that gives you a nice and cozy environment to sit in and catch up with some friends, this is a good choice. The wait was non-existent and the service was friendly.
author: Nadia H.

description: Solid Vietnamese place. A lot of Vietnamese restaurants in Inner Sunset are actually owned by Vietnamese-Chinese haha, but none of them have failed me. If there's one item to get here, get the five spice chicken and garlic noodles combo. Wow was it tasty. The chicken is so tender and juicy, and the skin crispy. It's enough for two meals if you're not starving and can't stop eating. The service was also good, even though I only got my food to go. They were attentive and made sure my food came out fast.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Their Garlic noodles is highly recommended!!! The  Pho Dac Biet is good. Service is great and so as the prices.  Looking forward to my next visit to this restuarant.
author: JayAnn A.

description:
This is for food order only. I am really not happy about the service made. 

1) my food came 30mins later than the ETA 
2) the restaurant only provided me with a spoon. How am I supposed to eat the imperial rolls, garlic noodles and five spice chicken with it? 
3) my three color drink came all spit...
See picture below
4) and as I started drinking the three color drink I found this in the drink: PLASTIC BAG 
See picture below 

I would highly recommend you guys check the conditions of your kitchen!
author: Sandrine L.

description:
Perilla is my go-to Vietnamese place in the Inner Sunset. I live really close so this tends to be my takeout order spot.

I have tried their five spice chicken pho, the beef brisket bowl, the garlic noodles and the coconut curry vermicelli. All are good, but the gem IMHO is the five spice chicken pho. DELICIOUS. 

Last time I was there I got the curry vermicelli, and although tasty, very heavy and potatoes were falling apart in the stew. Not my favorite part. 

The garlic noodles are very tasty as well with the perfect amount of spice and butter. YUM.

They are relatively average priced too with most bowls running about $9-$12 and garlic noodles on the side for $5.
author: Anna P.

description: Good food at a great price. Their food is tasty and the portions are large. The garlic noodle with. Bbq chicken is my favorite but many of the other items on the menu are also verygood. Cant go wrong with great price with a lot of food. And tasty what more can you ask for. .
author: Andrew M.

description: Their pork chop garlic noodle is the best in town. And service is A+++++++ . I rarely find any place in the city that the server (maybe the owner) smiles 10 millions time to customers like that. We ordered pork-chop garlic noodle but she took the wrong order, when it came out we didn't take it but she was so happy to exchange for us . Also she kept saying sorry and happily take the mistake to herself.  That is the exact manner you want to receive at any restaurant. Love this place. We are here almost every weekend.
author: Chloe N.

description:
EVENT: just feelin' hunger and dude... craving garlic noodles.. *DROOLS*

SERVICE: it gets busy! especially during the weekend... ling out the freaking door! Then you have to wait! Best time is after dinner time... so it's great for me since I eat dinner super late!!!!

FOOD:
Anything with garlic noodles! My favorite is the imperial rolls w/ BBQ pork, and garlic noodles! Drench it with fish sauce... and you're a winner!!

OVERALL: Anything with garlic noodles is excellent!!!!!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
I had the 5 spices chicken with garlic noodles. Not a traditional Vietnamese dish but I saw many reviews about it. ORDER IT! The meat is flavorful and delicious. It comes with garlic nooodles. Which you can eat without and it'll stilll be satisfying. 

I'm not a big fan of pho and I thought the broth was good. I also ordered the shrimp spring rolls. Just be aware that they already add sriracha sauce to their plum sauce. You can probably ask to get it without. 

Vietnamese coffee was good as well! Overall very pleased with my experience and good service here. 

Tip: Parking is difficult.
author: Tam V.

description:
I got the garlic noodles with imperial rolls and 5 spice chicken. It was amazing!

Noodles were chewy, the way I prefer. The serving size was large. I only ate half of it and was stuffed. 
Granted, I ate one noodle at a time, but each noodle is so thick that one at a time is reasonable. 

Imperial rolls had the satisfying crisp to each bite and the chicken was tender and juicy with crispy skin. 

Would order again! If you're watching what you eat, be aware that this does have butter in it.
author: Serena W.

description:
Tonight, a friend and I decided to have dinner in a new neighborhood, one we don't normally frequent. My friend had Perilla bookmarked on Yelp for their garlic noodles. I knew very well how great they are because I've been to the Mission St, SoMa location many times before but noticed this location had better ratings so time to try it out! 

I love the location! Right on Irvine and 10th, next to all my other favorites like Manna and San Tung, this place offers lots of seating, nicely spaced out and for the most part pretty clean. The staff was super friendly throughout service. At one point though, they hovered around our table for our food order, kind of threw me off as I was try to catch up with a friend but I could tell they were preparing for a rush, which eventually came. In a way, I appreciate the efficiency. 

To start, I got the Imperial Rolls for $7.75. Crispy fried rolls filled with pork, taro, carrots and silver noodles. As a side they also came with lettuce, mint and cucumbers with a fish sauce for dipping. I'm always a fan of deep fried things, the filling was a bit mushy consistency, different from their other location and although it came with 6 rolls, it was odd that they only served two pieces of lettuce to wrap them up in. Still enjoyed the flavor though. For my dinner, I needed to get my norm: garlic noodles with 5-spice chicken for $10.25. This is their signature dish, no matter what location so get it! This specific location though, OH EM GEE! The chicken was huge! Super flavorful and juicy. Also, they probably served double the noodles from their mission st counterpart. So much food, two people could share it! Such a great value, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT! 

All in all, another great option to revisit in the future. So happy to be adding more great recommendations in other neighborhoods. If you're in the area, you've gotta come by and check them out! Trust me, it's worth it!
author: Rockne H.

description:
My friends swear by it but I've only tried it once but I wouldn't again. Got the garlic noodles which tasted like it was missing garlic. The egg roll was ok but nothing special. The meat tasted bland. My friends were telling me it's not usually like this but none of us finished our meals that visit. 

Portions were generous and staff was friendly.
author: Frank C.

description:
What to order: Garlic noodles!!  

My friend and I ordered the Five Spices Chicken Garlic Noodle ($10.25) and Charboiled Pork Chops Garlic Noodle ($10.95) and both were super delicious! Both come with a heaping pile of garlic noodles, a large slab of protein, and a yummy sauce to pair. The chicken tastes delicious when dipped in the sauce. 

Portion sizes are gigantic, but you'll probably still finish the whole dish because they're that good! I also enjoyed how they added a few pieces of broccoli to the dish - it made me feel a little less bad about carb loading from the noodles.
author: Kris C.

description: Perilla is our go to place for garlic noodles. I ordered the chicken pho today because I was feeling a little sick and I was surprised. The soup had a much more homemade taste to it than most pho places. Pro tip: add a little lemon juice and hot sauce to your garlic noodles ;)
author: Karina T.

description:
Such good food! So I only ever think of Viet food as Pho, Banh Mi, or Beef cubes... I've been missing out my whole life and I'm so glad I found Perilla. 

Perilla is a small homey little restaurant just on the outskirts of Golden Gate park. But none of the flavors here are little. The staff is super friendly and welcoming plus the service is quick. 

We ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken... This dish can be my last meal. its is so good. The garlic noodles are sautéed in so much butter that it can't be bad and its has such a good garlic flavor you can't just have one bite. The five spice chicken is tender and seasoned to perfection, I can eat 5 lbs of that chicken. If you come here which you definitely should I highly suggest ordering this dish. 

We also ordered the grilled pork summer rolls: tender juicy grilled pork, soft tender vermicelli, and a peanut sauce that is on point. 

Come to Perilla, you will NOT be disappointed!
author: Vincent T.

description:
This was my first time eating here. I came in for lunch with a friend to catch up. The restaurant was pretty full on a weekday; however, there was no wait. I ordered the 5 spice chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles. To be honest, I've had better 5 spice chicken, but the garlic noodles were on point! The chicken wasn't bad, but I wish the meat had more flavor. I felt it was missing something. The skin part had a lot of flavor, but the meat inside was lacking flavor and seasoning. Maybe it was just mine. My friend liked her chicken. The Imperial rolls were fried nicely.

Service was fast. I will definitely be back for those garlic noodles! I'll give the chicken another try, or perhaps try something else with the garlic noodles. Yummm.

Parking: Street/Meter
author: Lucy L.

description:
I love going here when I come back to the Bay Area. A friend introduced me to this place and I am so grateful that he did because I always have a great experience when I'm here. The staff is always nice and attentive, especially that one waiter with the glasses (sorry I don't know his name). 

I order the garlic noodles with five spice chicken with imperial rolls when I'm here; it's my go-to order and it has never failed me. I pour most of the dipping sauce over the noodles, the chicken and the egg rolls. The chicken is so tasty; the meat is so soft and the skin is so crunchy and flavorful. The garlic noodles have just the right amount of chewiness to it and it's not too garlicky so the taste doesn't overpower everything else. The imperial rolls are delicious dipped in the sauce.

It may be on the expensive side, but I'm always so full when I come here so I'm totally fine with it.
author: Brian F.

description:
Lovely place to grab a bowl of Pho. The vegetarian Pho was excellent: tasty, and came with a generous quantity of silky tofu and veggies.

Unfortunately, to use the bathroom you basically have to walk through their kitchen, which (to me) raised some sanity concerns...

Also, it can be a bit loud, and the tables are a bit cramped.

Service was quick, and prices were reasonable for the area.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Love Perilla! I've had good experiences dining in and with delivery. Two words: GARLIC NOODLES. The pho is super good, too. A great Vietnamese neighborhood staple.
author: Allie F.

description: If you have to order something, I highly recommend the five spice garlic noodles. As other reviewers have mentioned, Perilla by far has the best garlic noodles in the city. The egg noodles have a thick texture, and they are stir-fried and tossed with just the right amount of oil and garlic. The chicken is soft and flavorful, and dressed in a light sweet sauce. The portions are generous, enough that I can pack the rest home for leftovers. I have yet to try the pho here, but my sister likes it enough that she comes back often for it.
author: Joanne K.

description: Great Vietnamese cuisine. All of the pho options are yummy. The broth is clear and not too salty. The spring rolls are well made. Would also recommend the garlic noodles.
author: Kristine C.

description:
I live far enough where I don't come here to dine but close enough to still enjoy takeout via Eat24 or Caviar. I can't say their pho is that good but their che (three bean drink especially) is BOMB and tastes just like how it is in Vietnam.

And there is one dish here that I recommend above all others: five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The rolls actually aren't that special (tons of nearby options do it way better) but that chicken! It is cooked until the skin is crispy and each bite has just the right touch of grease. I would be perfectly happy eating that chicken with plain white rice, so you can imagine how elevated this meal becomes when you throw in a generous serving of Perilla's mindblowing buttery garlicky chewy noodles! Sometimes, more is more.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Seriously the best garlic noodle I ever had! I usually order the Imperial Rolls and Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle but I didn't have a big appetite so I ordered the Imperial Rolls and Charbroiled Shrimp Garlic Noodle. I understand that shrimp is more expensive than chicken but damn only 4 pieces of tiny shrimp on my plate for $12.55. The chicken option is $11.25 -- I know now not to order the shrimp because I was getting ripped off.
author: Annie Y.

description:
