I am a loyal to Perilla's bomb garlic noodles. The noodles hit the spot, whether it's a cold afternoon or a hot summer's day! I love it especially with the five spiced chicken, which is delectably moist and packs a ton of flavor. 

I was surprised that Perilla is Vietnamese cuisine because I've never heard any account of my mom making or mentioning garlic noodles, but I'm now a follower or this amazing dish.

The service at the Irving location is always prompt. Friday nights are crowded, expect a short wait. However, there's usually no wait during early afternoons during the weekday, no matter what location in SF you head to. If you are waiting during a busy time, and would rather steer clear of dining in, order takeout! It is prompt and perfectly packaged with the fish sauce in a little cup. 

Perilla is amazing and is a hard choice to make in my mind when it's so close to San Tung. When I'm craving something quick, am starving, and am craving a tasty meal, I come to Perilla. Affordable with absolutely no bs!
author: Bonnie T.

description:
My go-to dishes here are the five spice chicken vermicelli or the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. I tried the charbroiled beef once and it's pretty good too. The charbroiled beef's flavor was good but it was a little too tough in my opinion. The chicken is always tender and has a great crispy skin on the outside. It pairs really well with garlic noodles! The garlic noodles have the perfect amount of garlicky aroma without being overly pungent. The garlic noodle texture is nice and chewy. Imperial rolls are also really good- I highly recommend trying them! The portions are pretty big. I can never finish if I get five spice chicken, imperial rolls, and noodles.
The service here is always friendly. However if the restaurant gets crowded and you're seated by the door, it can be hard to get the server's attention. 
Parking in this area is usually easy to find, but can also be really difficult depending on the time and day of the week.
author: Emily L.

description: Their food is always good. I have never eaten in their restaurant but their delivery has been fast and polite and the food tastes fresh. It's on time and consistently good with all the menu items I've tried being yummy. I can't complain, 5 stars.
author: Tracey H.

description:
Loved this place so much we ordered takeout twice in a week! I got the chicken curry pho and pho ga.
The chicken curry pho was pretty heavy but extremely tasty. It was more like a sauce than a soup. The pho ga was pretty standard, a little light on flavor but nothing a healthy dose of Sriracha couldn't fix. The portions were fair.
The shrimp rolls were decent, not very much shrimp in there but tasty with the dipping sauce.
We got the garlic noodles based on other reviews. They tasted like...garlic noodles. I wasn't blown away like everyone else has been - maybe too hyped up by the time I got to try them.
Would definitely order from here again!
author: Emma B.

description: This place is a great stop. My husband and I are here visiting from out of town. Looked for a quick lunch and moseyed in here from the Sunday flee market :). He enjoyed the garlic noodles with pork and I enjoyed he shrimp rice plate. The pho looked good. We also liked the imperial rolls. Now to go walk it off through the golden gate park! Thank you!
author: Kristen Y.

description:
I love Perilla! I came here on a Sunday afternoon, surprisingly due to a mini local vendor market held outside, thankfully there was little to no line at all.   I was seated in the left corner closer to the entrance, and prepared myself for the five spice chicken that I had ordered.  I ordered the famed garlic noodles and five spice chicken along with the imperial rolls that was recommended to me.  

Five Spice Chicken:  My goodness, it looked so beautiful, that chicken was glazed with beautiful oil and that skin was oh so crisp.  I took my first bite, but I couldn't not help and nod to the side and smiled simultaneously.  It was a taste beyond words, I cannot recall the last time chicken taste so good.  The flavors of spice sprung in my mouth, and I dipped that bad boy chicken in the fish sauce and it was a force to be reckon with.  Each bite I savored that chicken.  It tasted so tender in the inside and crispy and delicate on the outside.  Perfection! 

Imperial Rolls: Super hot and crispy, it was browned to perfect colors and oh so flaky when it drops in your mouth.  This has to be one of the top egg/imperial Rolls within the city of SF.  I just couldn't stop after the first scrumptious bite.  

Garlic Noodles:  Never would I have thought these three ingredients would come together with such precision.  The garlic noodles was full of flavor each bite was soft and slightly chewy where it very simple tear off.  I added the fish sauce with the noodles to make a full blown combo of amazing taste.  

I would definitely come back and get me some five spice chicken and garlic noodles.  This will always be my favorite restaurant to dine when I am around the area.  If your craving for some good food involving chicken and garlic noodles look no further, here is the spot
author: Jacky C.

description:
We were on the list at Manna across the street but still had a long wait and were feeling pretty hungry. We noticed Perilla was seating immediately and had good reviews on yelp. What a good choice to come here.

We had the papaya salad with shrimp, veggie summer rolls, and shared the five spice chicken garlic noodles and a hot Vietnamese coffee. This is great chicken and I think I make good chicken. The coffee was perfectly sweet. The salad and rolls were so fresh. Everything came out to $30 for 2. Not bad!
author: Susie L.

description: Inedible.  The beef pho broth came out warm.  As a result, the rare beef remained a bloody, chewy mess.  I let the beef soak for a while and even buried it under the noodles in the hopes of transforming the raw beef.  No luck. Broth not hot enough.  I eat pho all the time and never have I seen this.  Took a few bites of the noodles, paid, and left. Should have gone further down Irving where there are better places.
author: Eric C.

description:
Really solid Vietnamese food, especially considering the fact that it's one of the few places I've been to that offers garlic noodles (which I definitely would have ordered had it not been for my dietary restrictions at the time. They looked delicious!!)

I was on a paleo diet when I came to Perilla - obviously not the best idea to go to a Vietnamese restaurant when you can't eat grains, but I was determined to make it work. I wound up ordering the five spice chicken vermicelli bowl... and asked for it with no vermicelli and extra lettuce (so more of a salad dish rather than a noodle dish). Though initially a little confused, the waiter quickly understood what I was looking for and accepted my request with no further questions. I was surprised by how flexible the restaurant was.

Overall, I thought the five spice chicken was really tasty. It was cooked so tenderly and packed a lot of flavor, which brought together an otherwise bland dish. Portions are large, and the price is really worth the size that you get. Service was quick and efficient.

I will have to come back and try the garlic noodles once I'm no longer paleo. One of the better Vietnamese restaurants in SF for sure!
author: Sheila D.

description: Phenomenal! This place was packed... and for good reason!  I found it by accident while going to see fireworks at Twin Peaks. Twin Peaks was closed but my long trip from Danville was worth the time and gas since our dinner was so good.
author: Carrie S.

description: I am a sucker for great service. I think it's more important than anything. You can get food food anywhere but service is always unique. I just had a quick lunch with a friend here and they were so quick and friendly. From the moment we walked in- they greeted us and swept in to take care of us. And when we left they also yelled out "thanks for coming".
author: Julianna I.

description: This is one of my favorite Vietnamese cuisines! I recommend the garlic noodles with chicken or pork and imperial rolls. Their portions are HUGE and I usually have leftovers
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
One of those must-try places in the Bay Area!

I came here one afternoon with a friend and we each got the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls and we also got a platter of spring rolls. 

Service was superb, the waiter came to frequently refill drinks and ask if we needed anything. The garlic noodles with the chicken was so DELICIOUS. The portions were huge and the chicken was so flavorful, tender, and moist. I liked how the garlic noodles did not have an overpowering garlic taste and it wasn't drenched in oil. The imperial rolls were fried perfectly and also very delicious. The spring rolls on the other hand was wrapped nicely but the peanut sauce was lacking. It didn't compliment the spring roll like other spring roll + peanut sauce combinations. Other than that, I would recommend this place to someone. I would also come back again, the large portions, affordable prices, and that FIVE SPICED CHICKEN is enough to come back for!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
Came here with my friend on a Weds night and we were seated immediately. 

FOOD: 
We ordered: 
#27 Garlic Noodles w/ Imperial Roll + Chicken: Garlic noodles were good, not too garlic-y and chicken was tender and it also came with 2 pieces of broccoli. I think the dish proportions are a little off. I would have liked more chicken and broccoli and a little less noddles. Other than that taste wise was great!

Pork Vermicelli: Huge portion of bowl of lettuce and bean sprouts covered with vermicelli noddles topped with pork. Again, I would like liked more pork in this dish. But taste wise was good. Pork was marinated nicely. 

I guess for the price they charge you get what you pay for. But the food is really filling. We shared both dish and ending up with leftovers.  

SERVICE: Very quick and friendly service. Our drinks were refilled often. 

AMBIANCE: Contrary to your typical Vietnamese shop, this place is dimmed down, but gives the place a nice "casual-fancy" vibe. Clean interior. They have one of those bathrooms that are located in the kitchen just a FYI.
author: Samantha F.

description:
I absolutely love this place.
The portion sizes are huge and I always get the garlic noodles with beef and it's the best thing ever! The taste is wonderful and always hot and fresh, so I definitely would come back again.

The service is top notch, with the staff always smiling and quick to refill our waters. The only problem is the wait can be a bit on the longer because it is such a small place, but I think this is definitely worth the wait.
author: Jessica Z.

description: One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in town. Delicious, fresh and great service!!!  I tried the beef vermicelli bowl and for an appetizer we had the pork spring rolls.  Amazing!!!
author: Daisy A.

description: Got the rare steak and meatballs Pho. The portion size was generous but the broth was not good. And for some reason the noodles soaked up the broth super quickly....the broth tasted very odd. Next time I'll stick with the garlic noodles and five spice chicken although I usually find the noodles too buttery.
author: Grace O.

description:
Had lunch here a few days ago as I was craving for garlic noodles. Based on the reviews the food and prices seemed good! 
I ordered the garlic noodles, five spiced chicken and viet rolls combo. Price was fair! Garlic noodles were a little dry though. Service was good, wait staff were friendly and attentive. The chicken and rolls were good as well! I'd definitely come back to try out their other raved about dishes.
author: Marielle D.

description:
We were craving pho but having become recent vegetarians, we were unsure what to expect. Perilla surpassed our expectations! 

The service was very friendly. We got the summer rolls which had some tofu in it and they were great. Then we got served our vegetarian pho with our garlic noodles which were both really delicious and filling. The pho was very flavorful which is always a concern with a typically meat based product. 

We shared these three items and had almost all the garlic noodles leftover to take home since pho itself is pretty filling for us. The portions were big for the entrees! We left very satisfied and happy!
author: Jess D.

description:
The Garlic Noodles are delicious, I think it's their signature dish, similar to The House of An's Crustacean in style, with a dish here averaging $10.

Parking can be tough, but if you have good karma or willing to walk, it's not bad.

The wait is hit/miss, but the service is spot on.

There's other food options if you do a walk-in on impulse and then it's too crowded with a long wait, so, that's always good to be in a location like this.
author: Rick S.

description:
I love this place! A lot of neighborhood parking/meter parking around here.

Garlic noodles are delicious here! It's a bit buttery, but it's good. I usually get the five spice chicken w/ garlic noodles, but the curry chicken noodles are bomb too. The curry chicken noodles have a coconut-milk base and it's delicious!

The portions are good, food is great and I always want to come back!
author: Melanie T.

description: Everything was very okay. I had the vegetable garlic noodles and the vegetables were mostly cabbage, which is not what I expected. The garlic noodles themselves were very delicious. My boyfriend had pho and enjoyed it but said he has had better. They were generous with their portions though. Not bad, just not the best!
author: Rachele G.

description: We ordered delivery and the 5 spice chicken was outstanding, everything was perfect we will definitely order again. The woman that took my order was very patient and understanding with our veggie substitutions.
author: Dee D.

description:
I came here to try the curry chicken vermicelli soup because all the pictures of yelp make it look delicious and I'm a big fan of curry, so it was a must try for me. They give you A LOT of noodles and I could barely finish the dish, so if you're looking for something filling this is the place to go. 

The curry chicken vermicelli had the perfect amount of curry in it and it didn't taste too heavy. Since the curry was the soup I was scared it might be really thick but it was light and savory. They gave me a good amount of chicken in the dish and all large pieces too! We also got the five spice chicken and the imperial rolls but with rice instead of the garlic noodles, the chicken was tasty and the imperial rolls was nice and crispy. 

The service here was definitely 5 stars, the servers were attentive and very friendly. They greeted us when we walked in and when we were leaving the restaurant. It's also really clean inside which was a plus.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I cam during Saturday night around 6:30ish. It was a full house but not much of a wait. I think we just got lucky with timing. 
Location: Parking is SUPER hard to find.

Food-
Egg rolls: the best rolls I've had in SF. Yet we're crispy yet soft when you take a bite of the he inside. It's complimented with a  tasty sauce that had a good balance between the sweet & spicy. The 5 spice chicken was savory and well made. Not something you would ideally choose if you are trying to choose a healthy meal since it's fried and excessively oily. The garlic noodles were ok, bit bland. Thai tea was perfect, not too sweet nor watered down. 

Service:  super friendly and fast waiters. Our food arrived within 10min after ordered. My BIGGEST pet peeve is when waiters pick up my plate off the table without asking.  But this place past the test! They politely asked to take my plate away beforehand.  Their table turnover rate was pretty impressive. Also, I noticed their servers did their best to accommodate sitting and give your check right away. They would give the people in line a rough estimate of time or they. Overall, stupendous customer service !
author: Carleen C.

description:
I've had the PPQ garlic noodles before and it's good with that crab meal set but it's a bit dry in this application. 

It is a bit better with the chicken curry which is similar to the Burmese version. Generous with the chunks of chicken and the curry is thin enough where you can dip your noodles into it and almost drink it like a soup. 

Imperial rolls were a little on the greasy side and came with two leaves of lettuce and three slices of cucumber. I did like that I could taste bits of taro. 

Service is really super friendly.
author: Shannon L.

description: Affordable and delicious, great service. I ordered a plate that came with two huge seasoned pork chops and a side of perfect garlic noodles. Well done.
author: Will D.

description:
I went there with two friends for an early dinner on a Friday and it didn't seem too busy.  


Two words: Garlic Noodles!  Thee most amazing garlic noodles I've ever tasted. You cannot go wrong with ordering their noodles.  My mouth is watering as we speak!  


Parking is typical in SF. It can be difficult and you'll most likely need to pay the meter.
author: TC C.

description:
Great place! Great food! Good service! The bowls
are delicious I tried the imperial pork it was Nom, Nom!
author: Ty G.

description: Perhaps it's because I'm not from SF but Perilla is really just run of the mill Vietnamese food that's marginally overpriced. Nothing special about this place but nothing terrible about it either. You could probably find something just like this restaurant in any other town to be honest. Service wasn't bad though.
author: Angela T.

description:
YUMMM the garlic noodles here are BOMB.

Came here for lunch around noon on a Saturday. Place was busy but not too crowded. We got seated immediately. 

We ordered the FIVE SPICE CHICKEN + IMPERIAL ROLL + GARLIC NOODLES COMBO. It was SOOOO GOOD. The garlic noodles were perfect. The Imperial Roll was basically a pork egg roll. Came out hot, crispy and delicious! And the five spice chicken was PERFECT. Super flavorful and the chicken was so soft and tender. It was awesome.

The grilled pork rolls were ALRIGHT. I wouldn't order them again. I expected thick pork paste like nem nuong style. But it was just a really thin slab of pork rolled with rice noodles and lettuce. Pretty underwhelming. 

Service is pretty standard and straight forward. But like I said, the five spice chicken and garlic noodles here is the WAY TO GO.
author: Melanie Y.

description:
Came by the other day for lunch and was seated immediately upon arrival, shortly after noon.

Started off with the grilled pork fresh rolls which were amazingly tasty! The rolls were fresh and came with a side of fish sauce. The grilled pork had a nice smokey flavor to them!

Moved on to the Five Spice Chicken, Imperial Roll, Garlic Noodles that was more than enough to share for two! The imperial rolls were very good and had quite a bit of taro inside them. The five spice chicken was okay. Chicken wasn't too flavorful nor fresh. Chicken was on the dry side. Garlic noodles had plenty of garlic flavor to them and was generously portioned.

Service was friendly by the staff. Restrooms are towards the back of the restaurant, inside the kitchen.

~$11/head after tax and tip for lunch with no SF Healthy surcharge.

...street parking is rather crunchy in the area...
author: Derek S.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place because their five spice chicken is freaken delicious but they only give 7 small pieces....grrrrr WHY YOU HAVE TO BE SO GOOD FOR 

Okay here is the breakdown. 
*It's a typically priced Vietnamese restaurant. Portion-wise, it's not much. BUT the food is pretty darn good. 

*Menu isn't as extensive but feature some of the more popular Vietnamese dishes and of course their ever famous five spice chicken with garlic noodles. 

I was craving pho but definitely couldn't pass on trying their five spice chicken so my girlfriend and I shared it. 

Five Spice Chicken w/ Garlic Noodle: 
-you don't get much chicken but for the little that you do get, it's magical. The chicken is moist and juicy, the skin is seasoned and cooked to a beautiful golden brown.
-garlic noodles were fresh and pretty good; not the best I ever had, honestly I thought it could use more garlic. 

Pho Tai Bo Vien (rare beef and meatball): soup is flavorful and delicious. It seems to also be apparent in their pho too that they're a bit exiguous or skimpy when it comes to meat lol. So do bear that in mind. If you're not concerned about portions then taste-wise, this place is a gem!

PARKING: street, metered and unmetered residential 

SERVICE: incredible! Guy was super friendly and attentive
author: Vivian S.

description: One of the best pho broths in SF. Also had garlic noodles with curry chicken -- delicious, but the chicken seemed perhaps a little undercooked because it was slightly red-tinged. Didn't get sick, though, so that's that. Above all else, the icing on the cake of my visit was the excellent, attentive service of the waitress, who was naturally calm yet incredibly responsive, timely, and personable. Great food and even better, nay, Best(!) service. Will be back for sure.
author: James C.

description:
Had an amazing lunch here at Perilla!
Ordered grilled pork rolls and five-spice chicken pho. Everything was bomb and portions were big enough too! Although this was my first time, Ivan pretty much say this is my favorite stop for Vietnamese cuisine. Can't wait to come again!! I want to try the imperial rolls next.
author: Brandon L.

description: I ordered the five spice chicken with the garlic noodles and it was just okay. It was nothing special to me. The garlic noodles were super buttery and didn't have much garlic flavor. I'm not sure if I would go back.
author: Allyson L.

description:
WHY DIDN'T ANYONE TELL ME ABOUT THIS PLACE? Correction: Okay, people told me about this place but WHY DIDN'T ANYONE DRAG ME OUT TO THIS PLACE SOONER? 

Garlic noodles, where you been all my life? #27 is going to be my go-to item each time now from here on out until the end of time. Five Spice Chicken with Imperial Rolls and Garlic Noodles... shut the door, you have all three I need. What I love about their dish is that they give you three rolls (cut up in half). THREE WHOLE ROLLS! Most places barely give me ONE! And they give me not one... not two... but threeeeeee? Five spice chicken was crispy and meaty and tender. Garlic noodles was so flavorful that I could cry. They gave two pieces of broccoli to make me feel healthy. This dish is heaven sent - super filling because so much food and reasonably priced at around $10. If only Perilla was next door to my house...

Don't even look at the sriracha or hoisin sauce because you don't need none of that. Maybe for your pho. I haven't tried the pho and I don't think I ever can because #27 is just too tempting. Am I overhyping it? No, I am not.
author: Diana C.

description: Love coming to SF and going to this place. Really good quality food and it's not on the overly expensive side. It's a pain to find parking but the service and the quality of the food make it worth it
author: Athina L.

description: Perilla is clean and has decent service. Prices are reasonable. Portions are generous and the Imperial Rolls are worth the extra 2 dollars.  Garlic noodles were rich and flavorful while the vermicelli bowl had a good balance of meat and vegetables. I wish the vermicelli bowl had less lettuce and more of other vegetables such as cucumbers and carrots. If I am in the area I would not hesitate to return.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Delicious food in this busy quaint local shop.  I only gave it 4 stars because food contains MSG* and I felt it after our meal of Pho & garlic noddles. I am to blame for not asking in advance, but I can't remember the last restaurant in SF that still uses MSG.   

* I called the restaurant after feeling the affects of the MSG and asked if they use MSG. They answered "just a little "
author: Janet K.

description:
1000th review!!

Went there a couple of times, never had to wait, food is nice, good quantity, cheap for San Francisco, friendly staff, and service is quick. The menu is quite large. I'd recommend this place to my friends.
author: Matthew C.

description:
Ate here for the second time yesterday. The food is delicious and the service was good. 
I will definitely be back and recommend anyone give them a try. 
We had Imperial Rolls and Veggie Summer Rolls for Appetizers. We had Five Spice  Chicken Garlic Noodles and Meatball Pho for Dinner. I had no trouble parking but this is Irving St. so I realize I got lucky. 
35.00 before tip. Just had Tea and water.
author: Nuno M.

description:
GARLIC NOODLES!

Not many places make Vietnamese style garlic noodles as well as Perilla does. (OK, I take that back, PPQ Dungeness Island also makes pretty mean garlic noodles too) I believe Perilla's claim to fame are their garlic noodles...and make sure to get them.

I've been coming here since they first opened when I was a pharmacy school student. I usually order #27 - garlic noodles with imperial rolls and five spice chicken.  The portions are pretty big, so if you're a small eater, this can last you for two meals.  The five spice chicken is pretty tasty and accompanies well with the garlic noodles. I also like their cha gio (imperial rolls) since they're really crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They also include taro in their cha gio, which is pretty unique since most Vietnamese joints do not include taro in them.  I am a fan of taro, so their cha gio always hit the spot.

But to describe their dish that put them on the map.. their GARLIC NOODLES!  Chewy egg noodles loaded with garlic flavor (and visible garlic chunks).  Each bite of the garlic noodles you can taste the garlic flavor. Something that I dig, but maybe not vampires. :)  I've had garlic noodles at other Asian joints, which were usually so bland that you couldn't taste any hint of garlic. With Perilla's garlic noodles...you can definitely taste the garlic! That's what I call...yummy! 

Overall, a great full-flavored meal that is very reasonable.  Come and try the garlic noodles!  If you're afraid of vampires, don't worry about them -- they won't be anywhere near. :)
author: Matthew L.

description: Ate lunch here on Irving Street. Viet soup noodle and Veggie roll appetizer. I thought soups were average and Veggie rolls were well made. Service was excellent and environment looked clean. I will try other entrees next time.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Ordered my food thru eat 24 at 7pm.  Right now it is 9pm and food hasn't arrived yet. I don't care how busy your store is, 2 stupid bowl of pho would only take 5mins to make.   Who the fudge would want to wait more than 2 hours for their food!   Management needs to see this and fix this problem or else I guarantee you your business would not last !

 So I got a respond from their manager .   All I can say is please take responsibility for your customer's wait time and not blame it on eat 24.
author: Lubin T.

description: Five spice chicken here is on point! The meat is so soft, tender, and a little fatty, which I like. Garlic noodles with the chicken is a fantastic combo! I didn't want it to end while eating even though I was so full. A little greasy but that's understandable. Will come back to try other entrees as well! I wish parking was a little easier to find too.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
what to order: five spice chicken garlic with imperial rolls
tip: order another one to-go because its that good.

so. bomb.
are you considering getting anything besides the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls? if so, you are a FOOL.
look at all these reviews, they all say to get this dish, and they are absolutely right!!

so freaking good and a HUGE portion. I kept eating and eating until I hated myself... and then I still had some left over for lunch tomorrow

I ordered one to-go for my boyfriend to try and I almost considered not telling him after I ate mine... thats how good it is.

I can't wait to go back
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description:
Come hungry. This casual Vietnamese restaurant serves large portions. The waiting area inside is minimal so don't be intimidated if you see people gathered on the sidewalk. Thankfully, service and attentive staff mean the wait is rarely long.

Imperial Rolls and Five Spices Chicken Garlic Noodle - Comes with 3 imperial rolls. The imperial rolls were ok. I would probably only order them again to share. The chicken was well seasoned and tender with crispy skin. The garlic noodles were just the right combination of buttery and garlicky but a bit dry.
author: Amanda H.

description: I'm absolutely in love with the Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles with Imperial Rolls ($10.75)! The garlic noodles are one of the best I've ever had and pair amazingly with the five spice chicken. The imperial rolls are a great addition to the dish with the fish sauce as well. Everything is flavorful and plentiful for such a good price too --you just can't go wrong. Since it was so much food, I had it for leftovers and it was still just as amazing for my next two lunches. This place is officially one of my favorites in SF without a doubt.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Ordered the garlic noodles with pork chop and it was pretty good. Prices were decent but I think a bit pricey for this type of establishment. Portions are generous though and the pork chop was cooked to perfection. Its hard to mess up on garlic noodles and they had it spot on, wasn't too greasy. My sister added the eggrolls on her plate and I wish I added them as well because they were so freaking good. I almost wanted to order extras but I was already so full from eating what was on my plate. I would definitely come back again. 

They take credit cards. Street Parking is very limited in this area.
author: Tommy L.

description: Been here many time and I have never once been disappointed.  The pho is flavorful and hits the spot on a cold day, when your sick or hungover.  The garlic noodles are amazing and my favorite is the five spice chicken.  I would definitely say they are the best garlic noodles I've ever had.  I must warn you through, the one on Haight does not taste the same.  I ordered it on caviar and I was not happy with it as it didn't taste like the one on Irving.  The flavors are totally different.  Not sure if it's different owners but I'm only speaking for the one on Irving.  And their staff is so nice and attentive.
author: Andrina H.

description:
Really nice. Good food and not expensive ! 
Excellent quality 
Very good service
A lot of food
I recommend this restaurant for people who like good Asian foods
author: Guilhem P.

description: Love the food... love the attentions! I had the rice and pork chops! It was delicious!
author: Miranda R.

description: i absolutely love this place, i have been here to take out twice this week, is around the corner from my place and the food is not only priced super reasonable but very delicious
author: Tony M.

description:
Such good quality comfort food. Obviously this place is well known for their garlic noodles and it lives up to my expectations. I get huge cravings for their flavorful egg noodles coated in garlic and the five spice chicken is nice and juicy. Everything is seasoned just right so no one flavor is too overpowering. 

Service is pretty quick and it doesn't get quite hectic, but parking is always hard in the inner sunset so be wary
author: Jay P.

description:
TL;DR: FIVE SPICE CHICKEN PHO, light garlic noodles, incredible service!

In my two times at Perilla, I have already nailed it down as my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco. This restaurant provides different flavors than what most would expect. Perilla manages to hit all the basics of Viet food perfectly while putting their own spiced up twist to it.

In my two experiences here, I've been suggested to come and I've suggested others to come with me. This is a popular spot in the area. On the Saturday that I came, it was extremely crowded. It took us about 25 minutes to get seated, which isn't exactly common in Vietnamese restaurants. The staff is incredibly gracious and patient. Multiple waiters checked up on us before and during our meal. When the check was given to our table, each of us were thanked for coming in for the day. Very sweet of them!

Both times I went to Perilla, I ordered the Five Spice Chicken Pho. Oh man, I have no idea where to start. This is such a unique dish. The slightly crunch skin chicken is served on the side of the bowl of pho, keeping it from getting soggy or losing its flavor. The five spices really do come out in this dish because it's one of the most flavorful bowls of pho I've ever had. The chicken and the pho is the perfect pairing for any type of day. I was also able to try some of my friend's garlic noodles. To my surprise, the noodles were very light. When I think of garlic noodles, I imagine the overwhelming taste of garlic, to the point of it becoming distasteful. These noodles were flavorful and had that tint of garlic, but nowhere close to overpowering.

If in the area, I would suggest only two restaurants: San Tung and Perilla. It's nice to know that when I'm in this area, I have restaurants that I can trust with an excellent meal. Also, I believe Perilla has recently expanded to a smaller location in San Leandro, closer to where I live. If it's anything even close to the original, I'll be going there often!
author: Calvin T.

description: Huge portions and really flavorful broth in the broth! Ordered the pho special (no tripe and tendons tho), and vermicelli bowl with 5 spice chicken and egg roll. The bowl was huge and chicken was very tender and full of flavor, egg roll was super yummy, and the sauce was great too. I'd return to try more stuff!
author: Mei W.

description: Was visiting UCSF for the afternoon and stopped by for a quick lunch with a friend. The service was quick and portions great for the price, but the food was pretty average IMO. I ordered the five spice chicken, imperial roll, and garlic noodles, which apparently is one of their signature dishes. The chicken was good, but the garlic noodles left something to be desired (too buttery for my taste). Parking, like anywhere in inner sunset, can be difficult and is metered on the street.
author: Eric C.

description:
Perilla has one of the best garlic noodles in town!

I have been in and out of this restaurant for over 4 years now. I've enjoyed garlic noodles from other restaurants in San Francisco, but nothing compares to what they make here. The noodles are perfectly softened with a good amount of butter. The flavor isn't too oily nor is it unbearably garlic-y. The beef that came with the garlic noodles were tender and juicy as well. We also ordered a plate of fried egg rolls which consisted of 3 rolls cut in half. 3 rolls sounded like nothing for our starving appetite, but I was famished after finishing the first roll. The crunchy exterior shell and the flavorful meat melded perfectly together with the vegetables. The service was incredibly nice and attentive. The downside is that the garlic noodles is the only dish I've ever tried here. But the plus side is that I get to try something new next time!
author: Linda K.

description:
I've been eating at Perilla in Irving St. for a long time now. So this review might be a bit over due. I won't comment much on the food other than it's fantastic, straight forward, and fairly priced. Good pho begins with the broth, and Perilla hits it right on the head.

This review, however, is for their customer service. Every time I've eaten at this location, or ordered delivery/takeout, it's been with enthusiasm and a smile; always trying to do well by their customers.

Last night, after a long 4.5 hour drive back home to SF, my gf and I decided that the perfect way to cap off the evening was with noodles from Perilla. So we placed an order via Grubhub; about an hour to deliver, sure no problem. We've ordered many times from them like this. It's been an hour and, and still no delivery. I suspected something was up, so I called the restaurant to ask for a status. 
It turned out that they had cancelled the order once it came in, because we were out of their range of delivery for this evening in particular, as they were really busy. Fair enough, but there was no notification, and much disappointment. As soon as I was on the phone with them, I got an email from Grubhub noting the cancellation. In other words, Grubhub didn't notify me until after an hour that my order had been cancelled.
The girl on the phone noticed this and expressed her confusion, and recognized that Grubhub's system had screwed us both over. She felt really bad, and said that if we still wanted the order, they would place a rush on it and send it our way. I thanked her, and told her that I'll keep in mind that Sunday nights are dicey for delivery in my area.
We were finally happy to have our noodles delivered. One of them we got pho instead of garlic noodles, but it didn't matter, because the noodle soup ended up being preferable, and the meat choice was right. Hah. Just had to replace the order over Grubhub so I could pay for it after the cancellation goes through.

Honestly, I don't write many reviews; just not into it much. But I thought this warranted it, and I'm always down to giving a shout out to local businesses.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Wow, love the food here!  I got the garlic noodles and five spice chicken and it does not disappoint!  the chicken skin is so crispy and flavorful. 
 Hubby got the chicken curry and it was really delicious too.  I didn't think I could finish everything because the portion size is quite big but since it's so damn good, I finished it all!  Would definitely return!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I don't always eat Vietnamese food, but when I do, I eat at Perilla. 

A popular item on the menu is #27, Imperial Rolls with Five-Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles ($10.25). THE HYPE IS REAL. ONE OF THE BEST GARLIC NOODLES IN TOWN. The chicken is also tender, juicy, and delicious. Other items on the menu are also super affordable and just the right portion size! 

Extremely friendly service! Every time I come here the servers give you a warm welcome and are extremely polite and attentive. One night, it was raining incredibly hard and my boyfriend and I left the restaurant without our leftovers. One of the servers ran outside in the pouring rain and chased after us just to give us our food -- and she was still smiling! That is dedication! 

Come check out Perilla. You'll be satisfied and full.
author: Kristal D.

description: Tried the 5 spice chicken noodle and it was really good. The chicken was nice and tender with the sauce on top. Good service and helpful with menu options
author: Brandon O.

description: Based on the other yelp reviews this place absolutely did not disappoint!! The five spice chicken was hands down the best chicken I've ever tried from a restaurant, highly recommend! I also recommend the spring rolls and the egg rolls as well, as the chili fish sauce they both come with compliment them very well. The garlic noodles were good but the flavor was not amazing as it wasn't strong enough. However, the portion sizes were pretty generous for the price point!
author: Tiffany C.

description: The first 2 times I went here, it was because I didn't want to wait in line to get into Yummy Yummy (about a block away). I saw the photos on Yelp of the garlic noodle dishes and immediately knew I wanted it. It's quite a solid dish. Great amount of noodles and meat. Only 2-3 pieces of broccoli, which is perfect, haha. The waitresses have been pretty friendly.
author: Steven L.

description: Love this place sm! The people who work here are superrrr nice, the food here aren't too expensive, food tastes good, and big portions :)
author: Isabella H.

description: I really enjoy coming here for the garlic noodles. Their five spice chicken, beef, and imperial rolls are good, but the noodles are definitely the show stopper. In terms of portion size, I think they could give a bit more... The service is good and I enjoy the atmosphere. The food comes to the table relatively quick and there's a bunch of TVs on the wall to keep you distracted.
author: Victor L.

description:
Probably the best Vietnamese food in the city of San Francisco, though the award for the best in the Bay Area, I still believe, goes to Ben Tre in Millbrae.

You'll see EVERYONE here eating the Five-Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles. There's a reason for that. It's delish. Big enough portion that you'll have lunch at work the next day.

Parking isn't cute, so walk or Uber if you can, bring your patience with you if you have to street-park.
author: Sean B.

description: This is probably my new favorite place for garlic noodles!! Not dry at all and perfectly buttery and garlicky. Service was also friendly and great! My favorite combo is the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. Decent portions and prices.
author: Joanna K.

description:
I'm familiar with the Perilla in the FiDi so was curious to try this one in the Avenues after a staycation day at the Academy of Sciences.  I actually think this location is better.  For the FiDi lunch rush, that location must precook a lot of the garlic noodles; I've seen huge the huge vats they pull from.  We came here for an early dinner when it wasn't that crowded; our order took awhile so I figured they made it fresh.  And I could tell the difference; the noodles were so good!

Imperial Rolls and Charbroiled Beef Garlic Noodle: I love this dish because I get three of my favorite things and only two pieces of steamed broccoli (which is still too much broccoli).  The imperial rolls were perfectly crispy and filled with moist pork.  It's not Tu Lan quality, but still really good.  I love the charbroiled beef because it's shellacked with tangy marinade and full of seared goodness; almost like having Korean BBQ done for you.  The garlic noodles are so garlicky and chewy.  They're not quite as good as An The Go (i.e. Crustacean's food truck), but still yummy. 

Pork Chop Garlic Noodle: A massive amount of meat.  Thinly cut, heavily marinated and nicely seared like the beef.  As much as I'm a big fan of the beef, this may be better.

Cup of Broth: I know you don't come here for the pho, so I obviously didn't order pho.  But I was curious how it tasted so I got a cup of their beef pho broth.  It was basically meh.  Heavy tones of star anise and salt.  Missing the rich fatty and umami meat subtleties you might find at Bodega Bistro.  Definitely stick with the garlic noodles.
author: Adam B.

description:
I'm in love with their garlic noodles and five spice chicken. Literal love. I've been here a couple of times now and I really can't get enough! I usually get #27, the 5 spice chicken, garlic noodles, and imperial rolls dish. It's a TON of food. Very filling. The food itself is deliciously flavorful -- just all around great. Portion size of each part of the plate is perfect. You know when you go to a restaurant and like half the plate is noodles and there's 2 pieces of meat? Yeah not with this plate. So that's great. The chicken is always very tender and juicy, with crispy skin. Noms. The garlic noodles are so garlicy and ugh I don't even care if my breath stinks after it, WORTH IT. 

Prices are also very reasonable -- about $10-12 per plate I believe. Parking situation is kinda sucky because it's on Irving. But hopefully you get lucky and snag a sweet spot, because this place is worth the hour long parking spot search. The service is also very fast, we usually get our food within like 5-10 minutes. And the waitress we had last time was so cute and Asian LOL. She reminded me of my aunt. Whenever I want a delicious carb filled meal, I'll definitely be coming here.
author: Amy T.

description: Wait. How come I didn't know garlic noodles is a vietnamese dish? I'm pretty sure we don't eat that in Vietnam. But seems like it's "totally Vietnamese" here in the bay area. Lol. Anywho, I like the food here. Perilla is pretty simple and down to earth.  You can mix and match their meat with either vermicelli, rice, or garlic noodles. I haven't tried anything else besides the garlic noodles yet but their meat are good! My favorite is the grill/charbroiled pork (thit nuong). OMG, also their imperial roll are sent from heaven, I can probably get full off of that.
author: Yen P.

description: It's a shame this place lies in the shadow of San Tung as I'm sure most people find it because San Tung is closed, AGAIN! On our annual spring break trek to "THE" City hitting the park followed by wings only to find that San Tung is closed "to spend Spring Break with our grandkids." That is understandable I suppose. I should say thanks because Perilla delivered an enjoyable alternative. The garlic noodles were very good, service was great (filled my water glass 3 times which is rare in SF). Thank you for a great meal!
author: B K.

description: I came here after a long day of work hoping to find some good tasting pho. I made the mistake on my part of ordering pho here in the first place because this restaurant is mainly known for their garlic noodle platters. Their broth was very very bland and their noodles were a bit soggy as well. I've definitely experienced much better pho elsewhere and probably will not be back here.
author: Monica L.

description:
I've been here only twice in the past 5 months, only twice because I am too busy and they dont open while im free...

now, i dont know about their garlic noodles (nothing eye-opening in my opinion honestly, given that it was their most "celebrated" dish by visitors and that was my first encounter with perilla at irving), but the curry chicken vermicelli...

my god.

that thing is a spicy (mild*) nectar sent from heaven. i dont know what i'll do without it.

if you get it for delivery, use half of the soup; save the rest to eat with rice the next meal. lol it is that good.
author: Eryn K.

description: This place is a hidden gem! Really good food, very friendly service, and a very good experience overall!
author: Erin B.

description: Good service. Very consistent. Hard to find parking . I recommend the garlic shrimp noodles and pho combo with satay beef broth
author: Eddie C.

description: The best garlic noodles and overall Vietnamese food I have had in San Francisco! I also had the five spice chicken which was good! The pork rolls were amazing and we got two of them! Will definitely order from them a lot!
author: Tara K.

description:
Very OK. I ordered the fabled five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls and was underwhelmed but satisfied. The garlic noodles are good, not great. Not bursting with flavor, but still tasty. I wonder if I could've asked for more garlic in the noodles. The five spice chicken was also solid, but not great. Slightly crispy piece of chicken thigh with a nice seasoning but still didn't have a big enough flavor of its own. I was itching for more of their spices. Sriracha probably would've helped but I didn't want to mess with the integrity of it's own flavor at the time. Imperial rolls were strangely lacking. A nice crisp (though slightly stale) but seriously reliant on the fish sauce. It just didn't bring that much flavor to the table. I guess I wanted more flavor out of everything. I was incredibly full after though, so the portions are pretty decent.

Very good service. Everyone is friendly and accommodating. They give you a pretty good environment to sit and enjoy a meal. Check it out if you're interested. I may have came in with too high of hopes.
author: Bryant C.

description:
This is one of our favorite spots near the park.  We always go for lunch after a walk in the park, though dinner would be nice as well.  The service is excellent, atmosphere is really nice, and the food is always good.

Yesterday I had the spicy, curry chicken, noodle soup.  Wow, what a great bowl of deliciousness!!  The fresh basil, jalapeños and bean sprouts make this dish awesome.  The five spice chicken with vermicelli noodles is also a favorite.  The garlic noodles are amazing, chewy, flavorful so good.  All their dishes are good, great spot.
author: Carole W.

description:
Generally nothing wasn't overly salty which I liked. 
I really liked the veggie crispy rolls, the five spice chicken, garlic noodles. Five spice chicken is all cut up so that was an added bonus.
Pho broth wasn't very thick but it's better for me this way as I'm limiting salt.
author: A A.

description:
I give it a 3 star because I think the food is decent. It's not bad but it's not like omg it's so good. I've tried pho and from what I remember, it tasted very bland and they didn't give too much meat. 

Today, I decided to try #27, the imperial rolls with garlic noodle and five spiced chicken. I felt that garlic noodles could've been more garlic-y, but the imperial rolls and the chicken was crispy and good. However I find it a bit on the expensive side for the amount of food. 

My bf ordered #26, which is Garlic noodles and chicken curry. I tried the curry and it was pretty salty, sadly which is exactly how my bf loves it. 

For all the times I've came here, it wasn't because I was craving it, it was more because my bf wanted to go because we didn't know what to eat. I personally wouldn't come here as my choice unless someone else wanted to go. The workers are very sweet and nice but oh wells :/
author: Elaine C.

description:
#27; Garlic Noodles with Imperial Rolls & Five Spice Chicken (comes with fish sauce and a few pieces of broccoli). DONE DEAL. 

Order this dish and you'll be set. My boyfriend Gabriel N. and I came here to eat dinner on a Saturday night. It's a small place so I suggest you try and come early because there is a waitlist going on. We ended up waiting about 20 minutes or so for a table, and about 10 minutes for our food. 

For about $10 you get quite a lot. They definitely stack you with a lot of Garlic Noodles. And these aren't just the shitty kind of noodles; these noodles are actually pretty darn tasty! Not too oily and not too dry at all. 

My boyfriend and I ended up sharing the #27 and #28 (same thing but with Charboiled Pork instead). Both dishes were really good but if I had to choose I think it would be the Five Spice Chicken. Chicken was made really well and the skin it had on was quite crispy. 

Overall, this place is really delicious! I will definitely be back if I am craving the #27 dish and/or if I am in the area :P
author: Amy T.

description:
First thing I want to say, HUGE PORTIONS! For the garlic noodle dishes, at least. 

My boyfriend and I came in on a Monday when they opened. It wasn't busy which was okay to me. I ordered their charbroiled pork with garlic noodles & imperial roll. I was so shocked when my order came! A huge pile of garlic noodles and I love garlic noodles! The noodles didn't have enough garlic flavor to me, to be honest. I love garlic so sometimes it can be too much for other people. My first bite was slightly bland, but as I got to the middle, it had a little more flavor. I did add some sriracha and fish sauce and it balanced it out. The pork was flavorful and not tough at all. I do want to try their five spice chicken next time. Service was great! I enjoyed my first time experience.
author: Joey C.

description: Good quality ingredients, very reasonable prices, huge portions... we'll definitely be back.
author: Seth C.

description: I have enjoyed my meals at Perilla every time we've gone or had takeout, and my husband absolutely raves about their garlic noodles. I haven't found that one dish that makes me want to rave yet, but I have tried numerous options on their menu and find it all very delicious and satisfactory. Their delivery tends to be a little slow, but eating in is always an enjoyable experience.
author: Daphne W.

description:
The garlic noodles here are amazing! And for a dollar more you can get two imperial rolls with your noodles. 

There's usually enough garlic noodles for me to have as a second meal. The five spice chicken comes with crispy skin on top - yum! The imperial rolls are soo crispy!

I don't recommend ordering the vermicelli here. They give you a lot of noodles and not that much meat so the proportion is really off. If you're planning to order something other than garlic noodles here, you're better off going to Yummy Yummy across the street.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Love love love love me some garlic noodles. 

Perilla is perfect especially since now their sister restaurant PPQ is no longer opened for lunch, this is where my cravings are completely satisfied. Its still quite a drive out Herr, but it's less busy even during peak lunch hours. It's mostly to gos or table of one,which is fine by me. The space to dine is very small a couple of tables, narrow walkways. 

There's always a lunch special going in for their banh mi (Vietnamese sandwich) and an order of Thai tea for about 7 dollars. But that's not why I'm there. Its for the garlic noodles! Its smaller portions but the same flavor is right there. A rich, buttery sauce with minced garlic slight crisp to the noodles, yet so moist and mouthful with each bite. Its a pretty huge side with the entree like their five spice chicken or pork. I only enjoy the chicken when I'm at Perilla, at PPQ its almost a waste of an order because there's so much better dinner options.

This is the place to try the PPQ pho (9.75)- love their broth. It's not a mouth full of salt or MSG, or green onions and cilantro. How lucky is that?! There's a couple of variations for meat choices, but there is one bowl size. That's all you really need. It's more expensive than your typical bowl of pho, but the quality is there and the rare beef is of a better quality. It's still under $10 a bowl which isn't bad. 

Imperial rolls (7.25) here are off the chain. Crispy as hell and it gets hotter which eat bite (almost tongue burning!) But it doesn't lose it's crisp during the entire meal. They're like fun sized version of lumpia but better tasting for sure. 

Five spice chicken whether its on the side, with the garlic noodles, on the pho- the skin's crisp is beyond me. Crunch with every bite, so flavorful and the chicken is moist! Not dry. The portions for the chicken definitely isn't skimped. If you don't know what to do, the garlic noodle five spice chicken #21 combo is pretty cracking! 

I'm a noodles gal, so you already know I'll have that side of their famous garlic noodles (3.5). The bowl is pretty deep and it's almost as much as you would regularly get at PPQ from a dinner side. 

To be honest, everything here is absolutely delicious. It opens for lunch and it opens for dinner. It's way more quieter and cozier than PPQ is especially for a date. Downside is no crab, but I mean service here is on point. Always friendly and smiling. Beats the service at any of their other locations. 

If you have that authentic garlic noodle craving, in the area, got a $20 in your wallet- you will be all set for Perilla.
author: Winnie G.

description:
First off: huuuuuge portions! I probably could've split my five spice chicken + garlic noodles order into two full meals. Great portion size for the price. 

Garlic noodles were flavorful and not super oily like I've had at other places. Chicken was nice and crispy on the outside, flavorful, and tender. 

My only complaint are the cold vegetables that come with the dish...I understand wanting to toss some veggies in there to round out the dish, but I'd rather not get any veggies than get them cold. 

Overall, a pretty solid place!
author: Winnie T.

description:
To start off, the service was pretty great. My friend and I came here on a whim after experiencing terrible service at another restaurant and leaving because of that. Even though there was a good amount of people waiting, we were seated within 10-15 mins and got our food shortly after. 

We had the Garlic Noodles with Charbroiled Shrimp and the Perilla Pho and they were both pretty good. I hadn't really tried either dishes much at other restaurants so I can't compare that accurately. But I thought their dishes were flavorful and perfect for gloomy SF days. Would definitely want to come back to try out other dishes in the future!
author: Guinivere A.

description:
Been coming here for years & I'm pretty sure I've only gotten two dishes here haha. It's either garlic noodles w/ imperial rolls and pork OR 5 spice chicken (depending on my mood). 

It's a huge pretty big plate - huge portion of noodles & a couple pieces of broccoli as well! If you're not feelin garlic noodle-y and want to opt for white rice, don't be afraid to ask! Just pour over the fish sauce and mm mmm :) Imperial rolls are always cooked until their crisp and meet is well seasoned. 

For 10.25, I'd say it's definitely worth it. Most recently I got to try my friends curry noodles & it was good at first - but I can never take too much curry at once - but she really enjoyed it!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I've been here several times with friends and my boyfriend. It *was* actually part of a regular rotation (if we didn't feel like Yummy Yummy or Kevin's)...but not anymore. Honestly, Perilla is good. I've been here multiple times, and they are almost always consistent. I would never write a review like this unless I was absolutely sure Perilla caused the worst food poisoning I've ever had.

Perilla was open on Christmas day (12/25/17). It was paaaacked. Nothing else was open. My boyfriend came here and ordered a five spice chicken pho and five spice chicken garlic noodles for both lunch and dinner, and brought the food back home since nothing else was open. We shared the pho for lunch and the noodles for dinner.

We both felt a little queasy before bed time, and went to sleep. Then we both woke up with the worst stomachache ever. He and I threw up multiple times through the night. Then another few times with it coming out the other way. Food poisoning lasted for another couple days. 

Given that the only other 2 things we had eaten were almonds and pistachios as a snack, it has to be Perilla that did this to us. I just hope that they are more careful in the future with food - it was a terrible experience. I'm shocked no one else experienced this on Christmas day.
author: A Y.

description:
3.5 stars because it's good but maybe not great. 

I had the BBQ beef lunch with garlic noodles. For $13 you get a big portion and a lot of imperial rolls (they're good). A lot of people were having pho when I went in so maybe I'll have to try that next. 

I'd go back if I'm on this side of the park, but Le Soleil on Clement's BBQ lunch is 10x better for around the same price.
author: Hanster P.

description: I haven't really had much Vietnamese food, and when I do I usually get pho, so it was really nice to see the menu with so many varying options! Looking around, I noticed everyone got the garlic noodles with the imperial rolls, so I decided to give it a try too. The imperial rolls are perfectly crispy and the garlic noodles are very good too (just a tad bland without hot sauce in my opinion). The order comes with so much food that I could easily get two meals out of it.
author: Alice S.

description:
Came here the other day with my date before checking out Cal Academy of Sciences Nightlife (DINOSAURS!!!! Rawrr!!) 

I had done research the night before of where to nom and it came down to Perilla and two other places. Fortunately, my date made it known that he was craving something with noodles and I knew we had to check this place out. 

We came just as it opened for dinner and were greeted by a very nice man. We both ordered the 5-spice chicken with garlic noodles.

Oh my goodness gracious was it delicious. The chicken was crispy but juicy and flavorful. The garlic noodles were plenty and not overpowering. The fish sauce was on the sweeter side so I occasionally dipped my chicken in there for funsies but my date basically drank his fish sauce. Around $20 for two dishes wasn't too bad either! 

In the end we were definitely satisfied and full. My date even recommended we come here again this weekend since we will be in town. We will see you again soon, Perilla. Thanks for being you!
author: Leslie Q.

description:
If I could give this place more stars, I would. One of my absolute FAVORITE places in the city! It is everything. If you're reading this and haven't tried Perilla, seriously leave. Go.

Now.

What you MUST order here are the garlic noodles. Hands down, THE BEST I've had. I can't imagine it being any tastier. I've never had a bad experience, and they are always cooked to perfection. It's not super oily, and there aren't huge chunks of garlic just floating around in it. It's always so flavorful, and the garlic is infused seamlessly. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I might have to order some for dinner tonight.

So if it's your first time, I highly recommend ordering #27 -- the five-spice chicken, garlic noodles and imperial rolls. This is my go-to order and it is BOMB DOT COM. The chicken is nicely seasoned, crispy and tender. You also get 3 delicious imperial rolls to top it off. The portion sizes are rather generous, and since I'm a small eater, I get two meals out of one order. I've also tried their pho, which is a good option if you want something warm and soupy.

Another great thing about this place is the service. They are always so friendly whether I'm dining in or ordering takeout. The street parking can be a bit tricky so ordering delivery online is always a great option too ;-)
author: Michelle H.

description:
I LOVE garlic noodles, and Perilla absolutely delivers.

Within minutes after ordering, I was presented with a giant plate of delicious butter and garlic infused noodles accompanied with tasty, tender meat (I got the five spiced chicken, and my friend had the pork--both of us were extremely happy) and crispy pork-filled rolls. We ate ourselves into food comas and still had food to take home.

Amazing.
author: Kelly R.

description: Their Curry Chicken with garlic noodles is delicious and perfectly flavored. Highly recommended! I intend on visiting again!
author: Etc C.

description: Big portions. Ordered four plates with five people and still can't finish. The satay beef pho is surprisingly delicious. Got the infamous #27 and as expected.... So good. If you don't want garlic noodles you can get the vermicelli. Service is great.
author: Cal L.

description: The garlic noodles are the thing to get here. I've also gotten pho here and it's not bad. They give you a TON of noodles in a regular sized bowl, but I thought the soup to noodle ratio was a bit off and there was too much noodle and not enough soup. It's also a little pricey, but this entire neighborhood in inner sunset is pricey. It's just something to be aware of.
author: Susan W.

description: Lovely place.  Quick, friendly lunchtime service.  Noodle were cooked perfectly.  Same with the chicken.  Spring rolls were fresh.
author: Andrew P.

description: Wait was not that long on sat afternoon close to 2pm, ordered pho and garlic noodle, portion and taste are good. Service was fast. Will try again next time
author: Grace L.

description: My first visit here several years ago was so underwhelming that I decided not to go back -- there are so many good places to eat in this town, who needs to go back to anything just meh? -- but someone I was meeting wanted pho and this was the nearest place, so I went. And now I have to remember always to give a restaurant a second chance! The vegetarian pho was delicious!! First of all, they have several vegetarian options, so that is a very good thing, but when veg pho with veg broth and mushrooms tastes this good, it's defs worth going back! And the fact that it wasn't an absolute zoo with lots of peeps lined up because it's the latest fad place to go or too loud to hear your friend(s) is even better!! Hoping they're as good the next time I get back there hopefully soon!
author: Helen T.

description: New experience visiting San Francisco - I had the Pho with tofu and barbecued shrimps on the side.  Wow - it was delicious.  My usual concern with pho is too much salt, but here it just wasn't the case.  Not too many calories either.  Service was totally down to earth, but available for refills at a moments notice.  Parking is on your own.  We found street parking without too much of a problem.  Will go again!
author: Malka T.

description: My first time here and had a great time. Was told they were best known for their garlic noodles and had to give it a try. The proportions were great! I'm not a person who eats big portions but the plate was big enough for me to also eat the noodles for dinner. I was recommended the five spice chicken garlic noodles and I would recommend that for others to try.
author: Dominique C.

description: Huge portion for a good price. I got the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles and could only eat about half of it. Pretty standard for Vietnamese grilled pork, but well-executed and tasty. I would definitely come here again.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Any of their 12.00USD entrees have enough veggies, meat, and vermicelli to be a real dinner. That is amazing!
Cooked in the charbroiled "French /Vietnamese tradition",  the meat is lovely and never greasy.
A brilliant... not too noisy, Soooo inexpensive dinner.
author: wally i.

description:
Friendly workers that frequently refilled our water and ran around like crazy to make sure we had everything we needed.  We got napkins when we asked for.. it's a  very simple jesture but surprisingly many places neglect their customer and deprive them of the basic services.  

First time here and with family.. I thought the garlic noodles are petty decent but could use a tad bit more garlic.  5 spice chicken is almost perfect but way too much oil.  I felt bad for my liver.  That chicken was glistening so much and drenched at the bottom I soaked it in a napkin.  The broccoli was bland but I didn't mind it being there since the rest of the food was just carbs and meat!!  A few slices of tomatos would have made my day.  It would have added color and appeal to the plate too.  Imperial rolls were almost pefrfect in its shape size and taste plus crunchiness.

Also tried their papaya salad starter and thought it tasted great besides papaya cut too thick or would be perfect but overall food for cost I'd give 5 star.

I'm really surprised that with the service and the food quality that this place only have a 3+half stars. Is there a problem with the other dishes?
author: Juila L.

description: The food here is smack af. Can't go wrong with anything here. Although I haven't tried everything, I recommend the garlic noodles or any of the pho. Very deliciously! I would also like to shoutout the customer service here. They are all very friendly and caring. Big big shoutout to the big Asian dude cause he helped us out a lot and made sure our time there was enjoyable. Make sure to check this place out!
author: Martin L.

description: This place has the perfect ratio of cheap to delicious and huge portion sizes to boot. The service is adequate. I had the #1 - Perilla Beef Combo Pho and thought the broth was good and the produce fresh. The best thing I've had on the menu was the Imperial rolls. The five spice chicken garlic noodles is a little heavy on the garlic for some.
author: Greg K.

description:
SO yummy. I got the brisket pho and my husband got the five spice chicken. We split the shrimp spring rolls. Everything was delicious - flavorful, fresh, and nice portion sizes. The place was clean, and service was fast and friendly. The only reason I'm giving 4/5 is our food was very heavy on the noodles (which seems to be common for pho places around here). I wish there were less noodles to make room for more delicious broth and veggies. I would still recommend this place and can't wait to go back!
A quick edit: prices are great too! Under 30 dollars for two entrees and an app!
author: Amanda J.

description:
I came on a Sunday night and there were a good amount of people which is a good sign. I got the pho ga (chicken pho) and it was delicious and refreshing. The soup base was not too salty and had a good chicken flavor. 

I saw that they had garlic noodles and that seemed like a popular item. Will definitely come back for that!
author: Kelly N.

description: I've had the grilled pork spring rolls, the five spiced chicken garlic noodles, and the five spiced chicken pho on my last few visits. The chicken is cooked perfectly. It has the right amount of seasoning and moisture--this is why I keep coming back. The noodles are a quite filling and the garlic flavor really comes through. I definitely could not finish one portion. But, you know this place makes great food when the leftovers taste great the next day. I definitely would recommend this place.
author: Rachel M.

description: Got the chicken pho, which took longer than expected. Compared to other places I've tried, it's okay. Definitely seemed like garlic noodles were their speciality.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Rockstar service today. I have been coming to Irving for the past few weeks trying all the many different flavors of food and this place was a bookmarked in my Yelp as a place that I needed to go to. The parking worked out fairly well because I was able to get parking directly across the street. I initially was tempted to go to the pizza place on the same block but I came to Irving for reason, PERILLA.

The menu in the window was exactly on point. I had been to another Vietnamese restaurant just yesterday and this place definitely seemed to be a bit nicer. After reviewing a few items on the menu posted in the window I made my way on in. This place is very clean and nice. I was greeted immediately and told, "Sit anywhere". That is what I'm talking about. Eye contact, greeting, and time to get seated before approached about order. That is exceptional customer service in my opinion. I found a table closer inside near the wall and took my seat. As I sat down I was given a menu and admired this place for a bit. There are nice pieces of artwork on the wall, good music, and a very easy going vibe. Well done. 

I ordered the Imperial Rolls and the Five Spiced Chicken Garlic Noodles along with a THAI ICE TEA. As I waited I saw how well this staff works together. Between the servers and the people in the kitchen everyone that works here is constantly moving and trading off with others to make sure customer needs are being met. Between refilling water, greetings, seating, and clean up it is no wonder that this place gets busy. Shortly after I arrived more people started to fill into this place. When my food finally came I was thrilled. I was a surprised at how good the food looked. The food smelled wonderful and I could not wait to get into this meal.

My first bite started with the Imperial Rolls...they were INCREDIBLE!!! The noodles and chicken were just as INCREDIBLE. As I continued on with this meal I was very very pleased with my order, especially since it was my first time here. The meal was FANTASTIC. The service was great and I was very appreciative my server, MEIZI! 

Lunch was a success and my stomach felt appreciated. I only wish this place was bigger for some reason but that is my own personal want for this place. Aside from that this place gets the job done. So come and check check check it out yo......
author: Robert F.

description:
Pretty good Five Spice chicken and Imperial roll. The chicken was so delicious and had such good burnt ends. The Imperial rolls had crunchy wrap and very good fillings. The portions were HUGE too. The garlic noodles were a lot and were flavorful. And they were very accommodating. We had a large party of 9, and they had to move all the chairs and tables around just to accommodate our group. 

This is not an authentic Vietnamese restaurant though. More like a Vietnamese fusion one.
author: Tung D.

description:
This places awesomeness is off the charts!! As suggested by many other Yelp testimonies it is a great place to enjoy delicious Vietnamese food. 

The location is very accessible, aside from having to park on the street but we found parking in less then 8 minutes. Being in the inner sunset it's fairly close to everything else, banks, liquor stores, dessert spots, it's in a very convenient location.

Inside the restaurant it's a very comfortable atmosphere, not too spacious but not too crowded. Although I'm sure a place with such good food must get extremely busy around lunch/dinner/weekend hours. We got lucky to be seated 3 minutes after walking in the door. 

I do have to say that the people working here are some of the best restaurant employees that I've had the pleasure to be serviced by in a good while. Very attentive yet not intrusive, I'd say their demeanor is the cherry that tops this place off! Thank you for that, San Francisco isn't the best place to be in for good service but this place does better than most. 

As for the food, well I think you should take my word on it and swing by for anything on their menu, our favorite is #28 ($10.75) The imperial rolls with charbroiled pork served with a very generous portion of the most delicious garlic noodles! Every item by it self is amazing! I would say the garlic noddles and the pork were my favorite!

2 thumbs up for this wonderful establishment! Thank you for keeping the sunset a delicious place to go eat! Most definitely will be back more!
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Spring break! Time to finally leave school and go home to eat the delicious foods you've missed. Incoming, garlic noodles and Asian Baymax?? I kid you not, our waiter was straight up Asian Baymax: he was super proper, sweet, and accommodating. If we needed a refill, he was there; if we needed an extra napkin or addition order, he was there...it was amazing. All the workers were really nice in fact!

Our table ordered 2 number 22's and 2 number 28's. Everything came out together so we didn't have to awkwardly wait. The plating was clean and simple. Food tasted B.O.M.B. Everything was well worth the garlic poop later on~ 

Enjoy :P
author: Cindy M.

description:
I was in the neighborhood (redeeming my groupon for a mani-pedi) and tucked in here thinking a Thai/Vietnamese restaurant called Perilla... WTF?  It was full, dark, warm and kind of steamy inside, not usually my favorite atmosphere, but it was almost 2:00 and I was hungry.  I got the #36 with a spring roll and 5-spice chicken.  It was very good, a pleasant surprise.  The roll was crisp and not greasy, with a real aromatic meaty blend stuffed in.  The flavor of the chicken was divine.  My one criticism would be that the skin was quite unpleasantly flabby.  I pulled it off, but what a shame.  I'm a big crispy skin fan.

Food:  31/40
service:  17/20
atm/intang.:  16/20
Value:  17/20
Overall: 81/100  barely makes a 4 star
author: Diane B.

description:
One of my go-to places when I don't know what to eat! It doesn't seem to disappoint and have always provided consistently good quality for the many times I have been here. I always order the Five spice chicken garlic noodles with imperial rolls and love it! The chicken is juicy and tender and sprinkled with green onion on top! The imperial rolls are always fried to perfection and each bite is filled with crunchiness. Now onto my favorite part of this dish, the garlic noodles (cause I love anything garlic!), are seasoned with just the right amount of garlic. I also enjoy this thicker type of noodle they serve. However, at times it feels a tad bit oily. 

I have also tried their pho noodles which were simply okay so I would definitely recommend the garlic noodles over them any day!
author: Eva C.

description:
Solid Vietnamese food compared to the nearby and more Chinese than Viet fare you get at Yummy Yummy. 

The grilled meats and shrimps are good.  I usually get their vermicelli bowls with the grilled items.  Funny that there are no perilla leaves in the these bowls.  The fishsauce is a bit diluted.  But service is quick and friendly.   

BTW, the garlic noodles.  Meh.  I think PPQ does better.
author: Kris H.

description:
Tried the charbroiled pork with egg rolls over vermicelli.

First impression - that's a lot of noodles! They also provide 2 eggrolls and a pretty good amount of charbroiled meat over a bed of lettuce. They also provide tiny garnishes of peanuts and green onions.

However, after pouring the fish sauce over my vermicelli, I noticed that it didn't add much flavor. It only helped to separate the noodles. I thought some pickled carrots or maybe a few chili flakes could have definitely helped its cause. You definitely need to evenly split bites of eggrolls and protein to ensure that each bite will be hearty enough otherwise you'll be left with a lot of noodles and lettuce at the end.

Restaurant was empty when we arrived, but fairly full by the time we left. It was drafty though, so keep your jacket nearby.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Wow, I didn't know that garlic noodles could be so good! 

My friends who are SF natives suggested that we have dinner at Perilla's on a Friday night. It was nice because the restaurant wasn't too crowded at 6pm and staff was extremely nice and friendly (they constantly checked up on us and refilled out waters!). 

I ordered the five spice chicken and garlic noodles based on recommendations from my friends, and wow it was SO GOOD! The noodles were perfectly cooked and tasted so yummy with the garlic. The chicken was well cooked and seasoned, and perfectly crispy on the outside! The portion was also nice and large and it was a lot of food. 

Overall, give Perilla's a try if you're in the area!! Five spice chicken and garlic noodles will not disappoint!!
author: Joyce L.

description: You really can't go wrong with #27 - 5 spice chicken, garlic noodles and imperial rolls. Its SO good and SO filling. They literally give you a pile of noodles and you just want to eat it all because its so good!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Large portions, great service, decent prices, what more could you ask for? Perilla is probably one of my favorite places to come to in SF when it comes to getting a well-cooked Asian meal. Both times I've come here, I ordered the garlic noodles with the imperial roll and chicken and left more than satisfied. The noodles aren't overly oily and the chicken was cooked to near-perfection; moist and flavorful. The workers here are also nice, greeting us happily when we came in and smiling while serving us. Any time I ask my SF friends to recommend a place, Perilla always ends up being one of the recommendations!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
You know when you want Vietnamese, but you want something just a tiny bit nicer. Well this place is it and more than a tiny bit nicer, since the wait staff is very friendly. 

The space is small and not super loud when you dine-in. The one thing they do, that others places don't is Garlic Noodles. All your usual dish choices, but instead of rice/vermicelli noodle you can get Garlic Noodle. They use a Canton Style Noodle and it's a slight Garlic and Buttery flavor. 

And the dishes seems less greasy than usual.
author: Theresa D.

description:
