There was a mosquito and 2 fruit flies in my pho ... Even though I love this place that shit don't FLY with me! Haha, I'm still funny though.

Now I have to find a new pho spot near Cole Valley.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Not bad- Vietnamese fusion with an American flair? I got the infamous garlic noodles, with imperial rolls and beef. The garlic noodles were alright- not out of this world or anything, they could have been a bit more garlicky and flavorful. My friend said that it was not as good as he remembered them to be. The eggrolls were great- so happy they used the right vermicelli rice paper which makes the eggrolls more crispy and textured- not a fan of Chinese style eggrolls. The beef was flavorful and good. This place seems to be a popular neighborhood spot. Would return to try other items if I was in the area.
author: Vivian D.

description:
I was surprisingly impressed! 

There's mixed reviews on Perilla so I had low expectations. I decided to just go with what they're famous for- chicken garlic noodle plate. Um, YUM. Chicken was super moist and tasty! Garlic noodles were good as well, but the chicken really stood out. The prices are standard for the area, but I found the portions to be quite large. Loved the imperial rolls as well!

Friendly service!
author: Noelle H.

description: Food is ok but the service has dropped off a cliff. It used to be fast and cheerful. Maybe a bad night?
author: Chou K.

description:
We popped in here to grab a couple of Vietnamese iced coffees to go.  

They were really nice in here and it smelled great. 

Want to come back  for the garlic noodles

Maybe I'll be able to bump up the rating

The coffees were way too watery and not good
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Quick Tip
Order via  Grubhub or Eat 24 for a quick pick up and delivery

What to get?
Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle
Curry Chicken Garlic Noodle
Imperial Rolls

Garlic Noodles are buttery, chewy, and full of garlic flavor! It's a MUST ORDER! Pair that either with the Five Spice Chicken or Curry Chicken and you've got a bombastic meal! The Five Spice Chicken is grilled to perfection--tender meat with a slightly crispy skin. The Curry Chicken tastes pretty much similar to the curry chicken soup at Perilla's brother restaurant, PPQ. Lastly, the Imperial Rolls are pretty tasty. Wrap the egg roll in lettuce, add a mint leaf, and dip into sauce for a flavorful dynamic of crunchiness and freshness!
author: Briana H.

description:
Ordered the Combo Pho and 1 extra egg roll , the Pho Broth was very salted it tasted nasty ,
I couldn't finish it. It was difficult to eat the pho. Never again
author: Russell T.

description:
Came in for lunch on a weekend of exploring the good ol city. Very classic Vietnamese place with the green chopsticks in the bucket and sriracha and hoisin sauce on the side haha. After looking at all these Yelp reviews, how could I not get the Five Spice Chicken with Imperial Rolls and Garlic Noodles? My friend got the same thing, but the rice plate instead. For $11, I think it's great because I couldn't even finish my plate!

-Five Spice Chicken : The skin is my always my favorite part of chicken and it's amazing on this chicken: crispy and flavorful. The chicken meat itself is tender and juicy, although not as flavorful as the skin.
- Garlic Noodles : They give you A LOT on this plate! This was the main reason why I couldn't finish my meal. The noodles are a bit oily but there isn't enough garlic flavor to my liking. Still great to have paired with the chicken.
- Imperial Rolls : My favorite part of the dish! Crispy, crunchy, and meaty. It goes perfectly with the dipping sauce. It's awesome that this little appetizer is included in this dish :]

I was very satisfied with my meal as was my friend. She also couldn't finish her rice plate. I had enough left for a solid leftover meal the next day. The servers were very friendly and attentive with refilling our water and getting us our check/boxes even before I got the chance to ask. Would totally come here again!
author: Karen T.

description: Did a take out tonight and was satisfied with the BBQ, garlic noodle and portion size
author: Drew B.

description:
This review pertains to their delivery of a large order.  We ordered Pho amongst other items and specially requested Hoisin sauce and Sriracha.  Not only was that not delivered but neither was any accompanying mint and bean sprouts, all of which for me is essential for a satisfying experience.  We also requested chopsticks, which was not sent either.  When I called them that none of our requests was honored it pretty much fell on deaf ears.  The lady who I spoke to said she would call back and she didn't.  Will never order again.  Very disappointed.

Edited to add the veggie pho was bland and disappointing.  Tasted like light broth that lacked any flavor
author: Robert W.

description:
My goal is to order garlic noodles from every Vietnamese restaurant I visit in the City.

Perilla currently tops the list in that department. Their noodles are perfectly cooked, not too oily, and not lathered in garlic powder. In fact, these babies were what started my quest in the first place. They also are my most annoying setback, as I consistently find myself calling in to order a la carte garlic noodles, going home, cracking a fresh egg, and making my version of Asian carbonara. 

I'd recommend these garlic noodles to anyone. Best I've had so far.
author: Chanun O.

description: I've been looking all over for a yummy veggie pho. I finally came across this place and it definitely fulfills the cravings. I went two days in a row just for the pho. Very simple yet delicious and good pricing. Can't wait to explore more items on the menu.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I used to order delivery through GrubHub all the time. Now that Eat24 and delivery.com offer incentives like $2 off or 30% off, I rarely use Grubhub anymore. Unfortunately, that means I forget Perilla delivers. And I used to love ordering their food!

December 2012
*Imperial rolls ($6.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=mOfdgssPMJcHuieu8yVvEg#mOfdgssPMJcHuieu8yVvEg
*Curry chicken rice plate ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=V2oyxybFtVq7pG_CcSuQ9g#V2oyxybFtVq7pG_CcSuQ9g
*Five spices chicken garlic noodle ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=5rp0tATcpcfUMI2xoDPlZQ#5rp0tATcpcfUMI2xoDPlZQ

September 2012
*Imperial rolls and charbroiled pork vermicelli ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=C-ZLuS4OBqSXzMvpSaZtjw#C-ZLuS4OBqSXzMvpSaZtjw
*Imperial rolls and five spice chicken garlic noodle ($9.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=rMkTLvCVUpAs1iXRYpQkwQ#rMkTLvCVUpAs1iXRYpQkwQ
*Shrimp rolls ($6.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=-49udEyIMh9hIcygERCfzw#-49udEyIMh9hIcygERCfzw

*Perilla beef combo pho ($7.75)
Soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=Bo1ZX1wGhEHCuF_m1--IsA#Bo1ZX1wGhEHCuF_m1--IsA
Meat & noodles: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=cYZ3qOj7f8T-yWDVZipO-g#cYZ3qOj7f8T-yWDVZipO-g
Sides & hoisin sauce: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/perilla-san-francisco-2?select=cYZ3qOj7f8T-yWDVZipO-g#ZmvT-h0StepsFLikhJviag

One of my favorite dishes is the Imperial rolls and five spice chicken garlic noodle. I get a big plate of variety for less than $10?! Yes please! The meat is tender. The imperial rolls flavorful and crispy. And the garlic noodles are nice and garlicky!

I have to remember to order through Grubhub when I'm craving garlic noodles and chicken since Perilla's version is delicious!
author: Elena N.

description:
Every restaurant they own is so good! Love PPQ  . . . Noodle House and Dungeness Island. Perilla has all the usual vietnamese dishes but their garlic noodle combinations are most popular and one order is enough for 2 (if you're willing to share).

What to order? Number 25 - Five Spice Chicken, Imperial Rolls and Garlic Noodles

The vermicelli is great and the salads refreshing. The pho is good although better at PPQ Noodle House on 19th and irving. The portions are generous here and everything is delicious.
author: Samantha L.

description: They are known for their five spice chicken as well as their garlic noodles. But I would totally recommend eating there pho noodles which I have found to be the best in the whole city. I have tried anywhere from 6 to 7 other PHO restaurants in the city and again I found this one to be the best although they are not fully recognized for this.
author: Matthew S.

description: When a restaurant receive a 4 star review in yelp, I expect it to be very satisfying to my tongue. With that thought in mind, I came to this restaurant, ordering the five spice chicken rice noodles for my brother and the Perilla beef noodle for myself. First, I tasted the broth, and it is by no mean surprising. Then I tasted some noodles, and I'm really annoyed with the weird taste in the noodle. The most important thing in pho is the noodles but the restaurant failed to provide good quality noodles. For the five spice chicken, it is solely normal roasted chicken without any "five spice" taste. Furthermore, the restaurant used lemon instead of lime, which is really rare to see in a Vietnamese restaurant. And I really don't like they put seafood sauce on the table because the combination of pho and seafood sauce, I don't know if you feel that too, is WEIRD. WEIRD!! Ah!!!!
author: Annabelle L.

description:
Yes, all the reviews about the garlic noodles, five spice chicken and imperial rolls are true. 

The garlic noodles are probably the best I've ever had and they paired extremely well with the chicken which was slightly crispy on the outside and moist and juicy on the inside. We also got the veggie pho in beef broth which was just ok. I'll definitely be back to try more items.

My water glass was always full and the service was on point. Solid!
author: Allyson R.

description:
MOST GENEROUS PORTION IN THE CITY! My girlfriend and I got double orders of the infamous garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken (and of course upgraded to imperial rolls). The noodle portion was HUGE I mean like a MOUND (thank you noodle gods) The 5 spice chicken was crispy with  a large cuts (not like slivers of chicken katsu) and many half cut imperial rolls! 
BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE CITY! Even though we were picking up take out, the cashier was super nice. We had to wait 5 min (it was worth it), she still greeted us very friendly. Right before they bagged our order, a very nice young server came to us (like a 5 star restaurant server) asking us for napkins and cutlery. Didn't get his name but he's very tall with a baby face (ha!) and really appreciated his customer service as well! 
We're coming back here again...and again....again!
author: Stephen C.

description:
you must try the garlic noodle with 5 spice chicken. Simple yet so good.

We eat in and so take out/delivery. If you plan and having it delivered order 45min-1 HR ahead
author: Linda L.

description:
One Word: HEAVEN.

This restaurant has a really nice twist to Vietnamese Cuisine, which I approve! My boyfriend and I each ordered the Garlic Noodles with Imperial Roles & Five Spice Chicken. For only $10 per dish, why do I need to share? 

The Garlic Noodles were divine and really lived up the hype. I liked that it wasn't too oily and didn't have an overwhelming garlic flavor to it. The imperial rolls were nicely crisp and tasted perfect with the fish sauce. And for the Five Spice Chicken... AMAZING. The chicken was just so moist and so flavorful... Unfortunately I wasn't able to finish it but my boyfriend gladly devoured my leftovers afterwards... No shame.

Will be coming back whenever I visit San Francisco. This place is so affordable and very generous with their portions! San Tung is down the street but I rather eat here instead :)
author: MyTien P.

description: Health inspection score: 75. NO WAY I AM EATING HERE AGAIN. I probably ate a roach. Disgusting. When are these places going to learn. YOU NOT IN JUNGLE NOW.
author: Pearl R.

description:
Decent place. My boyfriend got the pho dac biet and I tried the garlic noodle with five spice chicken for the first time. The pho broth was decent. There was a good amount of noodle and meat. The five spice chicken was deliciously moist and flavored. I would really recommend it by itself. I do not understand the fuss over the garlic noodle. I love garlicky food and I would have really liked this dish if I didn't feel so gross eating it. The whole dish revolves around grease and a great quantity of carbs. I stopped after a couple quick bites because I was so afraid of getting a heart attack if I kept eating it. The dish left me with such a heavy feeling afterwards, as if my body had to work extra hard to digest all that oil. I don't even think that garlic oily noodle is even an authentic Vietnamese dish anyways. You cannot find that in any Vietnamese restaurant in Orange County or Vietnam. 
Overall, the place was cheap and there were many different options. We will keep coming back for other dishes.
author: Catherine T.

description:
I've always wanted to like this place. I've been to this spot a few times but I always end up a little disappointed.

The most popular item here is the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. I can understand why a lot of people like this dish, but I think it's just okay. The five spice chicken by itself is good. It's perfectly seasoned and cooked crispy. The imperial rolls and the garlic noodles on the other hand are pretty bland. Though I like the texture of the noodles, the amount of garlic used might be equivalent a clove of garlic. I have to drown everything in fish sauce to make the dish taste good.

I've also tried their pho and beef carpaccio. From what I remember, the pho broth was pretty tasteless. And the only thing I remember about the carpaccio was just to never to order it again...

I feel bad giving a mediocre review because the servers here are really friendly and attentive. I would probably come back here if any of my friends wanted to eat here, but I will never crave this place.
author: Derek T.

description: Garlic noodles and curry chicken... need I say more? This place is delicious and the people who work here are so kind. I work around the corner and can pop in and out for lunch and leftovers to take home. I love that the meals are fresh and that the kitchen is open so that you can see the behind the scenes action. It's delicious!
author: Autumn B.

description: Nice inexpensive spot for lunch or dinner. The portions were large and the flavors were good.
author: Anne S.

description: Huge portions of delicious Pho at a very affordable price, especially in San Francisco! I had their beef brisket Pho on a cold and rainy day, amazing!
author: Noah P.

description: We were going to eat Manna, but it had a long line...so this place was across the street. The staff was super nice, food came out early, tasted good, and the place was clean. Good for parties with kids. Fairly inexpensive.
author: Valentine S.

description: Combo beef Pho was absolutely delicious. Perfect balanced broth with high quality tasting and looking ingredients. I've had lots of Pho from many different places and this tastes authentic and among the best in my humble opinion. Place has a relaxed vibe especially for lunch on a sunny day. We had light streamers shimming on us by the window!
author: Timur L.

description: Unlike some more popular restaurants on Yelp, Perilla has a vegetarian menu and offers a deliciously flavourful veggie pho broth. Good service, large portions and good prices! Best veg broth I have had in ages! I've had pho at quite a few places and this place is definitely one of my favourites.
author: Zoe P.

description:
Yelp Review

15. Food Taste: 5

Questions Answered: 14 / Total score: 5 = 5
author: Charlie A.

description:
Wow the trip to the restroom takes you back to Vietnam. Or a sewing factory

At first I thought it was the first door the the right but it's not. That door was a portal to a place for brooms or its another kitchen. I didn't open the door because to your left you see chefs in dark rubber aprons walking around looking something to do. And they were doing something because they were all wet and sweaty! 

It was great. A further down I saw a couple of women working on food. There were huge bowls of food ready to be processed. They were using their hands, call it hand made!

The floor was wet were covered in rubber mats, it was amazing. When I finally found the restroom, which is the farthest door and the last door, actually the only door I saw that I was waiting to see. The are two doors you'll see if you go to the restroom. The farthest door is the only door you should be looking for. The door with the restroom sign on it. However I was blind to see it because of all the scenery that was taking place. 

Okay. So i landed in the restroom. Holy mother of the Universe. It smelt like a dead body. Like, i was having a hard time breathing. It's like like a gagging type of smell but more of a, "ok wth it smells really bad". It didn't smell like dookie but like a super bad smell. Lol.

The hand soap did its job by covering the horribly bad smell for a second but the soap container was out of soap. I got like drips of it. 

So you push to enter or was it you pull? Idk but the door handle was just a dead bolt lock. And the door is too big for the door frame so the door sticks. You have to push or pull to get out. 

I was afraid of hitting somebody on my way out because I had to literally use my body to push the door open. 

Anyways, great food. I had the garlic noodles. 
Oh, the container for the chopsticks on our table were wet at the bottom for some reason. 
Thx guys! Gr8 place
author: Tony N.

description: Good food, bummer they won't deliver to the inner Richmond. Won't return since they won't include their northern neighbor in their delivery options.
author: Brian Patrick B.

description: The garlic noodles are fantastic. I dream about them most nights. The service is very prompt and the staff is friendly. The tables are a little close together but that's fine. Overall this is one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Victor S.

description: Yum! My go-to for quick & tasty Vietnamese in Inner Sunset without the high delivery upcharge. The Pho broth is high quality. I always get an order of their egg rolls. The garlic noodles are a hit every time. Delivery comes hot, but can take up to 45 min if they're busy. Highly recommend, just watch your sodium intake for the rest of your meals that day as I suspect you get more than enough here.
author: S K.

description:
Five-spice chicken + imperial rolls + garlic noodles! Hands down... must order! The chicken is so flavorful, so tender, and so moist (HIMYM, anyone?). The imperial rolls are always perfectly fried, crunchy, and delicious when drenched in fish sauce. The garlic noodles - MMMMM, what else is there to say? It's garlicky, buttery, noodle-y (?) goodness. The portion size is pretty hefty, usually enough for 2 meals. 

Parking can be a B around here sometimes. But be patient, and you will be rewarded.
author: Anna Z.

description: I went through a lot of reviews to see if it was worth a shot and turned out it really was. The portions are huge and tasty, the service is quick and the people working there are really nice. I got the imperial rolls and chicken garlic noodles and no regrets about. You need to check out this place if you're looking for a local Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Irving R.

description: REALLY great Vietnamese food! We ordered takeout from Perilla for lunch recently. The food was tasty, and the veggies were fresh!
author: Leanna J.

description:
I made the mistake of not looking at the menu before ordering. I dropped off the Mister and went to hunt down for a parking spot. This area is terrible for parking. You need all the luck you can get. I was on the phone with the Mister when he suggested a few things to order. Of course, I went for the safe side - the Vermicelli with imperial rolls and grilled pork. Meh, not impressed but satisfied. The imperial rolls were definitely not fresh (I'm guessing it was frozen and re-fried). I've had better. They loaded up veggies on the bottom so the bowl looks full. I didn't mind it. 

The Mister ordered their famous garlic noodles with the five spice chicken and imperial rolls. The little one ordered the Pho Ga. I didn't know if my dish was too bland, that when I grabbed some garlic noodles from the Mister, I thought the garlic noodles were tasty and delicious. Quite contrary to what other reviewers were saying, though I must say, the garlic noodles tasted familiar. The portions were just perfect (for the price). By the way, the broccoli on the plate is just for display, it has absolutely no flavor. I still ate it because I love my vegetables.

Service is warm and welcoming. Everyone seems so happy to be there. Restaurant is clean and spacious, very comfortable for small group.

If you have not seen enough pictures taken for the garlic noodles here, let me include one more.
author: Em T.

description:
I've only done takeout so this review is only for dinner takeout.

They are known for their garlic noodles and 5-spice chicken but honestly it was their imperial rolls and pork tenderloin that did it for me!  

The garlic noodles are good, but shhh, they were better the next day - it felt like the garlic flavor got stronger and more interesting.  

Also, I don't love imperial rolls but this one was flavorful, not too crunchy and just overall really enjoyable.  Also the sauce isn't too fishy (I don't like fish sauce) but has a good amount of sweet and sour to it.

The pork is flavorful and tender.  Not the best i've had (I'm a huge Mau fan for the pork) but good.

The 5-spice chicken is pretty good but not for me because 1) it's all dark meat and 2) a lot of the flavor is in the skin, and I don't like to eat chicken skin.  That said, I can see why people like it!

Parking for takeout is tough in the evening so if you have someone who can run out and grab your food even better.  But it was ready within about 15-20 minutes of calling.
author: Traci H.

description: I was famished when I got to this place. Very casual atmosphere and strange name for a Chinese Vietnamese food restaurant. My friend had Pho and I got a curry tofu noodle soup. Over all, the food was yummy and my friend plans on coming back to try other items!
author: Tu Anh T.

description:
Love the garlic noodles/imperial rolls plates. I ordered the imperial rolls, garlic noodles and BBQ pork. It was soo good. I was full at the time because I have gotten purple kow earlier, but even though I was full my stomach made room for this delicious food. I tried my boy friends dish which had the chicken instead and it was good as we'll. best garlic noodles I have tasted and the rolls were crunchy and different than most Vietnamese food places. I say this dish is a must try! Even though there were only two pieces of broccoli and I wish there were more, it's still a great dish. Maybe more veggies? A side of a salad? That's all I have to critique it with. I will definitely come again! Already craving the dish while typing this.

The service is something I must mention too! The people were so attentive and nice. Kept on refilling water and asking how the food was. Very friendly.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Garlic noodle is very good. Not many places serve this, so if you're into a dry garlic noodle, this is the place to beat.

Pho sucks. Chicken pho tastes like it has been drenched with rock sugar. Probably the most disappointing pho I've had considering it's also overpriced.. You're much better off going to Yummy Yummy a few blocks down.

All in all, come here for garlic noodle only.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
They were pretty amazing 
Food came out quick ! 
They are very friendly ! 
I don't have anything negative to say about my experience ! Food was delicious !
author: BiancaBMarie B.

description: Husband and I tried out this place as Yummy Yummy was closed. Decent pho for the price. I appreciated the quality of rare beef and the freshness of the veggies. Service was decent and the place seemed clean. Nothing to write home about but a decent bowl of Pho.
author: Karen N.

description: LUV IT. SO GOOD. FIVE SPICE CHICKEN. EVERYTHING. Ordered five slice chicken pho. Broth is balanced and delish. Lots of noodles. Perfect serving of the chicken on the side. Perfectly cooked. Super moist. Delish. Loved it. Definitely going to come back.
author: Mariah L.

description: Simple presentation and clean interior, but they could be more generous with proportions and provide more condiments like a tray of spicy sauces or fresh greens.  Price point is higher than other Vietnamese restaurants on the block but ingredients like meet seem a bit thicker and more quality.
author: M S.

description:
Perhaps the BEST chicken curry noodle soup I have had in town....or ever.
the curry was just right, the chicken perfectly cooked, the noodles soft and just past dente, vegetables on point.

Service was good, we were just seated right in, they seem busy most of the time. prices are great too, great portions.
author: Carlos L.

description: This is the only Pho place my wife and I like going to. Food is really fresh and customer service is superb. Employees are always attentive when your needing something.
author: PremiumShotz P.

description:
I absolutely love Perilla. Their pho is to die for... to mix it up I often get different kinds of meat in it. And the garlic noodles with chicken are incredible. I usually split an order of pho and the garlic noodles with chicken with a friend, and it is PLENTY of food with leftovers for the next day! Plus, dishes are under $10 which is an incredible price for the quality and amount you get. 

Service: the staff is so kind. They are really attentive and just really nice. Food comes out quickly and they really want you to have a good experience! Truly no complaints about this restaurant.
author: Kasia G.

description: Ordered their bun Cha (vermicelli) with charbroiled beef and deep fried egg rolls for lunch and was satisfied! Wish they would give a larger bowl of fish sauce which is normally bowl size in Vietnam!
author: Kerry K.

description:
This rating is for the delivery service. I suggest trusting the reviews here and not ordering delivery! 

This restaurant has great food and the employee on the phone was nice. I highly recommend that they fire their delivery guy. 

Eat24 and I had to call the restaurant twice to follow up on where the order was. Then the delivery guy has the nerve to demand a tip for his crappy, late service.
author: Tina G.

description: My go to place for comfort food! It is one of the few Asian fusion places in SF that actually makes good dishes. I usually get the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The portions are extremely generous and well-priced. The garlic noodles are sooo yummy and goes perfectly with the 5 spice chicken, which is tasty and tender. The imperial rolls are also nice and crispy and flavorful. The service is friendly and efficient as well!
author: Tina L.

description: This is an awesome restaurant for garlic noodles. The other items on the menu are pretty good too but the garlic noodles are definitely their specialty. 5-spice chicken garlic noodle is the best if you're having a problem choosing which garlic noodle dish to order. Parking is tough to find as usual and lines can be long at times but mostly not too bad. Great service and prices.
author: Vicheth K.

description:
The garlic noodle and chicken dish was very garlicky and exactly what was to be expected. The portions are quite large; two people can probably share a plate and then go for dessert or drinks after.  I love that!
Quick and friendly service. Nothing spectacular but nothing to complain about. Overall a decent experience. The place was nice in that it wasn't too loud and it was the typical casual Asian eatery. I really enjoyed my meal here.
author: Tu L.

description:
I dont know how ive been coming by this place for almost three years and have never gone inside. Clearly  I was sleeping on this, when it has everything my stomach desires. 

My friend and I as usual were at a loss for where to eat cause it seems wev'e been everywhere at least twice. Low and behold a stone was left unturned. 
Perilla is the quintessential eatery for Vietnamese cusine. 

The pork chops and garlic noodles were amazing..add that with a tall thai iced tea and its about as close to perfection as you are going to get.

Only set back is the space in the Perilla, they desperately need a waiting area but other than that if you dont want to wait take out is great.
author: Lauren S.

description: Those garlic noodles. I had to order the #27: 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls because of all the photos on yelp. Seriously was to die for. The garlic noodles we super dense and the most delicious thing ever. Don't know how to even explain it in words. Order the #27 and you will not be disappointed.
author: Brady A.

description:
One of my favorite places! Fast and nice service. Food is delicious! I personally like adding broccoli to one of the Pho dishes. The garlic noodles and papaya salad are also great. Vermicelli noodles are the best when it is too warm out for Pho. 
The portions are large and it is very affordable!
author: Jean Marie C.

description: Amazing Vietnamese food! Esp the garlic noodles, def check it out! You get a lot per serving lol. They also have delivery through grubhub
author: Wandi C.

description: I've only ordered their garlic noodles but they're really good. Serve big proportions of noodles. If you just want a quick lunch it can serve 2. I would suggest that they don't cook too much noddles all at once because I can taste the difference when they've been sitting in the crockpot for a while. But they're delicious when they are fresh out. Both the chicken and shrimp that comes with the noodles tastes great. Oh and their Thai tea is really good too. I like coming here!
author: Wendy I.

description:
I LOVE the veggie pho. Not too crazy about the broccoli in it, but the broth is so delicious! I couldn't stop eating it even after I was full.

The other stuff I had was ok, but the pho was the best!
author: Lori L.

description:
Great when you're just craving some down and dirty garlic noodles. Don't expect a gourmet meal. I ordered the five spice chicken garlic noodles with imperial rolls and it was exactly what I expected, large hefty portions that stank up the whole apartment. I have to say the garlic noodles at PPQ and the five spice chicken at Mau are better, but Perilla still does the job. 

Yelp said it wouldn't deliver to my friend's place that was less than two miles away after I entered the zip code, but we called and they were willing to do it for us, which was nice of them.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I have always wanted to try this place as I have seen many of my friends eat here! I just didn't know what the restaurant was called, but when my friend mentioned that there was this place that served garlic noodles - I had to check it out! I was super happy to figure out that this was the restaurant that I've been meaning to try! 

There was no wait to be seated. The place was decently full. I'm glad that my friend and I arrived here before the lunch rush because I was starving! My friend ordered the five spice chicken garlic noodles dish with the imperial egg rolls and I ordered the charbroiled beef garlic plate (I believe #24 on the menu). Omg I can't even begin to describe how good the food was and simple. My dish had the beef, noodles, broccoli, and fish sauce (which I don't eat). Even without the fish sauce, the food was delicious! The garlic noodle portion is huge and I couldn't even finish my plate in one sitting. The meal was pretty cheap as well! I believe it was about $30 without tip? 

The service here is excellent! Our water were always filled (even if the cups weren't even nearly empty and our server brought me a togo container without me even having to ask! I will most definitely come back here and try more of the dishes! :)
author: Joanne Y.

description: So great to bite into tender steak in a bowl of noodles fragrant with Thai basil. So fresh!
author: Paul M.

description: I had been craving garlic noodles and wanted to pick up something pretty quick and convenient on my way through SF heading home to Marin.  Found Perilla on Yelp, ordered on line.  Its just a few blocks off of 19th, found parking, had to wait maybe 10 minutes as they were super busy, but definitely worth it!  Everything was delicious!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Yum! Their garlic noodles and bbq beef/pork are my ultimate comfort food!
author: Steph M.

description:
This place is bomb. Period. 

I usually get the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperials rolls, portions are big and I usually get stuffed 3/4 through my meal. I don't even know what to say, it's just really good, trust me. Ahah

I went their recently with a group of 7, we were seated quickly (even though the place is kinda small) and the waiter was really attentive to us, even though they were kinda busy. I really liked that he didn't mind taking separate checks for all of us, usually some places hate doing that, but our server was SUPER nice about it.  

The vibe is super chill, they even had the NBA finals playing at the time, which I'm sure lots of guests appreciated. In the end, good service + good food = 5 stars.
author: Maurelle B.

description: I was wondering what was so good about this place since I've been seeing it a lot lately. Don't get me wrong I love me some viet food every now and then, but it's neve anything out of the ordinary. I came here with a friend after school to get dinner because he was craving for their garlic noodles and it seems to be pretty popular here. We both ordered the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. I enjoyed it! I feel like garlic noodles never can really go wrong, but something about this was delicious. The garlic noodles were not drenched in oil and the rolls were fried perfectly. In my opinion, the portions are big for me. The service was another thing that really got me to like this place. They constantly make sure your dinning experience is going well. The prices are also not bad. Overall, I would be back
author: Maggie W.

description: Garlic Noodles w/ 5 spice chicken is what you need to get here. I've been here numerous times. Lately, I've been calling in my order for pick up and it's been always pretty quick. The people are pretty nice and the place can be packed sometimes. However, I've never had to wait for a table, so it's a nice packed feeling.
author: Julie L.

description:
I've been coming to Perilla since high school and it never fails! Quick, cheap, and yummy Vietnamese food.

I usually get the five spice chicken, garlic noodles, and imperial rolls combo, which I think is one of the most popular dishes here. The five spice chicken is crispy and always cooked perfectly. Make sure to dip it in the fish sauce! The garlic noodles are really good too, a lot of garlic flavor and buttery. I just wish I didn't have to wipe my mouth after every time I forked some in my mouth, lol!! The imperial rolls are good and go great with the fish sauce too (what doesn't go well with fish sauce...???). I love the portion size here because they give you a big pile of garlic noodles that can definitely fill you up if you're able to finish, or you can pack it up and save it for later.

A new thing I tried recently was the papaya salad with charbroiled beef. It also has carrots, peanuts, fried shallots, and basil that fancies it up a little bit. This was a huge portion and I would definitely order it for myself again! The sauce for this isn't just fish sauce but it has other stuff mixed in too... Not too sure haha. However my friend ordered this and she said after a while, her jaw hurt from chewing LOL. 

One thing that stood out to me about my most recent visit was the customer service!!! There were 2 Asian waiters for the whole restaurant and they did an awesome job. Whenever they came to refill water or ask how we were doing, they were always smiling.

Great prices and big portions, what more can ya ask for?
author: Tara A.

description: Delicious! The charbroiled pork and garlic noodles are fantastic. This is a great restaurant with delicious and reasonably priced food. Greet for lunch and a beer!
author: Will D.

description: Great flavor and generous portion of garlic noodle and 5spice chicken. Their menu offered a great selection of garlic noodle plates. We also ordered the Satay Pho with well-done brisket. It was a huge bowl filled with plenty of vermicelli noodle and hearty brisket slices. The broth was flavorful with a good amount of spice. Definitely comforting on a cold day.
author: M S E.

description: Every time I visit my friends in San Francisco, who live around the corner, I always make them get takeout here (though I'm pretty sure I don't have to try too hard). You probably got the picture from all the other reviews, but their portions are incredible and the garlic noodles are so satisfying. My favorite is five-spice chicken, garlic noodles, and imperial roll combo. Even those these combo plates come with an enormous portion of noodles, we always order an extra side because for $5, why the hell not.
author: Irene C.

description:
I had the garlic noodles with imperial rolls and pork. 
Garlic noodles: great texture for the noodles, not overly salty or oily like most garlic noodles, garlic flavor was present without being over powering. 
Imperial rolls: meh, could have done without them because they were hard (thus the missing star)
Pork: very flavorful but a bit salty. Definitely had to eat each bite of pork with some noodles 
I'd definitely come back here again. Fair price and perfect garlic noodles that I can't seem to find anywhere else :)
author: Tina Y.

description: The chicken curry vermicelli soup was amazing! Definitely going back just to have that soup.
author: Robin T.

description: WARNING!!! Cashier tried to double charge us on our international debit card, claiming the first transaction did not go through, so we had to pay cash. When giving us change, she left out $20. Later we checked our account and the amount was indeed deducted. We had to return to the restaurant to settle this and she was shouting at us the whole time. On top of that, food was mediocre and service was slow.
author: Tracy L.

description: We got the beef garlic noodles and pork garlic noodles. It was delicious and the portion of noodle was huge. I was only able to eat half of the noodles. The imperial rolls were also decent. Their Vietnamese coffee is strong. We will definitely come back when we crave for some garlic noodles.
author: Lacy L.

description: Amazing! Good customer service and they give you a huge portion. This was my first time trying it and I'll definitely be back! Thai ice tea was great as well
author: Miranda C.

description: 4-Stars - Nope, I give it a FIVE (5) !  Super-fast service, large, hearty portions of excellently prepared food.  The Five Spice Chicken (noodles or soup) is an over-the-top choice that will keep us coming back over-and-over again!
author: Dirk C.

description: Garlic noodles for the win!  Exposed to garlic noodles when I moved to California. Never had the opportunity to try.  Friends were in town and wanted to try these and saw raving reviews here.  Neat name for a vietnamese place.  Looks Ma and Pa, like any typical vietnamese restaurant.  Had the garlic noodles w/ grilled chicken and egg rolls.  Once you ate the noodles, it makes you want more.  Texture was good, not too mushy, stringy, or garlicky.  Meat was tender and seasoned well.  Egg roll used  those non-traditional shells, a lot of meat on the inside.  Everything went great together!  Friendly service and always checked to see if you needed anything else.
author: Ivy T.

description: I love their garlic noodles, 5 spice chicken and imperial rolls, yum!! I've came here a couple of times and it has never disappointed me. Parking can be kind of hard to find, but I think it's worth it!
author: Bailey L.

description:
As a local staple in the Inner Sunset, I come here all the time for the shrimp rolls!  They serve the rolls w/ a peanut sauce that I prefer over other vietnamese places.  They are good sized and come in a packet of six, for a decent price.  I'd rank the shrimp rolls a solid 4/5!  Nice affordable bite if you're looking for an afternoon snack - which is what I typically do.

The vietnamese coffee is not that great though.  I'm not sure how they make it but it tastes like a shot of expresso, served over ice with regular skim milk added.  There was definitely no sweet taste of condensed milk so my assumption is that they used a different type of milk.  I don't know exactly what kind of vietnamese coffee grounds they used but I would rate the coffee a 2/5.
author: Jared N.

description: Loved their pork rolls - imperial rolls.. so crispy and good! The five spice chicken was great! Definitely enjoyed their Bun. Their garlic noodles were tasty but was definitely pasta-ish?
author: O K.

description: Not bad! I've been here quite often and get the usual dish that this place is most well known for--their garlic noodles! I always get it with the five spice chicken and imperial rolls. The dish itself has really big portions and is tasty! I just wish the garlic noodles had more garlic flavor and that the chicken had a better texture. Other than that everything is good.
author: Cee H.

description:
MMMM GARLIC NOODLES!!!!

I got the garlic noodles, five spice chicken, and fried imperial rolls. For $11, what a deal!! The meal lasted me like two meals. And everything was delicious. I'm a sucker for garlic noodles and love them here. The garlic noodles here reminded me of Kicking Crab's garlic noodles in SJ but a little drier. Still yummy!! Can't believe I haven't tried this place before. Definitely going to keep coming back!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Three stars for food alone. Not bad. Not great. I was craving pho, but also wanted to get home, so convenience and hunger held me back. Broth wasn't too flavorful, but sriracha and lemon helped a little. It's expensive for a bowl of pho, but I get it, we're in SF. 

Service was great though. 5 stars for that. Nice people :)
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
Came here on my lunch break because I was craving Vietnamese food - garlic noodles, specifically. Food was absolutely disgusting, and that might be an understatement. 

I ordered the #27: Five Spices Chicken garlic noodles with imperial rolls. Nothing was good about this meal. The noodles and chicken were EXTREMELY dry and the egg rolls were too greasy, gross!

Not too happy about wasting $11+ on such a disappointing meal. I wouldn't recommend this place to my coworkers and won't be back again.
author: Ivana Y.

description:
This has become my go-to spot for garlic noodles! I've tried the garlic noodles at Ben Tre, and sadly their garlic noodle is completely flavorless compared to Perilla's. This is definitely one of the main reasons I keep coming back here.
Their imperial rolls are also pretty good. Their curry is hands down delicious. Their portion sizes are huge. What else can I say? :)

I use the Eat24 app and order for pickup. It's quick and easy. No hassle at all. It takes about 15-20 mins for them to prepare your order, depending on how big your order is, of course.

I haven't eaten there so I can't say much about the dining-in service but when I go in to pick up my order, they're always really nice and quick no matter how busy they are.

My family, bf and I usually order the imperial rolls and 5 spice chicken garlic noodles, imperial rolls and charbroiled pork garlic noodles, and/or the curry garlic noodles. YUM. These dishes are $10.75 each. I'd say it's worth every penny.

Minus 1 for the fact that we did find a bug on the lettuce in our imperial roll to-go order. Bugs are a big no, no for me. But my bf says, at least we can see how fresh the veggies are...??? It was one time, so I still go for their delicious food hoping it won't happen again.

Warning: The garlic noodle does leave you with garlic breath afterwards lol so if you're not going straight home, help the people around you and bring a breath mint or something ^_^
author: Jennie L.

description: We had to wait about 10 minutes on a Saturday evening to get seated for a table of three. Service was great and attentive with very frequent water refills. We enjoyed the summer spring rolls, the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and the pho. Everyone enjoyed their food, and the portion for the chicken with noodles was large enough for lunch the next day. I'd definitely recommend if you're in the area (or you don't want to deal with the wait at San Tung)!
author: Gloria N.

description: The vermicelli bowls are great,  aldo get the garlic noodles.  The people who work here are so nice,  that I love coming here.  They always offer me water and tea if I'm waiting on takeout.  Seriously a rarity.
author: Arman J.

description:
Decided to try this place unexpectedly twice in one week; once with the housemates and once with the family!

First time around, I got the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken, and it was really good! Maybe because I was super hungry after work, but it hit the spot pretty well. Great flavor, and the chicken was very flavorful and not dry. The dish even comes with fish sauce and two pieces of broccoli (probably for presentation). As for the garlic noodles, they definitely have a good flavor of garlic and it is not overly buttery, but enough so it has a oily-like texture in the mouth. Definitely would recommend this dish for a first timer at Perilla.

Then yesterday I tried their vermicelli bowl with charbroiled pork and imperial rolls. Because I am a pretty big fan on the vermicelli bowls at other vietnamese restaurants, I was curious about this one. Boy.. it left me stuffed! The pork was great, noodles were a little thin than I am used to, but nothing to really complain about. Imperial rolls=hit the spot again. Good proportion with the veggies to the noodles which was nice. Another random observation is that my grandma got the pho with five-spice chicken and the bowl was huge. They put the chicken on the side so it would not get soggy in the soup; how 
considerate! 

I would come back here again especially for their garlic noodles and because all their dishes are decently priced (roughly between $7-$11). For the typical vietnamese dishes such as pho, I would rather go to the more authentic restaurants further down Irving since it is cheaper and fills me up as well.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Garlic noodles are always a winner. Chicken is classic, but shrimp is a nice splurge if you don't want too much meat. 

Cabbage salad with chicken was a pleasant surprise with nice flavor. 

Spring rolls with shrimp are always a disappointment. They are better everywhere else in the city. Even a Thai restaurant would do better.
author: Anjolie C.

description: Me and my boyfriend both ordered veggie pho. One with egg noodle one with regular. And it was the worst pho we have ever had. The broth tasted like hot dirty water. And the noodles tasted weird.
author: Chelsea G.

description: I was hungover and badly needed quarters for my dirty sheets. I ordered from Perilla requesting quarters (via Eat24), and they brought me quarters! Thank you Irving Perilla. My sheets and I are eternally grateful.
author: Sam W.

description:
After reading so many reviews raving about the garlic noodles, I was excited to try them out for myself! Maybe my expectations were just too high, but I was quite disappointed with the dish. Both the chicken and noodles lacked flavor, and I had to keep wiping the oil off of my lips every time I took a bite. There wasn't much garlic-y or buttery flavor to the noodles; they were just really greasy and heavy. There was a pool of oil on my plate under the chicken and noodles! I ended up pouring all of the sauce on my noodles to add some flavor, but even then, I couldn't get myself to finish all of the noodles. The imperial rolls were mediocre; I've definitely had better.

I think the two tiny pieces of broccoli are more for presentation than for anything else, but I still really wish there was more broccoli to help balance out the greasiness of the rest of the dish.

Considering that the garlic noodles were supposed to be the best dish at Perilla, I won't be returning anytime soon! Too many other good places to try in San Francisco.
author: Ivonnie S.

description:
Throughout my three years of going to college in SF, I've been so disappointed by San Francisco's Vietnamese food. My mom was born and raised in Vietnam, and after eating the food she cooks & all the Vietnamese food in San Jose (I'm from around there), everything else tastes pretty much mediocre. I'd give this place a 4.5 stars but I'm rounding up since their service was so great. 

Honestly super solid Vietnamese food, and their garlic noodles are bomb. Affordable pricing for Vietnamese food. I'm definitely going to be back more often!
author: Chris V.

description:
Decent place for solid food. Their specialty is the garlic noodle so we ordered the five spice chicken garlic noodle and the imperial roll/chicken vermicelli. The garlic flavor is not strong so rest assured, you don't have to be out all day with garlic breath.

The imperial roll was fresh hot and crispy served on top of a bed of "dry" vermicelli noodle. My favorite part is drowning the noodles in the vinegar fish sauce. Yum!
author: Conely C.

description: This is perhaps the most convenient Vietnamese delivery in San Francisco. The only flaw is that they fail to provide any disposable silverware. However, the food is delicious, and the drivers are courteous to call ahead to make sure their addresses are accurate.
author: Alvin T.

description: Came back to give this place another try after several years and I'm glad I did!! I got #27 imperial roll and five spice chicken garlic noodles and woooowww it was tasty!! Last time I got the garlic noodles I barely tasted any garlic but this time I could see the small garlic pieces in the noodles. One thing that I would've liked is for the noodles to be less sticky (perhaps less boiling time?). The chicken was very tender and full of flavor and the imperial roll was crispy and delicious, especially if you dip it into the fish sauce. I also tried the Thai ice tea which was not as sweet as I expected it to be. You can taste more of the tea which could be a good or bad thing depending on what your tastebuds like.
author: Emily L.

description:
Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle.

What is that?

It's what you should order.

What will you get?

Ordering the FIVE SPICE CHICKEN GARLIC NOODLE (Mi Toi Ga Quay Chao) will get you thick and chewy egg noodles, sauteed moderately with butter with garlic chunks. No, the noodles will not be swimming in butter--they will just have been lightly bathed in butter and then gently dusted with garlic powder. The noodles will be accompanied by tender, fatty, boneless chicken leg strips with crispy skin, topped with sauteed green onions and highlighted with a delightful bowl of fish sauce. Last but not least is a measly attempt at eating healthy with two pieces of steamed broccoli (http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/N3WKUdN_XB1ZTvAt2Lwn6g/l.jpg).

How much will it set you back?

A mere $8.50.

What else could you get?

Items such as the shrimp vermicilli or pho.

Will they be as good?

Nope.

What is I want to buy a lot at once; say, for an event...or for myself?

Unfortunately, Perilla doesn't seem to be very reliable when it comes to catering; read Michelle N.'s passionate review on that topic. Besides, the catered, mass-produced food just doesn't taste as good as the personal portions.
author: Adele F.

description:
Was hoping for a good experience after reading all of the positive reviews. 

First the good stuff:

The imperial rolls were pretty tasty, the five spice chicken was delicious plus the skin was nice and crispy, and the beef in my Satay Beef Pho were nice and tender. Portions were decent.

Now the bad:

The pho broth, regular was pretty lacking, could hardly call it pho. The garlic noodles, what I came to try the most were mediocre at best. Didn't really taste the buttery garlic flavor that it's known for. Lastly, the food took about 30 minutes after we had ordered, so better bring some good company.

I would probably go again just to try the vermicelli bowls or the rice plates.
author: Adrian M.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! I came here with 5 of my other friends to celebrate a friends birthday and we were so happy with our visit. the service here is GREAT the servers kept out tea full and served us with friendly faces. the food portion was HUGE and six of us shared three plates of garlic noodles. we ordered one with chicken, one with pork, and one with beef. they were all phenomenal!! i definitely recommend the imperial rolls as well. and finally this was all for under 60$ WILL DEFINITELY COME AGAIN!
author: Annie H.

description: Quick, cheap, and delicious food and the quality hasn't changed -  still as good as ever. Can't go wrong with the garlic noodle combos either with five spice chicken or the pork with the imperial rolls. Affordable and large portions. Can't go wrong with that.
author: Serena C.

description:
You must order #27 Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle with Imperial Rolls. The yelp reviews are no exaggeration of how good this dish is. I am a huge fan of their Five Spice Chicken and the imperial rolls, I would venture to say it's one of the best rolls I've had. We also ordered #18 The Papaya Salad with Charbroiled Beef, both of these dishes were a nice complement to each other. Their portions are huge, so the prices are very reasonable at $10-$12.

Extremely friendly service and quick. I highly recommend coming here if you're in the area.
author: Karen C.

description: I got the the garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken + imperial rolls platter. Imperial rolls were good, but DAMN the chicken and noodles were delicious! Noodles were thick, buttery, and garlicky. Chicken was skin-on (no bone), cooked perfectly with crispy, salty skin and juicy meat. So damn good!
author: J. A.

description: Great little casual place with really tasty pho and other staple items. Great for takeout! Very fresh and great service!
author: Molly P.

description: This was the go to during my freshman year of college. I'm from San Jose so nothing beats Vietnamese food than in SJ so I decided to give this place a try. It was kind of a American Vietnamese fusion where they serve garlic noodles. The garlic noodles, five spice chicken, and egg rolls (I don't remember what they were technically called) were super good! The five spice chicken and egg rolls were super crispy. Just thinking about the bite, crunch, and spices in the food is making me hungry at the moment! The price range is affordable for college students and I always return!
author: Michelle H.

description: Garlic noodle dish. So amazing. Street parking which may be difficult to find, but hey this place is really worth it. There pho bowls are huge as well. The servers are so welcoming and very generous. Makes me want to come back more.
author: Anriella D.

description:
Came in the afternoon. Got the Chicken Garlic Noodles.

The chicken was tender, the noodles were garlicky, comes with 2 broccoli. 
The bathroom is in an awkward place. On the way back and forth, I saw that there was a bucket of noodles just left out. Additionally the bathroom doesn't have paper towels, only an air dryer... this is a sanitation issue for the workers... people enter the bathroom with dirty hands, close the door and lock it with their dirty hands, do their business, then wash their hands with soap, and air dry it... this means, they have to use their hands to touch the door handle that was last touched by their dirty hand...
author: Kaje Y.

description: Pretty good Vietnamese delivery i would recommend this spot to a friend and i well eat here again. I really like my 5 spuce chicken and imperil rolls. The garlic noodles were good too wr are them with the curry chicken.
author: Seaera T.

description: Followed other Yelpers' advice and ordered #16, #27 and beef pho and we're so glad we did. All the dishes were amazing. Great price and even better service. The staff are so friendly and efficient. Worth the trek over for the five spice chicken alone!
author: cassy f.

description: Favorite garlic noodle restaurant. Must get the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. The plates are very filling and worth the money. Wait for food isn't that long ether. 5 stars.
author: Chris M.

description:
What can I say about Perilla's garlic noodles? They're:

(1) Buttery, without being oily to the point where your noodles can slip and slide off your plate
(2) Garlicky, without commanding your breath and whipping the noses of others

Two great things in one! They strike a nice balance and make for a very good dish. Need some greens to add some crunch into your dish? Their cabbage salad appetizer will give your teeth plenty of satisfaction as you chomp down on fried onions, crushed peanuts and fish sauce vinaigrette-dressed cabbage slices. 

I was disappointed I didn't get to try the famous San Tung down the street because of the ridiculous line. But I was VERY pleasantly surprised by Perilla's choice of items, flair to their dishes and pleasant, crowd-free atmosphere. Even my parents, who are picky about their Vietnamese food, enjoyed the food. Overall, I think it's the perfect alternative to hit after a fun but tiring day around Golden Gate Park.
author: Tony H.

description:
Pretty pricey for Vietnamese food!  6 dollars for a side of rare beef?!  I can buy 2 sides at another Vietnamese restaurant!

WHAT STANDS OUT - THEIR GARLIC, SCRUMPTIOUS NOODLES!  Anything with noodles and garlic, I AM ALL FOR IT!  Add five spice chicken to that and it is surely the perfect meal that will satisfy the palate!  This is like the only Vietnamese restaurant that I have seen so far that serves garlic noodles!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=Up8HEWNE6q36piHw-N5MLQ#Up8HEWNE6q36piHw-N5MLQ

Their other selections, such as Chicken Noodle Soup and Beef Noodle Soup, are offered at other Vietnamese restaurants and the quality at this restaurant is pretty standard.  

SERVER - One of the waiters, who helped us, were entertaining with his sarcasm about the food, commenting about the other servers and us!  

BATHROOM - You have to walk through the kitchen to use the bathroom.  Ew. Gross.  As you walk pass the kitchen, you can see the griminess of the waste and food scraps.  They should redo the layout of their kitchen and bathroom area! 

FINAL SAY - Just try their (word of mouth from friends to friends) FIVE SPICE CHICKEN WITH GARLIC YUMMY NOODLES!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Man this place is an absolute GEM for Vietnamese food.  Especially if you are a GARLIC NOODLE connoisseur like myself.  BIG FAT PORTIONS of noodley goodness.  The food is really good and really good price.  I would've included some photos but I started eating before the camera could be used.  

Also tried their beef carpaccio as well and it was stellar.  All the staff were really friendly and nice.  Nothing spectacular over the top but 4 stars forsure.  Definitely check this place out, if you want some good food and don't want to break the bank.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
i ordered through eat24.  initially i ordered from postmates but my order got cancelled so i tried eat24.  first of all, i loved that they set the expectation later and arrived earlier.  my food arrived 30 minutes early which was a welcome surprise.  

the food was excellent. everything was super fresh and so flavorful.  we had the fresh shrimp rolls, which were so fresh and delightful, the shrimp vermecelli with extra shrimp- it was awesome and soooo good.  we also ordered a side of garlic noodles which came straight from heaven...thats how delicious they were.  definitely recommend
author: Samantha B.

description:
This is my go to place for garlic noodles in San Francisco. I ordered the 5 spice chicken garlic noodles and it was absolutely delicious. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the noodles tasted delicious. 

This place has great customer service. The waiters here are really nice and attentive. 

The downside to this place is that it is pretty small, but it's San Francisco. Most places are small!  Parking is hard to find close to the restaurant but if you go past San Tung it gets easier.
author: Patrick D.

description: Garlic noodles are great and serving size is awesome. Imperial rolls and the meats are all really good. As a bonus the service is great, everyone is friendly.
author: John R.

description:
Don't do the delivery service. You'll be gnawing your arm off. Over 2 and a half hours to get a bowl of pho... What did I pay for?! I ordered through Eat24 and was alerted the restaurant was behind. But when I clicked on the order status, it showed that the order had left. 40 minutes after the estimated arrival time, I called the restaurant for the status to be told.... It's still cooking... SIGH, looking like it would be faster to order pizza. Eat24 is trying to help resolve the issue however, I'm still starving and can't leave the house, hence the reason I ordered delivery. 

Expecting this to be the best pho I've ever had
author: Audrey L.

description:
After spending a day playing in Golden Gate Park we yelp*ed a place nearby for some Vietnamese yums. Hello Perilla!
I love the service and five spice chicken pho here. It literally warms me up inside. Broth has wonderful flavor and isn't too salty. Decor is warm and inviting, has kind of a  modern flair to it. 
I liked the place so much I came back on my next visit to GG park!
author: Edward B.

description: So so so delicious. I got the five spice chicken and imperial roll vermicelli. The chicken was flavorful. It had nice, crispy skin on the outside and juicy, tender meat on the inside. Same with the imperial roll. It has a nice crispy outside with soft insides. The dish was very balanced. The vermicelli was very refreshing when paired with the vegetables on the bottom. The basil was noticeable and pleasant, but not overpowering. You can either pour the fish sauce on top of everything and mix it or pour a little and save some to dip. Either way, you can't go wrong. You get so many flavors in this one dish. Service was awesome! They kept refilling out waters! They were very joyful and very friendly. I was really hungry and unfortunately didn't take any pictures. I was stuffed at the end of the meal. The presentation was on point and I'll definitely be back again! Next time I'll grab some quick photos.
author: Justin H.

description:
From all the reviews, you already know this place is good.

Quick recommendations:
- Like everyone else on yelp, I say get the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls.
- There's something about the chicken especially, I don't know what it is, but it's damn good.
- There's are better pho places if you're looking for pho. My friend says he wouldn't recommend it if you want noodle soup.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Excellent service - very attentive, lots of smiles, overall super friendly.

Pho was just how I like it, and the garlic noodles will not disappoint. Also, very reasonable prices, especially for San Francisco. 

Will be returning!
author: Mallory W.

description: Garlic noodle is so good here, and also their pho is great as well. It's just a bit expensive for Vietnamese food, but the location makes up for it.
author: Pei F.

description:
The best Vietnamese spring rolls I have ever had. 

We had curry chicken soup and veggie with rice which was delicious. 

Will surely come back again.
author: Milana R.

description: I am not too big of a fan of Perilla for a few reasons. First, the pho ga here is not very good, and the portion size has been the smallest compared to all of the different pho places that I have been to in San Francisco so far. Secondly, their prices for their pho is about $1-$2 more than what I have paid for at other Vietnamese restaurants. I will not be coming back because I feel that eating here is not worth my money. Additionally, there is no air conditioning in the restaurant, so if you happen to eat pho on a warm day or you get hot while eating the pho, you won't feel very comfortable because the restaurant can get pretty stuffy.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Ordered #28 because my boyfriend recommended the garlic noodles here; was not disappointed. The waitress also memorized the menu and repeated our orders, which was great. 

I liked how the imperial rolls and pork were cut bite sized so I could have the ease of just eating the pieces along with the noodles. The different textures mixed well together and the flavors didn't clash either, which made each item easy to enjoy. For the price of only $11, the portion was enough to fill me up and well worth the money. 

The waitress came back once to refill our water and ask if we wanted anything else. She didn't come back again to refill until I asked for the check so minus a star for service and for tricky parking. 

Side fact: for being a Vietnamese restaurant, many of the workers at Perilla aren't Vietnamese!
author: Vy P.

description:
I would be hard pressed to give Perilla anything less than four stars - it's solid, house-made Vietnamese fare for the relatively undemanding urbanite. Maybe because Jamie W. and I are used to the one on Mission near the demolished Transbay Terminal, a bustling place during the lunch hour, that we were marginally disappointed with the garlic level in the garlic noodles served here. Dare I say it was a tad bland, which makes stuffing your face with heavy-duty carbs more of a dietary challenge than it has to be. But I won't ding them much for that since the quality level is still pretty darn high for the Perilla brand.

Now that there are three of them in the city plus PPQ Beef Noodle House close to this location and the PPQ Dungeness Island in the Outer Richmond - are we looking at the Vietnamese version of the King of Thai Noodle chain? Could be... In truth, we went to the Geary location first but found it closed for renovation, so out of determination to have our garlic noodles, we took the 44 O'Shaughnessy line to the Irving Street location, which was very nearly packed. Soon after we were seated, we ordered the $6.50 Shrimp Rolls, which were a tad small but still delectable as a starter.

Jamie and I went our separate ways on our $8.50 Garlic Noodle plates - I had my standby, the Five-Spice Chicken (see photo), while he veered into the Charbroiled Pork marinaded in garlic and pepper (see photo). Both were perfectly tasty, but I have to admit the standout may have been the $6.50 plate of Seasoned Vegetables - shredded cabbage and carrots mixed with fried tofu (see photo). I was liking it all, but the young woman sitting behind me kept playing with her hair, pulling it into a ponytail, and whipping it against my head with no regard to the lack of sanitation in her nervous habit. Disgusting...and wear a hat to cover your dandruff-covered head, hon.

FOOD - 4 stars...still Perilla-quality even if they seem to have a garlic shortage here
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...get me away from that hair-tossing moron!
SERVICE - 3 stars...always smiling, just not always present
TOTAL - 4 stars...if only the Mission location stayed open for dinner and on weekends (sigh)
author: Ed U.

description:
This place is quite small, but they serve the food pretty quick so wait time isn't TOO long (or maybe I just went at a good time).  They had one guy waiting all the tables when I went which made things a little slower but he was so sweet, and it was just him so I totally understand.  He came by often to refill water and I can tell he looked around and try to tend to everyone which I always appreciate.

I ordered the five spiced chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles were meh.  I haven't eaten too many straight garlic noodles to compare too but it was bland.  I expected a more garlic-y taste but sad, nada.  They also had this stale texture to it -- idk, maybe it's just me.  Imperial rolls were imperial rolls, they weren't as superb as I expected it to be either (thanks for the hype, guys).  But the five spiced chicken... That's where it got me.  The chicken was so tender and the spices were amazing and one point.  I wish the skin was a bit crispier but hey, it works for me. About $10 without tip so not bad for the big portion.  I didn't finish so I took the rest to-go.  

I'd definitely come back for the chicken, and maybe the garlic noodles again just to see if it was this one time.  

OH! That two person table right by the window is HOT AS HELL. I swear, my friend and I felt like we were being cooked under that heat lamp of a light.  Haha we were going to ask to sit at another empty table but by then all our food had come -__-
author: Lisa L.

description:
The garlic noodles and five spice chicken used to be my fave but my taste buds started acting up and then they had that remodel. The garlic noodles was a bit bland for me to begin with but the chicken and fish sauce balanced it out. I like my garlic noodles to pack a flavorful punch, and Perilla did not do that for me. BUT it's still a really good and popular dish. It's definitely worth a try if it's your first time here! Everyone's taste buds are different so you never know if you'll like it or not. 

Other than that, their pho dac biet is good! Soup has such a strong flavor but in a good way. You can definitely taste the long hours in making the broth. But my only gripe is that they give you very little meat. More meat please and it'll be the perfect bowl of pho! 

Lastly, service is amazing. I've never experienced such great and friendly service from an Asian establishment. The workers are super sweet and super nice! They kind of remind me of my own family, so when you come, you do feel that homey vibe. I really wish the best for this business, they deserve it.
author: Brenda K.

description: I love Perilla! I always get the garlic noodles with egg rolls and the five spice chicken. They give you an amazing portion size for a pretty good price. The noodles are cooked perfectly and have a nice garlicy taste to them. Their eggs rolls are super flavorful and fried to perfection. Lastly, their five spice chicken is so tender and juicy and is totally delicious. The servers are always super friendly and helpful too!
author: Sam L.

description: Solid place for Vietnamese food. I recommend ordering the garlic noodles - the most popular menu item but I also really enjoy the vermicelli dishes with egg rolls. The wait is pretty short compared to the wait at other nearby restaurants. My friends and I ended up going here one time because after waiting 45 mins at another local restaurant. However if you're ordering takeout from there be careful! It took my order an 1 hour longer than the promised delivery time. I only live a 5 min drive away so I don't understand the cause for the delay.
author: Kristy L.

description:
I liked here as Pho junkie. 

I had #1.  The amount was not enough, but the soup was hot enough.  The temperature of soup is key to any kinds of noodle soup (Pho, ramen, udon etc)
Bean sprout amount was good.  The service was friendly.
I want to try more food including rice plate.
author: Kaori M.

description: Mediocre place for Vietnamese cuisine. The staff was friendly and attentive. The pho was not the best, but I was really impressed with the garlic noodles. It was not overly oily and was quite delicious. If you come here, order the garlic noodles.
author: Kelly O.

description:
Papaya salad was an epic fail. It was tasteless even with the fish Sauce which was clearly diluted. I have always ordered papaya salad from almost every single restaurant where they offer on their menu, this place is the worse. 

I ordered the garlic noodles which everyone is talking about. One for me one for my honey. Oh dear. Clearly it was not made to order. It was premade and the reheat when customers order it. How do I know? The top layers of the noodles stack were dry and had the roasted looking, whereas the inside still remind its oily moist texture. I am a big fan of garlic noodles but this place disappointed me a lot. 

However, their imperial rolls were good, crispy and juicy. 5-spice chicken and BBQ pork were juicy as well. 

Service was attentive probably because it was a quite late afternoon. 

No. This is not my place to go.
author: Rebegi G.

description: This is actually my second time here. The first time, I got their Pho combination and I was not impressed. I didn't like it. I thought the broth wasn't flavorful. I would give it a 3 star. Luckily, I tried this place again because my roommate recommended their garlic noodles. Oh my. I was in love with their garlic noodles when I first took the first bite. It was delicious and not as oily as other places. I got the noodles with the five spice chicken and that was also delicious. It was so moist and flavorful. I was disappointed by their pho at first which made me not want to come back but I will definitely come back for their garlic noodles!
author: Peter N.

description: This is one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the bay. The garlic noodles are delicious and almost buttery; the five spice chicken is crisp on the outside, moist inside and flavorful. The shrimp spring rolls are light and fresh. It gets busy but they're really attentive about service.
author: Einat G.

description:
GARLIC NOODLES, SO GARLIC-Y!

My one gripe about this is, I ordered takeout from here and they packed the garlic noodle in to the box, which made it kind of soggy and dense.
author: Joyce C.

description:
I swore I left a review for this restaurant..guess not..but now here it is!! 

Been here a few times, and the garlic noodles + five spice chicken ($10.75) just gets me coming back for more! 

Located on the busy streets of Irving, parking is blaaah. Service is great, and so is the food. The restaurant has a nice layout to it, with plenty of seating; though it can get packed easily! As for price though, it is quite pricey...but it's good!..not amazing good though. 

If you love imperial rolls, I highly suggest you order it with any rice or noodle plates. You're paying $6 for a plate of imperial rolls separately, and basically $1 with it, for the rice or noodle plates! Definitely worth it! Though, I'm not a huge a fan of it.. 

The amount of food you get is quite fulfilling due to the garlic noodles. I normally get #21 and you must too! It's gartlic noodles & five spice chicken! My BF got the imperial rolls, shrimp, and garlic noodles (#30?) and it came with only 4 tiny shrimp...for $12? Not worth it! Once he got his plate, he made a regret and wish he had gotten the five spice chicken whereas it had 5-6 thick pieces. 

Highly recommend coming here, and ordering #21 for a first timer! They do also serve noodle soup, rice plates, vermicelli, and garlic noodles.
author: Mandy G.

description:
I give Perilla 3.5 stars simply because they have great and friendly staff. Customer service is the top things I rate in a restaurant. Both times when I go to Perilla, the staffs were helpful and friendly. Now, let's talk about their food.

I have both the raw beef and meat ball noodle soup as well as the raw beef, brisket noodle soup. I think they are both descent for their price but I definitely have better pho in San Francisco. However, it is in a convenient location.

My boyfriend has chicken pho both time and he enjoys it.
author: Crystal W.

description: hands down, one of the best garlic noodles i've ever had in the city! if you've been to ppq dungeness island on clement, then you'll know that the garlic noodles taste the same because they're owned by the same owners! i love ordering the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken. it's sooooooooooo delicious. you will not regret your decision. garlic noodles are a must here!
author: Sylvia H.

description: Get the garlic noodle, imperial roll, five spice chicken plate. It's #27 I think, and it is just the best of all worlds at around $10. You will definitely leave  feeling full, and your taste buds will be thanking you. I've tried their chicken pho and Vietnamese sandwich previously, but I would stick with the combination plate. It's simply the best!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Pros: clean place 
Fresh food
Large portions
Garlic noodles
Imperial rolls are killers
Nice waitress
Five spice chicken

Cons

Bathroom walkway 
Small ice coffee

Will return
author: John L.

description:
Rating based on food alone 
Ordered 27. The garlic noodles was average. I was expecting more. The rolls and chicken was really good!  
Very great service and was attenuous to our group. Service is 5 stars
author: Elena R.

description:
We tried to go to San tung but the line was insane !!! As a tourist, that was the recommended eat spot ..  Sad to have missed it. 

We went to perilla instead because there was no wait and my party was hungry! And it was so cold !!!! Luckily, perilla had free hot tea!!!  I ordered the imperial egg rolls with the beef with lemongrass and garlic noodles. The egg rolls were quite delicious and porky . I think the beef was kind of cold when it came out which was weird. But it definitely tasted good. The garlic noodles were so-so in my opinion and was pretty good with the fish sauce I dumped on it .. But kind of dry since there was no sauce 

Overall a positive experience, but I did puke when I got home. I think The noodles had butter which I usually cannot eat. If I came back, I would probably order the same thing anyway but hope for hotter meat. Like $10 a plate but sf pricing can't be avoided ..
author: Diana W.

description: Garlic noodles are good but not great, regardless I would happily order the Imperial Rolls / Beef Garlic noodles combo again.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I used to be a frequent diner here and what I always got: their 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. YUMMMM!

The 5 spice chicken is very flavorful, tender, and juicy. And if you haven't heard, their garlic noodles are bomb! It is a bit greasy, but it's sooo good! Their imperial rolls and spring rolls were average same as what you normally get from a viet restaurant.

It used to be $9 for the dish and about $5 for appetizers. I took at their prices recently and they went up a couple dollars! :(. It used to be a great deal for the portion you get, but now that prices are raised, it's average price, ~$11 for a plate. It's a big enough portion that I always have to pack my leftovers to go, and it still tastes great the next day. :)

They cater too now. A great choice for potlucks/parties.

Service has always been good every time I've been here. Alert staff and quick service.
They also take cards!
