Heard their the same owners as Crawstation :O. I new those garlic noodles tasted familiar!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Love, love, love Perilla! Their five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls is a must!!!!!! So delicious and flavorful! They have other items on their menu like pho and vermecelli bowls which are just as equally delicious. 

Their customer service is another reason why I love coming here. The people who work here are so friendly, welcoming, and cheerful.

5 stars for the food, 5 stars for the customer service, 5 stars for the overall experience!
author: Janica V.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place since I found it on Yelp a few months. Definitely was not disappointed by the imperial roll with chicken and garlic noodle combo! The servers are super friendly and when my friend and I came in it wasn't too busy. It's a small place but the food speaks for itself. I'm usually not a fan of egg rolls with rice paper wraps, but these were super yummy! 

I had to take it to go because they give you massive portions for $10.75. I ended up finishing the rest at home and it left me craving more of their garlic noodles!!
author: Victoria Q.

description:
I heard a lot about this place from my friends. They said the food was great and I heard especially good reviews about their garlic noodles. So the boyfriend and I checked it out after work one Friday. 

We ordered garlic noodles and the five spice chicken combo. I've learned that I'm not a huge fan of garlic noodles because it's super greasy. Not just here but every place I've tried them. Anyway, the food tasted good. The service was pretty bad. Because it was packed, I hung my bag on my chair and I'm not sure if she was doing it purposely, but one of the waitresses kept banging into my bag and my chair throughout the whole time we were eating. Uhhh? Why are you doing that lady? And after asking for water and being ignored, they finally came by grumpily as we asked a second time. 1. We shouldn't have to ask for refills 2. Don't be mad about us asking twice, there's a reason why we had to ask twice- because you didn't refill it without being asked and didn't refill it after we asked. Simple.

Anyway, we scarfed our food down and then left. Twenty minutes later- I start feeling nauseous and dizzy. Then later that night my boyfriend started feeling sick. Okay, not coming back for sure. Sorry guys, your food was great but made us feel sick after we ate it.
author: Dara S.

description:
I've never actually dined in at Perilla; I order delivery from Perilla on the semi-regular via Yelp Eat24. That said, their food is pretty damn delicious. 

I've tried several of their dishes, and would recommend their pho ga or their five spice chicken with garlic noodles. Both are excellent. They take the time to carefully package their food for delivery, and the portions are incredibly generous, especially for the modest prices. They're typically pretty fast, too.

If you're looking for Vietnamese comfort food without having to leave home (assuming you're in their delivery zone), Perilla will definitely do the trick!
author: Matt T.

description: Been coming here for the last 4 years since we live around the block. The food is good, extremely consistent, although I can't comment on authenticity. Our usual orders are pho, 5-spice chicken garlic noodles or vermicelli. The garlic noodles are delicious. The people are friendly, service always with a smile :). All in all a great neighborhood place to get a quick meal.
author: Daven D.

description: Ordered grilled pork rice plate, shrimp spring rolls, and beef vermicelli. Pork had good flavor but was not cooked well. Rice was soggy.  Shrimp spring rolls were small...overpriced. And beef vermicelli was good. Oh, thai ice tea was watered down.
author: Anna M.

description: One of the best Vietnamese spots in the sunset. There garlic nooodle is always bomb. The bun is always bomb too. There fish sauce is perfect here
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description:
Came here the other day for the second time. Previously I had the pho and  and side of garlic noodles and this time I had the five spice chicken pho with side of garlic noodles. 

The pho is good, though not particularly outstanding, but the garlic noodles and the five spice chicken are drishishishi (delicious)! The garlic noodles have the perfect amount of moisture and flavor without being too overwhelming. I think its better than Thanh Long garlic noodles, though I have met with opposition on that stance. The five spice chicken (decent portion!) comes on a separate plate as its grilled or deep fried with a light crust. 

The service is average for a pho joint, though our waters were refilled reguarly. The prices are ~$8-9/ bowl and the side of garlic noodles is ~$3 (affordable when you want to fulfil a craving).
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is spacious and awesome.
Kitchen is great.
Food is tasty and generous portion.
The Green Papaya Beef Salad is-OMG!!:D
Garlic Noodle plates come with Generous amount of Meat. That's a Plus because I love Big Meat Portions.
3 color Drink is good.
Staff is Super Upbeat.:)
Glad I gave it a shot.
author: Hung L.

description:
I am a huge phò fan. I've been here a few times. 

parking is hard, especially in the sunset .

Atmosphere:
Super casual.

Interior:
Open floorplan .
Open and airy.
Small space.

Service:
Good. Greeted us upon arrival. Waitress was nice and helpful, food service was a slow.

Food:
Menu has many options to choose from!

I ordered: 
The pho is pretty good. I've had it quite a few times.
I had one of the rice plates with the 7 seasoned chicken and I didn't like it too much. Wasn't very flavorful and not a lot of food for the price.

*thai ice tea. Always good 

Cons:
Slow service.

Overall:
Very good pho, other menu items not so much. I'm thinking of trying the vermicelli noodle plate next time. 

I will return
author: Nicky V.

description: This is the spot for garlic noodles. I had them with pork chop, broccoli, and egg rolls, which complemented the noodles quite well. Portions are fair for the price. I honestly wasn't expecting the best service-- but I was wrong. The servers were very friendly and attending to our needs. I would definitely come back here, and recommend to friends and family.
author: Justin Y.

description: Ordered the chicken curry noodles here. Pretty big bowl of noodles, so be prepared to eat a lot. Service here is really good and attentive. I definitely would love to come back next time to try the garlic noodles.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Perilla has to be one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Whenever I'm home, I make it a point to come here and satisfy my garlic noodle craving. My friends and I all agree that their five spice chicken is the best dish they have, with a large mound of noodles and juicy tender chicken on the side. For an extra dollar, you can add imperial rolls as well. My one complaint about this is that it can be pretty oily sometimes, but the flavor is just so good that I can ignore that fact. If you don't want chicken, the charbroiled pork is good as well! I haven't gotten around to trying the rest though.

Service is good here, and though it's a little bit pricey, it's definitely worth the money because it's so filling. Parking in the inner sunset does suck though, so either bus and save yourself meter money, or be prepared to walk a few blocks back to your car.
author: KC W.

description: First time having 5 spice chicken + garlic noodles, & it was a delicious mix! The spring rolls did not disappoint either.
author: Anna N.

description:
FIVE SPICE CHICKEN GARLIC NOODLES. 
This is a rating solely for this dish only because I never tried anything but this plate! And trust me... it's worth it. 

The chicken is marinated to perfection. And it is NOT spicy, so for all you non spicy eaters, dont worry. I got the basic one without the imperial rolls and I believe it was around  $8.50 which isnt bad considering how the portions are generous and the taste is near perfection. The garlic noodle was BOMB. It was not TOO garlicy. It was perfect. 

The restaurant is kind of small. The waiters are very friendly and enthusiastic, which I like. I came here about five times. One time they messed up my order and gave me rice instead of garlic noodles, and they happily took it back and exchanged it for me, NO ATTITUDE given. 

However besides this dish, I'm not sure if the other ones are as great. My friend made the mistake of getting Pho from here and he said it was horrible. He was Vietnamese so he knows his Pho. 

JUST GET THE FIVE SPICE CHICKEN GARLIC NOODLE. 

WARNING: Parking SUCKS!!! Every time my friends and I come here we take around 1 hour to find parking. Curse of Irving.... Just dont come during lunch, dinner hours.
author: Chena N.

description: So going into this experience I'm not a huge garlic noodle or Vietnamese food fan. BUT I really really enjoyed this place. Flavors on the meats (beef and chicken) was really good, egg rolls were bomb and the noodles weren't as greasy as some others I've tried. I came in on a Sunday towards the end of lunch and service was good and fast! If you've never been here I the comment you give it a try!
author: Blaine S.

description: My husband and I really enjoy the garlic noodle with spring rolls and bbq beef here.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Garlic noodles, five spice chicken is a must.  I don't like the curry chicken noodle at all, the curry flavor is from a cheap powder form and  coconut milk is lacking, however there was tons of noodles. Garlic noodle is kind of blend, it definitely can use a tad more garlic in order to call garlic noodle.  On the plus side its not greasy like some garlic noodles that I've tasted.  The staff is nice but the food comes out very slowly.  My fav is the five spice chicken that's moist and flavorful.  The imperial rolls not bad.
author: Mar H.

description:
5 spice chicken + imperial roll + garlic noodles = best combo
If you're in a rush or are looking for some super savory, buttery, garlicky noodles, check out perilla's on irving.

They're super fast for pick up or delivery, and they give you a ton of food for the cost.
The chicken is juicy and the noodles are delicious!

Can't go wrong!
author: Michelle L.

description: The cold noodle is really awesome and it comes with a lot of veggies. The sauce and meat are so great.
author: Yaya H.

description: Wonderfully delicious food and great staff! Will be going back here soon
author: Luke B.

description: Seriously love this place. Food is great and service always friendly and on point. My go to is the 5 spice chicken, garlic noodles and imperial rolls. This is definitely a once in a while treat. When I call ahead, my order is always ready for me so no time is wasted!
author: Danica C.

description: Been here three times. Come here to get their garlic chicken noodles. Great portions, not too oily, and dank. Add the rolls if you so desire. Other dishes are great as well, but I would encourage what they are well-known for. 10/10.
author: Jason T.

description:
Get the garlic noodles!!!! 
I got the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. NOM NOM NOM!
Their 5 spice chicken pho is hella good too.
Parking sucks around here so be prepared to circle around a bunch of times.
author: Angela D.

description:
This place is AVERAGE. Stop in if you are cold & desperately hungry. Not by any means worth going out of your way for.

Pho are just Average. Sf has waaay better Pho joints. Same goes for Spring Rolls.

Garlic Noodles are like any Chow Mein sort youd find in a shopping mall or centre.

Curries are also a bit bland, watery with chuncks of potatoes & chicken.

Garnishes & basil/peppers/onion/lime are small & minimal.

What's with the cups of luke-warm tap water that arent even filled properly.

Last but not least prices are a bit high & the wrinkled black Perilla shirts the Servers wear don't add up. 

Presentation of food is although acceptable.
author: Julian I.

description: The best garlic noodles, hands down. I will conatantly come back to this place because I'm hooked! My favorite entrée is the Five Spice Chicken with Imperial Rolls and Garlic Noodle. The chicken is crispy on the outside and truly has the spice-y taste in every bite. The chicken is tender and cooked to perfection. The garlic noodles has the right amount of bounce and not too much oil. I'm not crazy about the imperial rolls by itself but dipped into the fish sauce, it softens up the crispiness and really hits the spot. Perilla usually adds a few pieces of broccoli on the side, which I don't mind  but I'd prefer a bit more greens if they were gonna add it in there anyways. They also add cooked green onions to the garlic noodles to garnish which I love. Portions are HUGE and I typically make two meals out of one order! I came here when I was vegetarian (two years ago) and their Vegetarian Garlic noodles option has a vermicelli-vegetable stir fry combo included that was also surprisingly really good. Overall, service is quick and easy. I will most definitely return whenever I am craving somwle really good garlic noodles.
author: Sally Z.

description: Ordered the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles, and 5 spice chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles. Quality was good, portions were huge, and food tasted delicious. The noodles and imperial rolls were very greasy, but that's expected. Would definitely come back again to satisfy craving.
author: A L.

description:
More like a 3.5, but I'll give them 4 because of the friendly service. 

Avoid Pho, I repeat, avoid the pho. It ain't crackin. 

On the other hand, the rice plates are awesome, especially the garlic noodles. With that information in mind, this place is a 4 star spot for sure.
author: Kevin W.

description: I was in SF for the weekend and both my sister's friend and a cashier at Holy Gelato recommended we try the garlic noodles here. It.was.delicious! I ordered the rolls and five spice chicken garlic noodles and it was very filling; it was about $10.75 a plate and they give big portion. First time going to a Vietnamese restaurant and not ordering pho. Lol. I will definitely go back and recommend this place to others. Yum!!
author: Pammy P.

description: Excellent, fast service and delicious fresh food!  What more can you ask for?!  Cozy, clean little place, very accommodating, always open.  The staff is so friendly, I have to say personally, I love great customer service.  Sometimes it makes the food taste even more delicious!
author: Maxie P.

description: I have eaten at Perilla 5 times and will definately be returning. I love the Five Spice Chicken and Vermicelli, The Curry Chicken Noodle Soup and the Garlic Noodles and Five Spice Chicken. It is all so delicious and the wait staff are friendly and the prices are reasonable. Tasty!!
author: Donna C.

description: I get delivery from them at least twice a month, sometimes more. I always get the charbroiled beef with garlic noodles and pho ga chicken noodle soup. They are efficient on the phone, fast delivery and delicious! The food is always hot and the delivery people are ALWAYS nice. I recommend them to anyone and everyone! Yummmmmm!
author: r m.

description:
I frequent here quite often since it is cheap and walking distance within my house. It's a little on the bland side when it comes to Vietnamese food. I usually get 5 spice chicken pho and the broth always tastes pretty mediocre as in lacking actual flavors and spices. The chicken on the other hand is pretty good. Garlic noodles are average. 

All together I'd give them 3.5 stars if I could because the staff is VERY friendly and polite which is great and you can pretty much get a meal for under $10 per person and that's even for dinner time.
author: Nicole V.

description:
We were going to San Tung Chinese restaurant on Irving, but the line and wait time was crazy long. So we walked up the street and stumbled upon Perilla. What a nice find. Super good Vietnamese food. Had the pho, of course, but what's unusual is that they have vegetarian pho selections. 
Also had the pork with garlic noodles and spring rolls. The flavors are great, price is right and the service is very attentive.
author: The Foodie O.

description: This is a lovely spot - a nurse at UCSF recommended it to us. Would have given 3.5 stars, but will give them the benefit of rounding up. The pho was great, everything was fresh, and imperial rolls were some of the best we've had. Service was quick and attentive.  We'd go again for sure.
author: Jean S.

description:
We were a a party of five on new year's around 5:30 or 6. There were about 4 or 5 parties in front of us on the waitlist and we actually missed them when they called for us. One of the servers was kind enough to seat us as soon as they had a table available. Overall wait must have been 10 minutes. 

The place was small but that was to be expected from any store on Irving. We all ordered different kinds of garlic noodle plates and they were delicious! Fish sauce was just like my dad's homemade one. Portions were large for these plates and we all enjoyed them. Service was fantastic even though it was a full house. We definitely will be coming back if we're in the area :)
author: Lunasiel S.

description: Hooray for another restaurant which only does a few things, but does them reaally well!  Just Pho and garlic noodles--about 10 varieties of each (we had five-spice chicken pho, and imperial roll-shrimp noodles)--and both were excellent. A solid four stars.
author: David R.

description:
Perilla, I love you.

Perhaps I was traumatized by PPQ's subpar garlic noodles to never want to try again, until of course my boyfriend ordered them from Perilla.

The garlic noodles here are absolutely delicious and filling! Nothing like what I was served at PPQ. I've only tried the five spice chicken garlic noodles and five spice chicken pho. Everything was flavorful.
author: Mabel Y.

description: My boyfriend and I just had dinner here! He's been here multiple times, but it was first time for me! He got the garlic noodles with five spices chicken (he said he always chooses this) while I got their rare beef pho! I was pleasantly suprised by the broth of the pho, it was very flavorful and the meat was soft and juicy! The garlic noodles were perfectly cooked and the fice spices chicken tasted amazing! The staff was really nice and made sure our glasses were always filled with (cucumber flavored) ice water! Highly recommend this place!
author: Kira U.

description:
This is one of the few places I MISS since moving back down to Southern California. 

Imperial Rolls.
Garlic Noodles. 
and everything on this menu is amazing!

Staff is attentive! 

Do not have one bad thing to say about this place! :)
author: Jan Q.

description: Their garlic noodles are amazing.  Full of garlic and so tasty.  I am craving the noodles right now.  What time is it?  Only 9:30am and they are not open yet so I will have to wait until 11am to make my trek down there.  LOL
author: Debbie G.

description: Came here with friends for a quick lunch break and was surprised with how wonderful the service is. The waiter and waitress came by often to refill our waters and to check up on us. They are also very polite people! As for the food, their garlic noodles are BOMB. I ordered the #27 Spicy Chicken Curry with Garlic Noodles. The curry wasn't super spicy, but the kick is noticeable. Overall, great food, great service and I would definitely come here again!
author: Sharon D.

description:
Incredibly crispy imperial rolls filled with yumminess 

Enjoyed the garlic noodles with charbroiled pork too.

Clean casual atmosphere and abuzz with regulars and new patrons alike.

Service is prompt and friendly.

Both mission st and this location provided wonderful experience 

One off as they have not opened an outlet where I live
author: Nelce S.

description:
Generous portions (excluding the pho), tender five spice chicken, and incredibly friendly service. 

Perilla, I will be back! =)
author: TuUyen L.

description: Came here because Manna was a 30 minute wait. We got seated pretty quickly on a Sunday evening. We ordered 3 garlic noodles with curry, five spice chicken, and shrimp. All were very good. We also ordered spring rolls, egg rolls and a papaya salad. Everything tasted fresh and solid. All the ladies working there were very nice and attentive. After we finished we got to go boxes and they even gave us sauce containers to go =). My future sister in law loved their sriracha sauce. She said for some reason it's spicier and she loooooooves spicy.
author: W W.

description:
This is my go to place for garlic noodles. Their garlic noodles are usually on point and I enjoy it with the imperial rolls. You can't go wrong with the five spice chicken option. Still wondering why they only give 2 broccoli florets though...

I stopped by on a Thursday afternoon with my boyfriend and waited approximately 8-10 minutes. Although they were busy, I managed to make eye contact with one of the waiters BUT he did not say anything to us at all. Instead he just ignored us. They had 2 empty tables and maybe they were short staffed but the fact that we went unacknowledged, un-greeted, and basically ignored for so long, it ruined our mood. We ended up leaving and eating elsewhere. If we were acknowledged, we wouldn't have mind waiting but that wasn't the case. 

Garlic noodles are always consistently good. Service could be better. I feel like they give better service when you order to-go.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Went here for the must-try garlic Noodles per Buzzfeed's list for SF foods. Both the garlic noodles & the pho were tasteless, long story short. Buzzfeed, you steered me wrong this time. 

I did appreciate the friendly staff & them accepting customers past the 9pm closing time, so for that you get 2 stars from me, Perilla.
author: Milana A.

description: Delicious Gluten Free food that fills. We ordered the Imperial Rolls: Crispy and flavorful;finally completely crunchy rolls not soggy at all. My curry chicken pho was so good served with plenty of tender chicken thighs. The shrimp and garlic noodles (NOT GF) was also delicious. The servings are satisfying.
author: Janine M.

description: I love to come here on a cold and even a warm day. I had my first pho experience here and instantly fell in love. Nice people here. Great service. Only knock I have is that it isn't the most clean place I've eaten but it's not like super filthy to the point you don't want to eat here. I recommend the #7 and also try the garlic noodle's.
author: Isaiah E.

description: Great flavor and as always very filling. We were recommended this place by UCSF. Just a 7 min walk. Highly recommend!
author: Sheila P.

description:
This place is good enough if that Korean place across the street is crowded and you're just looking for a place to check in on Yelp near your friend's apartment in the sunset district and take pics and just be cool like everyone else in SF and you want to impress your ex-girlfriend in preparation for the wedding in Mexico where you're the best man and she's your date, even though you spit so much game the last 12 months and you took her to Yosemite and planned everything down to what trail you would take in order to see the abandoned mines near Nevada and some other cool stuff like the Gaylor Lakes and you just want to hit it because she lives like three hours away and you're both single and for some reason you think there may be a chance that you could text her when it's half past five but probably not because she lives three hours away and you still think there's a chance you could date but she's a Republican but it's all good because opposites attract and you've already met her family and you bought $130 worth of her family's barbecue sauce because it's THAT good and you want to support her mom but after she eventually flaked on the wedding 2 days before her flight you won't talk to her ever again because you could have brought someone else and she's not worth all the effort but it's all good because plenty of other girls danced with you at the wedding and the groom was glad she didn't come after all and there are plenty of fish in the sea plus only a few of your friends like her.

With that said I ordered the a noodle dish and the aforementioned gal ordered a chicken noodle dish. Nothing memorable here.

Yo it's snowing so hard outside that God must be getting rid of all his dandruff.
author: Jerry B.

description: The garlic noodles are where it's at! If you're craving pho, it also offers pretty good, clean broths. They could be a bit more generous with the noodles. The service is fantastic and friendly.
author: Jin N.

description:
Overall: I've found it! Perilla has satisfied my garlic noodle crave and that's a lot coming from a garlic lover like me. Unfortunately, I feel like this place is a little underrated (only locals know about this lovely place I'm guessing?) because each time I go, it's usually quite empty! Maybe its because I come in during after lunch hours (2-3pm) so it may have died down. But I've came here a few times and found this to be a little odd because this place is amazing! 

Food: Besides that, the food here pretty much hits the spot. I ordered the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles if I remember correctly. The noodles are chewy and filled with just enough garlic flavor. The charbroiled pork is nicely tendered yet chewy at the same time and complimented the garlic noodles perfectly! Other than the noodles, the entree included: a generous amount of the pork, two pieces of broccoli, and a nice dipping sauce (sweet and sourish fish sauce?) on the side. The portions are pretty big so I usually ask them for a box and even when I reheat it later on, it's still delicious! Thinking about this dish is making me have some serious withdrawals. Wished I had some to eat right now, yum! 

Customer Service: I can tell that they make their customer service a priority because the staffs are all really nice! Once you walk in, you're greeted with a smile and seats are available right away. Menus and water are brought out quickly and they wait a good amount of time before they take your order. Each time I'm there, my waiter was a nice, pleasant guy who wore glasses. He is well trained and is really well mannered! He makes sure to check up on you and go around for water refill. Overall, the amazing food and service makes this place one of my favorites!!
author: Abby C.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE PERILLA! The only times I give 5 stars are when I actually crave and salivate at the thought of the food. Perilla is definitely up there in terms of cravings and drool. :P

This location is nearby Justin N. who is a dear friend of mine. Every time I'm in the area, I shoot to either grab something quick here or go down the street for some dried fried wings from San Tung (*droools*). My favorite thing to get here is the Imperial Rolls and 5 Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles which is only $9.50 and comes with broccoli so you don't feel completely terrible for the meal! The chick is always juice and tender, but really flavorful, the imperial rolls are soooo good and crunchy, and the garlic noodles are so buttery and garlicy. I'm a total sucker for good garlic noodles... it's probably the key to my heart. 

Anyways, if you're in the area and want a quick and reasonable priced place to eat. Check Perilla out... but don't forget to get an order to-go and drop it off to me.
author: Tien P.

description: Stopped by last night and had a great time.  Our servers were super sweet and nice.  I didn't know there was a Perilla in this neighborhood/district.  Anyhow, I got the beef with garlic noodles and Imperial Rolls.  After splashing on a tsunami of Sriracha, I was in heaven!  I definitely recommend the place and will return.
author: Shaun W.

description: Been here handful of times. So far it's been quick and good service. Great food too! It's not easy to find parking as it is on Irving....
author: Jenn J.

description: The food was good.  I liked the rolls and the chicken.  I do think, they should use less oil.
author: Olya A.

description:
Super fast

#1 Reason to come here: GARLIC NOODLES. You know when you are scared that after you eat your meat you wont have anything flavorful? not the case! they are good on their own even. 

#2 The staff is ridiculously friendly. Always smiling, and will refer to you by name if they can which is always nice. Even when you are just there for take out , they treat you good!
author: Raj M.

description:
After seeing most of Yelpers ordering and talking about the 5 spice chicken with Garlic noodles I had to give them a go. I was not disappointed at all. The emperor rolls were great if not a little under done. The garlic noodles were firm and strong flavored which is precisely what we were after and the chicken was full of flavor. 

We decided get a small bowl of Spicy chicken curry to go with our meal.Again it was a flavor filled dish with a nice creamy if not a tiny bit too watery texture. 

This meal definitely satisfied our cravings for big Asian flavor and next time we are in the area we will give it another go.
author: Jacob B.

description: Always friendly, quick, delicious, unpretentious, clean! I don't know why there aren't more rave reviews. The garlic noodles and great service have me returning time and time again.
author: Anna Y.

description:
3.5 stars 
I came here with my friend about a month ago. I would say they are pretty decent. We both had the garlic noodles and the 5 spice chicken combo. The chicken was nicely seasoned, kinda crispy and hot which was good. Then we finally took a bite of the garlic noodles, they were cold/ room temperature. We were expecting them to be at least warm to be an indication that they were just made at first but no. The flavor and Taste were not bad I can see what the hype is all about. Also it Is at a fairly cheap price as well. 

Decor is pretty ok inside, still looks almost the same when it was toasties.
author: Stella J.

description:
It's 4:38 on a Tuesday afternoon and I just ate at Perilla. My past 3 star review has now gone to a 1 star and loss of my business. I'm so done eating mediocre Vietnamese food. There's too many delicious spots in San Francisco to waste your time here. My BF and I ordered 5 spice chicken w/garlic noodles and chicken curry w/garlic noodles. My GARLIC NOODLES WERE REHEATED! All our food was luke warm and the plates were steaming hott. My BF's chicken curry was overcooked and chewy!! I only came
For garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken BUT Perilla can't even do that right!!! ((Sigh)) so sad.
author: Andrew V.

description: Very good garlic noodles and large portions. The meat was cooked well too. I ordered this to go and ate it at the bar next door during a warriors game :)
author: Steph N.

description:
My friend and I decided on this place since we both hadn't been here before. We arrived a little before 5pm on a Thursday afternoon and we were the only patrons. 

We both ordered the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles. One of the waiters was confused and thought we ordered only 1 to share, but that was quickly taken care of when the waitress came over. 

Our food came out pretty fast. So, we were thinking that the garlic noodles had already been cooked and were prepared to go. We also thought that because the garlic noodles weren't even hot. They were just warm like they had been microwaved. Anyway, they were still good though with just the right amount of garlic. 

The 5 spice chicken was very tasty and the skin was crispy. You could tell it was well-marinated and not overcooked. We literally ate everything off our plates! 

We found it hard to talk over someone who was fixing a table with a loud drill, while we were eating so we had to pretty much yell at each other. Luckily, the guy wasn't drilling the whole time we were there. Other than that randomness, service was ok. 

Overall, I would definitely come back to have the same thing again! It was delicious! The only thing that sucks about this area is the parking. So, come on a weekday before the dinner crowd.
author: Fallon P.

description: Based on the recommendations from others here on Yelp, I decided to try the crispy imperial rolls and the five spices chicken with garlic noodles. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype. The chicken and noodles were just ok and the rolls weren't crispy at all. Granted I ordered through Eat 24 and had to wait a little bit for my order to arrive, but I don't think that should have affected the quality that much. The next time I'm in the mood for Vietnamese, I'll probably look elsewhere.
author: Alex H.

description:
I went here for lunch and ordered the garlic noodles with chicken and imperial rolls. The portions were large but I wish there was a better chicken to noodle ratio. There could have been a little bit more chicken. The noodles had a great buttery garlic flavor. The chicken was just ok. The imperial rolls were nice and crispy and went well with the dipping sauce. There were two pieces of cold and flavorless pieces of blanched broccoli on the plate. They said they were out of charbroiled shrimp but they had shrimp rolls. The rolls were good. They were fresh and minty and had a good dipping sauce.

Service was pretty good. The food came out fast.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Hubby says: that was good, I liked it.

I'd have to agree. We came here after a morning at the Academy of Sciences. We ordered a garlic noodles with imperial egg rolls and a brisket and meatball pho. The brisket was quite tender and the broth had a good balance of flavor without being too salty.
author: Pui-yun C.

description:
Meh. Not as good as Yummy Yummy, but I had no other choice that day. Service was a bit slow, but the vermicelli was pretty good.  Good portions - but a bit pricey.  Not used to paying around $10 for vermicelli :( 

Also - don't get their Thai iced tea. I think this is the first place where I can't recommend it.  It was so watery :(
author: Steph S.

description: BEST garlic noodles ever. I always order the Five Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles. It's the best item on the menu. The service is also quick and they pretty clean. Parking is a bit hard in this area,(but when is it not in SF) but if you're willing to walk a couple of blocks, it's not too bad.
author: Courtney D.

description: Garlic noodles? Yes PLEASE. On everything please. But especially with the 5 spice chicken and the fried or fresh spring rolls. Ridiculously friendly service EVERY single time I've been to this location. Haven't tried the pho or many of the other dishes, but man oh man do I love the garlic noodles. Great for a night out drinking, a night in lounging or a hungover Sunday morning. Ask very good Vietnamese iced coffee.
author: Daniel C.

description: Standard Vietnamese food. Solid lunch menu. Pork chops + garlic noodles = YUM.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: parking is very hard to find in the area. No wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: normal service. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: the garlic noodles are really good but not quite a must try. Same with the 5 spice chicken. 

_____

Overall Experience
3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
The food here taste best after a few alcoholic beverages
author: Elliott N.

description: I'm a huge fan of the garlic noodles here. They are super tasty. The only change I'd make is a little less oil. I also like the shrimp, beef and chicken dishes. The pho is just okay, nothing special. This is a nice place to hit up late at night.
author: M K.

description: Mmmmmmmm always a good place to go. Their garlic noodles are the bommmbbb and it's well portioned.
author: Anne B.

description:
Garlic noodles, five spice chicken, and egg rolls! Everything you love, nothing you don't, all for under $10! That's what I call a deal. Parking was a bit difficult because it's the Inner Sunset, but you'll be glad that your car is far away after finishing this meal. It's heavy on carbs and protein, and the portion sizes are very generous. I actually think I prefer the grilled pork so I will go with that next time. It included two steamed and cold spears of broccoli to cut through the heaviness of the butter in the garlic noodles as well as the fried crispy rolls. Service was kind of meh, but they were fairly quick with preparing and serving the food. The interior is spacious if not fancy. Also, it can get really loud inside because Perilla seems to be a favorite gathering place of families with young children who like to make a lot of noise! I will be back because the food, portions, and price cannot be beat!

One thing I forgot to add: I think their food is FULL OF MSG. I literally guzzled a gallon of water that night and this was after finishing two full glasses of water during my meal. So be warned if you are sensitive to MSG.
author: Leslie H.

description:
One day after work my mom brought home a couple boxes of the five spice chicken and garlic noodles. They were SO GOOD! I ate 3/4 of the noodles a hour before I went for my swim (aka work-out) which wasn't exactly a good idea since I was pretty bloated for the rest of the night. 

A few weeks later, my cousin and I came back from downtown and decided to go out for dinner in the Sunset. We decided we'd get garlic noodles. It was about 9:30pm when we arrived. Before we could even get our bodies into the restaurant, a lady shouted that they were closed, even though you could clearly see that people were still enjoying their not-even-half-eaten-meals. We were pretty bummed out. We stood in front of the door, outside of course, for about a minute and decided to go back in to see if we could order garlic noodles to go. The guy at the register agreed to let us get take-out but said that the only thing we could order was garlic noodles which was perfectly fine with us. 

Great customer service!
Delicious garlic noodles! 
(I prefer pork over the five spice chicken, my cousin said there was no "spice.")
author: Jess W.

description:
This 2nd location of Perilla (SOMA) is a welcome addition to the inner Sunset area. Nice to have another good Vietnamese restaurant besides Yummy Yummy a few blocks away.

Great place for fresh made to order lunch for under $7 (a few items cost more). The menu is very basic (just chicken, pork, beef, or shrimp): 12 noodle soups (pho), 10 rice plates, 10 garlic noodle plates, 10 vermicelli bowls, 8 vegetarian dishes, and 8 appetizers. On my last visit I got a combo special of imperial rolls and lemongrass pork over vermicelli bowl, to go. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UrQwpHXMWa5dcpUXLIK3cA/l Hot and delicious!

Just FYI that Perilla, Toasties, and PPQ locations are all owned by the Truong family.
author: Luis C.

description: I'll keep this brief; the food was fantastic, quickly made and very tasty. But the reason they got 5 stars was their excellent customer service. We came in less than an hour before closing, everyone working here was smiling, laughing, and being incredibly helpful. I'd definitely eat here again.
author: Will S.

description: Maybe my tastebuds changed. I'm finding myself here for lunch at least twice a month. And the garlic noodles taste so good after a day of sitting in the fridge -_o...
author: Christy L.

description: This place is amazing! I saw the place from SF times as one of the 20 places you have to try if you live in SF. The place is located in the area of the best restaurants in SF. The place seems like a typical pho place but they're famous for their garlic noodles. The garlic noodles is one of reasons why I visit this place. I would suggest getting their imperial roll and five spice chicken. Their customer service is on point. All the staff are pretty nice and they make you feel welcome throughout the whole meal. Their smiles and attitudes toward customers compliments the food well. Two thumbs up!
author: Clarence B.

description: We were super hungry when we got here and we found exactly what we were looking for! Great food, quick service, friendly staff and excellent value for money!
author: Waleed A.

description:
Seriously? What's the big deal with this place? I was excited to try it because of the excellent ratings. 

My meal was literally spaghetti pasta drenched in butter and garlic and a piece of low grade fatty fried chicken. Sure it tasted pretty good but, HELLO! Anything with that much butter tastes good...

I think I could make the same meal at home in under 20 mins and it would probably cost me about 3-4$ per person....

Go Figure.
author: Nina M.

description: Great example of Inner Sunset quality international food.  The interior space is clean, with plenty of room and tables.  Pricing is very fair, service is attentive and polite, and the portion sizes are quite large.  I had the chicken curry vermicelli, which was fantastic.  The bowl was enormous, and I was barely able to finish.  Really excellent, satisfying food, and I would not hesitate to come back!
author: Lars T.

description: I've been here three times in the past two and a half years and they have always been consistent with their service and quality and taste of food. For the price, I think the portion size is more than fair. The garlic noodle is definitely my top pick when I am here. I'm always here with a large group (5-10) and every single time they have been extremely welcoming and accommodating. Wait time has always been around 10-15 mins. Yay for Perilla!
author: Rebecca J.

description: They have a really delicious vegetarian pho option. Vegetarian pho is a. Not always actually vegetarian and b. Not always that good. But this place does it right! So fresh and flavorful and delicious!
author: Lily C.

description: Can't find good garlic noodles and five spice chicken anywhere else! The portions are HUGE, you can probably save half of it for a second meal. Definitely worth the price, plus there's hardly ever a wait for this place.
author: Lina C.

description: Best garlic noodles ever! Best five spice chicken as well! Very entertaining wait staff when in the weeds.
author: Kristoff F.

description:
Garlic noodles. Garlic noodles! GARLIC NOODLES.

My friend was insistent that we come have the garlic noodles. Despite the build-up that can only lead to disappointment, they held up. I enjoyed the garlic noodles. 

My overall problem with the meal was how oily it all was, and I like my fried foods, but this shiz was oily to the max. The noodles seemed to be the least so, but the chicken and imperial rolls were way too oiled up. The oil completely overpowers the other tastes, so while it seemed like the meat and rolls were well prepared, I could have been eating them blind and I would only know the difference by texture. The meal really sat on me, too, so I'm sorry to write that I wouldn't go back for anything other than a side of noodles. Maybe.
author: John M.

description:
THESE GARLIC NOODLES OMG ASAFZD

I've had lots of garlic noodles...and this one is. my. favorite. The garlic noodles I've had in the past were either very oily or not garlicky enough, but Perilla strikes it PERFECT. Their noodles have the right amount of garlic & butter...but doesn't feel too heavy or oily. My empty plate was hardly even greasy after I finished off every single noodle.  I ordered the garlic noodles with the 5 spice chicken which had a perfectly crisp skin and the juiciest of meat. The imperial rolls were also bomb.

I can't wait to come back here. The food is on point, the service couldn't be nicer, and THOSE GARLIC NOODLES!!!
author: Cher B.

description: the Five Spice Chicken Pho was tasty. yummy crispy skin on the chicken, served on the side. Not bad...
author: Nicole J.

description: Sad take out experience! They failed to package in any utensils or napkins. Furthermore, the amount of curry they gave us (less than a cup) was highly disappointing!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Oh Perilla. You've cured many a hang over with your delicious pho. I get it to go
so your guests don't have to witness the spectacle. You're welcome. 

**don't be stingy w the basil
author: Mel M.

description:
Strange name for a vietnamese restaurant if you ask me. I have no clue what it means and I'm  Vietnamese. Another typical place in sf where parking is just a huge pain in the behind. Theres metered parking and street parking. But be forewarn, good luck!

They seem to advertise their garlic noodles so that's what's i ended up ordering just so I can try what it's all about. Not quite sure how garlic noodles is anything Vietnamese related.

Charbroiled pork is thick, no fat, and perfectly cooked. Garlic noodles was a disappointment. Definitely not flavorful and was just noodles. Nothing special. The five spices chicken didn't taste like there was five spices but it was very delicious. The crunch and meat texture was perfect!!! I would highly recommend that to anyone that is eating here! 

Service was pretty good. They bought out the check prior to us asking for it but it's okay. They take credit card and cash. Causal attire is fine. Nothing special about the decor. Small place.

My thoughts, for being a Vietnamese restaurant there was no Vietnamese words on the menu. We tried to speak to the staff in Vietnamese to clarify what we were ordering since were used to ordering and seeing the words in vietnamese and she seemed like she spoke very limited Vietnamese. 

Restroom was clean but only one per person. Overall this place a ok. Perhaps because I'm a true fob inside and I'm used to the regular mom and pops Vietnamese restaurants where they serve the usual (i.e. pho, mi, bun rieu, bun Bo hue, com tam, etc.) not garlic noodles. I would like to know where that originated from and how it became Vietnamese.
author: Lisa D.

description:
3.5 - 4 scale.

I've been to Perilla's a couple times. Every time I've had good experiences. Today I tried the garlic noodles, imperial rolls, 5 spice chicken combo with Thai tea. The food came out suspiciously fast, but I figured they probably had it semi-ready since it seemed to be possibly their most popular dish. 

The garlic noodles were good but not as flavorful as I anticipated. The 5 spice chicken was delicious but not as moist (ugh hate that word) and tender as I expected. The imperial rolls I've had before, tasted good but not so special. 

Overall, I'm giving the high rating b/c you can really get a bang for your buck. The affordability, friendly service, and good food keeps me coming back.
author: Emily M.

description: Geez I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. This is your go to spot for garlic noodles! One of the best restaurants I've been to where they're garlic noodles are to die for. You MUST get the 5 Spiced Chicken + garlic noodles! If ya'll never had this before, you're missing out on LIFE. I'm serious. Okay, maybe not but you still gotta try this place. The wait can be from 15-20 minutes depending on what time you go at. I came here on a weekend and only had to wait 10 minutes before a table was leaving. Service is great, the workers are really nice. There's always a guy coming around for water and asking how our food is. That is the key to customer service. I really enjoy coming here for food and service. Oh, I forgot to mention, the carpaccio here also is good! The crispy garlic with the sauce is so good! Man I'm drooling thinking about all the yummy food they have here. It really makes me want to go right now but unfortunately it's already late so I have to wait lol. Anywho, those who are from out of town and loves to eat Asian (Vietnamese) food, try this place! It's definitely a MUST if you're in town. I definitely will be back here soon! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
Perilla has some great food at reasonable prices for their large portions and friendly, fast service. 
I've enjoyed two amazing meals here so far--Their papaya salad with beef is much larger than I expected and comes with a hefty portion of delicious beef on a bed of shaved green papaya and a nice dressing. The salad is flavorful and filling.
Their five spice chicken is flavor packed and satisfyingly crispy, and the garlic noodle is surprisingly complex. 
While many of their dishes are carb-fests, there are also really nice healthy options. This is a solid place to grab lunch or dinner, and they've been fast both times I've gone.
author: Allxie C.

description:
I hate doing stuff like this because I realize the restaurant business is these people's livelihood. But I have to inform my fellow yelpers, and I also feel that business owners have responsibilities to uphold for their customers.

I recently saw this restaurant listed on one of those notorious health violations lists. Perilla received a score of 81, which they do prominently display by the register. I have been here multiple times but this time around the knowledge of the score made me view this place with a more critical eye. I went to visit the restroom, which is located right next to the kitchen and where they "wash" the dishes. I did not like what I saw to the tune that I think 81 was generous. I've never gotten sick, but c'mon! Standards need to be upheld. Not coming back to this place.
author: Jose U.

description: Girlfriend and I ordered the veggies statutes garlic noodles. Really big portions, water was replenished at perfect intervals, needless to say it was a wonderful experience! Food was ready in 5 minutes!!
author: Miguel O.

description:
I have been here three or four times now and will be back I'm sure. Atmosphere is simple but nice. 

The garlic noodles are amazing!! Portions are very large so I usually get a side of the garlic noodles which is plentiful!  I also love the veggie summer rolls. Fresh and delicious!  They focus heavily on the garlic noodles but there are some other options as well including soups and platters with meat or seafood including a side of the garlic noodles. They have a good number of vegetarian options, listed in a separate section on the back of the menu. 

Service is not the most attentive and it can be challenging to get water refilled, but the servers are kind. Expect a wait on the weekends. 

Prices are great and you can walk out of there completely overstuffed for about $10. Drink selection is somewhat limited but they do have about three kinds of beer. I usually stick with water which is cucumber infused - free of charge. A very nice touch!
author: Natalie W.

description: We had a mixed experienced here. Poor service - I had to ask the wait person for our food twice. She forgot to bring our drinks and we had to ask about that. She even said to us "I'm getting it now..." when she saw that we were looking her way. We saw people who came after us being served either before us or immediately after us. There were only two in our party so we didn't have a large group. We ordered the pho which was passable. I've eaten pho my entire life and while this one was okay, the broth was not as robust or as deep as it could've been. The brisket slices, however, were very thinly sliced and very tender and flavorful. We also got the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles. The pork itself was tender, sweet, and tasty with a little bit of crisp which I like. However, I found the garlic noodles to be a little bland. Disappointing because I like the garlic to kick you outta the park, esp after I read the reviews. Overall, okay food, but I think the extremely bad service soured me on this place. Won't be returning. There's too many other great restaurants to explore.
author: T D.

description: Absolutely amazing. Great services fresh food from all over Vietnam. Great gem in the sunset!
author: Omar C.

description:
I went with 2 friends for lunch last week. One friend didn't know what she wanted so she asked what the waitress would recommend, she said the 5 spice chicken garlic noodles which was what I wanted to order. All 3 of us got that. $8.95 for garlic noodles, 2 imperial rolls, 5 spice chicken, & pickled veggies http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q. When I looked at the menu before going, I thought $9 for all that, you probably don't get much of anything but I was so wrong, you GET A LOT, it is soooo worth it. 

I would recommend this place.
Food was really good, people are nice, wait wasn't long for food to arrive, tables were readily available, and the cucumber in water was delishh and original (only seen lemons in water) which I will now try to replicate.

Parking is the only downside, it can take forever to find parking. I've learned that the hard way.
author: Kylie L.

description:
We went here on a cold evening for a nice, hot bowl of pho and were not disappointed.
We started by trying the grilled pork rolls which were delicious.
For the main course, my husband had the special pho with brisket and meat balls while I had the five-spice chicken pho.  Everything was perfect as usual and we walked with warm, full stomachs.
I can't recommend this place more highly.
author: Philip C.

description: Not very busy, a couple tables seemed to be consistently available throughout the meal. The waiters and waitresses didn't speak the most perfect English, but they took the time to be friendly and made sure we stayed comfortable during our stay. On top of all that, the food was delicious. The only thing I can call a drawback is the portion size. I'd come again when in the area.
author: Jay M.

description: This was my first time here and I thought it was pretty good. I had the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The chicken comes sliced with skin on and the skin was nice and crunchy. You get two imperial rolls cut into six pieces. A generous mound of garlic noodles which I found had an odd buttery taste to it. I'm accustomed to garlic noodles sautéed in oil and garlic. I probably won't get the garlic noodles on the next visit, I'll definitely go back.
author: Kim L.

description:
Their 5-spice chicken is some of the best I've had. Big portion. Crispy skin. Succulent meat. The 5-spice chicken & garlic noodles is one of the most popular dishes there. Whenever I've been there on a crowded day, a good half of the patrons are eating that dish.

Their beef Pho is better than average. It's Americanized (no tripe, tendon, strange cuts of beef, strange herbs, etc.), but at least it has very little if any MSG and the flavor is always consistent. I never regret eating it.
author: Gene G.

description: BEST garlic noodles in the city! I ordered imperial rolls five spices chicken with garlic noodles (#27 for $10.25). Don't order the imperial rolls appetizer $7 for 6 pieces. Instead order the imperial rolls with your meal because it only costs $0.75 to $1.00 more for 3 egg rolls. Hot tea is free! Good price, great food, friendly and happy servers = Definitely coming back!
author: Brandon L.

description:
This place used to be the old Toasties; I even saw someone wearing the Toasties shirt that says "Best Crab Melt in SF" on the back.

Anyway, I came here on a Thursday evening at 5:30PM and the place was empty. I ordered imperial rolls and charbroiled beef with garlic noodles for $9.95. The food came out hot and fresh in less than 15 minutes. I can't say much about service, because I ordered to-go. The imperial rolls were small, but fresh and very crispy. The dipping sauce that came with them was too vinegary for me. The beef was a bit chewy, but full of flavor. And the garlic noodles were perfect -- very buttery and garlicky and smelled just the way it tasted. Portion-wise, it filled me up but with no leftovers. 

I would definitely come back again and try other items! Overall, Perilla doesn't have a huge selection of food as does other Vietnamese places in the Sunset, but the food here is still great! The delicious GARLIC NOODLES will keep me coming back!! :)
author: Priscilla W.

description:
ridic 
ima put on the white boy voice and say 
just try it man 
pho tai tai on side just say those little dirty words and your san fran visit is alive .! 
*clean , nice , clean fast as hell just amazing so glad i came here ! just in amazing exp!
author: Christopher A.

description: I had plans to play trivia next door at Blackthorn and arrived early, so stopped in here for dinner. I love pho but wanted to try something different so I ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles based on the Yelp reviews. Well, they were not wrong, the dish is pretty great. You get a good amount of food for your money and the service was good. I would definitely stop back in if I'm in the Inner Sunset.
author: Candace R.

description: The place is probably most popular for garlic noodles. I had the garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken and imperial rolls. Pretty good, but not the best garlic noodles I've had. The only other item I've had here is the satay noodle soup which wasn't that great. They're also a little pricy for garlic noodles compared to others.
author: Ali F.

description:
Walked in and was immediately greeted by one of the servers across the room.  The server was nice and I ordered a five spice chicken garlic noodle and imperial roll plate.  The wait for the food wasn't that long and the server was nice when he answered my questions.

The food was pretty good.  I didn't taste much of the five spice in the chicken but it was well cooked and crispy.  The imperial rolls were what I expected out of the price.  The garlic noodles was subtle in terms of garlic and somewhat heavy on the butter, but it was very delicious.  In the future I would probably order one or two side orders of garlic noodles since it seems worth it.
author: Rob C.

description:
LOOOOVE the garlic noodles with the 5 spice chicken & imperial rolls (#27). I've been going to perilla long enough to notice that their plates have definitely gotten a bit scanty with the meat portions :/. Nonetheless it's still SO flavorful and filling, I almost always have to get a takeout box for leftovers saved for later. The water they serve does have cucumber in the pitcher I believe in it so it does give the water a little funny taste if you're not into that kinda flavor.

I've been here a couple times right before closing (9:30) and been seated right away, served our plates, and out within 30 minutes. Fast, quick, &delicious what else can you ask for?
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
Holy shit, their food is good. I should probably not be eating it when I'm this this hungry, because I've occasionally been known to hurt myself eating.

I don't know why I'm so surprised, because I've eaten here before, and it was pretty good then. Maybe it's because it's delivery. This is way, way better than my usual delivery.
author: Amy T.

description:
I always get their garlic noodle plates.  I like mine with grilled pork- it's cut real thin and very flavorful.  Also, portions are pretty big. 
I've been to both locations, SF and Sunset and they are both great and consistent.
author: Krystle L.

description: Best service I've ever had. Five spice chicken with garlic noodles is a killer. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Kaika K.

description: Five Stars for the Five Spiced Chicken (and the Garlic Noodles).  I think it really spices up your day to eat here. Although the Garlic Noodles w/ Chicken is my favorite here, the dish tend to be carb heavy, you can get just the Five Spiced Chicken by itself as a side and it'll just exponentially increase how enjoyable your soup, salad, or anything else non-garlic noodles that you buy.
author: Shelley C.

description: Garlic Noodles are full of garlic flavor.  Charcoal BBQ Pork, Beef and Shrimp are delicious.
author: Wan T.

description:
3.5 stars.

Having had lunch at the Financial District location on several occasions I was curious to see how this newer location fared.  I had lunch here following my Japanese Tea Garden volunteer project.

It's a good sign when a restaurant is filled with patrons on a late Sunday afternoon.  Lucky for me there was a single table right next to the window available.  The waiter who greeted me gestured for me to take that table.  There was some residue on the table leftover from previous diners so the waiter came back to wipe the crumbs of diced garlic away.  Some of it landed in my lap.  It didn't bother me that much though because my pants had caked on mud from the garden.

Along with the menu comes a big glass of water with no ice!  I'm accustomed to having some ice cubes to chew on, but this water was room temperature.  Blah!  I ordered the Golden Fried Quail appetizer and the Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles plus a soft drink.

As is true of their original location the kitchen service here is very good.  Even for fried quail which I expect additional preparation  time for mine came back pretty quickly.  The quail (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=byT8qXOpINIq7TGRdzjcrw) was a bit small in size but it was excellent in flavor.  Parts of the bone in the tiny wings were fried up so crispy that it was easy to just eat it with what little skin and meat there was on the wings.  In case you've never had quail this photo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=PPmBug_kLN2ib6PoJDnHRQ) shows the little delicacy at approximately 1.5 times of its actual size.  I enjoyed the quail slowly trying to pull away all the available meat.  It was fried up hot too so I had little choice but to it eat it slow.

The Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=ph01kGlwa8ZA2YKSJTNdJg) had arrived shortly after the quail so it had already begun cooling while I tried to finish off the quail.  The chicken was fried up with crispy skin on the outside and tender, juicy meat on the inside.  The seasoning was very good, but for a leg quarter that was supposed to be boneless I bit into two tiny shards of bone and spit out several pieces of chicken cartilage.  The garlic noodles were excellent in flavor with firm noodles and lots of finely diced garlic.

The waiter forgot to bring my soft drink though, and since he didn't come back once the food was on my table I had to flag down another waitress to get my soda.  No other complaints though.  I'll return because the food is very good.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Really changed great food and excellent service! The shrimp rolls are to die for and the sauce that goes with is to die for!!! Do not miss out on their five spice chicken and vermicelli
author: Nadia N.

description:
Well, hands down the best vietnamese food in inner sunset.

Love the five spice chicken, love the port with dry noodles

If you can't find parking picking up an order, just call them and they will come out with your food and swipe your card
author: Tony T.

description:
The food was so delicious! I got the beef vermicelli and my boyfriend got the pho with beef brisket and both were very good! Next time I will have to try the garlic noodles.

Also the waiters were very nice and kept our waters full, great service! Especially on Christmas night.
author: Ellie R.

description:
Honestly, I wasn't too excited to try this place after my friend's announced we were headed here for dinner, but I was pleasantly surprised with how simple and delicious the food was.

Ordered the garlic butter noodles w/ 5 spice chicken and imperial rolls for $10. Everything was flavorful and cooked perfectly. Tender noodles, juicy chicken, and crisp eggrolls. The noodles have a ton of butter on 'em, but hey butter makes everything better right? And they didn't taste overly greasy. Sooo yummy!

Tried my friend's charbroiled beef and my immediate reaction was "I'd order that." Super flavorful and tender.  

Service was a bit lacking. Took them a while to bring out the check and they never asked me if I wanted a box to take my food home. Besides that though, I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Garlic noodles are amazing. Get the garlic noodles. 
Pho is a little expensive. I order the #2 raw beef pho. They used to use eye-round steak, which is lean, tasty and pretty inexpensive. The last two occasions I went in however, they had replaced the yummy eye-round steak with real cheap, fatty, chewed up looking meat. Really unhappy about it. I asked the staff about it and they said the owner wants to switch to this. So here I am, letting you know: Do not switch to this meat. I wouldn't feed this to my dogs. It tasted horrible and looked like a total afterthought. Yuck. For a 9 dollar bowl of pho this is the garbage they want to put it in it? No thanks. I'll go elsewhere.
author: Bam A.

description:
I'm not sure what the hype is for this place, but i ordered the most famoous "garlic noodles, 5 spice chiecken and egg rolls" and it wasn't the best i've ever had... i should say it was the worse.  

I know this is suppose to be on food ratings, but there was this asian guy who worked there and was "scolding" the customer's child...or at least it seemed that way. the family of 4 was waiting to be seated but instead left because of it....  just not the best way to bring in more customers, ehh?
author: Stephanie Y.

description: The garlic noodles are good, wish they were a bit more garlic-y.... 5 spiced chicken is good, nice and crispy.. just the way I like. Bbq beef is good, but pretty salty. I just think it's a bit overpriced for some noodles and meat.. I mean at $10, that can be a bit much for what you get. Location is better for me than going all the way to the Rich to get PPQ..
author: Tiff C.

description: Love coming here for their garlic noodles and BBQ shrimp! It's so yummy! Each time I come they always greet you and service is fast and efficient.
author: Lisa K.

description: The pho here is absolutely amazing. The employees were super friendly! I had the Vegetable Combo with Veggie Broth Pho and my boyfriend had a Vegetable Combo with Beef Broth Pho. We both loved them and the portion size was very generous. We also got a side of Garlic Noodles which was also very appetizing and not overpowering. Perfect for a cold night like tonight was. Will come back for their tasty food and awesome customer service! :)
author: Aiko C.

description:
This place is a sister restaurant of PPQ dungeoness Crab  on Clement. This is a regular vietnamese restaurant that has not has a vietnamese name to it. What is good there? garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken and their imperill rolls. 

Would come back if I'm ever around the area.
author: Nhung C.

description:
I had my order delivered and it was an all in all wonderful choice since I just could not contain my craving for good chicken bun (bun ga nuong). The five spice chicken bun was exactly how I imagined it to be. Flavorful, crispy, and citrusy dark meat chicken with the perfect proportion of lettuce, cucumber, and thin rice vermicelli. I am shocked to say that the proportion of chicken to noodle was perfect. As a hungry meat eater, I haven't found a place that satiates my meat-to-carb ratio quite like this place does. 

Since my online orders cannot be tamed, I also got the brisket pho, which also hit the spot. It was light and had a strong beef flavor. I can't stand when pho is oily or watery, and this one had the perfect consistency. 5 stars for the food and short wait time. 

-1 star for the canned Tasco when it had said fresh coconut juice..not the same at all. I will still order here again for the fast delivery and $2 delivery charge (no minimums)
author: Fiona Y.

description: Oh Perilla. The good old Vietnamese family-owned standby neighborhood restaurant. My husband and I frequent this place about once every two weeks, and we have always enjoyed the customer service, fresh hot food, and the ambiance of the place. It's a great place for kids and first dates as well. Lots of vegetarian options. Give it a try!
author: mary g.

description: Awesome, comfy place, friendly folks, delish food. Beef with garlic noodles, YUM. Pho is also gooood
author: Richard C.

description:
Stinky breath never smelled so good!  The garlic noodles here are to die for!  I just had to stop in after reading all the Yelps and staring at the delicious pics.  I got the 5 Spice Chicken & Imperial Rolls w/Garlic Noodles ($9.50) & he got the Charbroiled Beef & Imperial Rolls w/Garlic Noodles ($10.75).  Also, as a part of the Grand Opening we got a free Thai Iced Tea & Iced Coffee.  The Vietnamese Iced Coffee was strong (like it should be) but still drinkable & good according to my picky coffee taste buds.  Our noodles came with some green beans on the side.  The rolls were nice and crispy and the chicken was moist and crispy skinned.  And the noodles were of course yummy and garlicky and according to my bf, not greasy like the noodles he had at Thanh Long before.  And the portions were so big, we both were struggling to finish.

Service was attentive and friendly.  Decor is nice and not what you'd expect from your typical Vietnamese restaurant, though, I can't find no garlic noodles at any of the Vietnamese restaurants I go to in the peninsula.  Hurry up to get your free Thai Iced Tea or Vietnamese Iced Coffee with your meal; I heard an employee telling a customer that it's ending at the end of the month.
author: Cat C.

description:
Wow yum...

Thank you Anthony for introducing me to this place. We all ordered the Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles (#21 I believe, for $8.50 each).

The chicken was tender and tasty (ESPECIALLY with Sriracha sauce) and the noodles were excellent! They bathed in garlic flavor and the smell inhabits your mouth for a day.. but it's definitely worth it! 

I wish they had a place like this around Irvine or LA because it's such a good deal for a good amount of food!
author: Joyce M.

description: Five spice chicken with garlic noodle and imperial rolls is quite excellent. I like that you can have a variety of food on one plate. The garlic noodles are lightly buttered and pair well with the chicken and imperial rolls. The chicken is well seasoned. It's a pretty good price for a big portion of food. I usually can't finish it all and take some to-go.
author: Josephine L.

description: I love coming here. I go to both locations on mission and Irvine and the food is great! I always get one of the following: garlic noodles, bbq beef, imperial rocks, and fresh sprIng rolls. I am always satisfied with the food! The only qualm I have is the servers don't always keep the water glasses filled....
author: Jill P.

description: I've ordered food on the EAT24 app here 12 times in 3 months. They have my order ready in about 15-17 minutes every time! So fast and their food is amazing! Get the popular stuff. Five Star Chicken with garlic noodles and Rare beef Pho
author: Josep R.

description:
We wanted to go to Sandy's up the street but it was closed so we found this place:
*greasy (I had the infamous garlic noodles with pork and imperial rolls)
*not very tasty (my gf had the papaya salad and said it didn't taste fresh, more like it came out of a package of shredded papaya...)
*service was not very friendly (waitress seemed annoyed when I asked for lettuce and mint leaves to wrap my greasy imperial rolls...)
*prices are too high 
This is an example of a place where the food is not made with love and the customer feels like a dollar sign.
Will not be going back.
author: Monkey B.

description: Decided to give this place a try since a friend recommended to me. The place was small and somewhat crowded, I looked at Yelp to decide what to get. I tried the Garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. It was pretty good, I just thought the noodles were too oily for my taste.
author: Michelle L.

description: Perilla is one of the cleanest restaurants in the Sunset. The food is tasty and inexpensive. I ordered the five-spice chicken, garlic noodles, and imperial rolls meal. The garlic noodles and imperial rolls were great; not too oily. I was a little disappointed about the portion size of the chicken, but it ended up being just the right amount to get me full.  The service was great! My waitress was friendly and attentive. It's worth the trip if you're in the area.
author: Jo Anne L.

description: We tried to go to a few other pho places, but the lines were too long so we ended up here and happy we did! The food was excellent and enough to bring home for additional meals! Enjoyed this place mug more than PPQ or the other popular one across the street.
author: Anastasia J.

description:
If you've read my review of PPQ further down Irving, you would know I love the food there.  The only thing I could think of updating there would be a newer facility and adding garlic noodles on their menu.  Well guess what?  They did it at Perilla!

Owned by the same people as PPQ (and Toasties for that matter), Perilla offers almost the exact same menu as their sister location and at essentially the same prices.  The types of pho are pretty much the same (BEEF SATAY PHO!!!), and they also have the usual vermecelli and rice plates as well; the only thing I could see missing were the entrees.  However, certainly worth the trade-off to gain garlic noodle plates.

Essentially, just imagine a charbroiled meat rice plate (some with the same kick-ass imperial rolls) but take out the rice for noodles.  The best part though, is that the noodles aren't heavy on butter or oil,and they taste great!  It'd be one thing if it was offered just cause - in this case, it's actually good!

The servers are nice, friendly, and funny to boot.  We were there on Friday night for dinner at around 8:30, and was surprised to see that they actually close at 9:00 (kind of early, especially for the area).  However, stragglers were still coming in despite the posted hours, and the workers were happy to take them in ("Come in, don't be scared!  These people seem to like their food!").  And you know what?  The workers were right.
author: Mike L.

description:
Simple. Altho not necessary authentic to the tee... it does a good job on a rainy day. 

And its affordable! Good pho at a good price. 

Parking sucks tho.
author: Nathalie N.

description:
So happy we settled on this place while being indecisive about lunch options in Sunset. I got the item #7 on the menu, pho with brisket and rare beef for $7.50, a decent price for lunch in the city. My non-pho-savvy friends were astonished that the meat came out pink and uncooked and marveled at its transformation to a satisfying grey color as I stirred it in the steamy hot soup. They give more meat than other pho restaurants! The noodle portions are likewise generous and I might not have actually finished had I not been absolutely famished at this particular mealtime. My friends got the vegetarian pho and claimed that the broth was simply boiled water; however my soup was pleasantly savory so I would definitely stick to the meat noodle varieties if you're an omnivore. 

The front of the restaurant is decently clean. The walls are maroon and the furniture dark in color, which actually gives the place a pretty classy look overall. The bathroom is in the back where the kitchen is, so it's kind of grungy but excusable. I would come again.
author: Amy G.

description:
Garlic noodles were delish. Pho was good, but not the best I've had. 

I would say go for the dishes, not the pho. 

Portions are smaller and it's a little fancier than your average hole-in-the-wall Vietnamenes places. 

Came on a Sunday evening around 6ish and it was super chill and empty. Some street festival had been going on, so people were around but leaving.
author: Alison N.

description:
I tried the vegetarian dishes and they vegetarian garlic noodle is good. Vegetarian pho and the veg imperial rolls are ok - not bad but nothing to write home about. The vegetarian filling for the rolls is the same as the vegetarian side coming with the veg garlic noodles - cabbage, mushrooms, some cello noodles and spices but wrapped in lettuce and rice wrap - it is good but tastier when they come with the garlic noodles, those have a good flavor and, as already said here, not as greasy as they are in other places, quite god...
Service is very good, personnel is attentive and respectful.
author: VIORICA C.

description:
In case you were wondering, the free thai ice tea special is no longer available as part of the Grand Opening special. 

But, I am still a fan!  Seeing it as just another mediocre pho place, I didn't have high expectations but Perilla surprised me.  

I've tried the imperial rolls and garlic noodles with beef and I've also tried the pho on another occasion.  According to my Vietnamese friend who was with me, she says their pho is legit.  I thought the garlic noodles were really good and although a little bit heavy with the garlic butter oil, it was really delicious.   

For two people, it's prob about a standard $20 - $25 meal.  Good service, good food!  Try it out!
author: Gloria C.

description: Good for dining in, take out, and delivery. The ladies that work here are very sweet. Service is always fast and friendly. Our go to dishes are pho ga, 5 spice pho, and chicken salad.
author: Ken P.

description:
Garlic noodles are a must!

I got the imperial roll, five spice chicken and garlic noodle plate combo and it was bomb.  The garlic noodles were buttery and garlickly without being over powering.  Also, they had just the right chewyness to them.  The five spice chicken is the best, my brother has tried the other meats, and pretty much says the chicken is the best.  The skin of the chicken is crispy and flavorful and the chicken meat wasn't dry at all.  The imperial rolls were pretty good, crunchy on the outside and packed full on the clear noodles on the inside, along with the usual filling.  Overall, really yummy and quick friendly service.  I would definitely go back, and the serving was plenty. 

They have lunch specials as well.

If you are a fan of garlic noodles, I would definitely order a side of it to go for later consumption. hehe.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Every time I eat at Perilla I receive exceptional service. Everyone working here is so sweet and go out of their way to make your visit extraordinary. Plus the food is killer! Favorite restaurant in SF.
author: Jamie R.

description:
I like the five-spice chicken, I haven't seen it else where so far.
I've also decided garlic noodle is really not my thing.
author: majia m.

description:
This is for delivery.  They took 75 minutes to complete my order. At 60 minutes I contacted Eat24 to get an eta and they never said more than Hello to me even once my order arrived. 

The food was ok, it was luke warm and a bit congealed,  I tried to reheat in the microwave but it just wasn't that great. I ordered the recommended 5 Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles and Imperial Rolls. 

I'm not impressed, there are lots of other Vietnamese places to get instead.
author: Frankee C.

description:
You get a pretty good bang for your buck here.. My friends and I all got the garlic noodles alongside chicken and imperial rolls and and it was more than enough food to keep you full for a while.. I even enjoyed the two pieces of broccoli that they gave us.. I was gonna ask for more.. The broccoli was nice to kind of wash away the MSG feeling of the food haha.. 

MSG or not the food was mighty tasty and a lot for the price that it was.. I would definitely come here if I'm in town!

I love me some garlic noodles~
author: Danny P.

description:
