3-stars for the no fuss greetings (cause smiling is just a waste of our time), straight to the point order and eat your shrimp, beef and garlic noodles! The garlic noodles coulda used a bit more garlic, but the beef was very tender and the shrimp was seasoned well.

The 4th star goes to the reasonable prices ($25 for two meals, including tip) and fast service (lacking the greets, smiles & convo), but we were out in a little less than an hour so we didn't have to run out and pay the meter! I'm sure I'll be back for my quick, garlic noodle fix in the future...
author: S Y.

description:
I. Love. Vietnamese. Food.

Vermicelli Noodles with Five Spice Chicken and Imperial Rolls ($8.50) - Delicious! My friend had the Garlic Noodles version and she really enjoyed them. Noodles aren't your thing? They also have version with rice! Basically any meat/imperial roll combination is available with either Garlic Noodles, Vermicelli, or Rice. 

The restaurant itself is cute enough. Nothing special, but has more "atmosphere" than a really hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese place. You also pay for that with a slightly higher price tag, though $8.50 is by no means too much for what you get.

I'll be back some time when I'm in the Inner Sunset.
author: Talia G.

description: Good friendly service and food. The garlic noodle with five spice chicken was delicious although I would have preferred a larger dose of garlic in my noodles. But overall a great dining experience and good place for kids.
author: John R.

description: So... I had the imperial roll with garlic noodle and beef. Something that LA doesn't have, supposedly. Noodle was okay and the beef was a bit too thick. It felt like it took forever just to chew. But props goes out to the imperial rolls. It was pretty legit. I want to give 4 stars, but beef (pretty well marinated though) was too chewy :/
author: Wendy V.

description: Perilla is the go-to delivery spot when it's Monday after a weekend bender at Coachella or the like, and you need some consoling. The imperial rolls and five-spice chicken are both absolutely delicious. The garlic noodles sometimes seem a bit plain to me, and I've never finished them in one sitting. But there's something mysterious about these noodles... because I consistently find myself tearing through them with a ravenous hunger every morning that they sit in my fridge. This delicious mystery makes these noodles worth it.
author: Jake D.

description: Love how crunchy and flavorful the five spices chicken is. The garlic noodles are divine. And the imperial roles were even better than they looked. Service was quick and polite. And one portion was just right for surprisingly two people.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Love this place for great takeout pho and for their tasty imperial rolls.  Really delicious vietnamese staples, friendly service, casual and easy.  Perfect for a sunday night.
author: Abigail H.

description:
Went here one day when yummy yummy ran out of food.  Imagine that!   I'm still a little dumbfounded by the fact that I waited 10-15 minutes for a table just to eat horribly bland pho in San Francisco no less. 

 I asked for fish sauce and then all the tables around me started asking the server to pass that sh*t along and weren't gonna allow me to commandeer the lone bottle.  This scenario sums up my experience here.  Dissatisfaction, desperation, and disappointment.
author: Amber R.

description: Came here a few times and it never disappoints! Always order the five spice garlic noodles+spring rolls or the beef garlic noodles+spring rolls! It always comes out looking great and the same and the garlic noodles is just the right amount of garlic taste. I love how everything is always so favorable and it never disappoints! Happy happy customer!
author: Kaman C.

description:
Great, excellent service with a smile! It's so refreshing to be there. I absolutely loved the server.
The meat however didn't smell or taste fresh. I will not return due to the meat however the staff is awesome. I would recommend the place for vegetarian dishes and drinks!
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
After failing to get a table at Manna and San Tang we found ourselves a Vietnamese restaurant across the road from Manna on Irving. From the outside it doesn't look great and judging by the choice of condiments and chopsticks on the table one would assume that they were Chinese rather than Vietnamese or at most Chinese Viets. Anyway going in we were met with a very friendly waiter who actually gave us top notch service throughout our stay. The menu is simple and easy to navigate with nothing too complicated. My advise is the Pho. Anything else is not compulsory. The broth is sweet and quite light, not heavy and thick like some places; It has been filtered quite a bit it seems. Second is the choice of topping. I ordered the Perilla Beef Combo Pho which includes meat balls, beef brisket and rare beef. The meat balls are lovely, and have a great texture to them: what you really look for in a properly made meat ball - not process and filled with fillers. The brisket was passable in my opinion and didn't really stand out. However the rare beef was as it should be - rare. On my occasion the beef was sweet and juicy with a strong beefy flavour. 
Even the two above mentioned ingredients didn't really shout justice until I munched into a mouthful of the noodles. The noodles, cooked to a perfect state were almost chewy to effect, not soft and sloppy. They had a definite counter-action when I bit down on it- the perfect texture (again in my opinion). Oftentimes we're let down by over cooked noodles that have been soaking in a pot for hours. Not here!

The other thing to mention is their five spices chicken. It's grilled, tastes great, smells even better and looks the real deal. Most importantly for me is that they use thigh meat (dark) rather than dry breast meat (white). I feel that they have put good attention to many of their dishes and thus have differentiated themselves from the average money busting rip off Vietnamese Pho joint. Too add to the food - the service was 10/10. Couldn't have asked for a better server. He was keen, had an eye for detail and explained the dishes well. (Well done you!). The total bill came to $31 for three of us which is very decent indeed especially when it's both yummy and filling. We couldn't finish it all so had to get a take out box. That's what you call bargain. 

Would I go there again? Hell yea! Go with friends and family, partners, bros, girls the lot. My only true tip: don't be afraid of the funny placement of their customer toilet. You have to cut through part of their kitchen first. But it's maintained well. Enjoy!
author: C G S.

description:
This place was pleasant and had great food. I decided to eat here after an interview close by (sadly, I didn't get the job). I came during an odd time, so there was just one other table in there. I sat in the front corner so I could look out the window and ordered the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles as was suggested. 

It was amazing! I would totally eat some of that right now. Even though it wasn't necessary, there was a side of nuoc mam which I loved since I love sauce with everything. I never had chicken like that, but it was delicious. The noodles were perfect, too. 

Not much else to say. I had a short conversation with a guy that worked there, and it was nice to end my visit with before my trek back home.
author: Nga C.

description:
WHOA WHOA WHOA NOW. 
WHOA WHOA WHOA. 
WHOA.

Some men and the resident ho (me) were standing in line at San Tung. Super popular- full of people- crammed with tables and food-San Tung.

I was restless and annoyed, and decided to wander around and break the chains of domesticity. And beeteedub, as a public health advocate, don't just stand around looking at your cellphone entranced by the glow, walk around, get some ejercisio! 

Only a block away from San Tung, I found Perilla. It had a menu posted against the glass exterior reading, and I quote, "GARLIC NOODLES. $4.95" The rest was history. I got the men to follow and we were seated immediately. A bunch of us got the garlic noodles plus 5-spice chicken or bbq pork. The pork was dry, but the chicken was yummers. The garlic noodles were super garlic-y, but not thee best (the best is at The Ark in Alameda, no joke). 

This branch, for there are like 6 Perillas across the Bay, has an awesome funny ol' man who manages it. He was talking to us and laughing lots. I like you, Mr. Old Funny Man.

Bee-tee-dub: 
$7.95-8.95 for most dishes.
author: Sarah W.

description: I would never order from here again purely because of the terrible customer service. After placing my order through Seamless for delivery, I waited almost an hour to get my meal (which was pho and spring rolls). I had to call to see where the food was (it hadn't even left the restaurant yet) and when I expressed my frustration, the lady that picked up the phone said, "What do you want to do about the situation?" She ended up saying she could give us 10-15% off of our next order, but I wanted a discount on the order I had purchased, so I called Seamless. They said they would call the restaurant and handle the discount...the receipt came back with a 10% discount. That amounted to a whopping $3 discount for terrible service and mediocre food. This restaurant apparently had no interest in keeping me as a customer...they should have comped the meal.
author: Rachel F.

description:
I haven't been here for years so I decided to try it out again. The reason why is because I usually at other Vietnamese restaurants around the neighborhood. I wanted something quick, close by and convenient.

I had the pho noodles with the rare beef and beef balls. It was not too bad. The soup was not salty nor did it leave your mouth begging for water as some broths do. 

Also ordered the imperial rolls. Pretty typical taro filling inside. Not too greasy. To drink, I ordered the iced coffee. Pretty good and strong. Just how I enjoy my Vietnamese coffee.

Service was good. I was there when they opened around 11 a.m. Cucumber infused water. Sat down, gave water without asking and food came out within 10 to 15 minutes. 

Overall it was alright. Like I said, it's convenient if you live around the neighborhood and don't want to travel too far for hot bowl of pho during those cold S.F. days.
author: Jerold C.

description:
Came here tonight for dinner and wasn't sure why I bookmarked it in the first place..maybe from watching check please on tv or something.  Anyways,  I love garlic noodles and it was a nice surprise to have a restaurant that had it is a main dish instead of a side order like other restaurants.   I ordered the garlic noodles with shrimp and imperial rolls and pho ga (chicken) - split both with a friend.   

The pho ga came out first and the noodles were tender, but the chicken was a little tough or chewy.  I prefer all white meat chicken tho.  This one had bones and skin in it.

The garlic noodles came out next and it was yummy.  The chair boiled shrimp was very yummy..I think they marinated it or something.  The price was decent..not super cheap or expensive here.

Overall, the place was delicious.  The service attentive as they filled our water regularly.
author: James L.

description: Came here for the first time yesterday with my friends for lunch. Ive got to say! My first impression of this place was really good. I went on yelp to see wat this pplace was famous for and what other people recommended, I ended up seeing a lot of tips about garlic noodles and five spices chicken. so I decided to order number 21 Five Spices Chicken with Garlic Noodles! . ive gotta say! the food looked so delicious it was not burnt at all unlike other places, not only that but it tasted super duper good. Ive eaten five spices chickens before from lots of other thai restaurants and ive eat garlic noodles from other places before. But this is probably the best Garlic noodles and five spices chicken i have eaten so far ! Should definitely try the garlic noodles and five spices chicken! going to come back here to eat again!
author: N S.

description:
I came here with a party of 3 on a Friday night at around 7:30 and got seated right away. The employees were very attentive, they took our orders promptly and also refilled our waters on multiple occasions without us asking them to. We ordered the garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles with pork. Both dishes were very yummy. I personally liked the 5 spice chicken the most, the meat was tender and the flavor was just right. The food was more on the oily side  and I didn't think that the garlic noodles were as good or as flavorful as I expected them to be.

Overall, I had a good experience here. The price was decent for the amount of food that you get and I thought they provided good service.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
Garlic noooooodles. :)

Let me start by saying that I seldom go here for dinner because parking is so damn difficult around this area during dindin time! Go for lunch.. yes you have to feed your meter, but you're almost always guaranteed parking. Also, Perilla isn't too crowded around lunch time. There's always an old funny man that recognizes mother dearest and I by face. He always cracks these random jokes that make me giggle a little.. 

Definitely get the five spice chicken, the shrimp plate, the imperial rolls, the thai iced tea, the pho.. heck! Get everything on the menu, why don't ya? Everything is good especially their garlic noodles! Oomph, perfectly seasoned, nice amount of butter ah I am salivating just thinking about it! Get a to go order of the garlic noodles and take them home to eat for dinner! Prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get. Should I mention that the water tastes like cucumbers? 

The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is cause their backroom (where they cut the meat and stuff) is kinda grimy. I saw buckets of meat lying on the floor while I was on my way to the restroom. Also, the cooks don't use gloves to cut their food.. ick! I'll let it go because the food is delicious!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Date/Time: Sunday ~ 7:00pm
Occasion: Hungry after a day visiting the museum  
Party of:  1
Ordered: Imperial Rolls and Charbroiled Pork Garlic Noodle (Mi Toi Cha Gio Thit Nuong) [see pic]
Accessibility: The place was w/c friendly.
Total: $12.31

If you like garlic noodles, than you must try this place. The garlic noodles was cooked to perfection; seasoned with the right about of butter & garlic. The charbroiled pork was seasoned well and had nice grilled marks.

I will definitely come here again and try the other garlic noodles dishes.
author: Anh N.

description:
I think this is one of those instances when the hype overcame the actual dish. Sadly to say, that was my experience with the Five Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles at Perilla.

The only good thing of my meal:
- Five Spice Chicken: The skin was crisp and the meat was juicy and so flavorful. Only negative is that it was also super greasy, but all things tasty usually are :(

Not so good things:
- Garlic noodles: I had high hopes, but this was just oily and lacking in concentrated garlic flavor. The noodles were mushy and dry, but the garlic-infused oil did nothing to add to it. Blah all around.
- Rare beef pho: So I guess I could have figured out that this "fusion" Vietnamese place wouldn't have the most authentic pho, but I didn't think it was worth the $8 at all.
- Spring rolls: These are advertised as having six pieces but they're really just 3 finger-sized rolls cut into 2 pieces. Not so tasty either.
- Parking: I guess this is a given in San Francisco. We actually only went to Perilla because we had wanted to try Sunflower Vietnamese in the Mission and could not find parking AT ALL. Still, we had to circle around block after block for this place, and considering how underwhelming most of the food was, definitely not worth it!
author: Shira C.

description:
It might be a little bit exaggerated to give Perilla 5 stars, but just hear me out as I give my reasons why. 

1. Usually when you find restaurants serving garlic noodles, they are surprisngly overpriced. I do not understand why because garlic noodles are so simple to make! So going to Perilla was like discovering a hidden gem because their dishes are cheap and delicious! 

2. The 5 Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles (#21) is a MUST for first timers! Their chicken seriously is bomb. It does have enough spice to it to add all the flavors needed to make this dish tasty. Their chicken also reminds me of King of Thai for those of you who have tried the Fried Rice with Fried Chicken. The noodles are pretty firm and just so good! It has just enough garlic in it and it isn't as buttery as some garlic noodle places. 

3. The portion size is incomparable to the price. $7.50 for tons of food?! I'm there! 

3 reasons are enough for you to just come here and check this place out. I love how it is Vietnamese as well. It isn't your typical Vietnamese place. I mean yeah they have pho and other noodle dishes, but just having their signature garlic noodles here, already makes this place stand out for me. 

I HAVE to come back here and show my parents andddd try their 5 Spice Chicken Pho.
author: Katrina T.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. The service is awesome every single time. I always get the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. The chicken is crispy and savory. The garlic noodles are delicious and not too overwhelming. Portions are generous too!
author: Vivian L.

description:
4 starts for the GARLIC NOODLES!!

It's basically what everyone comes here for. 

My favorite combination is the Five Spice Chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodle. It is a bit on the greasy and oily side but that's basically what most Asian dishes are like. Its really good but sometimes the noodle may be a little burnt which I get disappointed but so far it had only happened once. 

The Beef with imperial roll and garlic noodle is delicious too. It's my sister's favorite and I love it the beef is so juicy, it's not dry. The imperial rolls are a great snack on the side. They are crunchy and bite size so it compliments the dish perfectly. It also comes with 2 pieces of broccoli so you do have veggies on the plate and won't feel as guilty. You will most definitely be a stuffed and happy camper after you are done with the meal. 

I've accidently ordered these combinations but with vermicelli noodles instead and I didn't like it at all. It comes with the really bitter leaves and I'm not a fan of that. Aside from that it's just that they do go as well with the combination as it does with the chewy, thick, and warm garlic egg noodles.  

I always come back for more or bring new friends to try it. Sometimes we just crave it, it's kind of like crack for us. Before when I worked in sunset I would always go there and order take out because it's just right in the neighborhood even if I was like 15 blocks away. (No big Deal) But parking is horrible so I would recommend calling in if you plan to get take out.
author: Lisa S.

description:
This is one of my go to places since I've moved to the Sunset area.  Really reliable food and good service.  The pho is a bit more expensive than usual but you can tell the meat is higher quality.  

Honestly though, people don't come here for the pho- they're here for the garlic noodles!  I highly recommend the 5 Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles.  It comes with fish sauce but I actually eat it without.  I think the dish is flavorful enough.  Chicken is always crispy and moist.  And the garlic noodles is a bed of buttery and garlic goodness that will force you to brush your teeth - twice!  Their garlic noodle is my first choice for when I need to carb up before a race.  I actually only live about 7 blocks away but during those cold windy SF nights I get delivery haha!  Delivery usually takes about an hour and the food still maintains its quality.  

Speaking of which, my friend from NY came to visit me and fell in love with their garlic noodles.  So when I visited her in NY back in May, I got an order of their chicken + garlic noodle to go.  I saran wrapped the heck out of the container.  And put it in bags upon bags upon bags, then bravely put it in my luggage (Side note: NO LEAKS! NO GARLIC SMELL IN MY CLOTHES! WOOT WOOT!)  7 hours later my best friend was happily enjoying her freshly delivered noodles from SF.  I'm such a good friend :)

Random fact: Same owner as PPQ Dungeness Island in the Richmond and Thanh Long in Outer Sunset.  

BTW PARKING SUCKS bc of all the San Tung people!
author: Tammy N.

description: The five spice chicken with garlic noodles is an amazing flavor combo. It worked well as a soup too.
author: Manu V.

description:
Brought to you by the same people who owns Crawstation, Toasties, Dungeness and more notably, PPQ. What is not to love about Perilla? Essentianlly Perilla's menu is composed by all the famed goodies of this Vietnamese franchise!

PPQ's famous five spice chicken? Check!
Dungeness' delicious garlic noodles? Check!
Curry chicken pho that's found only at PPQ? Check!
Crispy Imperial Rolls? Check!
And of course, there's definitely a whole lot of pho to choose from!

While I am not a fan of the curry chicken pho, I've been told it is to die for. Miss Eva W. and Denise W. both crave the coconutty broth and when I recommended it to Mr. W's sister in law, she loved it too! I, on the other hand, love love LOVED the buttery garlic noodles paired with the yummy five spice chicken and imperial rolls. YUM!

Will I be back? Most definitely!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Got here after 12pm on a Friday and decided to order the Garlic Noodles and Five Spice Chicken to go.  The order was $8.63 and although I was told beforehand from someone I knew who was Vietnamese that Garlic Noodles aren't even Vietnamese at all, I still liked what I ordered and ended up eating the entire thing; I was quite hungry at that time, but otherwise, I would have just ate half and saved the rest for later - it's a pretty good amount that they give you for this, so you will get your money's worth!  

It took about 7min to receive my order and while I was waiting, two employees asked if I wanted some water while waiting, which I thought was nice of them to ask.  I found the chicken to be flavored well and it came with a sauce which made it taste even better; the garlic noodles were good too - the order also came with some pickled cabbage and veggies on the bottom.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
A tad disappointed, I really wanted to be in love with this spot. Minus two stars because of the service. It was incredibly slow, and there was a young waiter who was literally sprinting through the restaurant to help tables. It was super distracting and not safe at all. It was hard to use a metal fork and enjoy my noodles while someone was sprinting back and forth every 30 seconds very close to you. 

I didn't subtract a star for this but I looked up menu prices prior to coming to this restaurant and when I got to the restaurant I realized the prices were all 1-2 dollars more for each item.

I ordered the curry chicken with garlic noodles, the mister ordered the chicken pho (the basic chicken pho, not the five spice chicken). We also ordered a plate of imperial rolls to share.

Overall the food was delicious, the mister did mention that his pho noodles were a bit chewier than he was used to, but he was quite satisfied with the broth and the texture of the chicken. My curry chicken was delicious, not dry at all, and tons of chicken! Great flavor in the chicken and the garlic noodles, my only gripe was that there wasn't a lot of potato pieces and the pieces that were there were very mushy.

The imperial rolls were hot and crunchy as well, overall it was great and I will be back soon. The service was just very terrible and unsafe for customers and the staff. I hope the next time I'm back it's different.
author: Mindy T.

description: Great food (five-spice chicken); fast, pleasant, and attentive service.
author: Inigo M.

description: This is my go to place for quick, simple, tasty, and overall reliable Vietnamese food in the neighborhood. Yes, there's the more lauded Vietnamese restaurant down the street. BUT this place has garlic noodles - golden strands of buttery, garlicky goodness. So yummy! The pho and rice vermicelli bowls (with pork and spring rolls of course) are also delish.
author: Mark D.

description:
When you want really good pho and you're too lazy or too busy to dine out, Perilla is my new take-out friend. Their prices are gentle and the service, speedy.

Their new delivery guy is totally crush-worthy and he said my little boy, who greeted him in Mandarin, was really cute (after I'd tipped him so it was a genuine compliment). 

Awww..
author: Jennifer O.

description: I came here for lunch and ordered the five spice chicken banh mi. It was a hefty sandwich, but it was just ok. The chicken was too fatty, and the vegetables weren't evenly dispersed. The service was adequate.
author: Rachel H.

description: Fancy? No. Tasty and cheap? YES. The super tasty vegetarian rolls and garlic noodles make an excellent, filling meal. One complaint is that they're only open until 9.
author: Rachel M.

description:
DO NOT CATER FROM THEM! THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF! I'm never coming back here again, whether it is for catering or for dine-in. I will make sure to spread the word about this!

I usually don't write reviews unless I have to and Perilla deserves LESS THAN ONE STAR!!! I'm a UCSF student involved in several organizations on campus and we put on BIG events for the student body, so we usually need to order lots of food to feed hundreds of people. Thus, we're expecting the restaurants we buy from to exhibit great service because that will ensure future referrals and continued support from us.

Within the past two weeks, there were 2 major events on campus, and both ordered from Perilla. One with an order of $800+ and the other $1500+. With this huge amount of money and our loyalty to the restaurant, we expected their customer service and food portions to be fair and generous. That was NOT the case at all! I was so upset when the food arrived--in a 9x13 inch aluminum pan was ONE layer of chicken and that cost $33! That was an EXTREME RIP OFF! ONE LAYER OF CHICKEN DOES NOT COST $33!!! I was enraged and so were my colleagues. We needed to feed 200+ people with the $1500 at our event, and it was barely enough. One of my colleagues called the restaurant to try and seek resolution from them about their small portions, but they RUDELY HUNG UP on her while she was still talking. 

With $1500, we ordered a total 47 different trays that comprised of chicken, pork, garlic noodles, imperial rolls, veggie rolls, seasoned veggies, and rice. When we opened each one of the trays, you can visibly see that they tried to skimp on the portions by filling it up with LESS THAN HALF of what was expected. Also, for a "Vietnamese" restaurant, none of the staff can speak the language...what a shame!

I'm never coming back here to cater/dine-in from them again and I will make sure that the board members of next year's organizations will NOT do business with Perilla again.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Nothing spectacular here...

Sub-par vermecelli and pho. Decent-ish service as well. 

I can recommend the Imperial Rolls, but you can get those anywhere really....

Keep moving on, because there is nothing to stop for here :-/
author: Lauren F.

description:
GARLIC NOODLES! Buttery goodness in this dish. The noodles along with their five spice chicken...yum! I would recommend a dish that comes with their garlic noodles. 

Parking of course is horrendous in this area. Take the bus or prepared to drive around for a bit and walk.
author: Chris K.

description: Super good deal for the price and extremely tasty. Got garlic noodles with beef and imperial egg rolls. I was stuffed. The garlic noodles are really garlicy but that's why I like them. Egg rolls are tasty but not overbearing or too deeply fried. Lastly, there was a good amount of bbq beef, not so much so that I felt overwhelmed but enough where it complimented the dish well.
author: Eric F.

description: I get delivery from here all the time. Good food, good prices, reliable, and consistent.
author: Anil C.

description:
The garlic noodles really are the bomb!!  You can never go wrong when ordering that.  I usually get an order of garlic noodles on the side to-go for work during lunch and I get full from it already.  I don't know how they make it but I'm addicted to it.  You'll know what I mean when you take that first bite lol. I've ordered garlic noodles here at least 10 times and it's always super yummy.

Will I order it again? Of course. Definitely. Yes yes. Si. You know it. Yep. Well..you get the point haha
author: Diana H.

description:
Oh wow! I am a huge fan of this place.  The one in SOMA is good, and this one is equally good, maybe even better!  I like their menu at this location because there is more selection.  I got the five spice chicken with garlic noodles.  The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  The garlic noodles were excellent as usual.  

The only thing I did not like at this location is that they put cucumbers in the ice water they serve you.  For some reason, my water tastes oily.  Maybe I am just trippin' out.  Oh well. Can't win them all.  

Until next time, Perilla.
author: Victor L.

description:
I love the garlic noodle! Actually thats the only think I every tried from this place. Prices are very reasonable compared to other places with  that serves garlic at this quality. Portions are also fair. I usually eat about 3/4 of just the noodle in 1 sitting and the rest I save for a snack or lunch the next day. 

This place keeps me coming back for more!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I usually get vietnamese food in Lil Saigon (aka T'loin), but happened to be around the inner sunset neighborhood, when I was craving pho.  Not to mention that it was freezing with crazy winds blowing.  Anyways, ordered the #1 Perilla Beef Combo Pho, and it satisfied my appetite.  Also ordered the imperial rolls (mmm tasty).  

Overall, not a bad place to get your pho fix, and if you don't want to venture all the way to the "tender"loin.
author: Joshua P.

description: Their garlic noodles and food is good. It's a little bit pricy from the amount of food
author: Jasmin T.

description: so, the roomies and I decided to give then 1 last chance. BIG MISTAKE. we ordered over an hour and a half ago. guess what? we're STILL waiting. eff you for your BAD ass customer service.
author: Ann T.

description: This is the kind of place where the price of the food is so worth it since its pretty cheap! having just the basic beef pho, the soup was pretty good. My friend at the vegetarian pho and she absolutely loved it. I recommend anyone to go and eat here for cheap pho. As for delivery, I've heard the noodles aren't as great and their delivery system is a bit slow. So if you have t time eat here but for delivery, i'd look somewhere else.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Good portion, good food for good price ! I got the five spice chicken with the garlic noodles. The first time I had this, I got it to-go and the noodles were quite greasy but the second time I sat in and it was delicious. Service was great and who doesn't like cucumber water ? Not a place for healthy food, since they dont have much veggies on the side with the plate. But if you're looking for something filling, this is the place to go.
author: Hae Rim H.

description:
We got take out from this place for a lazy weekday dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the food. We had the 5 spice chicken garlic noodles, the fresh spring rolls, and the papaya salad with beef.

The food was greasy but great with tons of flavor and decent sauces for the garlic noodles and papaya salad. The salad was refreshing and beef that came with the salad was an interesting dry beef that complemented it well. The noodles were yummy and well spiced. The spring rolls were fairly boring without much taste to the rolls themselves although the dipping sauce that came with it was good. 

Overall, really enjoyable food for kind-of greasy takeout. We generally use 2 stars as our average restaurant and so would give this place a 3.5 (rounded up to four just for the surprising great flavors). We will definitely come here again!
author: Amy D.

description:
Holy shnikeys, is this place legit!

You're getting some really good food, bigger portion for what you're paying and the cost is so wallet friendly!

Everytime I'm here, the staff is super friendly and welcoming and attentive!
author: John M.

description:
Not cheap good veggie roll, 30 bucks

This place is not cheap. I would expect a pho place to be less expensive, is that too much to ask? The veggie roll is perfect, salad within and chewie spring roll skin outside, with some sauteed flavorful greasy appetizing meat outside (that's the sauce)! That is the crowning jewel. But the noodles and beef were disappointing, the beef though almost raw wasn't tender at all! The noodles are not very fresh either. Maybe we can blame it on the soup/broth not being hot enough? 

I waited for 20 minutes plus for my Vietnamese coffee to arrive. Where's the dipper I expected to see? How about the experience that I mix my own condensed milk. No, the coffee came ready made, and taste marginally acceptable, not the strong sweet and intense coffee I was expecting.

Two noodles, one appetizer and coffee 30 bucks. Okay may be it isn't too expensive, since we ordered appetizer and coffee, but I didn't expect to spend 30 bucks + tips on a pho restaurant for just two people and the food... meh
author: Dilys S.

description:
Food: The food is great,  especially the garlic noodles!! Its not too oily, I would say just right. 

Service: The service is fantastic, My First time there the server balanced our coke! Always accommodating when it gets closer to closing time. 

Parking: Difficult so just be patient
author: John B.

description:
My first time here, and my experience was alright. If you need to use the restroom, it's way in the back, through their kitchen.

I was with a bunch of people that day, and there were only a few customers. We all ordered different types of garlic noodle. I ordered the beef garlic noodle. One person ordered a Thai Tea, and soon, a few of us followed after and it seemed that our waiter was annoyed. We got our drinks, and one, who had came late, ordered one as well, and that's when she gave us an attitude asking if any one else wants one and angrily walks away.

Our food finally arrives, and it looked interesting; think of alfredo pasta. The beef was definitely good and flavorful. The same goes to the garlic noodles. It also came with a, I wouldn't say fish sauce, but a sauce to dip your food in. The Thai tea was actually pretty sweet. Not sure whether they used condensed milk, or just regular half and half.

Overall, I'd definitely go back and recommend it to others.
author: Sylvia b.

description:
Not enough love for Perilla.

I may be biased.  For most of my life, I've associated garlic noodles with more expensive food/special occasions. I usually think of those crab houses that serve garlic noodles where you can expect to pay $50/person easily.  Maybe I haven't been around enough, or maybe Perilla really is innovative, but having garlic noodles instead of rice in Vietnamese dishes blew my mind! I'd gladly pay $14+ a dish for this, but to only see $9 was amazing.

The garlic noodles are delicious and cheap.  I've tried the five spice chicken (great albeit a bit fatty), beef (solid, esp if you like lemongrass), curry chicken (delicious and adds another flavor layer to the garlic noodles)..... (I'm craving the garlic noodles so badly now -__-). The imperial rolls are really good here too.  The owner is very cheery and does his little trick with the soda which is always fun.

The parking can suck here, but the wait usually isn't bad, its relatively clean, and they usually have the big games on TV.  Perilla is a great place to go for a quick and cheap meal without it feeling like a quick and cheap meal (if that makes sense).
author: Eric J.

description:
Lying in bed with an injured foot, I knew there was no way I was going to be able to hobble towards some of my beloved eateries and get some much needed sustenance.

I scanned my delivery options and having tried Perilla's Mission street location a number of times, decided that some shrimp vermicelli noodles from the Irving store were in order.

Perilla has a twenty dollar delivery minimum - and they're very strict about it. I ended up having to order some garlic vegetable noodles and some veggie rolls in addition to the vermicelli. 

After about over a little over an hour - the food finally arrived.

The garlic noodles were wonderful. Buttery garlic goodness wrapped around my fork in huge mouthfuls. Their vermicelli noodles were satisfying and fresh tasting. Their vegetable rolls were disappointing though. I expected garden tasting crunchy vegetables in each cold roll, but instead found myself biting into greasy tasteless vegetable bundles. 

I am glad that I have a new delivery option besides pizza and Chinese food, but I can't see myself forking over 20 dollars again for delivery. While I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy hearty goodness of those garlic noodles, I can still taste those lacking veggie rolls, which cost the equivalent of a divine Good Earth burrito.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Food was delicious! My friends and I had dinner here and I was very pleased! We got 4 items to share. Shrimp spring rolls, papaya salad with beef, vermicelli with beef and garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken. Sooo satisfying! But what really made the experience very enjoyable was the service. We were greeted, seated and all the servers were friendly, cheerful and always smiling. Very attentive and extremely helpful! To me, I take service very personally, the food could be okay but if the service is stellar then they win huge points. Fortunately for this place the food was satisfying too. I will be back and continue to support this pleasant simple joint. 5 Stars!!
author: Maggy G.

description: Went here at least more then 2 times already, and I never get tired of their garlic noodles!!! Its so delicious and tasty! The service at this place is so nice and cool. I would recommend everyone who has not been here yet to get their garlic noodles!! Im sure you wont regret it, the best garlic noodles I ever ate!!
author: Christopher G.

description:
While kicking it the other day in this terrific little hood, we got hungry (go figure) and decided on this little place.

Parked Bessie out front and popped in for some Vietnamese fare.

We walked out of there with a full belly and absolutely delighted.

I had their Bun (cold vermicelli noodles) with barbecued pork and Imperial rolls.  P.I.C. had....shit, I forgot what she had but she did like it.  That much I remember.

We split a Vietnamese coffee and enjoyedthe cool and funny vibe coming from our waiter.

We now have another favorite place for vittles in the inner set.
author: Anthony D.

description:
My husband and I found this place when we were checking out our new apartment in the neighborhood and we've gone back several times because it's good food and pleasant service.

I got a veggie pho with beef broth the first time and it was good, though perhaps not the best pho I've ever had--still good though. However, the garlic noodles with beef were amazing. Really, really delicious. I had the combination of the garlic noodles with beef and imperial rolls, and really enjoyed it. Yes, the imperial rolls are on the oily side; they are fried. I enjoyed them. The beef was perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked and the garlic noodles were delicious. I would definitely order that again.
author: Jennie S.

description: Best garlic noodles in the city. I've tried a lot of places and they really make it the best. No one can ever get it right like they can. Service isn't that bad either considering it's owned I think by Chinese. I'm a fan!
author: ABC Z.

description:
Discovered this place over the weekend and decided to try it out. The bf's garlic noodles were pretty yummy, except I don't know how the five spice chicken goes with it. Nonetheless, it was still good. I ordered the curry chicken with rice and it was good. Just good. You see, I was JUST (not that I knew it at the time) starting my flu-cycle and it might have inhibited my senses a little, but all I had an appetite for was the curry sauce and my rice. I just kept going at it. I don't feel like I really tasted the chicken. 
So later on, I decided to steal some of the bf's garlic noodles and dump them in the curry, and THAT was delicious! Hah, the cravings of a soon-to-be-bffs-with-tissue-and-bed-girl.
 Whatever. I'll come back and have the garlic noodles again!
BTW, the servers who work there were pretty attentive. There were about 4 tables total but the guys kept coming around and filling our waters. I swear I've had my water filled up just a little more each time 3 times before I even drank out of it. NOT that I'm complaining........
author: Athena L.

description:
Ate here for dinner tonight and I am confirmed that this is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on Irving. The owners of Perilla also own PPQ, (another pho place on 19th & Irving), but I'd go to Perilla over PPQ anytime...mostly due to the delicious garlic noodles here. If the way to my heart is through my stomach...Perilla's got mine! 

If you haven't guessed already, my favorite thing here is the garlic noodles! Specifically, the chicken curry with garlic noodles. They are just so sublime.  So garlicy and buttery...mmMMm. And when combined with creamy yellow curry and chunks of tender chicken, it's beyond words. 

While it doesn't come with garlic noodles, the chicken curry pho is pretty amazing too. It's rich, creamy and super tasty. I happen to LOVE all things curry and this was no exception. Gotta try at least one of these dishes if you come here. Or better yet? Try both! 

As for service, it is great! Fast, friendly, and very attentive. The food portions are also large and the prices are low (under $10). The restaurant itself is cozy, well lit, and quite spacious. My only complaint about this place is the bathroom. It has been consistently stinky and dirty, so best to wait until you get home to do your business! Besides that, this place is a perfect 5 stars for me :)
author: Natasha H.

description:
3.5 stars

I ate dinner here with a friend.  It was a short 5 minute wait for a table at 7pm on a Saturday night. 

I ate the 5 Spice Chicken Pho and a side of garlic noodles.  Both dishes were tasty.  The pho tasted comparable to PPQs which is good.  

The service was fine, not very friendly, but ok.
author: Christy L.

description:
You know those kinds of days when you're feening for something warm to warm your belly, you want to stay local but you don't want to spend a whole lot for lunch?  Ok, and even the occasional need for the perfect hangover food.  Perilla is the place to go if you're in the Inner Sunset!

The signage is very discreet but the food screams DELICIOUS!  I always always always order the five spice chicken with either Pho soup or garlic noodles.  It really hits the spot, EVERY TIME.

The portions are just enough but if you're a hefty eater, it might come short of what you want/expect of a Vietnamese restaurant.  The service is no fuss and very quick.  Exactly what you want when you just want to eat.
author: Sandy L.

description:
I can dig the garlic noodles and imperial rolls but i wasn't super sold on the five spice chicken.

We also got their raw beef appetizer which was good at first but due to the very generous portion got sort of overwhelming as it went on.
author: Misha T.

description:
Basically the same menu items as PPQ on 19th without the lines. The only difference is the addition of garlic noodles to their dishes. 

Since they've opened, the entire block turned a new leaf, producing a plethora of dining options (korean, pizza, chinese bakery). 

Perilla, like their other locations, have quick (sometimes snooty) service, that accompanies consistent food. Perhaps not the gold standard of pho in the City, that belongs to Turtle Tower, but an always solid meal nonetheless. 

Tip: Order anything with the 5-spiced Chicken and you'll be fine.
author: Dennis L.

description:
Boyfriend and I came here tonight to see what the commotion was all about with these garlic noodles. We sat ourselves right next to the TV...OKC was playing.

Menus were already out on the table. We skimmed through the menu and ordered:

- Five Spices Chicken w/ garlic noodles: hmmm...not sure if it's just me but i've had better. the chicken was not as flavorful as Mai's (Clement) and the garlic noodles was not very garlicky. I LOVE GARLIC ...and that just didnt cut it for me. 
- Papaya salad w/ charboiled beef: mmm this was my favorite dish. the beef was so tender. i think i would've enjoyed this as my entree
- Charboiled beef w/garlic noodles: boyfriend had this one and it seemed like he enjoyed it because he finished his whole plate even the little "salad" on the side. 

Left full...but not exactly satisfied. Oh wells, it was worth a try. The service was ok. The man was standing right next to our table watching the game and he didn't even noticed that we were running low on water. The employees chit chatted amongst themselves. Might come back to try other things on their menu...possibly the imperial rolls. I wonder how they compare to Mai's (they have the best in my book).
author: Serena F.

description:
After a fun day in the city I wanted to eat here before heading home. Saw a pic of the food here on Lily L's Facebook n knew I had to try it!

I ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken an imperial rolls. The food came out lukewarm. That's one of my petpeeves. We were the only people in the restaurant so I hope it wasn't that our food was leftove from the lunch rush.

The imperial rolls were my favorite. They are made with the traditional wrapper that gets super crispy. Not that I'm a snob about it but I noticed that they were less like the wonton wrappers that some places use. The five spice chicken was good. Right amount of flavor but because it didn't come out hot it was less appetizing. The garlic noodles were plentiful but were my least favorite part of lunch. I know.. U must all hate me now lol. 

Would I come here again? Yes.. But I'll try something different and Mayr come when it's busy so the food has to be made fresh. I think I just came at a bad time :(
author: Lena H.

description:
I've had Perilla bookmarked ever since my sister mentioned the 5 Spice Chicken and garlic noodle plates.

My boyfriend and I came here on a rainy Tuesday night around 5:30PM. Parking is extremeley hard to find so it took us a while before we were able to get to the restaurant. It's a good thing we came at the time we did because the tables began filling up after we were seated. 

I ordered the 5 Spice Chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles. My boyfriend had the Charbroiled Beef with the same accompaniments. We also had a Thai Iced Tea that was pretty good. Everything came out to be under $25. 

Overall, the food was really good. The garlic noodles here are better than PPQ's because you can't see or taste much of the oil, although you can definitely feel it after dinner. I'd highly recommend you try this place!
author: Stephanie L.

description: This is a sister restaurant of PPQ. I just found out they deliver which makes it even better. We eat PPQ about one a week and get the always get the garlic noodles. I love the curry chicken pho but its a little better at PPQ. But they do the Satay beef pho about the same. (My favorite if you like spicy, get this...it has zucchini in it that makes it extra delicious.) The regular beef pho is great too. The PPQ chain remains our favorite!
author: Gwenn G.

description: i will coming back！！Rarely go to San Francisco today after it is unfortunately really great they taste great handmade noodles super delicious! Handmade dumplings are also good to eat dumplings my father said it very fragrant taste is very authentic delicious pancakes I certainly will come back to this store！i love Chinese food！
author: Yingzhen Y.

description:
Service: this is a very efficient restaurant!
- they saw us at the door and immediately wiped down a table and sat us
- they cranked out their food pretty fast considering a full restaurant by the time we were seated
- quick water rounds, just had to be patient until they came around

Food:
- Beef Carpaccio : no where near as flavorful/thinly cut as Anh Hong, i would not suggest getting it depsite it being their "specialty dish"
- Garlic Noodles!! absolutely delicious.  preferably with beef or pork.  shrimp and chicken were not that memorable.  generous portions for a cheap price!  unfortunately 2 out of 4 of our party had very dry mouth and felt dehydrated after eating...which probably means that there was plenty of MSG that contributed to these delicious noodles....

overall a good place to eat with a small group of friends.   fast service and u get in and out quick, unlike other sit-down restaurants.  i'd come again and next time i'd like to try their vegetarian dishes.
author: Tina A.

description:
I'v had the garlic noodle from Perilla and honestly that is the only dish in the menu that I recommend.  The pho and all other Vietnamese dishes are tasteless.  
The staff is really friendly and I'm sad that the food is just subpar.
author: Shirley T.

description: Came here tonight with two friends and I have got to say that the service here has always been so phenomenal. They are so professional and kind. Food here is so good and worth it as well. Forgot to take a picture but the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls with a side of soup definitely hits the spot. Will be back.
author: Marley P.

description:
Finally got to try Perilla and happy to say it was pretty good. It is definitely priced decently like most vietnamese food restaurants should be. 

We came here for lunch probably around 1:30PM and it wasn't too busy. Like other places on this street the restaurant is quite small and has probably 6-8 small tables at most. We were seated right away and of course I already knew what I wanted.

Since Perilla is the same owner of PPQ, I've already tried their garlic noodles. If I remember correctly though I liked it slightly more this time because it wasn't dry. For like $8.75 I got the garlic noodles with imperial rolls and five spice chicken. As others have already noted their five spice chicken is bombdotcom. Perfectly tender and seasoned! David L. got the pho and said it was just OK. If we ever come back, we'd probably try the curry.

Overall, Perilla is quite decent. 3.5 Stars from me. I'm just here to explore all the great ethnic foods around here. Irving street is full of great places to try!!
author: Stine H.

description:
The staff is nice and the interior of the restaurant is pleasant but the food itself is merely adequate.  It meets a minimum standard but does nothing to exceed any kind of expectation. 

We ordered takeout veggie pho, (2) thin sliced beef pho, papaya salad, and summer rolls.  Reasonably priced but perhaps you get what you pay for.  

The papaya salad was lackluster and plain and the full container sat in the fridge until it was finally thrown away.

The summer rolls seemed tasty at first but the skin roll was dry and the ingredients inside rather bland thereby necessitating the accompanying sauce for any kind of flavor. 

Even though we had (3) orders of pho, we only received two bags of vegetables. Initially there had been three bags but for some unknown reason the staff member removed the third bag from our order so needless to say, there weren't enough veggies for the three phos. Very disappointing. There was a sprig of basil in each bag, a lemon slice, some jalapenos, and some lackluster, borderline fresh bean sprouts that probably wouldn't be good to serve the next day. 

The pho broth was mediocre. It tasted like reconstituted beef broth bouillon from the asian food store.  There was no rich flavor from long simmering beef, nope, none of that. It was quite possibly one of the worst broths I've ever had.  The sliced beef tasted terrible and the whole experience was so numbing that I stopped eating. 

They put the noodles and beef in one bowl and the noodles were all clumped together and when you pulled out the noodles they broke apart. 

A terribly mediocre and unsatisfying experience.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Go here. Nice people. Good food. Free local delivery if $20+ if after 5pm. This location opens daily 11am-9pm

Parking kind of sucked but for the price and what you get, this place is SO worth it. For about $10, depending on what you get, you get huge portions that can feed a SUPER hungry person or two people with a medium to appetite. I wish they were a little closer (SF is a trek for me and this is deep in SF with no shortcuts to get to and fro) because I really like their food. They're also SO NICE! On the phone and in person, they're so caring and hospitable. I usually tip anyway when I pick up food but I WANTED to tip a little extra than what I usually do. My picky SO enjoyed the veggie garlic noodles. I really appreciate that with their plates, they give broccoli on the side. I love broccoli and it's not overcooked. They even season it a little bit with something, I think or perhaps it's the aromas and condensation permeating into the green flesh, soaking up the garlic goodness. This is what I ordered (Yes, I went a lil over board but I have food for days!) :

#30 Imperial rolls & shrimp garlic noodles   $12.25
#51 Imperial rolls & five spice chicken rice plate  $9.75
#59 Seasoned veggie garlic noodle  $9.75
#9  Curry chicken vermicelli (spicy coconut milk curry broth noodle soup) $8.99
Togo bag $0.10

Everything was $45 with tax. Like I said, good portions. I adore and salivate for imperial rolls like these that use rice paper instead of the flour but only if it's done right and they do it right. The pork and veggie inside the rolls are delicious and the dipping sauce, which is good too but to me, not needed. I just pop them into my mouth and it's gone. lol #30 and #51 each had 6 pieces of the deep fried rolls with a healthy ("healthy" how are butter infused noodles "healthy"? lol I don't care! Gimme!) amount of delicious garlic noodles. Oh and some broccoli. Who says I'm not healthy? ;) 

#59 was pretty good but if I had meat options at a place like this, I'm ordering the meat. It's good though and I also liked the Curry chicken soup which had a good spicy kick to it but not overpowering for baby spice buds like my tongue that can't handle much. The food tastes even better and more flavorful the following days as leftovers. Everything really infuses into each morsel. Next time, I'd order #27 Imperial rolls & Five spice chicken garlic noodles $10.75

Only thing is, I wish they offered and had brown rice but that can be because of limited space in kitchen or something. Well, if someone knows the manager/owner of Perilla and can suggest this and make this happen, you can be my friend lol, I'd totally pay extra for this healthier (low sugar spike and more fiber BUT it does have more arsenic...meh give me brown rice please! nom nom I don't care... yum in my tum lol)

I also like the feel of this location better than the one in the financial district. It's more low key here, more room and not packed, loud and crazy hectic like it is at the other location.
author: Mayana P.

description: Always good. Tonight we ordered garlic noodles (delicious), rare beef pho, and imperial roll.  Delivery is quick. Wish they had a seafood soup. Highly recmrmend.
author: Ilene B.

description:
Ordered delivery at 5:40p. Quoted 1 hr to 1:20. Said that was fine.  It's 7:30p now and called.  20 more minutes? If its gonna take more than 2 hrs for delivery why aren't they up front about it.

20 minutes later...no call no response. LAME. 2:30 later....it's 8:15p

They can't get in touch with the driver....I'm incensed!  Order is supposedly voided...tbc....
author: EJ K.

description: Came here to grab an early dinner with my sister after checking out the stairs on 16th. It was our first time trying garlic noodles so we were pretty excited and boy was it yummy. We had garlic noodles, imperial roll, the 5 spice chicken and the beef. We also ordered a side of rice, carb loading to the max. Everything was good but the most memorable was the 5 spice chicken and of course the garlic noodles. The rice was horrible though, it was so hard and dry like swallowing pebbles... I don't understand why almost all restaurants serve really hard rice!!! Next time I will just stick to the chicken and garlic noodles. I almost forgot to mention this has probably been one of the best service I ever received from an asian restaurant.
author: Julie C.

description:
Very clean and modern feel when you walk in. I had the 5spice chicken as advertised as their specialty and was a HUGE fan! The ingredients were plenty and fresh and the price was cheeaaapp! I couldn't finish smaller size by myself. I might have ordered egg rolls too. I think I did and they were amazing too. I try not to go to places more than once, but I would go back to this one. 

It only loses a star b/c they don't serve beer. Perilla, get a liquor license and I'll up the star ante! :)
author: Kimber C.

description:
I finally had a chance to try their garlic noodles yesterday during lunch, something that I bookmarked this restaurant for.  It was good in my mind, the cost was reasonable ($7.95 for the noodle with grilled pork, with the pork being quite good also).  It wasn't quite as good as Thanh Long (though it's not quite a side by side comparison).  On the other hand, Thanh Long is on a different level.

According to the menu, this is run by the same people that operate PPQ on Irving near 19th Avenue.  That place I always enjoyed their beef pho.  Therefore, I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews I see here about it (though the small sample of such reviews I see is in regards to their chicken pho, or pho ga, maybe that's why).
author: H K.

description: Eh, I've had better Vietnamese. The pho soup was just so-so. The broth wasn't that good.  The grilled meat is ok. Think it is run by Chinese. Others seemed to like the garlic butter noodles but that isn't my thing.
author: Deb G.

description: Good taste, big portions, and cheap price. What more can you ask for!!??? This is definitely a place I would consistently return to. Can't get enough of their garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken!
author: Marco M.

description: I've had their garlic noodles before and yes that is must try if you go here, but this review is for their pho. I ordered a #1 Perilla Beef Combo Pho and wasn't disappointed. The broth was flavorful and there was plenty of beef and meatballs for me. Big enough bowl to keep my hunger satisfied after a good workout and doesn't hit the wallet too hard.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I came here on a whim when Yummy Yummy just a block away was closed. I've always passed by this place but I've never ventured in till today. I've heard great reviews about their garlic noodles but they're really not my thing. I came with my boyfriend, however, and he did order them with imperial rolls and (charbroiled?) pork. It seems that he really enjoyed his meal and the portions weren't bad at all!

I on the other hand ordered the Beef Satay noodles. On the menu, it said it would be spicy -- it wasn't. It wasn't even it's lack of spiciness that bothered me. It's just that I was able to see all the artificial flavors and oils just floating on top of the soup. It repulsed me but I ate it anyway. I do have to say that their beef literally melted in my mouth without much chewing and I loved it! 

Just before this, they messed up on my order and gave me pho instead, which I wish I had decided to keep instead because it looked extremely appetizing. The waitress took it back to the kitchen and I heard them laughing and howling about how the cook messed up the order. Was it really that funny? I guess it was to them. It was so loud that it echoed in the restaurant! Quite disturbing. And the bathroom......... disgusting. Maybe it's just because I'm EXTREMELY germaphobic but it just didn't look clean at all and I was horrified.

I will try to come back next time for the pho and give this place a second chance. 3 stars for the food and I guess I can excuse the decent service.
author: Joyce L.

description:
The garlic noodles are really good, but also super oily. I would recommend sharing a plate with a friend if you're not hungry. Too much garlic + oil might make you feel sick later on. 

This place has food at an affordable price. I love the decorating inside the restraunt. It provides a quiet, soothing environment. The workers are nice. It's also really clean!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Been here once and would come back if I was in the area.  I ordered grilled pork with garlic noodles and imperial roll that comes with a side of pickled cabbage and carrots.  Everything was good, but nothing stood out.  Garlic noodles could have used more garlic but loved the chewy noodles.  Grilled pork and fresh, crispy imperial rolls were decent.  Nice portions..I came home with some leftover.  

Definitely a value..but then again, there are many other Asian restaurants in SF that are as well.
author: Kimberly C.

description: It's pretty guuuuuuuuud.  My go-to pho tai and garlic noodle spot.  winner winner i got pho dinner.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Hmmmm.... 2-3 stars? 

I've tried both their five-spice chicken garlic noodle and rare-beef and brisket pho now on two separate occasions. I've noticed that the service has improved since I last visited but the food was just mediocre.

The garlic noodles are delicious but really greasy. I definitely think they have the best five-spice chicken so I'll grant them that. I'll probably come back mainly for this dish. 

Pho? Broth- bland. Beef- not tender. Pho alone rating = 2 stars. They do give you a LOT of noodles so if you're super hungry and you rather have quantity over quality, order the pho.
author: Patricia K.

description:
After years of walking by the place and thinking the name of the restaurant sounded incongruous to the dishes being served, we finally walked in to try the food at a friend's suggestion/

We are vegetarian and we ordered the vegetarian pho and the garlic noodles with vegetables. The vegetarian pho was simple and bland-- vermicelli noodles, broccoli, mushrooms, tofu, and broth. The flavor improved somewhat with the addition of the garnishes they provide and a liberal amount of sriracha. This place reaffirmed the garlic noodles, though, which were pretty close to perfect. The right diameter of noodle, the right amount of what appeared to be freshly minced garlic that had been cooked to the point where the garlic starts to caramelize and get almost a sweet, smoky taste. Not too salty and not too greasy. I would put these noodles in second place after those on the menu at butterfly (embarcadero) and above those found at b.star (inner richmond).
There was no other vegetarian dish on the menu that really intrigued us, so if we were to come back, we'd probably order two bowls of the garlic noodles with vegetables and call it a day.
author: T K.

description:
Terrible experience at this place ... horrible service & they really don't know how to treat their customers. Might've just been a language barrier but this had to be the worst time even trying to put my order in.

Other than that .... the 5 spice chicken was awesome & the garlic noodles are off the hook=)
author: Jay A.

description: The parking in this hood is ridiculous. However the stars do not reflect the parking.  I enjoyed my garlic noodles with five spice chicken. I felt it was a bit dry on some of the chicken and not crispy enough. Side order of egg rolls were perfect. Burned the roof of my mouth. It's hot! I deserved it, didn't check. I was hungry. BF's pho was weak. Soup was bland. And the beef was sliced way too thick. I was surprised with the awesome reviews. service is excellent. Betty delightful group of people. Overly attentive and weird. You don't get good service at Asian food. You just don't!  I can say that. I'm Asian!
author: Gessa C.

description: Solid 3 stars, nothing special. Vermicelli had lots of fresh greens and cold noodles, pork was cooked well with little fat, but overall lacked flavor for me. Presentation a bit sparse.
author: Matt A.

description:
We went to PPQ just the other day to satifsy a craving but actually didn't order a crab like we usually do. So later in the week the same craving but this time we found Perilla thanks to Yelp! 

What a find! They have everything you want and in combo plate form! No need to order separate dishes of garlic noodles, grilled pork, imperial rolls, grilled shrimp and much more. Of course if you do want to order more in quantity, you can certainly order each of these items a la carte. 

Efficient and friendly service as well. And they even had tv screens for us to catch the Giants game!
author: Anna R.

description:
Well, as per usual, the lines of San Tung and Yummy Yummy have driven customers towards the other businesses of food and hospitality on Irving st. This time, Yummy Yummy lost a few customers to Perilla, but not indefinitely.

After perusing through the menu posted on the outside, my friends and I made a quick and somewhat brash decision to go inside as to not appear like arseholes. 

A waitress greets us...err, acknowledges our existence and throws a few menus our way. The spot was quite empty at the time, and the coldness of our server wasn't exactly encouraging to my friends and I toward behaving in our typically boisterous ways. Nonetheless, when our waitress returned to take our orders, I opted for the grilled pork and imperial roll rice plate. 

Food:
Actually, it was quite good. It was presented really well and I really enjoyed the imperial rolls here. They reminded almost exactly of my favorite rolls that I always get from Champa Garden in oakland. The pork was grilled perfectly and it delivered a bit of smokiness without being the least bit burnt. The accompanying fish sauce i usually have to drown my food in was almost not needed in this case.

From what my friend who ordered the grilled chicken garlic noodles told me, he enjoyed the chicken and the fact it was cut in pieces and de-boned was a plus as well. He also mentioned the garlic noodles were not as garlic-y as he would've have preferred. Having had the likes of PPQ in the city, I could understand what he was saying because the noodles didn't emanate the same garlic-y essence the same way the delicious garlic noodles of the more notable restaurants did. 

Service: 
As expected from a typical $ dollar sign Viet joint, the service was no frills, but it was honestly hard to even crack a smile or a nod of acknowledgement. This might sound petty but I think something like that or responding to your customer's "thank you's" a bit more might go a long way...possibly even earning you that "people love us on yelp!" sticker.
author: Nick C.

description: it is really good. I ordered two garlic noodles and one papaya salad for me and my friend, we love it. especially when you are eating noodles,  eat salad later, it makes your stomach feel fresh.  Food just as I expected. if you love noodle and garlic, it is a good choice. And I suggest you to order salad as well, it helps you to digest.
author: Xiuxiu X.

description:
yes!

garlic noodles were just as good as Perilla on Mission St downtown.  my sister in law always asks to come here when she visits from LA.

My favorite is the garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken. mmmm

don't plan on kissing anybody afterwards tho.
author: Jimming C.

description:
Although the pho broth here was a little too salty for me today, their garlic noodles and five spice chicken are amazing! Seriously the garlic noodles are better than any Cajun restaurant I've ever tried and the chicken has the perfect amount of crisp to it and tender meat, ugh now I want some garlic noodles.. 

Minus a star for the salty broth but it's cool I'll still go here at least twice month for some garlic noodles! :)
author: Antonio J.

description:
I was introduced to this place by my best friend, the beautiful Morgan M. She moved a few blocks away from this spot (lucky) and whenever I come to visit I demand that we go here. Sometimes several times in a weekend. I'm not Vietnamese, but I consider myself pretty knowledgeable when it comes to pho. I NEED pho regularly, like at least 3 times a week. I never get sick of it, it always makes me feel freakin' awesome afterwards and it's cheap.

I LOVE this place. I would eat at this place every single day if I lived within 20 miles. They use higher quality meat then most places and the broth is delicioussss. The garlic noodles are fantastic. The Vietnamese carpaccio is fantastic. Even the tea they give you is f'n fantastic.
author: Sarah W.

description: 5/19/2015 - Have decided never to order from Perilla's again.  They do have delivery but even that isn't enough to entice me to break my oath.  Yummy Yummy is just a couple blocks away and they have waaaaayyyyyyyy more choices including crab during crab season (and so far, the staff has been very gracious and friendly).  And if I go cross town to Clement, there's even more Vietnamese places to eat at.  So I don't need Perilla.  I'll eat at Sandy's (that's the right name) on 9th betw. Irving and Judah instead, stop and get take out (too bad they don't deliver but what would my life be if everything were as I wanted it to be???).  I've never met so many bad tempered Vietnamese before, all of the Vietnamese people I've ever had anything to do with have all been so nice, but not in this place.  Good luck to all you who continue to patronize this place.
author: Kai T.

description:
WAHH! I always eat at the Perilla on Mission and was in shocked that my friends wanted to eat at this location. 

For once, I didn't feel ripped off by Perilla. The portions are a lot bigger here and the price is at least $2 cheaper than the mission.  The 5 spice chicken, garlic noodles, actually comes with egg rolls! Did you know they charge $2.50 per egg roll in the MISSION!! They also have raw beef at this location. Must order RAW BEEF!! 

I will be back and possibly order take out in the NEAR FUTURE!!
author: Chanel L.

description:
When I clicked two stars, the description yelp gave was "Meh. I've experienced better."  That couldn't be more accurate.

We got pho and garlic noodles with five spice chicken.  Pho was not very good.  Broth was pretty bland and there was nothing special about the meat.  We heard good things about the chicken but it wasn't anything special
author: Jenny S.

description: It was nice to try a different vietnamese spot on Irving. Wasn't the best, but it definitely wasn't the worst. It was satisfying enough, and worth my money.
author: Melissa C.

description: favorite vegetarian pho spot in the city!!
author: Paris I.

description:
Convenient location for lunch  by GG Park which is 1 1/2 blocks north.  

The lunch plate is a good bargain.  Great 5 spiced chicken consisting of a thigh cut up into 6 slices , imperial rolls of 6 pieces, and a pile of garlic noodles all for under $10.
author: Shirley N.

description: The Five Spice Chicken is the best! I went there with my two friends on a Tuesday at 5pm, it wasn't busy at all. Great customer service and the food was yummy. Parking is pretty difficult especially during weekends. I would recommend this place to everyone! Fun-Fact: It's a vietnamese restaurant.
author: Amy C.

description: i love the porkchop garlic noodle combo with the imperial noodles! caps all on this review because its so good
author: Barry E.

description:
Yum! Garlic noodles and good food! 

I highly recommend the garlic noodles. Although the garlic noodles are not as good as the other restaurant in SF, "C," for the price you pay here, it is worth it to satisfy that craving!
author: Jen H.

description:
Decent meal.  Walked in at 9:05pm and thought they were closest.  Since there were still two people eating in the restaurant the staff was nice enough to let us order to go.  I order two dinner entree: five spiced kitchen and charbroiled pork, both with garlic noodle.  

I personally though the meat was nice marinated and flavorful.  I could also tell it's been marinating for a good amount of time and use high heat to cook it.  The garlic noodle on the other hand is so/so.  It reminds me of what my good friend made at his dinner party which is ediable, but just lacks the butter and rich garlic flavor.  The con is the flavor but the pros is I live longer because I'm less likely to get a heart attack.

Overall 4 stars is honest and fair and if you're in the area and need a quick fix this place is definitely worth a try
author: Tiffany C.

description: Very good food.  Affordable.  Good value.  the spicy beef soup is my go-to when I'm not feeling well.  They are very very nice as well.  we did their catering menu for an event and everyone loved it.
author: Genevieve B.

description:
I've been here twice & so far have only tried their garlic noodles. My eyes are usually bigger than my stomach so the first time I had this, i thought the portion was way too little. After eating it for awhile, I felt pretty full. Maybe it's because of the oily meat & noodles that it made the portion just right. 

Overall, taste wise, I'd definitely give this place a 4. Service wasn't bad considering it an Asian restaurant. I'm not saying that all Asian restaurants give horrible service, but at least this one was very attentive in refilling my water. Or maybe it's because my friends & I were just too busy talking to notice other things.
author: Anna L.

description:
My friend and I had one agenda on this one particular weeknight -- and that was to find a restaurant that served "simple" garlic noodles.  By "simple," we meant no additional chopped up veggies or unnecessary flavors.  We just wanted noodles + butter + salt + garlic!

With an easy Yelp search, we found our match at Perilla.  I loved how you could pick whichever meat you want and tag that along with a side of garlic noodles.  My eyes were fixated on the five-spice chicken from the get-go, so that what was I ordered (and have been ordering since).

The chicken is full of flavor, and most importantly -- juicy.  The garlic noodles are a perfect compliment since it is not overwhelmingly too garlic-y.  For those nights where you feel extra hungry, get their imperial rolls as an appetizer.

If you want a fast, easy, and affordable dinner that will hit the spot, Perilla is the place to go.  (Take-out and delivery are both available as well).
author: Judy C.

description:
The bowls of pho are ginormous--you could easily split an order with someone. I had the rare beef pho, and the broth was awesome after I dumped in all the jalapenos. My mom had a dish with imperial rolls and garlic noodles. She pretty much demolished it, so I can only assume it was delicious.

I am not a pho expert, but I think I enjoyed the pho at Yummy Yummy more.
author: Dante and Alleliah G.

description:
This place is the same owners as PPQ Dungeness Island and Toasties.  If you're looking for good garlic noodles, look somewhere else.

I walked in here on a fluke because San Tung was too crowded.  There were signs saying they served garlic noodles and I assumed that is what they specialized in, so I ordered the charbroiled pork chop with garlic noodles.  The pork chop was just okay.  A little crispier than most vietnamese places.  The garlic noodles were horrible.  Tasted pretty much like instant garlic noodle, if that existed.  The noodles were spaghetti noodles with garlic and parsley. I could've made it much better at home.  To top it off, our waiter seemed like he didn't want to serve us.  He would go to every table to see if things were okay, execpt ours.  That guy even had the decency to give us change back after we paid the bill. 

Will not come here again!!!!
author: Cedric F.

description: Good service.  That's what I noticed first.  Food is adequate and good.  Imperial rolls, five spiced chicken on vermicelli,  yummy.  The beef pho is good too. The iced coffee is on the small side and could improve.   I would go back, and bring appetite.
author: F K.

description:
GARLIC. INFUSED. NOODLES. GET ITTTT.

Anything with a combination of their garlic noodles is AMAZING. I've tried the Five spice chicken, the beef, and the prawns and they've all been great. I've had plenty of garlic noodles thus far, and none have even come in comparison with Perilla's. It's always a good sign to walk into this place and see that a majority of the patrons have a hot plate of noodles on top. I have seen some with pho bowls, which I doubt I'll ever try here because I just CANNOT come here and imagine ordering anything but their garlic noodles.

Food:
- Five spice chicken: Juicy and not dry. They also leave the skin on so it's nice a crispy when it comes to your table.
- Beef: juicy and tender. Not overcooked. No complaints.
- Prawns: Hit or miss. Taste wise is always a hit. However, sometimes the size of the shrimp can be a bit small, and considering you are paying more for seafood, you'd think they'd either offer bigger prawns or more in quantity. 

Portions are fair along with reasonable prices. 

Service: Always friendly with a smile. Nothing to complain about. They are always helpful and quite attentive with refilling water glasses. (Then again I always find myself coming at times when it isn't too crowded.) 

Parking is a bitch. It is Irving after all, so what else would you expect. Expect to walk at least a couple blocks if you aren't lucky with parking or find yourself coming during lunch/dinner time.

Definitely coming here to get my garlic noodle fix.
author: Jenna H.

description:
A very good place to come get a quick bite if you're around the 9th and Irving. Honestly, I prefer the pho at the nearby Yummy Yummy. However, the 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles combinations are fairly priced and extremely delicious for what it is. The chicken is spiced well and crisped to satisfaction. The garlic noodles are really good, since it's pretty hard to f*ck up what's already good. Garlic. And noodles. And probably butter. 

The service was prompt and friendly. I thought it was hilarious that the waitress was wearing a shirt that said something about biting and sucking on a shrimp head (clearly a euphemism). I think they have another restaurant somewhere in Richmond that is a Boiling Crab knock-off.
author: Dan K.

description:
Agree with comments describing the short hair waitress.  She definitely hates her job and it shows.

The food is OK.  Garlic noodles aren't bad.  My fiancé had the five spice chicken garlic noodles, which she liked, but it wasn't enough to go out of our way to come back.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
