Came here last Saturday for a friend's birthday nd I LOVED IT. I came here in a slightly bad mood but by tha end of my plate, I had loosened up quite a bit. 

We were seated almost immediately -- there were 7 of us. Tha menu had a good amount of options on it but i already knew what i wanted; Garlic noodles with charboiled beef. IT WAS DELICIOUS! Awesome, awesome... I'm glad we ate here because I've been meaning to try this place out. Tha garlic noodles were divine nd perfect... i only wish i had more of it! Nd tha beef.. oh my. Utterly speechless. They were as good as tha beef sticks at a Viet festival that go for like $5 each (not worth it but they're so YUMMY). Everyone else ordered similar plates, just different meats nd some had imperial rolls nd others did not. 

For tha service - It was OK. At one point, our friend refilled all of our waters for us. LOL. Our waiter refilled our waters at tha end but that was at tha end soo eh. Overall, it was a pleasant experience. I could overlook tha service because we didn't require much nd tha food was just so darn good. This place is so recommended. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Michael N.

description: Food was delicious, but ABSOLUTELY RUDE delivery service...called to tell me my order is ready, and he was outside. (Okay ill meet you at your car...weird, what happened to walking to the doorbell?) Gave me my food I paid WITH tip via app... and the delivery man had the nerve to obnoxiously say, "No Tip?" When i told them i did from the App, he had to call me...AGAIN  to say otherwise i didn't and demanded a tip... Sorry, but you are not a panhandling man... I paid for services, and received them. You are not ENTITLED to a personal tip...to one i paid ON THIS APP WITH TIP...if it wasn't that the food was actually well done, i would put one star...
author: Giovanni M.

description: Excellent customer service and amazing food.  MmMmmmmmm. Veggie rolls and five spice garlic noodles will be my favorite in this place .
author: Neha K.

description:
Oh my god, it's good. Though it was my first time, i immediately fell in love after my first bite.... 

So i ordered the five spiced chicken with garlic noodle and imperial rolls, while my friend got the same garlic noodle with imperial rolls but with pork. Ahh, both chicken and pork was delish! I probably can't decide which is better coz they're both so very good! The garlic noodle, which i have loved for many years now from eating it at PPQ, was good and not too greasy. The imperial rolls were bomb. They were so crunchy on the outside and even though i hate mushrooms, i ate those rolls lk i was born eating mushrooms. Just when i thought yummy yummy was my first go-to option for viet food, i found this and fell in love instead.
author: Verdina P.

description: Pretty gosh darned good! It took a little longer than normal Pho places for our orders to arrive, but they were pretty tasty. I thought the satay pho was interesting; most pho places don't have a spicy option like this.
author: Heather C.

description: Awesome pho restaurant.  They also have a variety of vientemese food like garlic noodles and five spice chicken. can come here for pho and also a healthy salad!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This place is really inconsistent. Sometimes we come here and its fantastic while other times we regretted it. First of all, I usually only get the garlic noodles here because its the only thing on the menu that seems somewhat consistent. I love how buttery the noodles are. Along with my noodles, I like to eat it with their yellow curry chicken. This is where the inconsistency comes in. Sometimes the broth for the curry is good and has the right hint of spice while other times its straight up plain and Jane. Not to mention their portions of chicken can be off also. 


CONS: Gosh i really hate to catch parking around this area, its like a death sentence. We always have to park blocks away. 
MEDIOCRE DISHES; NOTHING SPECIAL BUT THEIR NOODLES.
author: Mandy T.

description:
Yummy garlic noodles. 
The five spice chicken is the best! 

No need to try the rice or noodle soup because the garlic noodle is where it's at. 

This is not authentic Vietnamese food though, so don't go expecting that. Just expect delicious garlic noodle goodness.
author: Lily S.

description:
Really like the food, here are our go to items

Charbroiled pork - amazingly good
Garlic noodles
Imperial rolls
Spring rolls
5 spice chicken salad

I'm knocking 1 star off because their deliver has taken over 1 hour the last 2 orders we've placed - one of which was on a tues night. It's a little sad when you are so hungry and start getting stir crazy peeking out the window everytime a car drives by.

It must be because they are so popular! Perhaps hire one more delivery peron.
author: Sheila S.

description:
Had the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. Great taste but the chicken was a bit greasy. Other than that, food was delicious and portions were big. Would come back again. Service was 
fast and servers were friendly.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Fantastic five spice chicken garlic noodles. Pho is just okay. But the speed of serve and the price are what keep me coming back. And the fact that this place is literally up the block from my apartment.

Be warned that you will have amazing garlic-y oil dribbling down your face at the end. And a big effing smile too.
author: Teresa T.

description:
My family and I walked up and down Irving St to find a decent place to eat lunch. A lot of places were closed on the Tuesday we went for some reason but we saw this glimmer of light in the distance. I quickly yelped it on my phone to see how many stars it got before we went in. 

Good reviews! Let's eat!

We started with some veggie spring rolls which were amazingly good! They were a little bit warm with veggies and tofu. So good. I could eat just those for a meal. 

Also shared a bowl of veg pho with veg broth with my mom. It was ok. The broth needed a little something more. I'm sure the meat phos are better though.

This place got completely full at around 12:30. People were waiting outside since the place is a bit small.
author: Karen Y.

description: My bf LOVES the garlic noodle here. He seriously doesn't eat it anywhere else. My fave would be the five spice chicken with the garlic noodles. it is pretty bomb. the amount of garlic isn't too heavy BUT carry some mints... might scare away some people after your delish meal. what's good about the five spice chicken is that it could be with really anything - with your pho, garlic noodles, rice, etc. all hail FIVE SPICE CHICKEN!!! and their garlic noodle :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
Im bordeline between the 3 and 4 stars.

Craving garlic noodles for some time now, and finally got some yesterday.

Ordered the combo with egg rolls, garlic noodles and five spice chicken.
food took longer than would have thought. food arrived and i guess the portions are okay sized..for the combo.

egg rolls......kind of bland, but crispy. five spice chicken was juicy and crispy. garlic noodles were.....disappointing? iono.....felt like it tasted bland also...not garlicy enough....and kinda dry? meh. but add fish sauce and it kind of helped.

I guessss it was satisfying, since i was full. but i'll just have my bf make garlic noodles next time....tastes almost the same.

parking a bit difficult, but not too bad.
author: Christine M.

description: This place to me is the epitome of meh Vietnamese food. If you want Pho, go to Kevins. If you want rice dishes, go to Yummy Yummy. It's overpriced and the food is halfway decent. I think they focus too much on decor...
author: Cody M.

description:
#27 Garlic noodles with 5-spice chicken and imperial rolls. sooo YUMMMY!

This place is absolutely worth raving for. I love garlic and their noodles really hit the spot for me! At a reasonable price, you can get it for $8.50 and its only a dollar more to get it with imperial rolls. The portions are good and they cook the chicken perfectly. It's never dry (or at least mine were never dry), its very flavorful and texture is just right. i love the nice crisp of the skin.

 I definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves garlic noodles :))
author: Anh T.

description:
I go every once in a while to get the imperial rolls and grilled pork vermicelli. It's acceptable except when it's not--fatty pieces of meat that can't be chewed through, rolls that feel like they've been sitting around and not made fresh to order.

Today was the last straw when i realized that service just went to crap. I called in my order as usual, but they got it wrong (separated the rolls from the noodles). The guy behind the register was an ass, as if he didn't want to be there and didn't want me to be there. He begrudgingly swiped my card, and after i signed he left me waiting 2 minutes while he stood there and did nothing. I waited for my food to be brought out, but as it turned out, the food was already ready on the counter before i had even arrived. I guess i should have known which pile of boxes was mine? I'm done coming here.
author: Phuong M.

description: Great food. My friends and I walk in to an empty restaurant and before we knew it the place was crowded.  Quick service and presentation of food. The hostess and waitress was super friendly and chill. I asked her if they made goi cuon (which I hoped had that crispy thing in the mode) and she said yes and pointed in our menu. It didn't come out with what I expected, but I was hungry so i didn't complain for the crispy wonton/crepe embedded in the spring roll. I ordered the garlic noodles with five slice chicken-DELISH! Checkin yes was greasy but flavorful. All in all a great experience. He weird thing was the restroom and having to go trough the kitchen and seeing the cooks not wearing gloves. BUT the hand dryer made up for it because of the wind speed. Oh and the Vietnamese ice coffee was on point. Just be prepared to move the coffee to the ice cup and deal with the metal drip container.  That was too much work for me.
author: John Michael R.

description:
Not bad, but I won't go back.  There are so many delicious Vietnamese places to try in the City, this might not be one of them.
Had the Beef Pho, and spring rolls, absolutely nothing great about either.  Bland really.
Clean, and nice staff though.
author: Song H.

description:
Do you like the garlic noodles at PPQ Dungeness Island?? Well, now you can find those yummy noodles in the Sunset at Perilla!

They opened this location recently, so they were still having a grand opening special...free Vietnamese coffee or Thai iced tea with your meal.  I got a Thai iced tea to go with my Imperial Roll & Charbroiled Pork with Garlic Noodles( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/Xbuy3H6gW28yxU8OmszldA/l ).

The portions were very generous.  If you're really hungry, then I'm sure you could devour this plate.  But I only ate half and took the rest home for later.  The noodles were just as good as their other restaurant and the imperial rolls were nice and crispy.  The pork was thinly cut and very flavorful.  

Their dishes are a little more expensive here, but I'm willing to pay for those yummy garlic noodles!
author: Patra I.

description:
Better Chicken Curry Pho down the street at PPQ and better garlic noodles across the park at PPQ Dungeness Island, both odd findings, considering all, including Toasties at West Portal, are sister restaurants. 

I expected my Chicken Curry Pho to be similar to PPQ, but the portion seemed smaller with much less broth.  Flavor was also very different with my vote going to PPQ.  The garlic aficionado in me needed much more garlic in my garlic noodles.  Food was overall ok, but a bit of a letdown.  Despite my disappointment, however, the FH was surprisingly impressed with his vermicelli noodles with five spiced chicken imperial rolls.  

Service was fine and relatively quick, but I'd be hard pressed to return unless PPQ is closed, which, disappointingly, it was.
author: Mel T.

description:
I'm kind of between a 3 stars and 4 stars. The boy was getting sick and decided that he wanted pho, so we met up at around 19th to get some. But apparently the two pho places were not open so we walked all the way back to 9th and stopped off at Perilla. Although the boy's already been, he wanted pho this time around. He ordered his pho and I decided to get garlic noodles with the five spice chicken. Such a great idea. 

I had some of the pho and the broth was actually pretty good without any additions. The garlic noodles were decent, I've had better at Thanh Long and the chicken was pretty good as well. It's always nice to try places around the neighborhood. Great addition to 9th street as a great Vietnamese place.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Short review. Had #21. garlic noodles with the five spice chicken and a side of imperial rolls. 

Five spice chicken was juicy and bursting with flavor.  It's pretty much the same as PPQ on 19th and Irving as they have the same owner.  

I've been here on multiple occasions for a quick fix of garlic noodles. 

Service was excellent! Water was delivered without request.
author: Christopher S.

description: Real nice staff, I came in past 9 and they let me still dine which was awesome. Good food, good staff, awesome noodles.:) happy camper
author: Ricardo R.

description:
Five spice chicken + Imperial Rolls + Pork Garlic Noodle.

For $8.95, you get a decent portion. Everything in this dish is really good! Five spice chicken perfectly marinated. Imperial roll freshly fried with a thin layer of crispy skin. Pork garlic noodle that are not overly greasy.

We also got the Satay Beef Pho ($7.25). Satay is usually really greasy so the soup was a bit hard to drink but the pho and beef were good.

Staff was also very friendly and there's one guy who's surprisingly very enthusiastic about the food. Will definitely be back!
author: Tina T.

description: If anybody want well done beef don't ask them to cook them  again.They  will throw it in the microwave. Seriously it's disgusting beef came out nasty robbery. Never come back again.
author: Yoki P.

description:
Affiliated with PPQ Dungeness Crab, which is my weakness. OK, Garlic Noodles are my weakness. I've written like 10 reviews on PPQ (or 3. whatever)

We ordered take-out for a work lunch and the portions were humongous and very tasty. I can now fulfill my garlic noodle cravings RIGHT downtown. yay
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Garlic noodles were very tasty, but I'm sure the MSG helps with that. Drink lots of water. The imperial rolls, pho and other typical dishes were tasty but not extraordinary. The prices were fairly reasonable. It's a good go-to spot for easy Vietnamese food in the sunset. It's laidback and child friendly. The service is nice and not much to complain about.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Since we now live in the sunset district, we decided to explore our food options in our new neighborhood.

And being such a HUGE fan of the PPQ dungeonous island's garlic noodles, I just had try their latest restaurant, an infusion between PPQ and Toasties. Surprisingly, they still have the garlic noodle that PPQ is known for at their Clement St. location. We ended up getting this enormous portion with garlic noodles, grilled pork and the imperial rolls for about $9 bucks a plate. You would think that's a lot but the noodles are a heaping load and they give you not one but TWO of the rolls. We were too full to finish it all. 

The staff here is pretty nice and attentive, regularly refilling our teas. We were even offered free Viet coffee or Thai iced tea because it was still grand opening.

I saw some mixed reviews on here at first but what you guys needs to realize is that they are NOT known for their pho (which is exactly what the people who rated them lower got) but rather their garlic noodles, rice plates and imperial rolls (though the rolls here differ in taste slightly from the actual PPQ locations, which in my opinion taste much better.)

I highly recommend this place to anyone on a budget who wants  a delicious mixed plate, large enough to split. 

BONUS: These guys deliver!

As the terminator put it..."I'll be bach!"
author: Petra S.

description: i like this spot, it gets pretty full even on sundays. their garlic noodles are awesome! that is why i come here often. makes me full without eating too much!
author: Jackie A.

description: Definitely should get the garlic noodles! Yum!!! Not too greasy or anything.  The pork chops were pretty tasty too.
author: Meredith W.

description:
I unknowingly became like their first customer or something. :) 

Food = great portions, quality shines.  

Pho = needs better broth.  But otherwise it was good in my belly. ($7.00)

Vermicelli with BBQ beef & imperial rolls = good.  (Worth the $9.50)

Three color bean drink = excellent and they use green (for the environment) cups for takeout!  Gotta love the chunky drink! :D ($3.25)

Service = friendly.

I'll have to come back for a second try.....
author: Fannie S.

description:
Ahhhh I looooove garlic noodles! Simple yet delicious meal. My friend and I had food coma after coming here ahaha.

So basically you order garlic noodles with a choice of meat. And on top of that, the order comes with spring rolls! BAM. The perfect combo.
author: Julie H.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5
I ordered the pork chops with garlic noodles. The pork chop was nicely flavored, but the garlic noodles lacked the garlic flavor. There was some, but not enough. The service was decent. Staff needs to be more welcoming and inviting. It is a good deal though. I can say it's a much better deal than PPQ.
author: Chatree T.

description:
My goodness this food was bad and one thing for sure it not true Vietnamese Food. The soup taste like water with onions NO FAVOR what so every.  Chicken  had to  much oil and it too had no FAVOR.

For sure the cook is not Vietnamese.  I've been in Vietnam food on side of the road who put this place out of business.  Awful Awful no Favor.
author: viva H.

description:
Been there twice now and had a great meal both times! The place is decorated very nicely and the staff is very nice!!! will definitely be going there on a regular basis.

Had the 5 spice chicken w/ garlic noodles, the noodles are awesome! And the chicken was great. Just had the Pho too! Sooo good! The broth is perfect and the meat was tender and tasty, it of course came with ALL the fixings sprouts, thai basil and jalapenos. They've got the hoisin sauce and the best sauce ever THE RED ROOSTER SAUCE! (only thing that was missing was some of the crazier meats like tripe and tendon, mmmmm! I guess most people are not into that though).
author: Danger R.

description:
Do you know how hard it is to find a place that serves yummy garlic noodles?  Well maybe I haven't looked hard enough but the only places I've found are Thanh Long and Crusteaceans that even compare to the Perilla's garlic noodles. Mmmmm..... my mouth is watering just thinking of it.  I love Vietnamese food and when I'm really craving, Perilla will hit the spot.

My usual order is either the five spice chicken or shrimp with egg rolls and garlic noodles--you cannot go wrong!  I've tried the carpaccio and eh I wasn't much of a fan so much as if I were to get it down the street at PPQ's pho restaurant.  I've also got the papaya salad and that was a hit as well!  

I've never had to wait for a table but I'm sure there are times where this place can get busy.  I should warn you though, parking around this area can be a real pain especially on Saturday and Sunday afternoons--oh and Friday nights too.
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
Oh my gooooodness, this place is amazing. I can't believe I just discovered it.... 

BBQ pork with galic noodles and imperial rolls ... best. thing. ever.

I can't wait to go back!!! (:
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
How does this spot average under 4 stars?  I'm a big fan, even considering giving it 5 stars, but unfortunately that is reserved for very special places for me.

The five-spice chicken almost deserves 4 stars by itself.  It is excellently prepared, with the right parts crisped (the skin) and grilled (the meat).  It is quite possibly one of the best chicken dishes that I've had, and I never thought chicken could be prepared quite so well.

If you're not a fan of their chicken, then you must be for their garlic noodles.  They are incredibly delicious, with a nice kick of garlic butter (I think) that makes the noodles extra tasty.

I also had their imperial rolls, pork summer (or spring? could never tell the difference) rolls, and vermicelli with charbroiled beef.  Everything was delicious - and the service was also very friendly and timely.  I was very happy with (and very full from) my dinner here.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Cute Lab says: "It was... oh my god a squirrel!"

Garlic noodles are great... I had them with the imperial rolls which were, eh.  Tried some of my friend's coconut curry and it was a little bland.

Owner was walking around and was very friendly - waitstaff were pleasant.

They have huge buckets of plastic green chopsticks at every table... they are awesome and you will want to steal some for home.  Try and resist!
author: Cute Lab W.

description:
PHO GA WAS YUCK!!!
(1 star)

PHO-get this get place. I was offended by the crappy tasting $7.95 Pho Ga. As i'd like to say "how inappropriate". Trust my judgement.

- Food, Pho was not great
- Price, Overpriced
- Service, Shitty
- Ambiance, Simple clean and small

Came here for dinner and was expecting some decent pho. Already knew I was not expecting the best based on the people who were eating here. Their items of the Vietnamese dishes are in english so you wont be seeing Pho Ga, instead you will see "Chicken Soup". Walked in, not one staff person paid attention to me, sat down and they knew I was sitting there (waiting to be served). After 10 minutes of sitting there while the staff was 1) having a vietnamese conversation amongst themselves 2) picking up the phone and taking orders while another picks and delivers and another was doing who knows what. I have decided TO SERVE MYSELF and walked up to the counter and took a menu infront of them and sat back down. After awhile of trying to wave for their attention - the tables around me felt bad and i had commented "i guess i'm suppose to serve myself?" and everyone laughed. The guy who was pick-up and delivery been seeing me sit there and came to me to FINALLY take my order, althought it wasn't his job and he knew it was the other persons job. I was seconds away of leaving the place.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

PHO GA ($7.95) - Yah it was f'n terrible. For those who think this dish is tastier here needs to really explore their palate. Some chicken pieces looked like chicken and not so much of others. I didnt get that much chicken either. The noodles were kind of hard as if they didnt really cook the rice noodles. The taste of the broth (alone) was BLAH. Kind of bland and had a weird after taste. I dressed it with hoisen sauce, siracha, and all the veggies and it still tasted like crap. And for $7.95... YOU GOT TO BE KIDDING ME. Stay away from the pho. 

Will I be back? I'd like to try a rice plate - the 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles. Looks like thats the dish to get but i may refrain myself from ever attempting a second try here.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Yummy garlic noodles, though more buttery than garlicky. Wish it had more of a garlic flavor! Nonetheless, I was satisfied. Also, a side bowl of garlic noodles is definitely enough for one person if you're not too hungry or not feeling any meat.
author: Michelle L.

description: I've come here a few times and I'm never disappointed. I recommend ordering the garlic noodles with either five spice chicken or charbroiled pork. If you're looking for pho, I'd recommend just walking a couple blocks down the street to Yummy Yummy, but the garlic noodle dishes here are pretty good. I mean, not Thanh Long good, but worth its price!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Came in with my hubs and father in law. We are usually up to try anything as long as we get good service and good food.  Hmmm...we were given ok service and ok food. 

The pho was so so and oddly took longer than the garlic noodles and chicken. The garlic noodles were good, but more buttery than garlic.  

The first person that seated us was pleasant, but then was served by a different woman and she was not pleasant. She seemed to have her regulars, but everyone else was just on her grid. I am not expecting chatting like besties, but at least smile or look like I am not burdening you. Sucks if she was having a bad day, but dang...fake it if you have to work among strangers that look to you for service and a pleasant experience.
author: elizabeth c.

description: YUMMMMY. I can't stop telling people about this place. Yes they are known for these awesome garlic noodles and 5-spice chicken, but while you have to get that, also get their noodle soups. The service, price, portions, and flavors are SPOT ON. The only thing I did not enjoy were the imperial rolls, they felt kind of gummy to me and the filling was just average.
author: R L.

description:
I have been dying to try this place since forever! What threw me off was this establishment's kitchen was right next to the bathroom... Argh made me lose my appetite. I ordered a number 27 which is consist of imperial rolls, five spice chicken, and garlic noodles!  Let me say, before eating it fresh out of the restaurant, I had the opportunity to eat it at home (to go).  Unfortunately, the to go order was way better than fresh out of kitchen.  Perhaps it was a different chef or something but the garlic noodles I had at the restaurant did not have as much flavor.  The five spiced chicken did not have the flavor of five spice.  I would say perilla by far has one of the better garlic noodles than most Vietnamese places.  I however had better five spiced chicken at other Vietnamese establishments. 

The price is a bit more expensive than most Vietnamese places but worth it if you are ordering garlic noodles!  Service was decent.  The server even packed my to go plate for me. That's a plus.
author: Ann L.

description:
really bad all around...Ordered in and when the delivery guy got here he called i told i would buzz him up but he refused and told me to come down. i told i was unable to and asked again for him to come up, but instead he then hung up on me. When he finally did come up, he unhappily gave me the food and left. Once i opened the bag i realized they got one of my orders wrong, in which eat24 quickly and painlessly resolved. The food itself was pretty bad. We ordered the imperial and grilled beef rice, garlic noodle, and pork roll.
The rice plate was mostly rice, the beef tasted like dish soup ( which me feel nauseous after eating ) there was nothing special about the imperial roll. The garlic noodle justed tasted like  mushy bland noodles (not worth it). The pork rolls were mostly hard inedible noodles. ive eaten here twice before, and both times it was just ok. I really wanted to like this place, but after this experience im definitely never coming back.
author: R S.

description:
4 stars. garlic noodles were the best. It's kinda like a rice plate from a regular vietnamese restaurant but instead with rice, you have garlic noodles. Ive been craving garlic noodles for the longest time and perilla satisfied them. It wasn't too buttery or oily. It was just rightttt with a good amount of garlic. But if you absolutely love garliccc, then you might be a little disappointed. my plate was around $9-10 but that's usually how much other vietnamese rice plates cost at other restaurants.

Parking may be a pain in the butt because it's all meters all around so i guess it's best to go during dinner since free parking starts at 6pm. Small place but feels pretty home-y. Very nice workers. they even remembers all of our dishes without any paper to write it down. impressed. coming back here again whenever i have a craving for garlic noodles again
author: Andy F.

description:
personally, am not a fan of americanized asian cusine, but despite that i decided to try this place out. I got the popular garlic noodles with charbroiled beef (came with the sour-ish dipping sauce). 

so, the noodles looked way more delicious in photos than they actually taste (yes, sadly, the pictures got me). the noodles have a subtle garlic taste, and are on the drier side. the beef was mediocre, and the sauce was good, but that is hard to mess up. 

i can see this being good after being drunk, if you're craving some extremely unhealthy food, or if you have the munchies.
author: Sylvia Y.

description:
Hm.  It's good, but only because you can't really go wrong with butter and garlic, like literally it's just butter and garlic.  The chicken was standard at best--it's hard to go wrong with the dish.  

My friends were in LOVE with the noodles, but I cook enough to know how easy it is to make.  I wish the meat were better and I wish there was just more to the dish.  I mean, I'm all for simplicity, but if I'm going to be gorging on such a high calorie meal, it needs to be worth it.

Service was fine.  The waiter was funny.  He was trying to get us to buy a coke so that  he could do this trick.  Later another table bought it and he got the coke can to balance on it's side--cool, I guess, if I were 10.
author: Aly A.

description:
Was in the neighborhood and I was wandering around looking for a place to get my belly fed.  Noticed the Perilla sign and remembered this was one of the places I bookmarked awhile back for the garlic noodles. 

So off I went and sat myself down at a table.  I was starving and it was rainy and cold.  Was thinking about getting some pho to warm up but decided to stick with my gut and follow all my fellow yelpers in ordering the garlic noodles with the 5 spice chicken.  

The 5 spice chicken was good.  Crispy skin, juicy and flavorful but I was not liking the pool of oil my chicken was sitting in.  Seriously it was a pool of oil. Be ready to move your chicken around on the plate like I did.

The garlic noodle was just ok.  I didn't taste the garlic.  Each mouthful I was looking for some garlic and nada.  Did the price of garlic go up and nobody tell me?  Can't help but wonder if there was more of a garlic taste would  they had a gotten another star out of me.  

Hmm....all I can say is that I would come back only if I was in the area but I wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Cris H.

description:
Took a friend from the east coast who had wanted to experience Vietnamese food.

Of note, on a Tuesday, many other regular Vietnamese restaurants are closed. This really limits the options available for me to satisfy my friend's request. 

We came in here after searching the area, with plenty of restaurants to be tried, like Park Chow, but only a few limited Vietnamese options and it had relatively positive reviews. It was not busy at all, but became busier once we had sit down. The service was prompt, the food came out quickly after being ordered and so I was pleased that my friend got to experience this.

We had their imperial rolls, garlic noodles w/ five spice chicken and their vermicelli with charboiled boneless pork as recommended by many others.

Imperial Rolls = pretty darn good. (however, have had better in San Jose at some hole in the walls and bigger chains like Huong Lan).
Garlic Noodles w/ Five Spice Chicken = Both were well prepared, noodles, perfectly garlic-ky. The five spice chicken was tasty, but wish it was a bit more flavorful.
Vermicelli with charbroiled pork = Pork was cooked well, not tough at all, and went well as a dish with the vermicelli (again, would say I've had better in San Jose)

Food and Quality 4/5.
Service 5/5
Value 25$. 3/5 (A bit pricey, but fits within the neighborhood standards, but not for what I'm accustomed to).

Overall, friend and I had walked out full, satisfied, and I commented to my friend, you had a taste, but wish you could have been in San Jose for me to show you better.
author: Danny N.

description:
I visited Perilla with a friend on a Tuesday afternoon around 1:15 p.m. and the restaurant was about half full.  It's a pretty casual restaurant, and it's very clean inside.  We were very quickly greeted and the waitress suggested that we pick whichever table we wanted to sit at.  She brought us over menus and glasses of cucumber water.  It seems that many of the customers here are repeat customers- the waitress came over to our table just after a couple minutes and asked if we were ready to order, but since it was my first time actually dining in the restaurant, I wanted to take my time and thoroughly browse the menu.   After a couple more minutes, a waiter came back to take our orders.  He was quite friendly and just memorized what we ordered.

Five spice chicken with vermicelli noodles ($6.95): This was a huge bowl of yummy noodles and a generous portion of chicken too.  First off, the chicken was really good.  It was very "tender and moist," as their menu states and full of flavor.  The chicken did have a little bit more fat/skin then I was expecting- but I embraced it, and it was delicious.  The skin is nice a crispy too.  The noodles are like any other plain vermicelli noodles.  I like to pour the fish sauce over the noodles.  

Overall, the food was very tasty. The portions are very fair- it was plenty of food- so it ended up being my lunch and my dinner.  The food is made fresh to order and the drinks I saw at other tables looked good too.  The waiter and waitress consistently came by our table to check in and see how we were doing.  They refilled our waters several times and when I asked for a box to take my leftovers to-go, they even boxed it for me.  The service is right on.

Notes:
-Look for street parking, there isn't a parking lot.  Street parking is usually manageable, depending on the time.
-A lot of people love their garlic noodles.  I've had these to-go several times and they are definitely worth a try.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I believe I got the pork rice plate here. I found the portions to be small and the food was forgettable. I do want to come back and try one of their
 garlic noodle dishes though.
author: Helen L.

description:
I've only had their garlic noodle dishes. I sometimes get the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles and sometimes with the imperial rolls. Yum. I recommend the garlic noodles!

Their side dishes for the garlic noodle is a reasonable amount for around $3-4. I haven't tried their pho, but I heard it was just okay.
author: Mandy D.

description: Ordered garlic noodles with chicken for take out which was good. The noodles tasted really buttery and garlicky. The chicken was good too but needed to give a little more chicken compared to noodles. The service was horrible. I was carrying a little baby in a baby carrier with two bags in my hands, the server told me to leave the table and sit in a dirty corner so that they can offer the table to some other customers. I understand I ordered take out but they could have been a little polite about it.  For service I give them zero!
author: Spring B.

description:
Horrible place:

1. Annoying waiter - Took way too long to come to our table and take orders. He never asked us if we needed anything. He made strange comments and was highly annoying.

2. Food - Horrible. I have never had worse pho in my life. It was a water broth of undercooked noodles which completely lacked anything familiar to the aroma or taste of a well made pho. The garlic noodles were fine (not great) but seriously, everything else was just terrible.

3. Price - You don't get what you pay for. You get less, much, much less.

Why am I writing this? Because I love the inner sunset and it deserves to have great restaurant offerings. They don't need to be expensive, but they should offer well made, quality food.
author: O O.

description: This review is for my gluten-free friends so gluten-full people may not feel the same way. It seems like everyone comes to Perilla to get the garlic noodles which are made on egg noodles. Sometimes when I ask really nicely, the restaurant will make me garlic noodles with rice noodles but due to a BIG language barrier, the staff at Perilla could not even understand what rice noodles were. It was a pretty disappointing because they were resistant to even try to understand. Bad customer service is such a turn off for me. I ended up getting pho which was actually pretty good but not really what I wanted.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Five spice chicken and garlic noodles 
as good as the reviews say I'm a fan !
author: lyn m.

description: The short-haired waitress Thanh needs a customer service re-up. She was extremely rude and complained about the tip we left, when my friends and I were even nice enough to consider leaving her any tip at all. She threw the menus down, not distributing them, and when she came to take our order, all she did was point at me and say "go". When we finished our meal, she came back with the bill and threw the money tray down causing the change to bounce out. When we left, she chased us out to complain about the $2.36 and had the nerve to say "Two dollars only? Wow." while my friends and I stood outside. She needs work, and so does the food.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
Wow....it seriously took my a couple weeks to actually wander down from my apartment, mainly cuz i finally ran out of food, but boy was it worth it. Coming back from Pride, my friends and I needed some food, and this place stood, out, cuz we all love garlic noodles, and as advertised, this is the place to be.

The food seems to be a interesting mix of Thai and viet food, but the flavor profiles meld nicely. The garlic is not too overpowering, and the meat was well seasoned. 

The service is quick, servers are nice, and its a nice place, though we didn't sit down.

And if you want take out, its minimum of $20
author: Justin N.

description:
ALL I CAN SAY IS... GARLIC NOODLES AND 5 SPICE CHICKEN. 

When a friend first brought me here, it didn't sound too appealing or made that much sense to me since it is a Vietnamese restaurant. But OOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMGGGGGGGGGG I would trade a human baby for these garlic noodles and chicken. 

Who doesn't love garlic??? Who doesn't love chicken!??! And don't tell me you don't love these garlic noodles and chicken because you are a real fool if you can look me in the eyes and tell me these aren't delicious. Have only been here once as I am a native of LA, but I can tell you this was like one of the top meals of my 22 years of life.
author: Emily M.

description:
Super tasty and clean.

The vermicelli and pho are winners. 

Can't go wrong with the 5 spice chicken and imperial rolls.
author: kevin l.

description: Great, quick service and amazing food. On top of that, great price in terms of a restaurant being in SF! Great pork chops with the garlic noodles. Mmm... It was enough to fill up two! To summarize, a nice, delicious, two-worthy, meal for $10.25
author: Carol T.

description:
garlic noodles were soooo good :) 

pho tasted like pho, nothing too special there. Vermicelli was pretty good. 

Decent pricing, nice atmosphere, good location. The place looked clean. 

WILL COME AGAIN!
author: Jenny E.

description:
FOOD:
1.) garlic noodle eggroll shrimp = yummie



SERVICE:
good they refilled waters regularly


ATMOSPHERE:
Not too big, casual but nice.
author: Angela L.

description: I took my two kids here to eat for the first time and we were so glad we tried it.  My kids ordered the garlic noodles with seven spice chicken and they ate it all up.  They were so excited that this restaurant was in our own neighborhood, they couldn't wait to come back and they asked me if we could write a review so other people would come to eat here and it would stay in business.  I got the noodle soup and it was soooo good for the cold I had that week.  Super yummy and nutritious.  The family who owns the restaurant is friendly and terrifically helpful.  They spent a lot of time helping us decide what to get on the menu, and were full of smiles and patience.  Love this place for a casual quick and yummy meal.  We are going tonight for dinner and my sons have been talking about it all day, so excited to get their new favorite dish again.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Dear Perilla, I curse and Thank God the day I met you.. 

I thank god for letting me taste something so magical so mouth watering.... So much so that even writing this post at this very second has my mouth watering.... (DAMN,I wish I would have ordered a bowl to go!!!)

I curse you for having me so addicted and being over 45mins away from me... You are the biggest tease I have ever known!!! I know your there but I can't see you everyday.... 

oooooh how I miss your delectable garlic oodles of noodles with its most scrumptious curry sauce... YOU Should be ILLEGAL!!!
author: Sol R.

description:
My rating is based on the awful service I literally just received 30 mins ago. 
I've had a long day at work and all I wanted was their noodle soup, just me and only me. I came in and (granted they closed at 3pm but I was there at 2:35pm) before I even sat down, the manager? I guess urged me to "cash out now", I said I don't have cash, he's like card is fine. I asked is this normal? (to pay before I eat), he said "no, but we need to cash out now!" So I was like may I have the noodle soup?" He said we are out of it? I said all of it? He said "we have it, but we don't have it", I asked how's the Vermicelli? He said "we don't have that either", PISSED OFF AT THIS POINT, I just got up and left... he should of at least said something along the lines of "how about take out since we're closing shop soon?" you know like in a polite way... but the way he handled it WAS ABSOLUTELY RUDE, DISRESPECTFUL & AWFUL WAY TO "PLEASE" a customer.
author: Mari B.

description:
1. We were a party of 8 - my mom started walking towards an empty table which seemed to fit all of us- old man started yelling from across the entire restaurant " HELLOOO! HELLLOO! HOW MANY ?!!! NO NO YOU CANT SIT DOWN! YOU TELL ME HOW MANY FIRST BEFORE SIT DOWN! NO NO NO! HOW MANY!!??"  " NO YOU DONT DO THAT! YOU HAVE TO TELL ME FIRST THATS HOW IT WORKS!"
Jesus that was embarrassing and abrasive.
2. He tried to say to my mom " I MAKE YOU HAVE HEADACHE BUT YOU LIKE ME LATER!" Wtf?!
3. He opened a can of soda and sat on top of the cup to pour itself in the glass- while one of the kids started to reach for the can to stop it from spill in out  he grabbed his hand and shoved it away and said " NO NO! " and kept grabbing him and pushing his hand away. Assault much?
4. PHO was below mediocre- nothing special or exciting and definitely not worth the $8 for a bowl.

CONCLUSION: If you don't mind a old man in your face the whole time you are there, please go ahead and entertain yourself. PS. he is the only server at that time and the entire restaurant was packed- all 13 tables? It tok 15 minutes after his assistants dropped off water to place our orders - really ticked off. He even took the order of two table that came after us!!!

SUPERCONCLUSION- go elsewhere- better selection further down the street like YUMMY YUMMY or others .
author: Mario M.

description: First time here and it was not bad at all . I never tried the 5 spice chicken and so I decided to order it and it came with garlic noodles . The chicken was really good but the garlic noodles weren't bad but I've had better . The service was great and also food is affordable as well . Parking might be hard to find since its a busy street with other great restaurants . But if your in yhe neighborhood def come , when I went which was a weekday it was not crowded at all and got seated right away . I'm not too sure other times since it is my first time but def come and try this place out ;) .
author: Tiffany K.

description: I always get the garlic noodles with charbroiled beef and imperial rolls.  I like the noodles here because they're really buttery.  It could use more garlic, but it's still good either way.
author: Tina L.

description:
I've had this place in my bookmarks for over a year now and I finally got a chance to try it out. This review is also between 3 and 4, b/c my charbroiled shrimps were teeny and they only gave 4 (small ones).

Ordered the garlic noodles, imperial rolls, and charbroiled shrimps plate for $11.50. Everything solidly good, but like I said either the shrimps should have been bigger or they should have given like 2 more for the size.

Got there for a weekday lunch around 12 and we were the 2nd table in the place, by the time we left 40 minutes later, EVERY table was taken. They offer daily specials as well on the chalkboard outside the door.
author: Dina V.

description:
Update: they made up for canceling our reservation by putting us up at a 6-person table until a larger table opened up.  They had smiles on their faces the whole time, which was nice.

Food: the garlic noodles weren't as flavorful as before... :( five spice chicken and imperial rolls were still delicious though!
author: Amanda W.

description:
Mmm, bf wanted to try a new place. Went on yelp and found this.

I got their signature five spice chicken with garlic noodle. and my bf got some chicken curry. 

I did not like the curry, the chicken was very dry.

My dish was okay. TOO GREASY. did not like the garlic noodles because it just tasted like butter, no garlic. the chicken was good, but I felt like i neede some rice because it well seasoned.
author: Erica L.

description:
WHOA. Surprise surprise?

Was initially planning to go to San Tung, BUT DAYUM THATS A LONG ASS WAIT. BUUUUUUUU.

So no. Someplace different. There must be some place around here thats good.

We spy Perilla across the street. Interesting. They advertised garlic noodles in the front. Garlic noodles? I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES. Worth taking a closer look at the menu......

Sold. Lets go here.

Try the garlic noodles with five spice chicken. Oh man. I love garlic noodles. And now ... five spice chicken as well.

The imperial rolls are kinda meh. I probably would save my money next time.

One of the workers their is this crazy quirkly old Asian man who joked around with us that their microwave was broken and our food would be delayed. I really hope he was kidding. Our food came very soon thereafter, so maybe he was. I hope. o_o

When seen in perspective, their garlic noodles aren't nearly as good as the ones sold at The Ark which is located in Alameda, but these are definitely still very tasty.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Great vegetarian pho with fresh veggies (broccoli and mushrooms perfectly cooked), awesome flavorful broth. 

Also, every employee there was SUPER nice and friendly. 

Coming back for the famous garlic noodles next time.
author: Osh J.

description:
Clean and decent place to get Vietnamese food.

there are so many different places in the city, but this is conveniently located in the UCSF vicinity and have friendly staff.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
Garlic noodles is awesome! Totally delicious! The five spice chicken is awesome also. The best thing is they have a combo with both of them!

Chicken's nicely cooked and still moist while the outside is cripsy. The spices on the chicken just makes this thing so great.

The garlic noodles are crazy good. Just the right amount of garlic and the texture of the noodles are cooked to like perfection.

Service is kind of on the meh side, but it's a busy place. Parking in this neighborhood sucks so bad after 6pm. 

Their pho ga is not bad, but not great. There's nothing special about it.

Garlic noodles and five spice chicken are a must try here!
author: Steven B.

description:
Oh. My. GOD. These are the best garlic noodles I've ever had. Whatever you get, it MUST have garlic noodles on the side of it. I seriously cannot get enough of it. If I had to choose a restaurant to live off of for the rest of my life, this would definitely be one of the last ones that I'd have to narrow my choice down to. Ask for a soda and the older guy will come over and show you the soda pouring trick that he has.

As bad as this place makes my breath reak of garlic, I can't get enough of it. Writing this review just gave me the ultimate craving for it.
author: Tony L.

description:
Pho, I love you. 5 Spice Chicken, you rock. Garlic Noodles, you're super addicting. Hot amazing goodness,  you're always welcome in my belly. You being in my hood, awesome. 

Can't go wrong with this place. 

Only downfall? Sitting by the door on a cold gusty night.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Came here for a late lunch and ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls.  Maybe I'm missing something here, but I don't understand all the hype surrounding the garlic noodles.  Let me give you the play-by-play on each component of the dish.

- Garlic Noodles:  Too buttery and not nearly enough garlic.  It's called "Garlic Noodles", for crying out loud...throw a couple more cloves in there for old time's sake, it won't bust the bank.  I tasted the butter more than the garlic...perhaps it should be renamed to "Butter Noodles" instead of "Garlic Noodles".  
- Five Spice Chicken: Nice crispy skin, juicy and good flavors, no complaints there. 
- Imperial Rolls: Your typical crispy friend imperial rolls.

In a dish where the garlic noodles and five spice chicken were suppose to be the stars, half of the dish failed to deliver while the other half didn't exactly blow my socks off either.  

Will you get your monies worth = YES
Will you get some decent tasting food = YES
Does it live up to the hype = NO
author: Mandy L.

description:
Hmph.  Wasn't too impressed.  I read all the raving reviews about the chicken and garlic noodles.  It was alright.  I didn't think it was anything to write home about, and honestly, I don't think I'd order it again.  

We did get our food take-out so it's possible the food is better in house, but like I said, I don't think I'll be breaking down their door for dinner.  In case I go again, I'll update given a different experience.
author: Lily N.

description:
I have got The Garlic noddles a few times and I like them, also my kids like them.
The 5 spice chicken Pho is good. Only have done take out, staff have been freindly.
author: Tina F.

description: Love the garlic noodles, but overall the food is really tasty. Best part is you can get it to go and bring it to the bar next door so you can eat while watching some football.
author: Dilly M.

description: With winter's arrival, there's nothing better to nurture and feed the body than delicious belly warming flavor-full Vietnamese food. And it's all the more better when at a cozy neighborhood restaurant with a friendly wait staff. That place is Perilla. My five spice chicken vermicelli bowl (with extra chicken!) was so good and the servings are like at many Vietnamese restaurants in San Francisco, very generous.  It's also a great place to come with others. My friends all enjoyed their choices as well, including the garlic noodles and pho. The prices are extremely reasonable.  I look forward to coming back again soon!
author: Toby S.

description:
PERILLA. I love you.

You've got a somewhat high minimum order  for delivery ($20), but thats ok. You've got high standards. I can appreciate that. You don't need no fools wasting your time. I won't waste your time, lovely. Just give me that sweet, charbroiled pork plate, and it'll all be good. Throw in some shrimp spring rolls too. Yeah, just like that. With the sauce. Mmm.

You know, Perilla, you kinda remind me of my ex, Noodle Bar. Now now, don't make that face. Noodle Bar was a part of my life, but it's in my past. This was before I moved here, Perilla, so don't even get mad. Noodle Bar was a lot like you--reasonably priced Vietnamese food in the hood. Everybody went there. That place was always packed. I was sad when I left, not gonna lie. There you go making that face again, Perilla. But Perilla, I was so glad to have met you, you don't even know. You've filled that hole in my stomac--I mean, heart. Yeah, my heart. Let me take you out again tonight, girl. xoxo
author: Lilia M.

description: One thing and one thing only. Papaya salad with grilled beef. It haunts me in my gluttonous dreams. Try that and you'll be back for sure.
author: Rosavida C.

description: Love the five spice chicken and garlic noodle, perfect hangover food! The fish sauce goes great on almost anything, the only reason it's not five stars is because it's been exceptionally greasy a couple times I've ordered it.
author: Dane E.

description: The place didnt have bad food, in fact, they had an amazing eggroll. They did get my order wrong, and weren't around all that much at the table, so I didn't get tue chance to correct them.
author: Matt W.

description:
This place is not far from where I live but I have never been to this resturant because there are SOOOO many food places in Inner Sunset.  We went there for dinner on 4th of July because my fiance had to work that day and by the end of the day we just wanted some simple, tasty, non-expensive comfort food, and that's exactly what we got!  We ordered two noodle soups and of course the five spice chicken with garlic noodles (suggested by other yelpers!) and we were so happy with the flavor, quality, and the portion of the dishes.  The BEST part, was the service.  The wait staff was so friendly, and attentive, and helpful.  They addressed every specific request and changes we made to our orders, and kept coming back to ask if we needed anything else.  Normally, I don't like this level of attention, but these guys were so cheerful and helpful that we actually appreciated their constant presence at our table.  

Needless to say, I will be going back there regularly, and I'm already looking forward to my next meal there!
author: Sarah W.

description: This place is Great!!! The customer service is amazing and if you're looking for a good cheap, late dinner, this is a go to spot for local.
author: John T.

description:
A-OK.

I tried the Perilla noodle (Tem #1 on the menu).  It is OK.  Not great.

It is probably good enough to come back in a rainy day but not good enough to come back with friends.
author: Mike Y.

description:
I only get the five spice chicken with garlic noodles here. So for that, I give them 4 stars. I still like Thanh Long's garlic noodles just a little bit more but that's not to say that Perilla's is bad, just not as good.

I got great service here and I will return only because the garlic noodles are cheaper than Thanh Long's. However, I do not like that the prices online do not reflect their price increases.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Finally gave this place a try after seeing so many reviews and so many friends posting about them. 

Came on a friday night after work, not many people in here but not having to wait is always a win in my book. Took a while to find parking though especially because of all the other restaurants in the area. 

Anyways, ordered:
#27 and #28
garlic noodles w/ imperial rolls and 5 spice chicken
garlic noodles w/ curry chicken

A. Garlic noodles were decent. I've definitely had better before and they can be a lot more garlic-ky. 
B. 5 spice chicken was pretty good. Not a huge piece of chicken, nicely seasoned. A bit too fried / crunchy 
C. Imperial rolls - loved them. nice crunchy-ness and great flavor
D. Curry chicken - a bit watered down. Goes REALLY well with the garlic noodles, adds that extra flavor to them

Overall, service was so-so. Food portions were medium and those garlic noodles can definitely be better.
author: Kenny L.

description: You have to check out this place in the sunset if you go there once you go there twice, it keeps me coming back, The garlic prawns and the garlic chicken!!
author: Donald B.

description: This place was delicious! Friendly smiling servers, fresh food, very clean, generous portions. Highly recommend the fried tofu salad. Vietnamese coffee rounded out the meal. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Maria R.

description:
The garlic noodles were awesome, yes. But what surprised me the most was the beef. Holy shit that beef was tender and delicious... still pink on the inside too, which made me extremely happy.

Unfortunately it was my boyfriend that ordered the beef (vermicelli bowl). I had to steal pieces of beef from his plate. I ordered the coconut curry chicken w/ garlic noodles which was "okay", but the chicken was a little bland and grisly. Bad choice in general for me though... curry and garlic noodles--what was I thinking? I prefer eating curry with rice usually.... However, the garlic noodles on their own were divine as I mentioned earlier.

Next time I will try the garlic noodles w/ five spice chicken, or I might just say screw it and order the beef with garlic noodles again.
author: Melody S.

description: Garlic noodles all the way. I'm sure every review raves about this. It's even advertised on the employee shirts!
author: Vanessa C.

description: I guess I will be in the minority but I would say the food underwhelmed me. I have heard so much about this place and I want to like it but there are better places. The five spice chicken was tender and the portion size was large. The garlic noodles needed some salt and more garlic flavoring and maybe so chili. Don't get me wrong, the food is good but when there is such a hype you just expect so much more.
author: Eve C.

description:
Perilla rocks for their garlic noodles.  Add some chicken or pork because it's cooked really well!  I ordered some imperial rolls as well.  Was delicious and there was about 6 pieces (3 whole ones cut in half).  

We also ordered the raw beef slices with lemon.  This was the dish that I disliked the most, as the slices shredded pieces (some large, some small) and it wasn't drowned in lemon like other places. 

Overall, Perilla is A-OK but the price for the food doesn't stand out too much compared to the handful of Vietnamese restaurants in SF.
author: Reb R.

description: This place really is just A-OK. I have been here for lunch to try their Imperial Rolls + Five Spice Chicken with their famous Garlic Noodle. The egg rolls were okay, a little bit on the burnt side. I enjoyed the chicken a lot which was flavorful and not dry. The garlic noodles on the other hand were a bit on the drier side. I couldn't really finish all of it in the end. The garlic was great and definitely a great flavor but I needed a whole pitcher of water afterwards.
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
One of the best pho place in the city. Satay beef pho and garlic chicken noodle is over the top.

Killer Dish: Garlic Chicken Noodle
author: Wayne Z.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here because I went nuts after trying the garlic noodles at Thanh Long and he said it was pretty much the same here... Well, turns out he was wrong - I think the garlic noodles here are even better!! And way cheaper too... I think its owned by the same family that has Thanh Long, Crustaceans, PPQ, etc

I am totally in love with this place because I love noodles in general, and it kinda doesn't get any better than this. They're wonderfully chewy and the perfect texture and, of course, super garlicky!! More garlic flavor than at Thanh Long actually I think, although I'm pretty sure its also way more buttery and therefore more unhealthy but definitely more tasty, but do I let those middling details get in my way of enjoyment? Not really...

I got the combo plate of garlic noodles with five spice chicken and it also came with dipping sauce and a side of pickled veggies, which was an excellent contrast to the heaviness of the noodles. Chicken was so delicious, being tender and juicy on the inside with crispy, flavorful skin. All in all, everything went so well together! I'm totally obsessed now and can't wait to go back... when I'm feeling poor and craving my garlic noodles, Perilla is where I'll be!
author: Janey L.

description:
I am literally having a food orgasm while thinking about writing this. I came back from college one weekend and to my surprise, Toasty's was gone and Perilla had popped up in its place. After overcoming the initial frustration that my beloved neighborhood had decided to up and change without my blessing, I bit the bullet and gave Perilla a try. 

My friend and I had heard that Perilla was the cheap eats offspring of PPQ and once we heard the words "garlic" and "cheap" we were hooked. Surprisingly when you walk in, there isn't any kind of waft of garlic, although when you look at every single person's table there's a huge pile of noodles sitting there staring at you, tempting you, and making you salivate. 

I can really only rave about one dish here, because I'm a creature of habit (plus an Irving St pho devotee) and once I had the ordered the combo plate of Five Spiced Chicken, Imperial Rolls, and Garlic Noodles there really wasn't trying anything else. AMAZING. The garlic noodles are the best I've had, the chicken is amazingly crispy and juicy, the imperial rolls are delicious, and they have pickled veggies as a garnish--which really just seals the deal. And the portions are huge! It always lasts me 2 meals. 

DID I MENTION ALL OF THAT WAS ONLY $8.95? I would literally drive home every weekend to get this. Although I'm well past my freshmen years and couldn't face the embarrassment of putting on a Senior 15. 

*on a sidenote, the garlic  will literally seep out of your pores, so you probably don't want to eat here on a date or before one. or do. i did it, mostly because i have no shame and because I really couldn't resist eating Perilla. seriously, worth it. plus if somebody can't handle you at your garlicky-est, quite frankly they don't deserve to have you.
author: Michelle Q.

description:
After an eventful night of partying and lots and lots of drinks, I stumbled into Perilla the next morning for some hang over food. Entering the restaurant at noon on a Saturday morning, I was greeted by a packed restaurant without a place to sit. I was okay with that since I only wanted to take my food to go and not further agonized myself with loud noises from the patrons. 

I walked up to the counter and ordered the Five Spices Chicken with Garlic Noodles. The waiter told me that it would take 10 minutes. I stumbled out and headed to the supermarket next door to pick up some Young Coconut Juice to compliment my meal. I came back 10 minutes later, and stood there waiting for my order. The waiter walked by me 5 times before he came up and asked me what I wanted....really? It's that busy that you don't remember? I stood there another 10 minutes annoyed that there was no seating for patrons that are waiting for to go orders or a table when it becomes available. I was left standing in the obscure corner next to the utensil, flatware prep table waiting for my food. Eventually, the waiter came over with my food and sent me on my way. 

I have had the Five Spices Chicken before so it was my go to dish. It was just like I had before, the chicken was nicely glazed and quite flavorful. The noodles were okay but it was missing the garlic punch I would expect. 

Parking can be a hit or miss in this area so be prepared to hunt for one during the lunch and dinner rush.
author: Myron J.

description:
Two words. GARLIC NOODLE. Yum!

I usually go to Thanh Long for garlic noodles, but this place is pretty darn good too! Ordered a pho and garlic noodle and imperial roll combo. Portions are good and not overpowering. I shared this with a friend, and we left as two very satisfied happy campers.
author: Jenny M.

description:
OK so I have been here twice and looked up the reviews before going here. I was in the mood for pho so I decided to try it..not that good and very bland.
I read the reviews again and decided to go for the garlic noodles..so delicious! I ordered with the five spice chicken. My brother and I ordered the same thing. The chicken was so tender and perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. It pairs well their famour garlic noodles!! The reviews were so right, come here for the garlic noodles with a meat Only! No pho.

They are great for lunch, quick and very polite.
author: Lana K.

description:
Perilla you never seem to let me down. I enjoy your garlic noodles and fresh brazed meat.


One day we went in and I had just had my wisdom teeth pulled, I asked the waiter for the most gentle meal on the menu, she told me to try the Pho, to my surprise it was delicious!! I never had Pho before and it was so flavorful!!

So they are extremely fast paced and try not to make people wait long, the food usually comes out fairly fast and always presentation on 10! 


All in all I enjoy Perilla, their service and their food. They just opened a new one on Geary and it is also same quality in service, and the food doesn't skip a beat!
author: Aarin P.

description: Garlic noodles with anything is always a treat. And, though not a huge herbivore myself, the summer veggie roll was pretty good for this carnivore. They do only have a health score of 81, but the tastiness of their dishes and the amazing friendliness is well worth the visit. And by friendliness, I really do mean friendly. The staff here all seem to REALLY love working here.
author: Abe L.

description:
Garlic noodles!

This place is a part of the PPQ empire in SF.  If you ever had PPQ then you would know what level of greatness their food usually is...nuff said...
author: Patrick C.

description:
Wanting something hot since it was chilly and foggy out, my friend and I decided on this place for some pho. I had the beef combo pho with egg noodles, which was good. I liked that they use the super thin egg noodles.  Reading the reviews on here, I might have to come back and try the garlic noodles. 

Service is definitely lacking. Was not immediately greeted upon entering; waitress had to make a 2nd trip to our table because she couldn't remember our order (maybe that's why servers will write orders down?); and it took forever to flag down our server for the bill. 

I would come back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't make the drive just to eat here. 

*Props for the TV so you can keep track of the Giants games
author: Katrina L.

description:
Whoo boy. My arteries are still recovering from dinner here a few days ago.. but I'll be back here once my cholesterol levels stabilize.

The garlic noodles were so, so addictively good -- though, I've gotta say, you have to seriously f something up to make those ingredients taste otherwise. As a girl who grew up in Little Saigon, I do ponder the authenticity of the dish.. but not so much that I won't eat it with gusto. Fried chicken was great, as were the apps. The Vietnamese iced coffee is strong, so late-night caffeinators beware!

Service was also great; our group of 8 walked in on a Sunday night and were seated and served promptly. We cancelled a dish seconds before it reached the table, but they made no fuss. A welcome addition to the 'hood.
author: Julie D.

description:
The food here tastes very good.  I think everyone knows that and it's clear based on all the reviews.  However, I will say this.  Don't come here if you're looking to have the good stuff but want to stay healthy!  

I ordered their main dish, the chicken with garlic noodles and imperial roll. I'm pretty sure everything on my plate was very unhealthy!  The noodles are cooked in a LOT of butter.  The chicken I'm guessing was fried.  And I think with the imperial roll, there is no question how that was prepared.  If you're ok with the walking heart attack, then you'll love this place because all that goodness was excellent!  I also had the spring rolls and they were pretty good.  

I graded this place down slightly because it's easy to make food taste good when you use a lot of butter or fry the food.  Regardless of that fact, they do a pretty good job and this place is worth trying out.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I've ordered garlic noodles twice from perilla and both times it was great. Along with imperial rolls and shrimp rolls. 

The portions are fair for the garlic noodles and rolls. 

I'm happy to have found this place. Definitely will order from here again
author: Michael L.

description:
had the 5 spice  chicken pho. fantastic!! really fresh bean sprouts (crispy and appropriately chilled) and really tasty basil. 

service was a bit slow but i was in a rush cuz i parked in a 30 min spot. you'll have to circle during busy times, but you can typically find something quickly after hours. 

i'll be back.
author: Siva M.

description: Awesome service, innate hospitality-really nice guys. They jump to it and are happy to. This is a neighborhood place w/so much competition that the service really stands out and makes us want to frequent.
author: Janine S.

description:
I have been here a couple of times.  This place is mostly known for their garlic noodles.
The last time garlic noodles garlic was a little 'overpowering'.
This time they were perfect.

The price is very nice.  The food is worth it.  I think I liked everything I tried so far.  The rolls, the noodles, the rice....

Less stars because the place is REALLY small.  (Note I had to write in big letters)
On a weekday lunchtime forget the attentive waiter, forget the assisting staff if you are trying to dine.  There are too many people trying to do the same thing.

Take out is the best option for me.  When you have to wait for a table either you are waiting outside or you are next to someone's table standing over their food. The place cannot accommodate large parties at convienience.  They do not take reservations.  I will definitely eat here again, but will probably think twice if I want to dine for lunch.
author: Samrang N.

description:
I was not sure I wanted to take my friends' advice on getting the garlic noodles because I wanted soup so bad (freezing outside), but so glad I did! 

Omg so delicious and tasted it with pork and chicken. Chicken was way better with it in my humble opinion. They come with egg rolls and fish sauce. I wish they made these in San Diego. Highly recommend getting this dish! Large portions. You can totally share. 

Cheers!
author: Maurice A.

description:
It's very good! That's it. 

Oh, I'm not helpful? Fine, it's your typical pho and other standard viet fare, except that it stands out from the rest of the crowd in savory flavors, low greasiness (especially in the soups). The combo pho has surprisingly not so much funky meat like most other pho places, but the soup is really good and it's overall a solid pho experience.
author: Paolo D.

description:
Nothing out of the ordinary in terms of pho, truth be told.  Maybe we should have ordered the noodles instead?!  

The decor is nice (kinda gives a Spanish/tapas place feel).  The guy who takes the orders is great (I'm assuming he always takes the orders... he took all the orders the day we were there, walking around, cracking jokes)... funny, friendly, and just generally fun to observe.  

May go back if I'm in the area, for the noodles, but definitely not going to haul ass to the sunset especially to eat there.
author: Vandana N.

description:
We got takeout from this place and LOVED the garlic noodle/ 5-spice chicken combo. The pho, however, was not very good. 

Garlic Noodle/ 5-spice chicken combo: Garlic noodles are chewy, buttery and delicious. Not SUPER flavorful but a great starch to the chicken. I'm pretty picky about my meat quality but the chicken was good! It wasn't white meat, but it was cooked to crispy which made the dark meat pieces DELICIOUS. I'd definitely get this again. 

Rare Steak Pho: Now given, i think it was a mistake for my boyfriend to order Pho from a takeout place, but he had a craving so I went w/ it. The broth was tasty and everything was just OK. We did, however, have to re-boil the broth in order for the meat to cook up which was a huge disappointment but now we know not to order this to-go. 

Overall: great spot for takeout-- we'll definitely be ordering again.
author: Sandy H.

description:
My first thought when I saw this place was, "Man, it's tiny!" then "Wow, there's a lot of people." Our group of about 15 could only get a reservation at 8:45pm (45 minutes before closing), and when we sat down, we pretty much took up half the restaurant. The owner(?) was really funny though. He kept joking around and had quirky comments like "Saturday is really busy here, you know, Saturday night fever."

After reading the reviews on Yelp, I got the Five Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles. Delicious!! The chicken was nice and crispy on the outside and the meat was juicy and moist. I think they used brown meat, possibly chicken thigh, because if that was white meat, I want to find out how to make it taste that good (I'm a big fan of brown meat, not so much white meat)! Both the chicken and the garlic noodles had a really nice flavor. I'll probably come back here to try their pho or get some more garlic noodles even though it's about a 45 minute bus ride for me.
author: Katherine T.

description:
5 spice chicken w/ garlic noodles definitely rocks! I was craving for garlic noodles, but didn't want to spend a lot of money on a Friday night.  Perilla is the perfect choice. It's comfort food at an affordable price.  No wait that night and was served the delicious meal.

The chicken was soft and tender, although a bit on the salty side.  
Will be back if my craving hits again!
author: AhLin C.

description: Great, casual Vietnamese. I wouldn't say this is the most "traditional" Vietmese place (at least from my experience traveling in Vietnam), but it's got good food, a clean environment, good service and reasonable prices. Love those Garlic Noodles!!
author: Desmond G.

description:
I found out about Perilla through Yelp's newsletter about the hot food spots down Irving. I am not a fan of Vietnamese food, but after seeing how Americanized the dishes were I decided it was worth trying.

I would have loved to have the dine-in experience, but the boyfriend was too impatient to look for parking around Irving. He kept complaining he was thirsty so I ran in to Perilla and ordered a Thai Iced tea. I told the owner I would come right back and order the rest and offered to leave my license. He was so nice, laughed it off and said 'Don't worry about it! I trust you! I know you'll come back!"

WOW. Great impression to give me. 5 starts for the service alone. I immediately came back to order the food and pay for everything.

I got the garlic noodles with beef and the chicken and rice plate.

OHEMGEE...the garlic noodles were to die for and the meat was savory and tender. I'm not a fan of chicken and rice plates, but I had faith there plate would be great and...IT WAS. The chicken was flavorful and had the perfect amount of rice to go with it. Don't you hate when placed skimp you on the rice and you don't have enough for the dish? I sure do! But Perilla was in no way stingy with portions. My boyfriend and I shared both dishes and still had leftovers.

If I went back I would just fill up on the garlic noodles with beef. Damn I am craving it now...
author: Surge C.

description: The garlic noodles here are to die for. I haven't had any better anywhere else. The pho is just OK. The service leaves much to be desired but I'll deal with it to eat the garlic noodles.
author: Michael S.

description: This place is really good. The service is even better. First time here, didn't really know what to order, asked the waiter who suggested te charbroiled beef with garlic noodle. The dish is of the chart! Highly recommend this place.
author: Zade T.

description: pho was flavorless.  food tasted like lightly repurposed chinese - didn't have the characteristic freshness of good vietnamese, not many herbs. and no limes!  (how could they not have limes!  lemon wedges just aren't the same). sauce for imperial rolls, papaya salad, and vermicelli bowls were chokingly sweet. portions generous though.
author: luosha c.

description:
It was the very first morning since I moved to San Francisco.
It was a little foggy and a lot colder than I was used to at the time.
So pho sounded great. 
Plus it was literally the closest restaurant to my apartment building.
I ordered the vegan pho.
It had broccoli, carrots, onion, mushrooms and fried tofu.
Im not a very picky eater but it wasn't very good.
The noodles tasted like they weren't cooked enough.
They were all stuck together in my bowl.
Even though it wasn't a meat based broth, I've had some pretty tasty vegan pho before.
I had to put a lot of Sriracha and hoisin sauce in my broth to make it more flavorful.
They were nice enough to cook my bean sprouts for me when I asked though.
I won't eat here again unless it's the ONLY place open or something.
author: Justine L.

description:
Stumbled on this place tonight and decided to go in because:

1. I have never had Vietnamese 
2. It was pretty busy!

I got the Garlic Noodles with 5 Spice Chicken because the waiter said that it was a popular dish. It was very tasty! The chicken was flavorful and tender and tasted amazing topped with sriracha! The noodles were not to greasy (as other reviews said) and complemented the chicken well. I also had the Thai Iced Tea which was great. My bill came to $14 ish after tip so you can't beat the price either!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Sat down waited 5 min for a menu, another 15 min for them to take my order (idts 8:30 on a non busy saturday night). Finally when they took my order they wouldn't substitute shrimp rolls for imperial rolls (they cost the same and I didn't want deep fried). Rest of stuff is likely going to be decent but sour taste was left in my mouth before even started eating. People need yo learn some customer service.

Also they use the same towel to clean the floor that they use to clean tables.
author: Michael W.

description: This place is really good for pick up. They give a good amount of food and its very tasty. Its not the best I've had, but you can always rely on a good meal. They don't have many options, but I definitely have my favorites. The papaya salad is nice because of the sauce and all the fried garlic that comes with it. I also love the shrimp vermicelli with imperial rolls. The Five Spice chicken and garlic noodles are also very notable. They have some of the better imperial rolls I've had, especially in the Sunset. They're always incredibly fast and nice about everything. The perfect go-to place.
author: Dexter H.

description:
My bf and I were with our friends at Blackthorn one night and our stomachs started to roar as we were guzzlin' our Gimlets and pitchers of beer. Their menu was at the table we were sitting at and felt adventurous. We ordered their "signature" garlic noodles and some rolls. 

- Sorry people, it wasn't that special to me. Maybe it's because I love Thai food so much that I like alot of flavor, and needs to be incredibly spicy. I REALLY love Garlic, practically obsessed. I felt falsely advertised when I could barely taste the Garlic, big no-no from me.

+/- Rolls were okay.  The sauce was super watery, whats up with that? I just prefer thicker sauces with lots of flavor.

Conclusion: Maybe I needed to try something else, or I might spoil my taste buds constantly with intense flavor?
