I guess I am not a really big noodles fan and like more to my meal than a fat pile of noodles. The impression that I've been stuck with about this place is that the food tastes bland. I've had realllly bomb Vietnamese food other places. I would maybe give it another chance if I went to someone else's house and they already ordered it.
author: Julia D.

description:
My relatives come here ALL the time.  So often that the owners know them.  So I finally got to try Perilla last night with my BF.  Parking as usual is always difficult in this neighborhood but we managed to find parking fairly close by.  FYI:  keep in mind that they DELIVER!!!

We were told there was a 30 min wait so we stood outside and played on our phones.  It was actually a 15 min wait, not bad.  I knew exactly what I wanted, 5 spice chicken and GARLIC NOODLES!  My bf, who was a little clueless about what to get and also never heard of this restaurant went with what he knew and ordered the 5 spice chicken pho.  We also got the shrimp spring rolls which I wasn't too impressed with.  But my chicken was delicious and the garlic noodles, well, you've read all the Yelp reviews and Yes, they're all true, YUM!  The bf wasn't too impressed with the pho, (I told him NOT to get pho).  But he ate it all up to save the chicken for last.  

As I type, we have some left overs in the fridge; I'm so excited!
Knowing that they deliver and do take out that's how I'm having my next meal from Perilla.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I should have looked up reviews before coming here...  Looks like the garlic noodles are off the chain.  I ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli bowl with the imperial rolls.  The chicken was standard; as good as any other vietnamese restaurant.  I was satisfied with my meal, but it wasn't anything extraordinary.  I'll have to come back and try the garlic noodles and update my review another time.
author: Anthony N.

description:
This used to be a mainstay of my weekly takeout schedule but i had to quit going because I was gaining too much weight.

My favorites were the five spice chicken or beef over Garlic noodles.

Friendly staff, good food, great location.
author: W M.

description:
I usually go for pho at Vietnamese restaurants (because I love pho), but since the person I was there with had been to Perilla before and recommended the garlic noodles, I decided to try them. I got number 21, the garlic noodles with chicken. I am so glad I decided to try the garlic noodles - they were delicious! The garlic flavor definitely enhanced the taste but was not overwhelming, and the chicken was boneless (thus easy to eat) and very tender and juicy. They left the skin on the chicken pieces but it was so delicious and crispy it might have been my favorite part of the dish. They also provided some fish sauce and pickled cabbage. I'd recommend dipping the chicken and/or noodles in the sauce. Portions are well sized - quite filling but not disgustingly huge.
The guy who works there is also pretty cheery and provides altogether good service. 
Note - they do have a bathroom, which is relatively clean, but it is pretty far in the back past a kitchen area. So don't give up on finding the bathroom - you just have to look for it.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
After all the hype from all the good reviews I've read on Yelp, I was so excited to come try the famous Garlic Noodles and Five Spice Chicken dish.  NOT up to expectation!

The food came out warm...WARM, not HOT!  I was disappointed already.  The noodles were too cheesy and you can taste that it's been sitting there for awhile before they had served it.  The chicken tasted just regular, which I've had better elsewhere.  

My boyfriend and I both ordered a plate, except he got the Grilled Pork.  NOT good either!  We barely touched our meal and the total came to $20...a waste of my $20 and lunch!

Definitely not worth trying and would never come back!
author: Nancy S.

description:
It was a dark and stormy night I ran soaking into Perilla, a smallish joint apparently operated completely by one very busy man. He was very nice and I was impressed by his ability to man the phones, the patrons, and the food at the same time.

Unfortunately the cuisine was pretty disappointing from start to finish.  The papaya salad was made from those super-thin grated strands that come in a bag... it had almost no flavor.  There were no shrimp, green beans, or tomatoes, and the sauce was actually an egg roll dipping sauce rather than the traditional one.  So that was my first red flag.  And the tea was lukewarm.

The garlic noodles with bbq pork and egg rolls was really greasy.  The pork was alright, but the noodles and egg rolls tasted like a coronary disaster.  The pho was the best part of the meal, but it wasn't anything remarkable.  I could have been hotter.

The whole meal was pretty inexpensive (around $30 for two), but I don't think I'll be returning, especially since there are so many exciting options for dinner within a few steps from Perilla.
author: Mari C.

description: "Five spice garlic noodles" is what made us come in and give this place a go. The garlic noodles were sooo yum and on par with Thuy Longs!!! The Pho is also good and the broth was fresh. I am a fan of the veggie pho for sure!! This place is a great quant little neighborhood pho place that is clean with great prices!
author: Michelle I.

description: I absolutely love the service, best service in sunset by far. I love coming here for dinner & the five spice chicken is my favorite! I also love the shrimp I just wish they gave more pieces.
author: Krista K.

description:
So I definitely didn't know this place existed until today... But I was one happy camper after my meal. (:
I ordered the FIVE SPICES CHICKEN PHO and I was definitely happy with the portion size. (: The chicken was so tender and the soup itself was extremely appetizing. Perhaps I enjoyed it a little too much since I'm getting over a cold and anything with soup makes my eyes sparkle and light up.. hahaha. 
My friend got the garlic noodles with chicken meal. It looked delicious as well. Apparently she frequently comes to this place when she's in the neighborhood.. Which I now understand why. lol.
Good service. The waitress was very quick with refilling water and getting us our meals. Yay!
Another thing is I didn't know PPQ (lower Irving) is associated with this place.... I guess I learn something new, every day. Hahaha.
author: Susan Y.

description: Garlic noodles...need I say more?  Everything I have tried here has been delish, you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I really love the garlic noodles with pork & egg rolls and the curry pho.  The restaurant is CLEAN which we all know is a plus when it comes to Asian restaurants.  Service is always prompt and friendly.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!
author: Wendy H.

description:
My friend Vincent and I sat in the car on 19th Avenue for 30 minutes to come here! And before that drove another 30 minutes from Milpitas!

Hungry guy + traffic in SF = Cranky monster.

Good thing I'm like, the best company ever and time went by quickly :) We danced and sang to EDM music while slowly making our way down 19th Avenue and FINALLY arrived at about 12 noon.

I think it was definitely worth it just because I'm obsessed with garlic noodles. I ordered the #29, which consists of garlic noodles, egg rolls, and beef. He ordered something similar as well.

For $10 I got a huge plate that I could barely finish. I think for what Vincent paid for, I got everything I wanted! The egg rolls were actually really good. The taste of the beef was similar to what I've had before, but it was also lean. I didn't have to trim any fat off. The garlic noodles were, of course, delicious! But I'm still on that search to find THE BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVERRRR.

The service here was good too. Sometimes Vincent couldn't understand the lady because she had a heavy accent. And we both thought it was weird that our water tasted like cucumbers. Yes, cucumbers. They put several slices in a pitcher they use to serve you. Normally, I eat cucumbers, not drink them. Nontheless, I didn't mind at all. 

I'd definitely come back. I'm totally biased, but whatever. Garlic noodles make my happy!
author: Enza P.

description: The only dish I order here is the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken, so that's the only thing I can really vouch for here. It is delicious. The garlic noodles taste just like the ones at PPQ, and it is way cheaper! The bf ordered pho, but he said it was just alright. I've never seen a wait at this restaurant, but they do always seem busy.
author: Lily Z.

description:
First the positives:

1) Their pork vermicelli is a 5-star deserving quality. The meat is thick, perfectly marinated and grilled. Pho is about average, maybe a bit above average. 

2) They have innovative menu (garlic noodles, five-spice chicken) that separates them from other Vietnamese restaurants. 

However, here are some negatives:

1) Service: They are super skimpy on napkins. You get exactly ONE napkin unless you ask for more, at which point you get additional ONE more napkin. This is okay the first couple of times, but when you keep getting into situations where you have to ask for napkins, it gets really old and start to question if they are trying to save money by being really stingy on napkins. 
Another negative point about their service is that they are not exactly friendly. We once had a group of 6 people, 5 of whom paid with credit card. I know this isn't the most fun thing to do for the merchant, but we also did not deserve a treatment where the waitress literally slapped/threw the plastic tray for the bill on the table and went away. Situations like this make you want to stop coming to the restaurant regardless of the quality of food. 

2) Cleanliness: The restroom at the restaurant takes away any kind of appetite you might have had prior to stepping into that room of nastiness. It doesn't matter if you starved for weeks. Once you walk into that restroom, you just want to throw up and starve for another week. It is disgusting. 
Furthermore, I saw the cashier sorting through basil leaves and sprouts on the countertop at the front desk!!! There was no tray/plastic barrier or whatsoever. The veggies were flat out laid right on top of the front desk counter top! Don't they have a different surface area, hopefully in the kitchen, to do something like that? This shows that the restaurant not only lacks cleanliness but also some common sense that you do not prepare food, esp food that will be consumed raw, on the surface that is not meant for food preparation (and definitely not next to money). Anybody who saw this would be gawking at the scene. Restaurants just should NOT do things like this.

Food is about 3 stars, not life changing, not inedible. But the two points I mentioned above bring it down to 1.5 stars, but I give 2 stars rounding it up.
author: Jane M.

description: Garlic noodles are pretty good here even though its probably not that hard to make at home but this is a good spot to come for a quick garlic noodle fix. Price isn't too bad either for a dish.
author: Kevin E.

description:
Food was yummy!

Got the grilled shrimp, garlic noodles and imperial rolls.  That all went with a Vietnamese Ice Coffee.  Went with a group of friends and they all enjoyed it.
author: Carol K.

description: My boyfriend got the chicken and I got a veggie rice plate. The chicken was super fatty and I had to ask him what he got because it didn't even look like chicken. My veggie plate was horrible. I had two bites and had to stop. It was wilted cabbage, with some carrots and what i think were shredded mushrooms. It smelled horrible and I didn't eat it...and I'm not even that picky. There are many restaurants in the area. .. we will not be going back to this one.
author: Josephine R.

description: When I am craving grilled pork, this place always pops in my head. I've had delivery in the past, but now that I no longer live by the Panhandle, I find myself craving for Perilla.  I'm not an expert with Vietnamese dishes, but I do like the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles. Definitely not the healthiest, but I indulge once in awhile. Everything in moderation; can't eat this everyday. But it's so good when I do.
author: Myra M.

description: The food now is not as good as before, if you have ever been there in the past. I think that's because of the change of ownership. And they have a few new faces there. The meat is not as fresh as before as well. Though the food is still ok, I hope they can get back to the quality they once had. Or else, I will just look for somewhere else to eat.
author: Darren Z.

description:
Not bad, not bad... 

Satay Beef Pho on the menu, I think it was #10. They did a great job on the soup base. It was thick and flavorful unlike some placed where it taste bland and full of oil. The portions are generous and it definitely filled me up (a big eater). Also they included a lot of meat in the pho. From what I saw, all their meat are machine sliced, like those japanese shabu placed. Very tender meat. 

Overall experience is great. Will come back to check out other stuff on the menu!
author: Eric Y.

description:
Garlic nooooodles!! Honestly that's the only thing I've ever ordered here. Never tried anything else there. Service is whatever here: you order, they bring, you eat, you pay. Easy peasy lemon squeezy. Never had bad service experience. They're just blunt. 

I usually get the grilled shrimp with garlic noodles or recently I've been getting the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. It's good, makes a decent meal, hits the spot, & is not that expensive.

To-go friendly, me and my boyfriend get that a lot. Pretty quick and convenient.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The fried chicken is delicious. 
As simply as I describe this, it basically speaks for itself.

Do yourself a favor: order a bowl of the pho with brisket and a side of fried chicken.
It'll make your day.

Went here on the Saturday morning after Thanksgiving because my friend was getting sniffles from the cold and she was craving major noodles and soup. Not many people earlier in the morning, but I've got no qualms about not waiting! 

$7-9 per meal.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Good, fresh, original Vietnamese. Had the charbroiled pork with garlic noodles. Fantastic dish. The noodles themselves would make a good entree. The char on the pork mixed with the noodles was awesome. The shrimp roll was fresh and flavorful; although, the waitress, recommended the Imperial Rolls. I'll have to try them next time. 

Staff was friendly. Great place.

Again, I want half stars. Not quite a five star, but I'd like to give it more than four.
author: Gary W.

description:
If you read my other reviews, you would know that I love garlic noodles.

Perilla does garlic noodles right and they give you a lot.  I always get the 5 spice chicken with the garlic noodles and it has never disappoint.  They always give a lot of noodles and chicken.  I usually get delivery from them which is awesome because there isn't many good places in the Sunset that delivers.
author: Mimi P.

description: I was very excited to try Perilla, as it is right down the street from my friends apartment. I looked at the reviews and pictures on yelp and everything seemed great.  I ordered the 5 spice chicken, imperial rolls, and garlic noodles. It was just okay, everything i had needed more flavor to it. It wasn't bad but wasn't great. The service in fact was terrible. I would not go back for the reason they never checked on us once, I had to flag the waiter down for a box and when I politely asked it seemed as if I was bothering him, when we asked him to break out $100 bill he absolutely refused and said the had no change which I find hard to believe on a Sunday evening. The waiter gave us so much attitude for no reason and for that i'd never go back. It's a shame.
author: Jackie S.

description: Garlic noodles, egg rolls, and 5 spice chicken or beef are all pretty good. I like their garlic noodles better than PPQ in Outer Richmond. Good lunch or casual dinner spot.
author: Caroline D.

description: Five spiced chicken & imperial rolls with garlic noodles. That is all. Good service, good price, & cute little place. My sister would drive from wherever she is to this place just to get the garlic noodles. It's THAT good.
author: Tina S.

description:
I was surprised to find the pho #5 to be pretty decent here (it came with rare beef and meat balls). The garnishes were not too fresh but otherwise still good. The portion was large for one size at $6.95/bowl.

The garlic noodles, grilled shrimp and imperial roll dish was $11.95. It tasted pretty decent if you wanted your garlic noodle fix.

Service a bit slow and the servers speak Chinese/Cantonese so that's a plus! 

Street parking or metered parking.
author: Jboogie L.

description: The garlic noodles are pretty good here. The complimentary sides were also good. Pretty busy place so can be loud at times. Regardless, pretty good fix. The noodles will definitely get you full.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Food: 
1) Five spices chicken and garlic noodles: This dish comes with strips of chicken, garlic noodles, pickled cabbage and some fish sauce. The chicken was very well flavored and tender. The skin was just the right amount of crispy tasty texture! It was good quality chicken cooked perfectly. The pickled cabbage really helped increase your appetite for the food and the fish sauce was made really well too. The garlic noodles smelled just as good as it tasted! Full of the garlic aroma! YUM!
2) Charbroiled Beef and garlic noodles: This dish came with strips of charbroiled beef, garlic noodles, pickled cabbage and fish sauce. The beef was very well made! So tender and full of bbq flavor. You can literally make your mouth water if you just smelled the beef on it's own. The garlic noodles really complimented the dish, along with the pickled cabbage and some fish sauce for extra dipping. Everything was very well made!  
3) Three color bean drink: I was kinda disappointed because there were only TWO colors and not three. Normally, there is a green jelly layer bathed in coconut milk, a red bean layer, and a yellow bean layer. 
 However, the green jelly layer was missing in this drink. Instead it was replaced by a clear jelly that is not nearly as good as the green jelly. But it was still pretty good, a bit too sweet, but still pretty good. 

Service: Kinda forgot about us as my water never even got refilled. But overall, pretty nice and friendly. 

Ambiance: Just a typical restaurant. It was clean and well kept. Not too heavily decorated so not much to comment on. 

Price: Decent, for the amount of food you get and the taste of the food. Very reasonable. All the dishes were below $10 and you get a good amount of food. 

Overall: I would totally come back!
author: Amiee H.

description: I don't know why anyone would complain about this place, especially people disliking the Garlic Noodles w/ 5 spice chicken! I crave that frequently, & it's a great value for the money. I recommend you order what I mentioned along with the Imperial Rolls. I think it's $10.25, & worth every penny.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I was craving Vietnamese food one evening and stumbled upon this restaurant. Hardly ever noticed it before, but it was a wonderful find. Upon walking in and sitting down, it was really stuffy in the restaurant and I remember the lights were really bright in this restaurant. Not too many tables around and they were quite close to each other. 

- Shrimp Spring rolls: Nothing special and not the best I have ever tasted. 
- Papaya salad w/beef: Generous portion and very flavorful with a spicy kick. 
- Five spice chicken w/garlic noodles: This was delish. Garlic noodles are on the oily side, but I loved the fact that the garlic flavor is subtle and not overbearing. Chicken was full of flavor and not dry. 

Service was good, the waiter was extremely friendly and chatted it up with every single table. I would come back for the garlic noodles. GARLIC NOODLES are a must if you plan to come here, trust me!
author: Tracy T.

description:
Omg I would of totally given 5 stars if it wasn't for the bad service! Well it wasn't really bad, but they don't pay attention and I swear I looked the cashier in the eye while continuously waving my arm in the air and he totally ignored me!

I got what everyone talked about ! The garlic noodles with the 5 spice chicken. The portion is kinda huge! I was not expecting such a huge plate! I wished they gave me more of that salad thingy on the side! And why me and my friend ordered the same thing but her has the pan fried chives and mine didn't!!! I was waving my hand in the air for hella long and no one came to me so I just started to eat it! I gave up trying to get their attention for the longest time and it was NOT even a full house!

Anyways the thai iced tea was average as well. The garlic noodles was a bit dry for my taste but other than that, it was a delicious meal and I hope they will improve their service and pay more attention to their customers and their needs!
author: Alice Z.

description:
So I had a sudden pregnancy-like craving for Pho and then remembered it was...dun dun dun... TUESDAY! dammit! The place I usually go to (primarily for convenience) is closed on, you guessed it Tuesday.  How is it that I always need my pho fix on the ONE day they are closed??)

Looked up places on yelp and decided on this one solely based off the positive yelp reviews, the fact that it was at 9th & Irving and all the amazing looking photos.  Then my roommate says her friend goes there a lot. Decided.

Minimum $20 for delivery and all the prices are around $7. Man, I want pho, but not that much pho. So I take the N, yes the N at rush hour to 9th and Irving just to appease my craving. So packed that I can't even reach for my phone to call ahead. Walk in, notice that all the diners are Asian - good sign - but then again this IS inner sunset. Read my book. "Lady your order ready." Great! So excited/distracted that I forget to check that everything is there.  Run for the N. Now I'm thinking this doesn't seem like everything is in here, but I can't check now because I'm smushed on the N. Shit.  Get home, check it out annnnd.....NO CONDIMENTS :( Why am I such an idiot?? I should have checked!  WHAT!? No bean sprouts, onion, chilies, basil, onion, or spicy sauces?? All the things that make up pho completely left out? 

3 stars mainly based on the fact that the condiments were left out (mainly my fault for not checking) And if you don't have the condiments, well you don't have pho!

SO, basically I payed $7 for beef broth, broccoli and tofu :( because I didn't even order it with meat :( The shitake were exceptionally chewy, and they didn't give you that much tofu (I mean when you order w/tofu, I think they should give you more than 4 or 5 pieces).  I was impressed that they put the broccoli in a separate takeout box with the noodles so that it didn't get overcooked in the broth.

I will have to follow up this review when I actually try their pho the way it was meant to be served with all the lovely garnishes. All the dishes looked really yummy so I will definitely be coming back!
author: Devin W.

description: Excellent garlic noodles w the grilled pork chops.  The veggie spring rolls are great with the peanut dipping sauce.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Great garlic noodles and good hospitality! The 5 spice chicken was tender and juicy. The environment was nice and the service was decent.
author: Maggie L.

description: Have dined in multiple times and food is always consistently good.  Recently tried delivery and they came within the estimated time frame (about an hour on weeknight).  Although delivery time is longer than most places it us worth the wait as there are few places that will deliver pho.
author: Sashimi W.

description:
Perilla has great food.

First and foremost lets talk about the garlic noodles they serve. They are incredible: garlic, butter and light airy noodles. This dish is a must have. The five spiced chicken is very tasty but my favorite is the curry chicken. A big steaming bowl of pure goodness. Their food is good, simple and really satisfying.

It's a small, busy restaurant and they have great food and nice service. They also do take-out and will have your order ready in no time.

My advice to you:
If you're in the hood, do it.
author: Denise S.

description: I got the imperial roll and grilled pork vermicelli bowl. It was so big I was actually defeated and couldn't finish my last bite. :/ So yummy, though, and full of veggies so I feel almost healthy. A++ for tricking me into convincing myself I can eat cinnamon cake and ice cream afterwards. Pork was flavorful and the spring rolls were crispy. No complaints.
author: Lady V.

description:
Sorry Perilla =[ 

I got the garlic noodles with the chicken. Chicken tastes as normal as normal can be. There wasn't anything special about it, same goes for the garlic noodles as well. It just taste like chow mein noodles topped with garlic..... 

Overall, MEH.
author: Maggie C.

description:
I LOVE the Charbroiled Pork Garlic Noodles dish here. There are a variety of garlic noodle dishes that come with your choice of meat; either chicken, shrimp, beef or pork. I highly recommend the noodles, regardless of which type of meat you choose.

The pho.. not so much. Although the soup base was good, I didn't like the beef slices in the pho, it was too chewy and thin for my liking. 

There are some vegetarian dishes served here as well (pho, garlic noodles, papaya salad). 

The thai iced tea was okay, nothing too special.
author: Nancy L.

description: omg... everytime i come to san francisco i have to eat their garlic noodles at least once! its so good and yummy :) ^^
author: Charles W.

description: This place is great! Friendly, attentive service every time I go. It seems like the popular dish here is the garlic noodles and five spice chicken with imperial rolls. My go-to for sure!
author: Amanda T.

description:
4.25
This local and small business gets a lot of customers so it gets really busy. However they do their best to keep everyone happy. 

Our party of four got the each got a different garlic noodle dish beef, chicken, pork, and shrimp. The garlic noodles were cooked fresh with garlic and butter. It was one of the better garlic noodles Ive eaten and the price was also very fair ranging form $7-$10 each plate. 

We also got the raw beef appetizer which was alright although Ive had better when the beef was laid flat to soak the lemon sauce. The beef here was served with onions and lemon sauce but crumbled up like a piece of paper with reduced surface area. 

They also serve pho and rice dishes but their claim to fame is their garlic noodles. Overall good small business place to eat. I would recommend this place to others and wouldnt mind coming again.
author: Robert Y.

description:
I have eaten here thrice. The first two times were decent with the pho and garlic noodles. Most recently (2 days ago), I tried Dish #10, Satay Beef Noodles. Dear God, I regret that decision. Let's just say the toilet and I became good friends for a good 36 hours.

I would have given this place 3 stars, but then again, who wants to be a better person and forgive/forget? Not I, apparently.

No love,
Disgruntled customer
author: T N.

description:
The Garlic Noodle is the hype of this place.  Honestly now, it's not that great.  It's just simply garlic + butter + noodles.  I mean it's decent, but it's not over-the-top great... Haha.

Anyway, I came here one night with the ladies after a long day of scouring around town, and we finally decided to pick vietnamese as a cuisine to eat for the night.  Looking on our Yelp app on our phones, my friend found this place, with decent reviews, so we decided to give it a go.

I ordered the Five Spice Chicken w/ Garlic Noodles w/ Imperial Rolls.  Everything was yummy.

What I thought was weird was on the way to the bathroom, there were workers cutting meet in front of the bathroom.  haha.

As usual, parking on Irving street is horrific, but we managed to find a good parking spot close by.  We sat down, ate and just chilled.

I had came here another day for lunch, it was bay to breakers day and there was this crazy girl parading outside the bar next door chasing pedestrians on the street.  Haha.  Funny.
author: Tina L.

description: The very good thing about this place is the garlic noodles. They are amazing. The chicken was too fatty and fried too long. The rolls both spring and imperial were just kind of there. The sauce that the spring/shrimp rolls came with really didn't add much to the overall taste of them. I wouldn't go back except for the garlic noodles. Too many other places to check out.
author: Ezra B.

description: Excellent garlic noodles that I've been craving for a while. The place is clean and staff is very friendly. I was seated next to the window, with a nice view of the street. Ordered one of the lunch items: charbroiled beef with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The meet was very flavorful and soft and the rolls were just as expected: hot and tasty. The garlic noodles really hit the spot. Nice place for lunch in the Sunset.
author: Mike H.

description: The girl who severed us was RUDE. She threw our money on our menus on the table and then she also threw our change at us. I called the manager after we ate because she was so rude. Thanh is her name
author: Samantha S.

description: Garlic noodles!! with eggrolls and either five spice chicken or pork chops.  Not too many vietnamese restaurants in san francisco serve garlic noodles so this spot is different from the typical pho noodles and the portion will fill you up! oh, and they serve cucumber in their water!
author: Def J.

description: I got the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The food is pretty decent. I thought that the chicken was good. The garlic noodles were dry and slightly sweet. It's pretty A-OK in my book. Parking is a pain in the area. The chicken is really crispy. Portion size is pretty good as I was stuffed after eating.
author: Andrew S.

description:
When I heard that my friends want to eat garlic noodles, I think of no place other this Perilla. They probably have the best garlic noodles in town!

You must try the Five-Spice Chicken with Garlic noodles + rolls (only 1 dollar more for rolls!). The chicken is not dry and has lots of flavor and the garlic noodles are just plain amazing. The portion is pretty big and it is under 10 dollars for most items!

Not only is the food amazing so is the owner! He is such a funny guy. He jokes about everything! You have got to meet him! Now go try this place out!
author: Pak K.

description:
I actually checked our Perilla because my cousin who is a Yelper is a regular here and garlic noodles always sound like a good idea on a cold and rainy SF day. So I dragged (which wasn't a hard task) by BFF here. 

The parking situation was fairly easy not anything like Clement St. The restaurant was very well lit and super clean. We both had dishes with garlic noodles. I mean let's face it, I'm all about sharing but garlic noodles, mango anything and ice cream, I'm like an ill tempered dog from the Dog Whisperer with food guarding issues. We had to order our tea as I guess water is just the norm and tea has to be requested. 

The imperial rolls were perfect. They were the right size and not at all soggy. The noodles also had the right balance of garlic and not oily at all. I will definitely return to try um, basically every dish on the menu. I'm withholding five stars until I can do that, which may be sooner than I think. Yay!
author: Alia D.

description:
I was in town this past Tuesday, running some errands with a good friend, when we decided to try some of San Francisco's popular garlic noodles. With his luck, our first choice wasn't open until 5pm and our second choice wasn't open at all! We settled for third and ended up at Perilla!

Our first impressions were that the restaurant was small and very clean. We were seated immediately upon arrival as there were no other customers. We started off with the papaya salad with charbroiled beef (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=zw0FDaMoxoSw2gnDUJVf4g). Man, the portion was huge! It came with freshly julienned papaya, basil, carrots, peanuts, dried shallots, and a ton of charbroiled beef. The flavors of the charbroiled beef and veggies complemented with the fish sauce DELICIOUSLY. Next time, I'd probably prefer the papaya salad with poached shrimp instead...the beef was a little too heavy as a starter for me. We then ordered 2 orders of imperial rolls (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=iWz-T5a2bmd2ferjrGJL2w) and five spice chicken garlic noodle and 1 order of charbroiled pork rice plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RNy3_hU1N2qyS5PVc9RaYQ?select=jyWQX5GrkY16ZcNdNvyLzg). The imperial rolls and five spice chicken garlic noodle were definitely a hit! The imperial rolls were extra crispy and filled with tons of ground pork and veggies. The five spice chicken was crispy outside, but juicy inside--it was sooo good! The garlic noodles were just A-OK for me...I guess I was expecting the noodles to be more garlicky, but the garlic flavor ended up being very subtle. Overall,  I think I was more excited for the five spice chicken than the garlic noodles. Sigh...oh well, I'm still a fan though!

And oh, the service was great--quick and friendly.
Street parking was such a drag.
author: Lien T.

description:
Under the sign for the restaurant, is a banner that reads: 5-Spice chicken and garlic noodles. They might as well name the restaurant that because it's their star dish. 

I'm a breast man (when it comes to chicken, duh!) but they serve a juicy piece of grilled leg meat that I just can't deny. The combination of the 5-Spice chicken, the sweet dipping sauce and the garlic noodles is a match made in heaven. 

I could eat those noodles everyday of my life. Who doesn't love butter & garlic? If you don't, we can't be friends. Nice knowing you! 

The prices are reasonable and the host/owner guy is a hoot! He made our birthday gathering fun and he was very entertaining (drunk?).
author: Joshua C.

description:
Very good deals with garlic noodles!

I ordered the 5 spiced chicken with garlic noodles!!! 
The noodles were kinda dry but the chicken was hella bomb!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Garlic noodles are my weakness. 

For $8.95-$10.95 (depending on meat choice), you get a heaping pile of steamy noodles full or garlicky goodness, with a side of thinly sliced steak, 5-spice chicken, prawns or a variety of other items. Plates come with imperial rolls or without.

You can opt for vermicelli or rice instead of noodles. And unlike the Mission Street location, this place serves Pho - my other weakness.

Portions are generous so I always have leftovers.

And this sounds like an odd compliment, but I love their water. It's infused with cucumber :) The only downside is parking, so be prepared to circle the block for a while or take public transit.
author: Mariela D.

description:
I've had two experiences:

1) @the restaurant.  The garlic noodles were uber tastey and the service was decent minus my sister getting the wrong order.  I will say that fixed it in a timely manner to make up for it.

2) Delivery:  I waited for food to be delivered for 2 hours. No courtesy call. I've called once after an hour and 45m to see the status and I get "any minute now".. 15m later.. "oh the driver just left."  dot dot dot.  Food was OK but not worth waiting two hours.. ME HUNGRY!!!!
author: Chris O.

description:
Hubby and I came here tonight to try something new. 

Sure glad we did cause I'm in love with the garlic noodles and five spice chicken. My husband ordered Pho and he said it was pretty good. We saw folks ordering the curry which is what we will have to try next time. 

We also order the Imperial rolls which were ok but not the best.. we've had better.

Left full and satisfied...we'll be back to try other things.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Oh my Flying Spaghetti Monster, the five-spice chicken pho is the perfect food for when you're not feeling well. I don't know how authentic it is, but I don't care--it tastes sooooooo good.

I also recommend the cabbage salad--I got it as a side to build up my delivery order to the minimum charge, and it could easily be a meal unto itself. Really tasty, good proportion of all the ingredients.

Delivery was fast, food was fresh, this is now my go-to Vietnamese place.
author: Jen D.

description:
If you were a magician, but you didn't know how to do a certain trick, would you advertise that trick?  Would you claim to know how to amaze with that trick?  Would it be on your specialty list?  Let's pretend this trick is how to make PHO.  Let's go out on a limb and say that you don't have a snowball's chance in a stripper's cleavage to cook pho.  Would you stencil that magic trick on your new glass windows?  Would you feature it on your limited menu of specialized magic tricks?  

Or would you omit it until you could actually perform that trick?  Something along the lines of: I'm sorry, that's not part of the boutique magic tricks provided.  Shoot down any mention of the trick until it can be performed without your beautiful assistant dying a bloody, dismembering death?  Sounds like the smart thing to do, right?  Good help is so hard to find these days and parents get more and more upset when performers die in front of their kids.  Like snuff films.  

The moral of the story: don't advertise pho unless you can do it well.  If the garlic noodles are your thing, don't try to edge in on the pho market by claiming that you can cut that poor woman in half.  AND put her back together.  We know the magic trick only works once.  It's good until the first bite.  

The soup was bland and not salty, like hot steamy water.  I had to put fish sauce in the broth.  And I usually NEVER add anything directly to the broth except basil and jalapeno.  The meatballs were filthy.  They had the consistency of Chef Boy-r-dee.  I should have known that Perilla made a strategic choice not to use the word "BEEF" balls but instead "meat" balls.  Small, the size of GI Joe's nuts, and about the same pale, fleshy color.  

Thai iced tea was also watered down and not the tangerine yellow.  It had no flavor.  Not even sweet.
author: Christina C.

description:
Seriously one of my absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurants I've found in the bay yet!

They know me as the peculiar dude that always orders the same thing: Imperial rolls + charbroiled pork over vermicelli, extra rolls + pork. "How is your favorite dish," they ask, to which my reply always is: "excellent!!"

Never fear, I've tried most of the other dishes and so have my friends, they are all choice. Give em a go!

The seating and service are comfortable and fast. The prices are fairly reasonable.
author: J H.

description:
CHEAP EATS!! 

Parking of course is difficult in this area, especially during lunch and dinner hours.

Definitely a good place to go for some garlic noodles. Not as expensive as Thanh Long, which is a def. plus. The portions are very filling. But keep in mind if you do take home some leftovers they aren't that great when it isn't fresh. 

This place isn't recommended for large groups, since its a little small restaurant. I would say 4 max.
author: Joeleen C.

description:
Perilla is my go-to lunch spot when I'm on my own.  I LOVE their vermicelli bowls, they are by far the best in the Inner Sunset!  I always get the bun thit nuong with cha gio (grilled pork with fried spring rolls for you non-Vietnamese speakers), and it's never a disappointment.  The pork is marinated in something addictive, because I can't get enough!  The fish sauce is perfect and a great compliment to the salad.  I adore the owner, he remembers me every time.

I've also tried their garlic noodles, which are amazing, though not really my thing.  I prefer the lightness of the bun to the richness of the garlic noodles.  

Prices are great, and service is quick.  I can be found here on weekends whenever I have a bun craving!
author: Rachael J.

description:
Perilla did not necessarily disappoint, but it did not wow me either. The decor is decent and the staff is friendly.

The pork spring rolls (not the fried kind) were very good, and the garlic noodles with pork were very filling.  The noodles, although chewy and buttery (in a good way), lacked in garlic flavor. If you are famous for your garlic noodles, I expect a sucker punch of garlic, not a baby slap.. 

We also shared the spicy beef pho, which was not that spicy, and something was off about the broth (it had a shrimp-like aftertaste?). However, this place definitely does not skimp on ingredients!

All in all, a good meal at a great value. You pay for what you get.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Party of 11. Fifteen minute wait @ 7:45pm on a Wednesday night. Not bad.

I had no idea this place existed, but it is forever engrained in my mind now. Not knowing what to look for, some of us couldn't help but notice the giant yellow banner saying "Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles". Sold.

It's 7.95, but for $1 more, throw in some Imperial Rolls! The rolls were crunchy to perfection, and the chicken seasoned well, moist and juicy. The garlic noodles were kind of dry and stuck to itself, but nonetheless it's garlicky flavor completed my plate of newfound happiness. You can't go wrong with this! 

The portion was more than enough to leave me satisfied I had to stop myself from eating more despite my stomach's content so I could have some the next day. But I could have finished it.

I also sampled my friends yellow curry, which was delicious with a kick!

Service was easy and efficient for our large party.

Will most definitely be back!
author: michelle f.

description:
Not the best pho I've had but it was a rainy depressing day and pho is always a great comfort food.  I got the #1 which is the Perilla combo pho soup.  The broth was bland so I had to add a few sauces and I NEVER add sauces to my noodle soups.  I'm a broth purist and I don't mind if it's a teensy bit bland as long as there is some flavor but on this particular night, the broth just wasn't doing it for me.  The noodles were a little overcooked, too.  The service was a bit slow as it took me ages to get my water refilled.  

On a more positive note, the portions are quite generous and the setting is very clean and comfortable.  Would I go again?  Maybe.  If I were in the Sunset area and I was craving pho, then yes.  But if I have my car and I can trek 20 more minutes to another locale, I'd probably opt for something in the tenderloin.
author: Karen N.

description: Garlic noodles with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. Enough said!
author: Peter D.

description:
Yum! Great five spiced chicken! I think I will ask for extra garlic next time.

Pho is perfectly cooked too. +Cheery, thoughtful service. It's happiness!
author: Margaret S.

description:
I have never been a huge fan of garlic, but after reading reviews after reviews on Perilla and its garlic noodles, I gave in and tried it.  

As our first try at Perilla, my husband and I shared a bun with pork and five spices chicken with garlic noodles.  Wow, they were both really delicious.  The garlic noodles only had a hint of garlic taste as some yelpers mentioned; they are chewy and buttery and hard to stop eating.  The side of pickled cabbage serves as a nice balance to the rich and fatty meat and noodles. The pork and chicken are both super tasty.  The best part about them is that they didn't have too much fatty parts that I have to discard: a problem fairly prevalent with places like Yummy Yummy.  

All in all, Perilla may be a better choice than PPQ or Yummy Yummy in the following ways:
--it's cleaner, less crowded, less wait. 
--service is just as friendly
--price is just as low
--meat is tastier and leaner than Yummy Yummy
--PPQ doesn't have garlic noodles

I can't believe it took us this long to finally come here!
author: Candice B.

description:
perilla n.
1. An annual Asian plant (Perilla frutescens) having opposite leaves, a bell-shaped calyx, and flowers with a short, white, tubular corolla. (thefreedictionary.com)

Uh... Asian? Really? Don't let the name fool you - this place is not a fancy, hoity-toity restaurant. Heck, I wouldn't have even thought it to be a Vietnamese pho/garlic noodle joint if I wasn't introduced to it after my obsessive run for garlic noodle places, which coincidently included PPQ Dungeness Island (sister restaurant). 

All you need to know/try at this place are:
-garlic noodles
-imperial rolls
-your choice of meat 

Five spice chicken is definitely their most popular, but I also love the charboiled pork because my burps smell less horrible after eating it. Sometimes the garlic noodles could use a little more garlic but it's delicious either way.

Although I think their pho is decent and comes with a hefty portion of noodles, the soup flavor is a little lacking.

For the price point ($7-12) and location, I love coming back for a casual lunch or dinner.
author: Liana L.

description:
Do I miss Toasties?  YES!

Was replacing it with Perilla a bad idea?  NO!

For a mere $8.95 you get perfectly seasoned Five Spices Chicken, delectable crispy Imperial Rolls and buttery Garlic Noodle good-ness!  Also, I LOVE their Thai Iced Teas here!  It was a perfect balance between tea and sweets - so good I even took one home to go lol.

My GF ordered their #5 which was something with beef balls and Pho.  It's okay.  Don't come here for that but their famed garlic noodles.

==========

-.5 Star for not being able to kiss the GF after because of my garlic breath

*4.5 Stars out of 5*
author: Chris Y.

description:
We have been here many, many times since learning about them at the Inner Sunset Neighborhood Street Fair. At the fair, they gave out samples of the Garlic Noodles...and that's what brought us in.

My personal favorite is the 5-Spice Chicken, but  any of the combinations with Garlic Noodles work for me. Food comes out fast.

My kids love the place, guests we have brought love the place.  What more can you ask for?
author: Scot B.

description: This is where I go for garlic noodles without breaking the bank (for fans of the well-known PPQ, Perilla is owned by the same people). While the garlic noodles may be too plain for some, for me the subtlety of butter and an abundance of minced garlic, works...more than works, actually. I usually get the garlic noodle + 5-spice chicken plate because the chicken is always juicy and the skin is crispy. I reheat the leftovers the next day and the food is just as mouthwatering as it was at first bite! (My mom would even pack food from here for me to have while I was away at college..and Perilla made studying for midterms and finals a lot less painful.) I have noticed that their prices may vary a bit depending on what location you go to (maybe because of differing rent costs?) but no matter which branch you visit, Perilla is still quite affordable.
author: Caralisa L.

description:
I've been such a bad yelper.  And who knew?  I was holding up my reviews right when I hit 420 reviews.  hah go figure.

Plus, I feel so insufficient in my reviews compared to Patra B with the photo and all, but I'll give it my best shot.  

It was a good suggestion for Perilla since I've never heard of it before and it had some of my favorite Vietnamese dishes like garlic noodles and grilled marinated meat.  

Alas, there was no disappointment for this stomach.   Imperial Rolls were fried to expectations.  The Charbroiled Prawns were well flavored while the garlic noodles weren't as good as PPQ but close to.  It was grand opening, so we were given free thai ice tea as a compliment.  Can't beat that!
author: Vincent K.

description:
PPQ Garlic noodles in an informal setting, sign me up!

No crab here, but the noodles with shrimp is amazing. If they were healthier., I'd eat here once a week.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I've been here 4 times now and the food has been consistently good. The people are really friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is pleasant.

This is a great addition to an already lunch-option-rich neighborhood.

Strangely, Quarterflash, Harden My Heart was playing the last time I had lunch there. I've heard this song before at other restaurants in this neighborhood. Is this the official lunchtime song of the Inner Sunset?  I'm paying attention now and will document future Quarterflash hearings.
author: Horace A.

description:
This place is a deal!

The garlic noodle set is totally worth it...for its price.

Honestly, the garlic noodles here aren't all that great. They're kind of dry and lack...something.

But hey, for it's price, it's totally worth it!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
There are good things and not so good things about Perilla.  

On the positive side are the garlic noodles (big surprise eh).  I personally enjoy doing this with the five spice chicken and imperial roll but beef is fine too. I've also liked the vermicelli noodles here, which is a pretty standard offering difficult to screw up. 

On the negative side is the pho.  Could be one of the most mediocre bowls I've ever had. Just not tasty, the noodles were sticking together and the beef not too high quality. Maybe a bad day when I had it but I wasn't impressed. 

Basically, stick with the garlic noodles.
author: Michael S.

description:
I ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls.  The garlic noodles were really delicious and had a large amount. When the dish first came out, I thought it was rather small, but the noodles really fill you up and are really good!  The chicken was good, kind of greasy though, but I liked it because it was crisp and moist.  The imperial rolls were okay, not really my favorite, but was very crunchy. 

Never tried the Pho here and I don't plan to.  It just looks like a very Americanized Vietnamese Restaurant and I just wouldn't order the Pho here.
author: Josie L.

description:
Hmm... 

It hasn't changed that I am a fan of this place and I have gone there 3 times since I found it after my chiro appointments. LOL.  

However just one note... and I hope the owner is paying attention to these reviews... I think they are slightly disappointing me in regards to their consistency of food.  Those of you who know me know that I always stress the importance of consistency of food and service at restaurants.  A good restaurant knows what is THE way to prepare and serve a certain dish, train all chefs in keeping it that way, and stick with it.

Well, every single time I've been here, I've ordered the exact same thing.  Rare beef pho and Thai iced tea. Well, they still taste great.  However I no longer have my praise about the perfectly layered sliced of rare beef, and LOTS of them, like I used to.

The second and third time I've been here, it seems like they stopped layering the meat in the center of the bowl like pretty pink blossom, and they no longer are giving you almost 1/2" thick layers of meat like they used to.  I don't know if they changed the company they get the meat from, if the first time I dined there they were making things extra nice to impress people, or if I was just super lucky when I first dined there... But now, my bowls of pho looks like just a nicer quality version of rare beef pho and not something that knocks my socks off.  If they had kept up with the presentation and quality of my rice rare beef pho, I would've upgraded them to the glorious 5 star rating... but yeah, I'm sticking with a four....I hope they don't get worse as I WILL update.
author: Sascha O.

description:
I haven't heard about this place until recently when a friend of mine mentioned about garlic noodles at Perilla. I love anything with garlic on it, so I came here last weekend to try out the garlic noodles.

Came here with a couple of my friends on a Sunday night and had to wait about 5 minutes to get seated. I ordered a #27: five spice chicken, imperial rolls, and garlic noodles. It came out 15 minutes later and it smelled so good! The imperial rolls were crunchy, five spice chicken had the perfect spice, and you could taste the butter and garlic on the noodles. It literally was mouthwatering! One thing I don't like about this was that there were only a few pieces of chicken. But it was still a very delicious meal. When you come here, you HAVE to try the garlic noodles. Don't order anything else!
author: Vivian L.

description:
This place is well reviewed, so here's a short overview.  

Excellent Pho and Garlic noodles.  I recommend the Pho with rare beef and brisket.  It's one of the best ever.

Service was great, the place was clean, and if I lived here, I'd come here weekly.
author: Ed W.

description:
After a cold trying morning attending appointments around UCSF, we needed warm food fast.  Pho seemed like a good idea. The food here was about average but there a few unique perks to Perilla.  I had the Satay Beef Pho which was warm and filling but not nearly as spicy as advertised.  However, the Five Spice Chicken was divine.  And they had a side of broccoli on the menu which is an awesome addition to any bowl of soup.  

My other peeve was that I ordered a Vietnamese Coffee and it was served in a mug, latte style mixed together.  Strange since the asian lady across the way had her's traditional Vietnamese style as coffee that drips into the condensed milk.  Perhaps you have to be asian to have it served Vietnamese style?  And I was a little weirded out when the National Beef Company made their beef delivery to the restaurant.  My advise is stick to the chicken.
author: Nicole R.

description: Shrimp imperial rolls go hard!! Yep garlic noodles are exactly what you should expect: delish!!
author: Betty B.

description:
a bit on the heavy side. seems like the boil the noodles in straight garlic butter! Mmmmm... 

I had the 5 spice chicken. Definitely more food than I needed for $10.75. 

To me honest - next time I'll probably just grab the garlic noodles. Only 6 bucks, and it's still more food than I could possibly eat in one sitting.
author: David N.

description:
!! MSG - ALERT  !! - DO NOT COME HERE IF THIS IS AN ISSUE FOR YOU!

I was at Perilla with my girlfriend and one of our friends, who also owns a restaurant in the Bay Area. I asked the waiter if there was MSG in any of the dishes, to which he replied, "yes all of the dishes, except the Papaya Salad [and some other dish] have MSG". I can appreciate the honesty. I am not allergic to MSG, but passed on it, as I had a burger from Passîon (AMAZING, BTW) earlier. I went with a light Papaya salad, which was sub-par, and a dressing which made it bearable. 

My GF ordered a veggie dish with garlic noodles. She threw up a half hour later.  We NEVER have this issue at Marnee Thai, or Kevin's Noodle House. 
                            
                                                     IT'S THE MSG!!

In addition, the wait staff gave us sh*t for asking for peanut sauce.

I most likely not eat here again. Marnee and Kevin's Noodle House, you have my heart.

Wish you the best Perilla. Remove the MSG from your food, and we'll possibly come back. I don't need any of us throwing up again, and ruining our night.
author: Scott G.

description:
5 spice chicken, garlic noodles, and egg rolls!
all on one platter.
Can get busy during lunch/dinner hours.
LOVE the fact that their garlic noodles aren't too garlicy and just right for my taste (BEST I've had thus far)
Parking might be a bit difficult, but pretty sure you can found one around the neighbor since it's Irving.
author: Virginia L.

description: Garlic noodles, BBQ pork, & imperial rolls plate was fantastic!
author: Kristine C.

description:
After reading Yelp reviews, we decided to give Perilla a try for dinner and were not disappointed.  All 4 of us ordered some variation of the five spice chicken, which was perfectly seared on both sides.  I had the imperial roll/chicken combo with garlic butter noodles and was the only one to take home leftovers (being a slow eater and gabber).  But even the leftovers were eaten before midnight, as I got hungry again.

Service was efficient and friendly. Our food arrived pretty quickly and water glasses were refilled regularly.  Our group was also catching up over dinner - we stayed longer than other parties who arrived around the same time but were not rushed out the door at any point.

I can't wait to eat my way down their menu!
author: M G.

description:
As much as I enjoy trying new restaurants with quality food, I love the security of having fallback dishes at familiar restaurants in my back pocket for hectic days.  After eating here recently, I have a hunch that the much-reviewed Imperial Rolls and Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle would become one of my go-to meals.  

The highlights of the dish included the crispy chicken skin that did not slide off the juicy meat and garlic-infused noodles with pockets of pan-fried crisp.

The servers were cooperative with our efforts of seating a large party together, and readily provided refills of their cucumber-flavored water.

The price of 8.95 for the dish did not make it a steal, but the amount of food left me pleasantly full.
author: Andrew M.

description:
number 27 please! =)

Garlic noodles, five spice chicken, and egg rolls all for like, $9! I always get the same thing here. I actually think thats why everyone goes here. haha. Other than this place, the only good vietnamese garlic noodle spot around here is thanh long...and let me tell ya, your entire bill at perilla probably wouldn't be enough to cover tip at thanh long..haha. (its a totally different dining experience though. i love thanh long too).

anyway. the food here is really good. you get a large plate with a few side items and its all for under $10. i've tried the other things on the menu, and all the plates are good. the pho...ehhh...not so much. but thats not their specialty. 

the servers are all really nice too. they don't compromise time for quality of service here. people actually smile at you and refill your water. =)
author: Linh P.

description: Came here for lunch STARVING. Left the restaurant about to BURST from fullness. I ordered the garlic noodles with shrimp and beef and the portion was HUGE. I ate the whole plate because it was so dang good! Definitely coming back for those garlic noodles... probably will bring a friend next time to share the dish because I am not finishing it myself next time.
author: Jenita N.

description:
Seems like Perilla is doing pretty well... came here to eat on a Thursday night before heading out to Ovo... and the restaurant started to fill up towards 7ish.  There are plenty of tables with no reservations needed.  I don't even think they take reservations at this point.  This place has the same layout as Toasties except that they have more lighting to make the place look brighter and cleaner.  Perilla is now part of the family of restaurants with PPQ crab and Toasties.  The owners are chinese, but they speak some Vietnamese which means they probably grew up in vietnam.  So that means this place can't be too bad.  

Their menu is simple, serving from Pho, vermicelli dishes, broken rice dishes, and their (as well as PPQ's) specialty of 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles.  Garlic noodles seems to be their thing.  We ordered what everyone else had--5 spice chicken and garlic noodles with imperial rolls, as well as the charbroiled bbq pork vermicelli, and chicken curry.  The curry smelled delicious when it came out... but at taste, it was very bland.  The chicken and garlic noodles were really good, but I would share this dish as it can be on the heavy side with the oily noodles.  The noodles were good but a little oily.  The 5 spice chicken had lots of flavor and a nice crunchy outer layer to it... it was really good.  I'm usually not a fan of the imperial rolls because it's not as crispy and tends to be harder to chew... but Perilla makes great imperial rolls!  The spring roll wrap was definitely fried all the way and didn't have the "i'm-going-to-rip-out-my-teeth" feeling.  YUMMM.  As for the vermicelli noodles, they were standard as any other pho place.  For those of you who don't know how to eat it, it is a bowl with lettuce and cucumbers at the bottom of the bowl with a layer of rice vermicelli noodles on top and meat.  You pour about 3/4 of the sauce into the bowl and mix the noodles, lettuce and cucumbers with the sauce...like tossing a salad.  The sauce is really what makes this dish so good... if you don't add it, you're not getting the full Vietnamese taste and it will just taste bland. The portions for all the dishes were good and decently priced ( a little higher than pho restaurants).

Overall, food was good, service was good, and ambience was ok. For 4 dishes, we paid about $10 each after tax and tip.  I would definitely come back here again... Still need to judge their pho =P
author: Diane L.

description:
Those garlic noodles are amazing. I would say that I cannot get enough of them, but after a little while they're just too oily.. I do crave it every now and then though.

I recently tried the vermicelli noodles and the pho. Awesome! I split the vermicelli noodles with egg rolls with my best friend. It's a good sized order, but perfect for two people who aren't too hungry. The BBQ pork was well seasoned and had that grilled...barbeque-y flavor to it. :) The pho is... pho.. I really don't see how you can go wrong with it..
author: Erica A.

description:
Just came back from Perilla and I am satisfied and very full.  This is my new favorite Vietnamese restaurant!!!  Seriously.  

We ordered a Papaya Salad with Charbroiled beef and felt healthier doing so.  It was so om-nom-nom good!  The sauce they serve with it is indescribable.  Ordered the Rare Beef Flank Pho too - also hella good.  The broth was perfect and they give you just the right amount of noodles and aren't cheap with the beef!  Our third dish (yes 2 people ordered 3!!) was the 5 Spice Chicken & Garlic Noodles and it was pretty damn good. Not quite as moist or tasty as Thanh Long's garlic noodles, but definitely a runner up and worth the $7.95 since it comes with nice amount of chicken.

I LOVE THIS PLACE and will definitely be back.  All 3 dishes, tax and tip came out to under $35, and I gave a 20% tip!  Excellent value and extremely tasty but not too heavy.
author: Dee H.

description: Great food, specifically their imperial rolls.  Horrible service. : (
author: Tiffeny L.

description:
Ordered for take out. 
I haven't been here in over half a year. First of all, i think prices went up a little bit.
Portions got a lot smaller and lacked garlic flavor in noodles.
Imperial rolls were fresh and crispy. Meat was ok, seem like it was cooked previously and just microwaved.
author: J W.

description:
Delicious!
Had lunch here with my friend and enjoyed a tasty lunch with garlic noodles and beef. I loved the noodles, yes I did have garlic breath and a loud stomach for a few hours after but it was worth it!
Prices are $8+ but not too expensive. Service was friendly and fast. Definitely a good spot to eat and go.
Would definitely return in the future to try other dishes. I like the family chain of PPQ restaurants!
author: Miss H K.

description:
Perilla decked out in holiday decor was pretty easy to find on the streets. I wanted a good place to eat with my cousins, and yelp came through once again.  I ordered the imperial rolls, marianted beef and garlic noodles dish....which was portioned big and really delicious. The non greasy garlic noodles were so awesome! Even the pickled veggies were pretty good too. Cousins got the veggie spring rolls and the veggie pho (she must have liked it, she ate everything). The other dish we got was the 5 spice chicken rice plate (E. says that the chicken wasn't really spicy, but again he finished the entire plate). My aunt was a bit pickier, she's from old school 'Nam, so she knows good pho...she thought the broth was a little oily, and needed more seasoning. (She got the rare beef & beef balls pho noodles). 

Service was really good, owner came around to check everyone personally. Parking is street only (bring $2.00 in quarters, there's only 1 hour parking around).
author: Pauline L.

description: Been here quite a few times and I have to say my favorite item on the menu by far is the five-spiced chicken with imperial rolls and garlic noodles. And sometimes to switch it up, I'll order the charbroiled beef instead.  Everything is delicious and I always leave happy and full!!! nom nom nom!!! :) (see picture)
author: Shawna M.

description:
After a long fulfilling night of debauchery with no moderation in sight I needed to restorative properties of a steaming hot bowl of Pho.  So we dragged ourselves to this small establishment.  On every table is a crock containing chopsticks, and soup spoons, sriracha and hoisin.

When it comes to food I am often perplexed when ordering since I want to try everything.  So whenever there is a choice that includes multiple options I am in.  I ordered the beef combo bowl which included meatballs, brisket and rare beef.  I was not a fan of the meatballs but the rest was tasty.  It comes with a plate of purple basil, bean sprouts, jalapeños and lemon.  I of course dump it all in.  The only thing I was craving was more cilantro, then again I have an addiction to the stuff.  There was some in the broth but not enough for my tastes. 

The bowl hit the spot and if I am in need of its powers again while I am in the Bay area I might have to partake again.
author: Megan P.

description:
Grand Opening November 18, 2009
They are offering free ice coffee per entree.

This is their 6th addition to the ever expanding restaurants for the Truongs.  2 Toasties, 2 PPQ's, and now 2 Perillas.  An infusion between PPQ and Toasties, comes Perilla.  The Sunset district actually needs a restuarant like this.  

Five spice chicken with garlic noodles and brocolli
Pho dac biet
Bbq pork with rice
BBq pork with imperial rolls over vermicelli
Bbq beef with garlic noodles
Bbq pork rolls
Imperial rools

If you have ever been to any of the PPQ's............it's exactly the same,  It's Fantastic.
author: jason g.

description:
talk about bang for your buck!! $9 goes a long way here - HUGE plate of garlic noodles and bbq pork (or a variety of other delicious proteins)

PLUS pickled veggies! who doesnt appreciate some pickled veggies? =) we loved them so much, they gave us more. great neighborhood spot.
author: Jess M.

description:
Tried the pho.

It's the bomb dot com! Pretty good flavor and not greasy at all.

Goodbye 19th & Irving, hello Perilla :)
author: Miss H.

description:
Been here thrice and i thinks its nice. Twice I've had the Pork Chops n rice, oh and the Chicken Five Spice. I love their dipping sauce especially with the cucumbers sliced. Cant complain or not be nice, the food portions they give are pretty good for the price. OK i cant rhyme anymore!

The garlic noodles are good too tho. This is the closest place i know of where i can get Vietnamese Drip Coffee near my office. bang-bang!
author: Nick V.

description:
I've only been here a handful of times and each time I always get the same thing. The garlic noodle with 5 spice chicken and imperial rolls. The dish is delicious; however, there are times where it is not consistent. There are times where it tastes better, which makes me worry every time I decide to eat there. Recently, it was not great; the noodles lacked garlic favor and were actually too bland. Normally, I like my food with less salt and favor, but this time it was like they forgot to add the flavor. The chicken was great, but there might be times where they give you the ends which tend to be ruff and dry. So it can be a hit or miss with ordering this dish.
One thing is I have not tried any other dishes, which is my fault so I am unable to give a full evaluation and rate them. However, based on that one dish I gave them 3 stars due to their inconsistency. 
Also, if you are not fond of cucumbers like me, beware of their waterrrr!!
author: Diana L.

description: I have never tried vietnemese food and my bf is Vietnamese. He wanted me to try pho and I like it. He said it was just ok. We also tried raw beef salad and pork chop with rice. Everything is pretty tasty. And service was good too. No need to wait a lot on Friday night even though they were busy. Over all I liked it pretty much.
author: Alice K.

description:
Perilla is a pretty small and cute place that doesn't appear very much like a Vietnamese pho/noodle shop/

Their garlic noodles are to die for.  I couldn't stop savoring every single bite, and by the time I was done with their sizeable portion, I was left wanting more to feed my newfound addiction.

I'd suggest getting the five spice chicken garlic noodles, or their barbeque pork garlic noodles.  Excellence on a plate.
author: Loren L.

description: been twice this week and will be back for sure. the meat is some of the best we've ever eaten, service is on point and the pho is hearty and flavorful. yum!!!
author: Button L.

description: Garlic noodles, consistently great. Next best garlic noodle to Thanh Long. The 5 star chicken is great, but I have to say the beef is outstanding. The spring roles were great and the price is the best!
author: Monifa W.

description:
- is the biddy baby sister of PPQ . . .  flagrantly speaking Cantonese Mandarin, Cantonese, and English, pitching foods available *  I think the guy transplanted from a used car lot . . .

Flying solo today, dived right into the first parking space in front, in the neighborhood of the Med students.  .  .  Turned out it was NOT my destination, fantasizing about the tonkotsu broth of Saiwaii where I SHOULD have been.

OK, since we're here, having gotten a primo parking space, switched gears to VietNam mode, deciding to order something of wonderful 5-spice chicken, starting with those fabulous delicate delectable Imperial rolls, and staunchly determined not to have pho (NO broth today), hearing the guy apologize (respectively & APB across the whole room) to everyone ordering that there was no curry today, "How about trying something you've never had before?"
                       Instant cucumber infused ice water (bottomless)
Ms. wait person suggests that I order the Imperial Roll/Chicken combo Buun.  So, wise.  -ala carte would've added up to $14.00, the combo is $8.50.  Virtually, for $1.00 more, it would be an order of the Imperial Roll Buun PLUS the chicken thigh.  ???
Imperial rolls were re-grilled, but tasty just the same.  The chicken was well well-done (almost fat-free), but still crunchy & tasty.  -comes with a large sauce cup of diluted fish sauce. . . no garlic after-bite.  -and, so almost beside myself at the presence of LOTS of ground peanut.  -could not taste the "mint" nor the basil, forgot my wedge of lime . . .  Then the powerful VN Iced coffee to complete the experience.

Noticing that the top seller is the garlic noodles with choice of meat or prawns, six in its own category heading on the menu.  This just well may be the quest of my next visit, albeit the best values are in the combos, and on their daily Lunch chalk board on the sidewalk, entries beginning at $6.50!
author: Clifford L.

description:
reasonable price. delicious garlic noodles, flavorful 5 spice chicken...i like this place. 

for almost $8, you get a pretty decent serving of garlic noodle...a lot more than what ppq gives you...the five spice chicken was yummmalicious, very flavorful, it has a veryy niceeee crisp to the skin---maybe that made me like the chicken a lil more.......mmm mmm mmmm....


they're known for their garlic noodles, so stick to that...
author: Helen T.

description:
Garlic noodles, I love you!

They say that Crustaceans has some super secret recipe for their famous garlic noodles - which I have yet to try - but I have to believe the Perilla/PPQ's is just as good.

Perilla now delivers to my 'hood: 94117 baby, yeahhh! That means way too much garlic noodles for me.

My faves:
garlic noodles w/ five spice chicken (around $8)
rice plate w/ pork (around $8)
the pho is good, too and is still warm upon delivery (around $7)

Delivery requires $20 or more in food which is NOT a problem for me! :) Check Perilla out when you're on 9th and Irving or see if they deliver to your hood. If you work in the FiDi, there is a Perilla on 1st and Mission. Warning, though, Perilla causes food coma. :)
author: Deann M.

description: Pork spring rolls are some of the best in SF.  The garlic noodles have large chunks of raw garlic and I found them too potent, but the other menu items I have had were always good (vermicelli, beef, shrimp spring rolls, pho).  Not the best in the city, but the best option in the sunset.
author: D M.

description: This small little restaurant is a very nice and clean Vietnamese restaurant. The food is very well-made and everything I've tried turned out good except the pho (it's not the best in town). I've had the vermacelli noodles and the garlic noodles. Five spice chicken is delicious and the skin is crispy. I'd also like to add that the shrimp is really good -- grilled to perfection. The garlic noodles are good except I would recommend a little more garlic (just personal preference, I'm sure you can ask for added garlic) and more flavor. And depending on your server, they can be a little dense from time to time. Also, you'd think they'd be a little nicer to people of their own kind. They love to hover over tourists and kiss their feet while us locals get a "how you doing? good? ok, peace" and one water refill (if even).
author: Sophia K.

description: It's ok. Only highlight was garlic noodle. The pho is average and portion is small. Prices are little higher due to close to 9th avenue. Basil was not even fresh and clean. Probably wouldn't be back unless for the garlic noodles.
author: Larry L.

description:
My husband LOVES this place. Perilla this, Perilla that. He swears this place has the best pho. I of course didn't order the pho. Instead I order bun thit nuong cha gio. BBQ Pork with egg rolls served over a bed of noodles and veggies. 

I was impressed because I had a special request of them adding extra veggies to my dish. Usually my request is ignored.. but not here! WHOA, did I have a ton of veggies! I wasn't overly fond of the taste of the pork.. it wasn't seasoned enough, and had a tough texture. I saw another patron eating the BBQ Beef. It looked 5x better then my pork. 

Parking wasn't horrible. Park towards the beach side, and there will be more parking. Bring quarters for the meter!
author: Alice E.

description:
A friend told me about Perilla (near Ferry Building) have the best garlic noodles and that I need to try it so I was glad when I saw the brand new Perilla on Irving - yippie! no more driving 3/4 across the city for noodles.

We had the Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle w/ Imperial Rolls and Beef Combo Pho.  

Garlic noodle was very tasty, very garlicy, and non-oily which makes it a non-heavy entree. 

The chicken tasted blend, but good texture. 

Don't waste your money/time here for pho - it's your average pho, nothing special.

Fast service - just be sure to wave your hands to get their attention. We were in and out of there in about 40 minutes.  They actually let us get a seat even though we came in 5-10 minutes before closing time.

Verdict: 4/5. Will definitely come again for garlic noodles.
author: Joanna W.

description: The wait was long during lunch! So if you want to head to this place, you should probably go after 1pm. The food was good and reasonable. Had the five spice chicken noodle soup. The soup was kind of bland and didn't have any vegetables in it really but the chicken was good. Didn't have a bunch of fat on it like some other Pho spots I've been to. I will be back... at a later time.
author: Mariya L.

description: Oh, Perilla, you've won my heart for the having the best garlic noodles I've ever tasted!  Went here the other week with my family and we ordered the 5 spice chicken, imperial rolls, and bbq pork  My favorites were of course the garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken.  The noodles are thick and chewy, also perfectly seasoned with just enough garlic so that it's not too overwhelming.  Also loved the chicken--fully flavored and oh so yummy!
author: Kristen T.

description:
A great local spot when you want something decent, tasty and not too overkilled with grease and doesn't kill the bank!

I recommend the garlic noodles and spring rolls!
author: Joanne H.

description: Great tasting garlic noodles! Love the customer service! They are very friendly. Great suggestions. Will definitely come back and next time I will try the chicken pho.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Driving down Irving st., I stopped at Perilla because their "Grand Opening" caught my eye. Ok, so they opened a month ago, and the sign is still up announcing their grand opening, but I'm not complaining because I was given a free Thai Iced Tea. I ordered the rare beef pho and imperial rolls, and overall the food was good, but nothing impressive. Pretty normal Vietnamese food in taste, and a tiny bit pricey for it. 

I think it's important to mention how nice and excited our waiter was. It felt like it was the very first day of them being open. He gave us a lot of attention, and the restaurant wasn't exactly empty. 

Overall, I give Perilla 3.5 stars for its food. But i'm upping it to 4 stars because of that waiter.
author: Isabel C.

description:
yep, I likes this spot. Was here a few weeks back.

  Fills yer tummy up.  Garlic noodles and whatever combo is awesome.  Haven't tried them all yet, but will go down the list whenever I eat here.
author: marcus o.

description:
Beef combo pho was very good.  The rare beef was piled in a heap in the middle so it's slightly above the hot broth which made it not cook through - very nice touch if you like your meat pink.

Imperial roll and five spice chicken rice plate was a little disappointing.  The menu said leg quarter but it was just a boneless thigh - it was perfectly grilled, crispy skin and tender juicy meat though very light on the five spice flavor.
author: Elsie D.

description:
Take my breath away 
Take my breath away 
Oh yes you buttery garlic noodles you take my breath away and make it smell like garlic too.
author: Sophia C.

description: The noodles were decent. Not the most scrumptuous garlic noodle.  I think it lacked the chewy gumptiousness that authentic Asian has.  But I can deal with what they served.  The chicken was nice and crisp.
author: Yvette E.

description: Was craving garlic noodles so we came here. Yummy! This place has good portions and definitely will fill you up. There are a lot of choices on the menu and many vegetarian options as well. Prices are decent and the workers are super friendly! :)
author: Sze-Wing L.

description:
This place is at the bottom on the barrel when it comes to pho. I tried their 5 spice chicken pho and it wasn't very good at all. The broth was very bland. And the broth was also piping hot for about 15 minutes. I don't mean a little warm, I mean that it was bubbling for about 3 minutes after they gave it to me.
