No amount of blowing and stirring could cool this inferno! The noodles were typical but the condiments were very fresh. The 5 spice chicken was fair- its better and PPQ.

If I'm on Irving, I'm sticking with Yummy Yummy!
author: David D.

description:
They don't lie when they have their red banner that says "Best Five Spiced Chicken, Garlic Noodles" or something like that.

I ordered the imperial rolls, grilled pork and garlic noodles. I must say it taste amazing! Imperial rolls were crunchy, and a puts a pop in your mouth. The grilled pork was okay, I tasted better but the garlic noodles got me saying yum! It wasn't skimpy and it definitely gives you the garlic breath! It may look like a small portion but it will definitely fill you up! 

I already sensing a crave for some garlic noodles when I move back to San Jose.
author: Lianne D.

description: So this place is NO good.  I had the vegetarian pho.  I would think it would be very difficult to create a bad tasting vegetarian pho.  But this place succeeded.  The soup base tasted like dishwater.  It was just horrible.  Everything about the pho was bland and lousy.  And the spring rolls.  I LOVE spring rolls.  This place had THE worst spring rolls I have EVER tasted.  It wasn't light and fresh and appetizing at all.  It seemed like it was a fried eggroll hybrid.  The filling was DEEP FRIED and then it was rolled up causing the skin to get super soggy.  And this was a COLD spring roll.  It was unpleasant.  I'm getting grossed out just thinking about that meal.
author: Dee J.

description:
I've been here twice.  
Perilla Beef Combo Pho - not good when compared to for example, kevin's noodle house.  The soup was not piping hot, as pho is supposed to be.  It also was not as flavorful and rich.  
Imperial Rolls and Charbroiled Beef Garlic Noodle - Really delicious.  All three items on the plate were well-made.  The rolls were crunchy.  The beef was tender and the noodles had just the right amount of garlic and oiliness.  
Prices and portions are fair.  Service is good.  Space is not big but clean.
author: Lisa L.

description: It is really a 2.5, but I'm being nice. The food is cheap, which is the reason as to why I rounded up. But it is nothing special at all. The portions are small, and the meat can be very fatty. But I guess I understand for the $10 full meal price tag its fine. I have a bit of heart burn from this place. Service is fast. Located in nice geary street location.
author: Nikita K.

description: Can honestly say that these were the best garlic noodles I've ever had. Ordered the imperial rolls with chicken garlic noodles. We also got the carpaccio which was awesome.
author: Joe N.

description:
So here is the thing with Pho - Either you get something WAY too fancy and not really authentic. Or you get something seedy that you question actually ingesting. 
I was super excited to try the Veggie Pho here, as  I haven't found a decent place since I moved to the city. This place hit the mark for me.
1. The tables and restaurant were clean.
2. The service was fast and friendly.
3. The prices were GREAT.
4. The Pho was delicious: I had the Veggie Pho with HUGE pieces of tofu (A bit too big, but broke apart fine) Next time I will try an appetizer and definitely order Veggie Pho with Beef broth because the Veggie broth left something to be desired.

I will definitely return.
author: Jena D.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here this weekend because Yummy Yummy was packed and we didn't want to wait. This place is a block off from that restaurant. Overall I like the place. they offer a lot of dishses it seems that are not offered at other places. My main complaint is about the food. Everything seemed to be a little bit fatty for my taste. I got the spring rolls with pork, and it was very greasy but pretty good. My boyfriend got the rare beef pho and I could see that it was not strained completely. The food was still good tho, and the people at the next table had garlic noodles, which i think the restaurant is rather well known for.

So overall, I prefer going to Yummy Yummy, but if I were in the area I would give this place a shot again. The prices are very good, and the staff seems very nice. Food takes a little bit longer to come out than at other pho restaurants, so like 10 minutes. Lol
author: Steph G.

description:
i thought it was ok, my friend got 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial egg rolls, and i got roasted pork with garlic noodles. the imperial egg rolls were alright, the roasted pork was way more flavorful than the 5 spice chicken,

 i shouldn't of ate it first cause it made the 5 spice chicken taste like nothing. the garlic noodles was alright, it taste good but over hyped, and thought it would taste way better, i needed way more garlic. it was just a mild hint. If you considered yourself a big eater it aint for you, for my friend was still hungry, while i thought it just hit under the perfect spot. wasn't hungry but was too full. 

for the amount of food, and cost, there are way more better places.
author: David L.

description: Had ordered delivery and it came pretty quickly. The food was still hot and warm. Good thing is they deliver to UCSF but won't come to your floor. Have to meet them in the lobby. We go the Beef & shrimp w/ garlic noodles, 5 spice chicken w/garlic noodles and prawns W/garlic noodles. Everything was good but the garlic noodles needed a little more flavor. The imperial rolls were kinda soggy but It may have been the container from the delivery.
author: Ayana K.

description: I came to Perilla after craving the wonderful garlic noodles at PPQ Dungeness Crab which is all part of the same chain. I ordered the garlic noodle and five spices chicken combo to go and it made my night. For under $10, I get a whole satisfying plate of garlic noodles and a decent size portion of the chicken. This has definitely now become one of my go-to places for a casual dinner/ to-go night.
author: Kelly C.

description: I've only been here once, but I loved it here! My boyfriend took me here and previous to our visit, I have never heard of this place before. I looked on yelp to see what was popular here and of course, the five spice chicken and garlic noodles popped up so that was what we ordered and it was gooood. It's hard to find really good garlic noodles because a lot of places Ive been to overcook their noodles, but Perilla's was cooked perfectly. The five spice chicken was really good too. It was a simple dish with tons of flavor. Definitely coming back here again. I docked one star though for the location because the parking in this area sucks, but it's okay, those garlic noodles and five spice chicken is worth it :)
author: Faye M.

description: Pretty good.  Don't really have much to say except I wasn't disappointing.  The 5 Spice chicken is definitively the best thing on the menu.
author: Audrey K.

description:
When you're too lazy to go and get the food, this place delivers!

The food is not that bad but just the fact that they deliver is awesome! If your sick, lazy, or too hung over to do anything... pho delivered to your door step is the way to go. Plus the broth was still pipin hot! 

$20.00 min for delivery and it's freezy.
author: Anna S.

description:
I would give this restaurant 3.5 stars. .5 for the very jolly owner here.

My friends and I came here for my belated birthday dinner. Initially, I was suppose to go to Cheesecake Factory. When I thought about it, I really didn't want to wait, so I settled for something close by and simple.

We were seated right away. I ordered the vegetarian pho bowl, my friends ordered the imperial roll with vermicelli and garlic noodles. All of us liked our dishes, although mine was quite simple. Not much I can eat at a pho place being a vegetarian. 

I'd recommend this place if you feel like eating Vietnamese food.
author: Tina C.

description:
You can't beat good food at a great price!  For $8.95, I got the imperial rolls with chicken garlic noodles.  What a deal.  The service was great during both of my visits here (as I've said before, it's very unusual to even GET customer service at Asian joints). 

1st visit - I discovered a piece of hair in my imperial roll.  It was packed on Saturday night and we were seated close to a couple who looked like they were enjoying themselves.  Rather than make a scene, I waited until they left and told the owner quietly (I assume he is the owner since I've seen him there twice already) that there was a piece of hair in my roll.  He took it away and said "no charge."  Wow, I wasn't expecting THAT from an Asian joint.  Awesome.

2nd visit - I miscalculated the total on my credit card receipt and they charged me the lesser value.  They could have entered the higher amount since that was what I wrote on the receipt, but they didn't.  Two thumbs up again.  

Both times, the food arrived quickly on our table and I was genuinely pleased with the taste and experience.  Keep up the good work Perilla! It's nice to have another great restaurant in the Sunset.  I will definitely be back!
author: Christie X.

description:
The Pho tai was alright.  Not the greatest.  The Spring Rolls were pretty good.  The shrimp in them were a lot larger than the ones you typically see in spring rolls

I think i ordered wrong.  Almost every table had some form of their 5 spice chicken.
author: Lawrence C.

description: BEST vegetarian pho I've ever had (with a vegetarian broth too-  not chicken). They put a lot of work in the details of thisdish that can easily be pretty boring in other Vietnamese places.
author: Megan L.

description:
Had a craving for Vietnamese food and picked Perilla based on the reviews. I ordered the food for take-out, which explains the two stars.  Ordered the Imperial rolls/chick w garlic noodles, Char Pork Vermicelli and papaya salad w beef.  By the time I got home (20 min) the food was room temp. and the crunch was gone from the imperial rolls.  The vermicelli was lacking the cucumbers/sprouts.  The salad was a nice portion and very good.  
I will give this restaurant a try again, but will eat in and re-review.
I love Vietnamese food and one of my favorite places to go was Minh Tri and the #44.
author: Dee D.

description:
This place is delicious.

delivery 5-spice chicken pho + broccoli = amazing and enough for 2 meals!

also ordered the shrimp summer rolls- they were not anything special, and the peanut sauce was pretty spicy.

I have also had the 5-spice vermicelli bowl- it was perfect for one of the rare hot days in SF.
author: Leslie S.

description: This shit is sssssoooooo good..  Please, I am a big foodie; please get the Five spiced chicken noodle!!!!!!!  I don't know what they put on it but u will want to slap someone for not telling u sooner : )  4 stars for food.. minus one for service minus the smile :(
author: TJ W.

description:
Good Vietnamese food and such incredibly nice people. And they deliver!

I really like all of their rolls, papaya salad and their 5-spice chicken and pork with vermicelli or garlic noodles.
author: Emily R.

description:
Typical tasty vietnamese food, BUT with a twist. (Buttered garlic noodles platters) Delicious! 

Service is great. Servers actually kick it up a notch and interact with customers.

Pricing very decent, $6.75 a plate and up.

One bad thing is the thai ice tea's not sweet enough.

TIP: 

-AFTER EATING THE ENRICHED STARCH NOODLE, YOU MIGHT WANT TO BALANCE IT OUT WITH SOME VEGGIES, AS YOU MIGHT HAVE DIARRHEA.
author: Keit K.

description:
Not as traditional as some other places in SF but I sure do LOVE this place!

I love their Pho. Fast service and quality food! One of my favorite spots in SF.

Vermicelli is also delicious!
author: JM C.

description: This is my favorite pho place, hands down! Super fresh ingredients and great flavors. I dream about this soup in my sleep.
author: Bridget B.

description:
My friends excitedly texted me the other day about a new Pho spot. I was pumped. They made it sound like the jam. I thought to myself...finally a bossy pho joint, Ive been dying for a go to place that isnt in the TL. Not that theres anything wrong with that. 
I waited for a day when my resident asian was off of work so I could take her with me.  She has been wanting korean BBQ but I said this Pho place came first. Well, long story short, the place they had told me about was Perilla, and not only was it not new, but I had been there over a year earlier with the very friends who recommended it to me. Disappointed to say the least. 
Im not knocking Perilla for that, its not their fault I had high hopes, but I will say a year later, my experience was none different. 
I wont say the service was bad, because for that to be the case, it would have had to existed. I gave the waiter every possible cue that I was ready to order (menus on the side of the table, lots of eye contact etc) but it took a wave to place my order. After that we were on our own. The water cups are little rocks glasses and mine was 3/4 filled. I never got a refill despite being done with it before my food even came. I love my Pho spicy, and its pretty dang salty to begin with so water is a must. No water ruins my meal. 
This would be something Id tolerate if the Pho was good, but it wasnt. Super super bland. And cold. The noodles were cold which is cool, because the broth usually warms them up but this broth was luke and so the rock of noodle barely came apart. Strips of meat instead of round, which was interesting, but not better. So yeah. Generally a dissapointment. 

One note_ the dishes are all under 10 bucks which for SF, isnt bad. But yes,  they are forgettable and need to raise thier standard.
author: Ryan K.

description: Was on the way to another restaurant for some pho but parked across this one. My friend and I yelped it real quick and decided our fellow yelpers thought it was good enough. I gave the pho dac biet a try and I must say it was far from that. I'm a person who loves my meat, that means some fat and some tripe. The broth was alright and my meat was gone before my noodles were done. Let's just say this isn't authentic Vietnamese food.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Maybe I should have ordered the 5 spice chicken w/ garlic noodles?

Brand new Vietnamese restaurant in the old Toasties location.  I gave it a go since my standby across the road Yummy Yummy is closed for a couple of weeks.  Alas, it shall not replace my old flame.  The rare beef pho was just so-so.  Yummy Yummy has loads more veggies in the broth. 

On the plus side, service was very friendly and FAST.  The free Vietnamese iced coffee didn't hurt either.
author: Anita K.

description: Loving this place. Quick - great simple food - good prices!
author: Davis J.

description: Curry vermicelli noodles is a delicious alternative to pho.  Sometimes you just want a little more something.   Garlic noodles will leave you breathing garlic until the next morning -even after 2 toothbrushing - so eat with caution.  Delivers to the lower Haight.
author: Wakako U.

description:
A and I came here for dinner a couple weeks ago.  It was packed, but there were a couple of tables available.  A had read a review on Yelp about Perilla (but the other location) and it had mentioned garlic noodles.  I LOVE me some garlic noodles so he said he had to take me there.  Of course, we ordered the garlic noodles.  We also ordered a bowl of some soup noodles, which I can't remember right now.  I remember they were spicy though.  As you all know, I can't really take the spicy, so I didn't have so much of that.

The garlic noodles, though, were really pretty good!  I would go back the next time I have a craving for garlic noodles.

The reason I'm giving this place only 3 stars though is because the service was soooooooo SLOW.  We were sitting there forever waiting for someone to take our order.  The food came out in a decent amount of time, but then we were sitting there for forever and a half waiting for our bill and getting our moneys back.

However, A did say that he went again at a not so busy time, an the service was much better.  So I guess it depends on when you go.  If you want decently timed service, don't go during prime hours.
author: Kris L.

description:
Tried their five spice chicken with garlic noodles. 
Five spice chicken was nice and crunchy. Wasn't dry at all. 
The garlic noodles however were a bit bland a little too buttery for my taste.
Would I come back? I don't think so.
author: Grace S.

description: I came here a couple days ago because everyone was talking about how great this place was. I think the fact that I heard SO much about this place, made me have high expectations. I was a bit disappointed. I got the five spice chicken with imperial rolls & garlic noodles. The five spice chicken was good, & the imperial rolls weren't bad, but I expected the garlic noodles to be a lot better. The food wasn't bad, it's just that I expected it to be a lot better.
author: Cicily C.

description:
I like this place. Their combination plate of bbq beef, spring rolls, and garlic noodles is awesome.  The red been drink is really good too!Their pho with rare beef and flank is nothing different from other vietnamese restaurants.

Our server was great, but I think she was the owner...
author: Goldie L.

description: the food itself is tasty, but their catering services are awful. over the past several months, we have continued to order from perilla to provide food for events, and they have continually given us less and less for the same price. compared to our first order, only half a year ago, we are getting about half as much for the dollar. i suspect they have no interest in maintaining relationships with loyal customers. will not be using these guys again.
author: Lucille S.

description: Yummy garlic noodles, soft, tender and juicy charbroiled pork, crispy imperial rolls and a refreshing glass of Vietnamese iced coffee on a warm SF day = 4stars :) I will be back when I"m in the area.
author: Veronica N.

description:
Wow! They have done it again! Henry and Charlie just keeps it coming! Good job to the both for opening their second Perilla restaurant in the old Toasties location! I drove by today and noticed a "Vietnamese cuisine" sign up, so I decided to go there with my girlfriend.

I ordered the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles, while my girlfriend ordered the five spiced chicken with pho. Not much of a difference, but the chicken was good! They're also having a special... free Vietnamese iced coffee, or Thai iced tea with your meal.

I'm glad a restaurant like Perilla is around the neighborhood. This makes another restaurant within walking distance from my pad. Again, good job to the Truong's for opening another restaurant! Two Perilla, 2 PPQ (Irving and Clement), 2 Toasties (9th avenue & West Portal).
author: Edgar G.

description: Five spice chicken and garlic noodles. Get it. so stanking tasty. After Sunflower Restaurant, this is my second favorite place to get garlic noodles. And the 5 spice chicken is the perfect partner for this carb-y goodness.
author: Aletheia W.

description: Kick butt!!!  Had a flavorful chicken noodle soup.  My wife had the garlic noodle with chicken and spring rolls!  That garlic noodle is just as good as thang long BTW. Plenty of food for two people for less than $25 with tip.  Had to take home the rest. Definitely coming back.
author: Joel M.

description:
A friend just moved to the Sunset and after helping him move into his new place I was hungry and decided it was a good time to finally explore one of the many restaurants at Irving and 9th Avenue.  It was a hot day and cold Vietnamese vermicelli noodles sounded perfect so I popped into Perilla.  What luck!!

I ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli, with extra chicken and the waiter didn't even flinch when I asked for extra meat.  I always order extra meat wherever I go and sometimes I'm met with attitude so already it was a good start.  

The food hit my table and looked amazing.  The chicken skin appear crisp and rendered beautifully and all of the typical Vietnamese veggies were present and in their resplendent verdancy.  The taste was just as good, I absolutely loved it.  The chicken was bursting with flavor and the skin was, as I had noticed visually, perfectly rendered and crispy -- a great contrast to the succulent thigh meat beneath.  The drizzling sauce was well made.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp, adding just the right coolness to the dish.  This was the perfect lunch for a hot summer day.  

I'd definitely go back to Perilla.
author: Adam P.

description:
I gotta thank Big Moe for this one. 

The place is nice and clean and the service was great, but it ends there. I ordered the Pho Dac Biet and let's just say my buddy Phil makes better beef broth then Perilla, and Phil don't cook! His idea of cooking is cracking open a can of soup and placing it in the microwave. 

The soup was bland and had no flavor, if you want some real pho, go to Oakland's Pho King or San Jo's Pho 54.
author: Steve S.

description: Delicious, but they use MSG. I'm not sure how many other pho places do, but that was decision enough for me not to come back. Other than that, everything about the place was wonderful.
author: Andrew W.

description: Perilla blows the pho competition away! And- there is a lot of pho to be had in the inner sunset, so this is a meaningful assessment. The servers here are always very kind and helpful- especially the take out guys. They run take our from 5PM to 9PM for free, $20 minimum. I HIGHLY recommend the #2 Rare beef pho (Just like Drake said, it's the best I've ever had). If you like garlic and noddles, you MUST order the garlic noodles-- I can't even describe the massacre that took place the first time I ordered them, poor little noodles, didn't stand a chance. Overall, Perilla is quickly becoming my new addiction... I don't even have to leave my house anymore, what more could I ask for?
author: Morgan M.

description:
I wish Yelp can have an option of a No Star because this is what this place deserves.

I know Asian restaurants are notorious for having bad service but majority of them comes with great food so you can look the other way. But this restaurant's food is not that special that come with attitude that I experienced tonight.

We came here this evening and the place was not busy like other restaurants in the area.  We walked in and we were place at the window seat for 2. Since the window was open and it was a cold night, we asked to sit further inside the restaurant.  

The gentleman that was behind the counter had no problem with it but the Asian lady we dealt with did not seem too happy.  Anyhow, we sat down at the table that he was ok with, she came by a minute later and threw the menu on the table.  

I immediately got up and said I'm out of here, this is not the way to treat customers and especially repeating customer.  I got up and just walked out without saying a word, as I got closer to the door, the lady said, "what's up?" out loud.  The tone of voice she had when she said that sounded like a ghetto person in the hood trying to instigate a fight.  

This is a restaurant of fast food, mediocre taste and low price.

This restaurant will never get my money!!!!
author: C Y.

description: This place was so awesome. Totally a surprise; I came here with a fellow Elite after a quick visit to the de Young. I got the garlic noodles, five spice chicken and imperial rolls and omg, the garlic noodles were amazing. Everything was. It seemed like a huge plate when it came out and I pretty much killed it. And totally a steal for the price. The place isn't fancy, but it's also more than nice enough for a casual dinner. The staff was friendly, the food was good, the prices were cheap. I will definitely be back!
author: Courtney A.

description:
I was excited to try Perilla because of all the reviews and pictures of their garlic noodles. I split two orders with my friend. We got the chicken pho and garlic noodles with beef and imperial rolls. 

I liked both of the dishes, but was expecting the garlic noodles to be amazing, but they didn't impress me too much. Maybe I had too high expectations.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Parking sucks, thats the minus one star, but if it were not for that then I would have given them 5 stars.

I am very particular about my vietnamese imperial rolls. they have to be just right, they can't be wrapped in lumpia/egg roll wrapper, it HAS to be the porous kind to soak up that sauce!

garlic noodles are mouthwatering here! 

I usually get the bbq pork-imperial roll-garlic noodle combo with a thai iced tea.  sometimes the flavors are too strong for me so i get a side of rice to balance out the saltiness, the good saltiness i mean.

servers are friendly and sometimes even funny! but sometimes service is slow even on a day when there's not many folks.

its one of my go-to spots on lazy sunny weekends.
author: RACHELLE T.

description:
Went there twice, but very different rating for the two:
So i am giving average of 3 star over all:


 #1.   once when they first open, (4-5 star)
Went for lunch and i really enjoyed their garlic noodle, and had been recommending it to all my friends ever since!

 #2:  once couple weeks ago.  (1-2 star)
for dinner, thought to impress my parents  with their delicious garlic noodle.  Turned out a bit disappointed this time, food are overall more salty, and even the five spice chicken which were supposed to be the same from PPQ on 19th, were not as good.  ( I'd rather go 19th for that dish now, same owner btw).  And very disappointed with the garlic noodle, color were off, looked a bit burned and texture were hard, tasted like overnight noodle.  And the portion were very little, even less then lunch menu.

Not sure if i will go there again.
author: Jasmin Y.

description: I ate here for the first time today.  I wanted pho and this place did the trick.  I always worry when trying to find new place to get pho.  In the past I have been let down, but this place delivered.  The broth wasn't anything amazing, but the meats were all perfectly done and tasty.  It would be nice to have more of a variety as far as condiments i.e. hot chili oil or even soy sauce on the table, but its no deal breaker.  I would like to go back to try the garlic noodles.  The chicken that comes with them looks great.
author: Dan L.

description:
This is your typical Vietnamese Restaurant. The menu is basic; pho, rice and vermicelli dishes. One thing Perilla has on the other Irving restaurants is that they serve garlic noodles!

I ordered the five spice chicken, imperial rolls and garlic noodles. I also had the extra garlic noodles for 3 buck more because I love garlic noodles. Put in my ordered and 15 minutes later had my food out the door to-go. The place is nice and clean and the servers are very sweet. As for the food i was very impressed, taste and price wise. They are very generous with their portions and with the extra noodles i had ordered, i had enough for a lunch meal the next day. Definitely will be back !
author: Jacinta D.

description:
I'm a fan of vermicilli. Sandy's wasn't open once, and I had to try some bun of the Perilla variety. I couldn't stomach any meat, so I ordered the vegetarian vermicilli and received something unexpected. I really just wanted what I normally get, but without the pork, but this time the veges were cooked and the dish was not tasting fresh and new. 

Oh well. I ate all of our fried egg rolls and they were something to return for. Entirely too tasty. made this experience A-OK.
author: Anna O.

description:
Imperial rolls were a great start to the meal.

Curry chicken with rice, pork with garlic noodles and beef with vermicelli for main courses were all large servings and delicious. They grill meat really well!

The only complaint was slighty slow service, which wouldn't affect my desire to return. Great prices sweeten the pot!
author: S M.

description: Amazing veggie garlic noodles, they seriously are everything that you think they will be and more.  Chicken Pho is also the way to go.  Those two are enough to feed three people, so don't be scared, just go for it.  Delivery is key, especially on Sunday afternoons.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
When I'm in the mood for something light and flavorful for dinner, I usually crave for a bowl of chicken vermicelli. So this goes to explain the reason why I've tried the five-spice chicken vermicelli from practically every vietnamese restaurant alone Irving...from Kevin's noodle house to PPQ to yummy yummy and now Perilla. BUT I have to give the "Best Five Spice Vermicelli" award to Yummy Yummy. The proportions were a bit off at Perilla- too much chicken and not enough vermicelli.  Also, my bowl was only half full! The beansprouts, ground peanuts, and romaine lettuce was nothing special and not as fresh as  Yummy yummy.

My bf ordered the Satay Pho which is similar to PPQ in Outer Sunset which is no surprise since both are owned by the same people.  BUT the Satay Pho at Perilla is a bit lighter on the satay sauce.

The decor at Perilla is more modern, simpler and roomier than Yummy Yummy which makes it a good place for students to hang out. However if I'm craving my Five Spice Chicken Vermicelli, I'll be heading over to Yummy Yummy..sorry Perilla!
author: Shirley W.

description:
Kids we have a contender here!  Perilla offers seriously good garlic noodle dishes with crunchy spring rolls and dipping sauce.  I can't say I was a fan of Toasties (predecessor) and wasn't sure how close to PPQ this would be, but was pleasantly surprised:  few can pull off Asian Fusion in a casual way and do it right.

Now is all a bit on the heavy side so prepare for large combo portions, but the price is A-1.

Give it a shot.
author: Jim W.

description: Excellent rare beef Pho, the sprouts were super fresh, and the broth was perfectly spiced.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Excellent vermicelli with char grilled shrimp. (Bunh--salad). My husband loved his rare beef pho. Great service. Vegetarian options for noodle soup or bunh.
author: Suzanne W.

description: Nicer space than PPQ, but I favor PPQ over this place.  Nothing bad to say about the the food here. Because of the location I will be back...
author: p w.

description: My brother showed this place to me when I visited him in SF and we ate here EVERY SINGLE DAY I was there. Ordering the Imperial Rolls with the 5-spice chicken and garlic infused noodles was the best decision of my life and I get a little teary -eyed knowing it's more than 350 miles away from me here in LA. Great prices, amazing food, YOU must dine here... like, yesterday!
author: Rhoi C.

description:
Delivery ($20 minimum) is swift.
Menu seems limited with variations on a theme: 5-spice chicken with rice, bun, or garlic noodle; or perhaps a combo plate of pork & imperial roll with rice, bun or garlic noodle; or perhaps broiled prawns with rice, bun or garlic noodle... you get the picture.

But the dishes are well done indeed - the five-spice chicken wonderfully caramelised, the garlic noodles piquantly garlicky. Imperial Rolls are tight and crisp - perhaps a tad *too* savoury.  The veggie summer rolls are the best - the outside is not deep-fried, but the filling marvelously, surprisingly sauteed, filled with sweet veggies and mushrooms and bits of tofu...

Glad to welcome these guys to the neighborhood.
author: Claudine C.

description: I come here very very often and I am never disappointed. I always get Pho, the vermicelli, or spring rolls, all are just soooo good!! I'm not an expert with this type of food, but it tasty to me so I always recommend it and go back! Plus it always makes me happy when the workers actually take the time to learn my name and say hello even if I'm just walking by that day.
author: Natalie J.

description: Probably the best Perilla of the bunch in terms of food quality and quantity. The garlic noodles have a good chewiness to it, at this location at least. Five-spice chicken is pretty consistent among the various locations of this chain. My gf had their noodles which was alright.
author: Ray L.

description:
BELIEVE ME...

better than thang long garlic noodles. for $8.95 you get garlic noodles, chicken/beef/pork, and imperial rolls. 

better than any other papaya salad I have ever had.
author: K L.

description: As a Chinese-owned Vietnamese restaurant, the food is okay, not spectacular, but has big portions and will fill you up.  The pho is okay, not the greatest and the soup base is average.  The meat that is used  is kind of tough and not as tender as some places I've had.  The 5-spice chicken is pretty flavorful and the chicken is pretty good.  The service is quick and the employees are friendly.
author: Lawrence E.

description:
What can I say about Perilla?  I love it!  The garlic noodles are absolutely mouth watering and covered in BUTTER!!  I had the beef and that was cooked to perfection.  The portions are just right and filled me up right on time for dinner.

When it comes to pricing, they are just right.  And if you're not into a plate they also have pho.  Try it and you might like it.

The lunch traffic can be a bit crazy, and I don't recommend for larger groups, but it is totally worth the wait.
author: Rachelanjoli Z.

description: Loved the vegetarian soup here. My date had the Garlic noodles and can't stop talking about them. The staff is friendly and the place is clean and pleasant.
author: Emily P.

description: Perilla is and has always been a great foodie place for me and my friends. (dammit i have no friends as so it states here :(...) The restaurants is in fact owned by my classmate's aunt. The restaurant is mostly packed during lunch time whenever i go there and sometimes dinner time too. The food and service there is great. I highly recommend trying the five spice chicken and garlic noodles with imperial rolls. I don't see a problem with this eatery and I'm fairly pleased with it. However, I just don't think that this restaurant is super amazing and is not up to the level of having a five star rating. But four stars is a definite rating for its amazing Vietnamese food and good service!
author: Athena W.

description:
I really wanted to like this place bc it's closer to me than yummy yummy, but there are just a few things about it that have turned me off...

the first time i got takeout - rare beef pho - and by the time i got home (1 block away) the soup was barely warm.  i still thought quality of meat was good tho, i liked how thin the slices were, and i just figured next time i should eat AT the restaurant next time for hotter broth.

the second time my roomie and i ate there - service was SO slow even though we were the only customers!  i think they also skimped on the meat...i didnt feel stuffed like i always do after having pho.  also, their young coconut juice isn't fresh; it comes straight out of a can that i could buy myself at an asian supermarket.

i think next time i will go back to my trusty yummy yummy!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I was extremely excited to go here...first off, the Vietnamese coffee was served authentically Vietnamese style (with the dripping coffee thing on top that I don't know the name of but my Vietnamese grandpa uses it all the time) and the Thai Tea was great. Also, the presentation of the food is amazing. All of these yelp photos made me want to drool and I was so so so excited to try it out.

I got the garlic noodles along with the imperial rolls and the chicken, and I was not impressed at all...the imperial rolls were meh, the garlic noodles were pretty good but it seemed like a pretty simple recipe, and for my first meal of the day I was not inhaling the food like I usually do, and the chicken was very standard. By no means was it bad, but it was very average to me. 

My friend got the pho, and as a guy new to Vietnamese cuisine he liked it. I will admit- it looked very mouthwatering, especially after being disappointed from my first few bites from the garlic noodles, but when we seasoned it with everything it still did not taste good to me.. broth was weird, like the beef bones/chicken were not left in long enough and it was just overall not flavorful... I would say that maybe it was just healthy and msg-less, but my momma makes pho without much msg at all and it tastes much better than here. Guess no place beats my momma's home-made pho. 

Maybe it's good compared to other Vietnamese places around the city, but the only Vietnamese food I like in the city would be Vietnamese sandwiches...otherwise I have yet to be impressed by any Vietnamese places in San Francisco (would rather go to San Jose for that), but for Vietnamese-fusion cuisine this is A-ok...would not come back, but would not go out of my way to stay away.
author: Anna T.

description: Decided to dine here with some friends spur of the moment, and I wasn't impressed. I tried to garlic noodles, which I'd heard were good, and they were indeed yummy, but nothing I couldn't make at home. And the curry chicken was underwhelming and definitely lacking in seasoning. Not sure if the food was Americanized or just plain bland...
author: Gwen T.

description:
perilla is a great family place.  great food and genuine service.

Henry the owner is very friendly and so is the rest of the staffs.  always greet customers with a smile.

everything on the menu is awesome.  the garlic noodle is great but so is the veggie rice noodle.  the curry chicken is very yummy.  I would recommend the garlic noodle with curry chicken.  their new fried quail is delicious.  the BBQ pork is tender and juicy.  

I love this place.  a good restaurant doesn't need a thousand entree on the menu just a few good dishes is enough.
author: Jane A.

description: Do yourself a favor and dont go here.  the Pho and the vietnamese salad bland.  Head to YummyYummy instead.
author: Tom L.

description:
This place wasn't very good.  i got the beef pho.  it came with no bean sprouts, no basil, and basically no garnish of any kind.  that kind of seemed lame, but i was hungry and hoped for the best.  then i tried it.  blah!  it tasted soooo bland.  hardly any flavor in it at all.  even adding a bunch of hot sauce couldnt save it.  i've eaten a lot of pho in my time, but this is probably the worst i've ever had.  we also had the charbroiled pork.  that was ok, not great, but not bad.

not sure why anybody would go here when yummy yummy is a block away.
author: vlad k.

description: Perilla is totally solid, with decent prices. The pho tastes fresh, with better quality beef than you'd find at most similar joints, and the garlic noodles are indeed delicious. (The imperial rolls are nothing to scoff at either.)
author: Guillermo K.

description: Very friendly service and very fast seating, don't be surprised if its packed full during the midday. You have got to try the Imperial Rolls with Five Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles!
author: Aaron M.

description: Perilla is one of my favorite pho joints in San Francisco. The entrees are tasty, the portions generous, and the setting relaxed and clean. My favorite dishes include the flavorful pho (number one, which I pair with a side of steamed broccoli), the crispy five-spice chicken, and savory garlic noodles. Service is also prompt and friendly. Limited street parking is one downside to dining here.
author: Chris T.

description: My friend took me here & at 1st I was like WTF kind of name is Perilla for Viet food? Turns out it was pretty good considering I never eat Viet food in the city. I got the Pho Tai. The beef was so soft and tender and the pho broth was delicious!
author: Diane L.

description: Every time I have gone here, it's been nothing but satisfying..garlic noodles aren't the best I've had, but pretty damn near... imperial rolls are deliciously fried. grilled shrimp flavorful..service is excellent.. and its cheap!!
author: April C.

description: As much as I love their delicious food, I'd have to say that their delivery service is very disappointing. I've ordered from them several times and not once have I had a perfect order. Each time, there would either be spilled drinks, missing utensils, leaking sauce, a very forgetful delivery boy, or a combination of all things gone wrong. However, the food is amazing I must say (especially the 5 spice chicken with noodles), but stick with eating there and not bothering with delivery.
author: Nikki P.

description: Five stars!  No need to say more.  Stumbled upon this place and now?  Now--I am addicted!  Love this place.  So wonderful.  Light, healthy and delicious.  Never have anything other than the Pho. The Best!
author: Elisa B.

description: Food is OK.  I had better. The Imperial rolls were good. The pho was a bit soggy and the soup was meh.  I did not even finished eating this pho. Maybe I am a Pho snob.
author: Drew C.

description:
Since I heard good things about Perilla, I decided to give it a try. I got the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and charbroiled beef with garlic noodles for my bf. I liked the chicken and the beef, but the garlic noodles were mediocre. It didn't have enough garlic flavor to it and was almost bland. Maybe it was just this one time because I'm not saying I won't come back, I will. 

The menu says there's free delivery and catering. Good to know!

P.S. They're only taking cash right now because they don't have their card machine yet. Don't worry, it's only temporary and BOA, Wells Fargo, and other banks are within walking distance.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Grand opening on 11/18/09 at the former location of Toasties.
Had to try the newest Vietnamese restaurant because simply I wanted someone to eat.

Ordered the five spice chicken over vermicilli. Great portions and the grand opening special includes either Thai Iced Tea or Vietnamese Coffee with your meal. Food-wise, it almost compares to Yummy Yummy's down a block, but still good.

Since I chose the Thai Iced Tea over the Vietnamese Coffee after a long debate (I like both of those drinks...) and since the food won me today, I'll come back another time (ASAP) to order another meal with  free COFFEE.
author: Kim L.

description: I popped in here a few weeks ago with friends.  I ordered the BBQ pork, fried spring rolls and garlic noodle combo.  I wish the noodles had a bit more garlic flavoring to it as it was a little bland for me. Though the garlic noodles beat other places vermicelli option anyday.  Be sure to check your bill.  We were over charged by an extra dish, but the waitress hurried to correct it once we pointed out the error.
author: Stacey L.

description: I LOVE this place. The boss is really nice, funny and he actually talks to the customers and work. I usually get number 27, five spice chicken with imperial rolls for $7. Really cheap for a big meal. So far this week, I have eaten here twice. They have the best garlic noodles in the city. Going to be coming back soon.
author: Melissa G.

description:
the garlic noodles noodles at perilla are so good, you won't even know how much you crave garlic noodles until you have some.  when the food arrives, i'm in heaven.  i should really learn my lesson!   

in my opinion, get the grilled beef.  i think it is a whole lot better than the popular five spice chicken.  the imperial rolls, picked cabbage and carrots that comes with it are pretty good sides too.  

the portion is completely filling, i can't really finish the combo by myself.  like with most garlic noodles (and imperial rolls), keep in mind that leftovers don't taste half as good as it does when it is fresh.  and it comes without saying- be prepared for garlic breath!
author: Irene W.

description: Best Garlic noodle / vietnamese cuisine in San Francisco!  it's a clean little restaurant located on irving street with many other restaurants for a foodie to choose from. the garlic noodles here is pretty good for the price that they ask for. i'm slowly becoming a fan of their cucumber water that they serve you as you wait for your order... this place has a variety of sides on their menu to go with their garlic noodles... only down side is that it can get kinda tough to find parking during lunch and dinner hours... but you'll definitely leave with both a happy stomach and a happy wallet =)  approved for those who look for eat good without your wallet hurting afterwards.
author: Jeff C.

description: The pho here is kind of pricey considering the amount of pho you get. However the imperial rolls and the garlic noodles are the bomb! Plus, they give you free water!
author: James L.

description:
Five spice chicken + garlic noodles + sauteed season vegetables = yummy

I am so excited they deliver in the neighborhood! I definitely took a menu with me to go haha.
author: Julia M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here after having sushi across the street at Kazu (great place we were just really hungry).  I was really excited because I knew they had garlic noodles and I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES (Thanh Long is amazing).  We were seated right away.  Being Vietnamese I never eat out at Vietnamese restaurants because my mom cooks the best Vietnamese food period!  But the woman can't make garlic noodles so I gave Perilla a chance.  I was on a quest to figure out if this was a real Vietnamese place or one some other group decided to open.  Then I heard the waiters speak Chinese to together.  Seriously?  Ouy.

THE FOOD:
My boyfriend ordered the combination Pho and I had warned him that it wouldn't be as good as my mom's.  Well once again the girlfriend was right.  The broth was bland and the soup wasn't even hot enough to cook the raw beef!  HUH? I had the garlic noodles with imperial rolls (egg rolls) and beef.  It was alright not good enough to make me come back.  I also ordered a Thai iced tea that tasted deluded.  That is a complete "no-no".  Overall the food was just alright, and alright does not cut it when I can get the same food (minus the garlic noodles) cooked so much better for FREE from my mom!  Again ouy.

THE SERVICE:
It was fine.  The main waiter kept coughing up a storm which was gross.  The food came out fast.  All our food with tip cost us $26 which seems like a lot for a Vietnamese place (I'm use to going to the T.L for Vietnamese food so that may be why). 

Overall:
Will not be coming back.  I guess Thanh Long will remain my garlic noodle place... sigh how I wanted to like to!
author: Lyly P.

description:
Came here recently because I have never been to the one in the Financial District because it's always crowded at lunch time.  Tried it out with my roommate for dinner.  

I had the combination Pho and the shrimp spring rolls (fresh).  It was very tasty and the soup was nice and mild, but still had a good taste.  The service was friendly and it is still there "grand opening" so they are giving a free soft drink with a food purchase.  They do not accept credit card yet, but will soon.
author: Peter W.

description: I had a rice plate here today, #46--it was pretty good. I wish I ordered the garlic noodles but I didn't. My boyfriend ordered the pho and the broth wasn't very flavorful. Not BAD, but I've had better pho. Next time I am trying their garlic noodles! Service was friendly, nice area and would def come back!
author: Lynn C.

description: Ordered the garlic noodles, imperial rolls, and five spice chicken and I was so glad I did. The garlic noodles were not too oily and I love how the rotisserie chicken was so appetizing yet tender. The portions were more than enough and the price were reasonable. The only negative thing I do have to say about Perilla is the location-its not close enough to my house! But for the tasty garlic noodles and imperial rolls, its worth the drive.
author: C M.

description:
Great food! I love the rare beef pho', it's always good, sometimes the chef slices the beef extra thin which I love. Garlic noodles are really good. I've enjoyed everything I've tried. Sometimes the servers are spread a little thin, but the food comes quick, and is super fresh. every so often they are out of something but I guess thats the price you pay for how fresh the food is. Go there!
~J
author: Jamie S.

description: I got the garlic noodles, five spice chicken, and fried imperial rolls. I loooove crunchy foods and the imperial rolls were perfect! The garlic noodles and chicken were also very yummy. The staff showed my friend and me great hospitality and made us feel welcomed even though we stayed a little past closing time. Great food and great service, would definitely come here again :)
author: C K.

description: The brisket pho used to be good, but the last few times I have ordered it, it was stringy, chewy, fatty, and tasteless. Order the garlic noodles. They are still good.
author: Mimi J.

description:
Dinner and a show! Well, lunch and a show. Ok, not really a show, but there's still lunch. 

As we sat down for lunch, we order a Coke to quench that nagging thirst we worked up walking down here on a very rare sunny, hot day in the inner Sunset. The guy walks up to the table with a frosty Coke in one hand and a glass of ice in the other. He starts talking, we're not really hearing what he's saying, but he pops open the can and starts dumping Coke into the glass of ice. He sets the can (still emptying) on top of the glass and we watch with growing trepidation as the beverage quickly reaches critical volume. With a deft swipe of his wrist, he rescues the can and sets it down on the table, averting certain disaster. As the kicker, he takes the can, remaining Coke still inside, and leans it over to balance on its edge! All before we can even place our lunch order. Phew. 

I've been here several times and the quality is very good, although a few bucks more expensive than some other vietnamese restaurants in the area. Pho is $6-7 a bowl. Bun is about the same. The garlic noodles are the same they have at PPQ, so if you like them there, you should like them here. The options are pretty much the same across the board, so you choose your meat and decide if you want it with the garlic noodles, pho, vermicelli, or rice. The pho does have its MSG, though, so beware if you're one of those people that gets MSG brain. The five spices chicken is a sliced boneless chicken leg/thigh crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. Good flavor too, but it comes with the fish sauce to dip for your dining pleasure. The fried imperial rolls are delicious. Fried, fried, deliciousness. But you also get a few leaves of green lettuce to wrap around them. I like the pickled vegetables they add to the meals. 

Overall an excellent choice for the Inner Sunset. I predict spilling a few cans of soda as I try out that balancing can maneuver.
author: Saunders C.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but was fairly disappointed.

We ordered for delivery and were told on the phone that it would take about an hour, which is fine. But the food showed up after 90 minutes, not an hour. When I called the restaurant to inquire about the status of our order, I was treated politely but offered no apology for the lateness.

The driver wasn't carrying any change when he got to the door, and since he (for some odd reason) didn't park in front of our building, I had to wait while he ran down the block to his car to get change. He also offered no apology for the long wait.

The food was just so-so. One member of our group ordered the pork rice plate and two of us ordered vegetarian dishes. Nothing was bad, just rather humdrum and unimaginative.
author: Melissa M.

description: This place is good! I need to try the pho but the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken is what you should order! Came here for a bite with the gf and came back the next day with the parents. It was that good... had to bring them to try. The only draw back were all those flies flying around the restaurant. I will eat here a lot and probably get take out as well.
author: Gordon L.

description: I've wanted to try garlic noodles for the longest time because of the great reviews that I've heard. I ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and my friend got the grilled pork.  Both the chicken and pork was really good but I liked the pork better because the chicken had a layer of fat under the skin.  The garlic noodles didn't have as much flavor as I thought it would have....it tasted like the garlic noodles that I attempted to make at home!  The portions didn't look that big but I was very full and actually had to force myself to finish the last piece of chicken.
author: Amy C.

description:
Oh my garlic noodles.  This place is the real deal.  If you are looking to stuff yourself, you cannot go wrong with the imperial roll & [choose your favorite meat] garlic noodle combo.  My favorite is the beef ($9), my husband always gets the pork ($8).  

I haven't eaten in the restaurant yet -- we always have it delivered.  The guy answering the phone is friendly and happy to take your order, which is nice because most of the time when I call someplace I feel like I'm bothering them?  Like I've called their house number or something, and they wish I would just leave them alone.  Anyway, Perilla has got some kind of futuristic phone system going because dude always knows my phone number and it saves my name and address.  I should also note that my husband works second shift, so by the time he gets to his noodles, he's eating them cold, and he *still* loves them.  I wish I could convey to you in this short space what a persnickety diner my husband can be.  This is high high praise.

Also, maybe it's because we're just up the hill (about 5 blocks from the restaurant), but these guys deliver lightning fast.  My doorbell rings about 10 minutes after I hang up the phone each time.  Other restaurants in the area with delivery service never even come close to that.  Bonus: the delivery dude is really friendly.  I mean, I don't want to oversell it, it's not like you'll be best friends in minutes, but he really seems like he's happy to bring your amazing delicious dinner.  For the speed and the friendliness I always give him a good tip.

Give Perilla a call!  They'll treat you right!  And OH MY GARLIC NOODLES.
author: Ann H.

description: I loveeeee this place. I've been here once, and you can bet I'm coming back again! I love the garlic noodles with chicken. So damn good - and oily :)
author: Sharon G.

description: ordered the shrimp garlic noodles here, and really enjoyed them.  Good price, shrimp cooked well, liked the noodle texture.  Would definitely come back.
author: Phil J.

description:
Pretty good.

What I ordered and liked: Five spice chicken, garlic noodles (as good as hyped), and eggrolls ($9.50). Portions were filling, but would wish the pricing was a bit cheaper (can't always have it your way, oh well).

What wasn't to my liking: Shrimp plate, only 4 pieces and for $11.50 is ridiculous. The 3 colored drink was ok, nothing outstanding. The coffee was, in my opinion, very good, but for what seemed like a shot or two of coffee and an OD amount of ice, it's quite pricey ($3).

Servers were very friendly if you're wondering. 
Would come back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Kenneth L.

description: Read the reviews on yelp. Thought I'd try their garlic noodle.  I ordered (togo) the 5spice chicken with garlic noodles.  The food was decent. Pricing was reasonable.  Will have to try it again and see if its better fresh from the kitchen.
author: Sheenie L.

description: We came here on a late Wed afternoon, and got seated right away.  The garlic noodles had the perfect texture and but I wish it were a bit more flavorful.  However, it's great for those who don't like their noodles too garlic-y/spicy.  The 5 spice chicken was tender and decently seasoned, but nothing out of the ordinary.  We also got the pork bánh mì, which was was great (generous portion of the delicious pork, nice balance of veggies on crispy baguette).  Overall, good food and service at a fair price, but nothing to write home about.
author: Linda Z.

description: I always get the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The five spice chicken is yummy! Garlic noodles are my favorite part of the dish! The imperial rolls are just okay, I've had better. Regardless, I love this dish!
author: Mable J.

description:
Walked in here the day after they opened thinking it wad still toasties.

Anyways, we decided to give it a try the other night. 

Food was excellent. I had the charbroiled pork over rice and my buddy had the  charbroiled beef dish. 

Both were very good. Cooked perfectly and nicely seasoned.

We were given free Thai iced tea because of their grand opening.Also got some free hot tea.  

The service was great and decor and was nice and simple. 

Best part was the total was 17 bucks for a great meal.
author: Stefan T.

description: Love love love this place. When I'm craving garlic noodles and don't feel like going to Jasmin Garden and want something close by, Perilla hits the spot every time. Pho is BOMB, not like the cheap Pho spots. The beer is fresh as they slice it there. The imperial egg rolls YUM espcially with the garlic noodles. Parking can be a hassle though BUT well worth it!
author: Jennifer S.

description: pho has a nice broth that doesn't overwhelm you with msg and is well portioned with meat; i personally wish it were a little tastier and more flavorful. cha gio is authentic, thai iced tea is sweet, restaurant is new and clean, service is pleasant, and prices are right. didn't get a chance to try the garlic noodles but i'll try it next time i come here; if that's good i think perilla will easily be worth a bump to 4 stars.
author: Sherman L.

description: This place... is pretty good! The place does Vietnamese food right. Vietnamese food is not all about the noodles. I ordered the imperial rolls, five spice chicken and the garlic noodles for $9. The waiter was relatively uninterested in anything that we said other than what we wanted to eat. This place was great, the presentation and the taste was superb. I'd definitely choose this place over all the Pho places on Irving. This place rocks!
author: Ryan L.

description:
Tried both pho and garlic noodles here - Can say that the garlic noodles are excellent - some of the best in the city! I had 5 spice chicken. Also, charbroiled pork was very good.

Overall, service is good, staff are very friendly, and the place appears presentable. Nice addition to this neighborhood.
author: MandS R.

description: I've been wanting to go to Perilla for a while now.  Finally I had the chance to try it.  Obviously, I got the Five Spice Chicken w/ Garlic Noodle & Imperial Rolls because it's on everyone's review in yelp.  The garlic noodle didn't disappoint.  It was garlic-ed perfectly and it wasn't very oily/buttery.  I've seen places with a pond of oil at the bottle of the plate before.  The chicken was excellent, but not the best.  It was leaning toward dry.  The imperial roll was very good.  It was very crunchy and tasteful.  As for service, it was very good.  They keep coming to our table to fill our water.  I'll definitely recommend this place and will come back again =)
author: Calvin T.

description: Wow this place is good!  The service is also very attentive.  We just moved nearby and were looking for something good and quick.  Pulled out my trusted Yelp app and a few minutes later we were here.  The imperial rolls were very tasty as well as the food we ordered.  I had the beef with lemongrass and garlic noodles.  The beef was excellent and the garlic noodles were pretty good too.  My girlfriend had the five spice chicken over vermicelli and that was also quite good.  We would definitely come here again to try the other dishes that looked appealing.  The waiters were also very friendly and attentive.
author: Lam N.

description: Went here because we were looking for a PHO restaurant and were in the area.  No tripe, no tendon, no cartilage and way too clean for a PHO restaurant.  Other than that the PHO was pretty standard.  Good but nothing special.  I consider this one of those "Gringo" friendly vietnamese restaturants.  I don't trust clean PHO restaturants.  Had a side order of the famous "garlic noodles" and wasn't really impressed.  All they are is noodles sauteed with butter and garlic, nothing really special.  Would probably go back but I'd rather find a hole in the wall PHO shop with all the fixings.
author: Don T.

description: Had their pork and garlic noodles with spring rolls...YUM.  Service was a little on the brusque side, but the food is good, and I think if I became a regular they would be nicer (they were nicer to other singles in the restaurant because they looked to be regulars).  Decent prices and good location (not far from N Judah stop).
author: Jo S.

description: I had the beef brisket pho and unlike the beef pho at their Mission location, this was pretty disappointing--not enough broth, the brisket was tough (I mean really tough). The one thing I will say is that the $7.25 price tag is much more reasonable than the downtown price. I mean, can you really charge a $3 premium on the same dish?
author: ai f.

description:
Parking: It took us about 20 mins of driving around just to find parking. Perhaps it is because we are not from SF.

Food: garlic noodles and the chicken is good. Don't try their specialty "bun rieu" because it tastes AWFUL!.  I am half born with half Vietnamese ancestry do I know what it should taste like! The worst part is not even having the shrimp paste that usually goes with this dish! What type if restaurant offers the dish but not the accompany shrimp paste?!

Service: rude! When I asked for the shrimp paste, the waitress with the short black hair gave me a rude look and said "I try"....she didn't even said it nicely not at least respectful as if I am asking for a star from the sky!!! Guess what? Surprise suprise...no shrimp paste when my order came!

I wondered if I said everything in English she would of treat me differently! Not going back there!
author: C N.

description: Great food at a reasonable price. This place is always happening. Great addition to Inner Sunset
author: Johnny L.

description: Heads up!  Called to order banh mi and was told they no longer make them!  Too bad...
author: j d.

description:
finally got to try this place since i can never make it back in time to the city for the perilla in fidi.

i tried the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken and imperial roll.  it was a good sized portion and the garlic noodles were delicious!  you can choose this combo with the five spice chicken, beef, or pork.

the papaya salad was a great highlight of our meal as well, the portion was generous and it tasted amazing with a touch of sriracha.  i will definitely try this place again!
author: Carli F.

description: Awesomeee! I came here with some friends on a friday night and we were seated immediately. Our food came pretty quickly. Everyone got a dish with garlic noodles and we were all pleased. The lady that works there is also really friendly and funny!
author: Jessica C.

description:
This was one of those occasions where yelp did not lead me astray.  A good friend and I kinda unexpectedly found ourselves on our old stomping grounds- 9th & Irving, just a couple blocks from where we went to high school.  So much had changed since 2005 and we wanted some Vietnamese food, so we consulted our good and (usually) trustworthy yelp app and it brought us here.  We weren't too hungry so we split a bowl of pho and an order of spring rolls.
Now, I'm gonna start with the negative just to get it out of the way. 
*The service: Not very good. The server approached us to take our order after we had been sitting for less than a minute, and then didn't come back for about 15.  (To be fair she probably thought we had been there before, or always ordered the same thing when we went out for Vietnamese food, but was still a little frustrating.)
*Springrolls: Pretty blah... not much food or flavor packed in there.
"So, why the 5 stars?" you might ask.
The pho
was
that
AMAZING.
Seriously. From the perfect broth to the DELICIOUS beef, it was by far the best pho I've ever had. Highly recommend, come here for your Vietnamese food needs!!
author: Emma A.

description: This is definitely a place where I could see myself coming regularly when I'm too lazy to cook. The food is fresh and mildly healthy. As everyone else has raved about, their garlic noodles are delish. I tried the noodles with the grilled pork which was pretty good, but my girlfriend got the five-spice chicken which was PHENOMENAL~! It was well seasoned and juicy on the inside with a nice crispy skin on the outside. I loved it! The prices are also really great here, for two people it was under $20 for dinner. It's not super packed or loud because of the layout of the restaurant, so it's really good for conversation. I really recommend this place for cheap dates. Impressive and a money saver *wink wink*
author: Kevin L.

description: My friend from SF invited me for dinner here. Walked in for the first time and really liked the setting. Most Vietnamese restaurants I've been to the waiter would come only once to our table to take our orders. The waiter actually came to our table several times to ensure everything was ok and if we needed refills. So great customer service! I ordered the five spice chicken with imperial rolls. I gotta say, the five spice chicken was pretty darn good. Not your ordinary chicken you would get at Vietnamese restaurants. Would definately come back next time I am craving their five spice chicken!
author: Irene C.

description: Looking for some PPQ-style garlic noodles but at great cheap prices? Come here! 8 bucks gets you a big portion of garlic noodles with accompanying 5 spiced chicken....another buck gets you the same thing with imperial rolls. No, we didn't try the pho, and probably won't. I have this thing about pho in restaurants where the menu is purely in English.
author: Annie Y.

description: Walked all the way from our home to this place and we weren't disappointed. I had the Combination plate of BBQ Beef and Imperial Rolls and rice and just had one complaint there wasn't enough beef! Next time I'll wear my "Where's The Beef?" shirt from 1984 well, ok, no. At this point it's a tube top and not a good look for me. We also had the Pho with Beef Ball and watched the A's and Giants on the Big screen. I almost barfed my food out when Daric Barton struck out looking again. Ass!!!
author: graham c.

description: Garlic noodle is pretty good. The portion is big. For lunch we get five spice chicken PLUS imperial rolls (which were basically spring rolls) on the side. The price is cheap too so definitely a comfort food for people with big appetite.
author: Cliff T.

description: Hi, I am seven years old.  Also, I went to Perilla  on September 29, 2013.   I liked it because the staff were nice, they had a lot of good vegetarian things to eat,  and the pho was delicious.  One more thing, is I would recommend it to someone else.
author: Kevin F.

description: Dude.  They deliver.  Nuff said.  It's Vietnamese food awesomeness, simply put.  I got the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls.  Loved it.  I'm not a huge fan of Vietnamese food, and I'd definitely consider ordering from here again!
author: ROB L.

description: I really like the vermicelli and the garlic noodle dishes. Super reasonable prices, and good value for the money for sure. We are fans.
author: Mark B.

description:
love the fact that they have garlic noodles as a carb option w/their dishes.  prices are alright, portions are not ginormous, which is fine with me.  they are more generous w/the carb, and select on the meat portions.

we had:
chicken & imperial roll combo w/garlic noodles
pork & imperial roll combo w/garlic noodles
chicken & imperial roll combo w/vermicelli noodles
chicken w/rice

even better they deliver to our friends' home in the sunset!  we were lazy to cook or go out to dinner that night.
author: Sheri N.

description: The garlic noodles are awesome. I would recommend getting the five spice chicken over the other meat options. It's very nicely done and perfectly pairs with the garlic noodles.
author: E L.

description: Horrible service. Ordered a #1 beef noodle and waited 15 mins until they found out they forgot my order. When they finally got around to making my noodles, it took another 15 mins for it to come out. Portions are small. Cold vietnamese coffee is childs size compared to other restaurants on Irving. Nothing about this place makes me want to come back a second time...
author: Wilson T.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in the city. The Garlic noodles and the vermicelli are really good. The pho is good but not stellar. The place is very clean and the staff is friendly.
author: Mo B.

description: Man, I really used to like this place.  The garlic noodles are still okay, but the grilled prawns entree was really bad recently...Four really anemic shrimp with rice for $10 :(
author: Mike R.

description: I love the FIVE SPICE CHICKEN GARLIC NOODLE.  They are consistent in how they make this every time I get it or my friends get it.  Nice crispy chicken and the garlic noodles wasnt drowned in butter or garlic.  PAPAYA SALAD WITH CHARBROILED BEEF was pretty good. The IMPERIAL ROLLS AND CHARBROILED PORK VERMICELLI was really good just like Yummy Yummy but the PHO isnt comparable.  My fave is still Yummy Yummy PHO.  BUT if you like your PHO...lacking a better word...less salty I guess then try it here.  The portions are good and so is the service.
author: she q.

description: The food is great! The garlic noodles are so yummy. Not to mention the price range is totally affordable. I got kind of grossed out walking to the bathroom, but whatever, overall loved the food, loved the staff
author: Asia S.

description: Very good food and considerate of vegetarians. All veggie dishes come with tasty, soy-based, non-fish sauce. Cabbage tofu salad was excellent with nice crispy fried tofu strips. The Veggie combo garlic noodles were also very good and served as a very large portion; good for two meals. Many combo plates went by with Imperial rolls that looked great. A nice addition to the neighborhood!
author: Emily M.

description:
This is my first Yelp review in a long time, and my first 2-star review at that.

I was hoping for a good bowl of pho, or at least a decent one. What I got was a disappointing bowl with flat and bland broth. It wasn't inedible--I did eat the rare beef and well-done brisket, as well as the noodles. But I usually finish off the broth, just not this time. Strangely, the basil and the jalapenos that came with the pho were also bland and tasteless. Where was the flavor in all of this? I only had flavor in my meal because of the Huy Fong sriracha sauce. And no, I'm not a fire-eater who's burned out my palate. Thinking back to the menu, the only beef choices were rare steak, well-done brisket, and meatballs. No tendon, no tripe. It makes me wonder whether the blandness of the broth is caused by the not using all the beef parts.

Maybe this place is more about the garlic noodles and five spice chicken which other Yelpers seem to rave about here. But if you want better pho in the Inner Sunset, go to Yummy Yummy, even if you have to wait in line (although there's never been a line whenever I've gone there, but it is always busy). They have much more satisfying pho there.

Service isn't great here. While I do appreciate not being jumped on to have my order taken at the minute I sit down, I didn't need to wait ten minutes in a not-so-busy place for someone to come by. And I had to ask for water--the waiter never asked me if I wanted something to drink.

As I walked out, I noticed an empty table by the window where two barely eaten bowls of pho sat. Had I noticed that before I went in, I probably would have kept walking. And that's the other thing...when in the world were either of the two employees planning to clear that table?
author: Stacy L.

description: amazing noodles, but industrial grade chicken. why not charge an extra dollar and serve something sans salmonella?
author: Stephan T.

description: You wouldnt even assume this is an asian resturant but its pretty americanize with their design outside and inside. the place is a bit tiny so it can get crowded but got pretty quiet around 3pm. my first time here i ordered #21 garlic noodles with chicken. mhmm pretty satisfying. the chicken was very tender, with the skin being roasted and crispy. the noodle was decent all though maybe a little more garlic would be great. the owner seems really nice, took our orders within 30 seconds and got onto it right away. refilling your water every time it gets empty. definitely wouldn't mind coming back again.
author: Michael L.

description: Food is ok. The place is filthy though for a new restaurant. Anyone ever used thir restroom? What's the deal with the vase in the hole next to the sink?
author: Duy N.

description: Best pho I've ever had. Service was fast and prices reasonable (what you expect for pho - cheap). Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly. Broth was amazing. Would be curious to try the garlic noodles & other stuff some other time, but I'll have a hard time not ordering the pho over and over again.
author: Sam Z.

description: If I could give less than 1 star I would. First, their vegetarian pho consisted of 6 pieces of broccoli, chunks of the worst tofu I've ever had and overall flavorless. To top it off this place didn't even include the typical sprouts, basil, ect!!! Seriously?That is what half of what makes pho make pho. The food was beyond terrible. I am not one to generally write reviews, but this was so bad I felt compelled to. If you want edible pho go elsewhere.
author: Sarah E.

description: The Imperial Rolls & Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodle (item #27) was quite filling and an all-around satisfying meal. The three full-size but tiny crispy fried rolls came with sweet vinegar dipping sauce. There was enough of the tasty chicken thigh meat; I could taste of the five spice seasoning but it could've used a bit more. The egg noodles were served al dente (more chewy than mushy) and were nicely coated in butter sauce and had delicious garlic flavor.
author: Cliff W.

description: I came here after reading all the reviews about the five spice chicken and garlic noodles.  I wasn't impressed with the five spice chicken because I couldn't taste the five spices.  It tasted a lot more like regular fried chicken, and it was a little on the dry side.  The noodles tasted OK, but they tasted as if they had been heavily buttered.  For me, it defeats the purpose of eating Vietnamese, which I favor for its lighter cuisine.  The decor is well done, but the service is not the greatest.
author: Robert C.

description: Sick service and garlic noodles to die for.  Love the owners.  They stayed open late, complimented my watch, and generally made my night awesome.  Price also gets 5 stars.  Less than 30 for a great dinner sans booze.
author: Thomas B.

description: After going to their sister restaurant PPQ, and finding out that they were closed mondays, we ventured to Perilla. We ordered the beef satay soup, imperial rolls, beef pho, and the spring rolls. The imperial rolls were really good, but i have had better spring rolls from other Vietnamese restaurants.  The noodle soups we ordered were also really yummy, and flavorful. The beef pho here was great the soup was hot, and that's what i expect from pho on a cold day. All in all i would definitely return and try some other things from the menu!
author: Lily S.

description: I don't like Pho but they have good garlic noodles
author: Roman I.

description:
A serious disappointment. 

Read the reviews, saw the sign & ordered Garlic Noodles w/ 5-Spice Chicken. The noodles were...not right...tasted more garlic powder than fresh garlicky. They were somewhat soggy, and waaay too buttery (yes, it's possible). There were not 5 spices involved in any way with the chicken..it was ridiculously oily.

I don't think I'd go back....well, maybe, if someone else pays.
author: Sarah H.

description: Five spice chicken garlic noodles ftw!
author: Abhinav S.

description: Great garlic noodle dishes! and their Pho options are nice.  Great service brings me back every few weeks.
author: David Z.

description: My friend took me here for dinner and I ordered five spice chicken with garlic noodle. The garlic noodle was the best garlic noodle I ever eaten. When I was done I wanted more garlic noodle. The five spiced chicken was tasty and crispy and moist in the inside. Their customer service was attentive and friendly.
author: Lily T.

description: We only did takeout delivery, so I can't say anything about the restaurant itself, but for delivery: the food was very good, and it tasted healthy, not greasy, and it was delivered very promptly.
author: Syd S.

description:
Irving is a street writhe with Pho places. For one to stay on this street it is going to need something special. Unfortunately I can't think of anything that makes this place special other than the Grand Opening Special that gets one free ice coffee or tea with their meal.

The soup was typical of most pho places. The noodles were ok. Two things stood out for me. 1) the soup was only half full. It was a large bowl but it still made me feel like i had been jipped. 2) The ice coffee was served in a normal glass with crushed ice premade in the back. While the coffee was of typical flavor it is typical for a sit down restaurant to have the coffee made at the table.

If I've a hankering for pho and really want some ice coffee at the same time and they are still doing the free coffee thing then I'll drop in here, otherwise I'll probably walk the extra steps for Yummy Yummy or PPQ.
author: H B.

description: Perilla has amazing pho: their broth is much better than everywhere else I've gone in the Inner-Sunset. But I really love how friendly the staff is. One night, after being in lab for 12 hours, I had a massive pho craving, so I went to Perilla for take-out. Anyhow, when they handed me the broth, I dropper in on the floor, causing the plastic container to crack and leak like crazy.  Fortunately, they gave me a new container of broth for free--I love these guys!
author: Walter L.

description: Stopped in to have lunch on the way to the arboretum, we don't know the neighborhood well so we decided to try this place on a whim. This was one of those great finds you tend to have on a perfect day. The interior was clean, not crowded plus they had the ballgame on the TV. Overall the food was a good value with generous portions. We ordered the carpaccio and were both amazed on how crunchy and mild the onions were especially since they were very thinly sliced. I had the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and imperial rolls. The chicken was tender and flavorful, the imperial rolls crisp and the garlic noodles were also very good but a little light on the garlic compared to others I have had. The staff was very freindly and the restroom was clean, a definent plus in the city.
author: Travis M.

description: Yummy Garlic noodle dishes. I've tried all of them. The best ones I think are the five spice chicken and curry chicken. Good service and food comes out quick.
author: Dawn Z.

description:
