The imperial rolls were good, but you're paying $2 each if you order the appetizer sized version. Pho was not remarkable and kind of bland tbh. They're rather skimpy with the slices on onions and cilantro that go on top. Actually, I didn't get any slices of onion. 

If you get a rice plate with imperial rolls and meat, you get two imperial rolls, a mound of rice, and maybe a handful of meat and some broccoli. I'd come back for the garlic noodles and imperial rolls but never for pho again.
author: Crystal L.

description: Went to Perilla for lunch today, ordered the chicken pho and vegetarian pho with mushroom broth, the mushroom broth was light and delicious; however, the noodles lacked any flavor whatsoever needing to add extra hoisin sauce provided for on the table. I've had better pho in the avenues.
author: K H.

description: Didn't love this place, although the service and ambiance were fine (the interior is nicer than yummy yummy, but the service was not as friendly).  The pho was, as others have said, bland -- the beef was good, but the broth was not.  It was the first time I've been uninterested in eating more than a quarter of a bowl of pho.  Probably won't go back, even though yummy yummy is still closed.
author: Danielle G.

description: The veggie garlic noodles were delicious! The noodle bowl was also good - took away a star as they did not have vegetarian Imperial rolls, which I thought was very surprising. Nice ambiance and good service for a quick casual meal. Suprisingly kid friendly.
author: Shweta V.

description: the noodles are the bomb! :-) i was disappointed by the C-rate chicken though, it was obviously discounted stuff. poor quality, but the noodles were amazing! Get the vegetarian options though!!!!
author: Hello G.

description: WOW! Just like all the other reviews, I have to say that the Garlic Noodles were YUMMMMMY.  my bf had the Five Spices Chicken and Imperial Rolls, while i had it w/the port. . both were VERY good!  I am totally adding this restaurant to my weekly rotation.
author: Andee A.

description: Sooo good!!! Since I finally decided to eat her I dream about eating their garlic noodle and imperial rolls.  Delivery was super fast, hot and delicious...definitely 5 stars, but I think when I dined there the staff forgot about our table.  I never got my lemonade, our waters were empty and it took forever for us to flag them over for the bill.  So four stars in house.  They are still very quick about bringing you what they remember so if your mouth is drooling when you get there you don't have to wait long....Hmmm what is that delivery number again?  I'm hungry for some papaya salad.
author: Debora B.

description: I forgot to update for my second visit, but the garlic noodles are a bit too soggy for my taste.  I got the imperial roll vermicelli this time around and it was soooooooo good! it was just the right portion too, they add a layer of lettuce on the bottom so it's not just all noodle.  I like that, will come back just to eat this.
author: kim w.

description: Yelp never seems to fail me! I found this place on Yelp after searching for places to go to on Irving! We found parking right in front of the restaurant and was able to sit in front of the restaurant to watch my car since it was before six so the meters were still running. Was a bit skeptical about garlic noodles because it just seemed so plain to me but after looking through peoples review, I wanted to try something new and so I got the garlic noodles with chicken-it was sooooooo yummy. The price is resonable, and they give you big portions. The waiter was joking around and was showing us "magic tricks," while he poured our sodas out the can and into our cups. The wait time was not long at all, was up and outta there in less than an hour! Will be back for more :)
author: Melanie S.

description: If you wan't Pho, skip this place and go a little further down the street to Yummy Yummy. It's not that great here...and it always has kind of a weird to taste to it...at least in my opinion. I've also had their popular Garlic Noodles, which is what they're mostly known for, and wasn't really impressed. I found them too greasy for my liking.
author: Star M.

description: Just ordered here for delivery and my goodness...talk about speedy delivery. From the time I ordered to the food arriving at my door, it was a total of 18 minutes!! OMG..can you believe that?! Delivery took 18 minutes on a Saturday night!! Double score!!! I will definitely be back and can count on the awesome delivery service! You guys rock!!
author: Karen R.

description: I like how they give you huuuugeee portions and free thai ice tea or coffee for all your entree.
author: Sandy L.

description: The garlic noodles are amazing! Very nice addition to this neighborhood. I didn't eat in the restaurant though.
author: Stina I.

description: i can't say enough how much i LOVE five spiced chicken, especially if done right. this place does it very right. the secret?? skin ON! it's the best part! and red meat, no breast nonsense. their garlic noodles are a home run...correction grand slam! it's very garlicky with a hint of sweetness. the noodles have just the right amount of chew. paired with the five spiced chicken and it's...it's...it's damn finger lickin goooooood!
author: Melissa Y.

description: I have yet to eat here, I simply go for their che Vietnamese dessert beverage called Three Color Drink. It's super delicious and contains red bean, mung bean, and gelatin, with nice sweet coconut milk and ice. Their version is good but I do wish they wouldn't put so much crushed ice and instead use more coconut milk. I usually get three big sips in and then that's all, no more coconut milk. If any other Yelper's out there could recommend another place where I can get some more tasty che, let me know.
author: Ericka A.

description: this place horrible! you might as well eat a top ramen!!! dont waste your money here!
author: Robert G.

description: A little pricier than normal Vietnamese restaurants, but the place is clean, good service, and there is a section for garlic noodles.  I got a rice plate with the charbroiled pork and egg rolls.  The rolls were awesome.  I scarfed it down!
author: Neville B.

description:
garlic noddles are awesome. The price is really good. I went with a big group of people. For 12 people meal, they cook fast! 

The old man there is very enthusiastic. The restaurant environment and customer service is definitely 5 stars. The waiters/waitresses do not hover. ++!!
author: Selena L.

description: i dig it! this place is hot! i end up gettin the garlic noodles with5 spice chicken and spring rolls. definitely not a dissapointment. large amt of food and the chicken was delish. although i've had much better fried spring rolls they gave you three full rolls for just a dollar more compared to the garlic noodles and chicken by itself. it's a quiet place and quite popular.
author: Jason W.

description: Garlic noodles are excellent.  Accompanying pork slices were tasty and perfectly cooked.
author: Richard R.

description: Solid vietnamese. Loved the Imperial Rolls & BBQ Pork Bun (vermicelli); 5spice chicken; garlic noodles; 3layer drink, spring rolls (cold kind).  Kid friendly and relaxed.
author: MaomingSweetiepie Z.

description: Look, I appreciate great food and I love to eat.  But I don't get excited if something turns out mediocre.  After all, I'm going to eat again in 6 to 12 hours, right?  I read Perilla's great Yelp reviews and decided to give them a try.  Omigosh!  This food is to die for.  I looked at the menu online, called the Irving Street phone number, and had a delightful conversation with the order taker.  He arrived at my apartment within 30 minutes, smiling, and carrying hot, hot, hot food, attractively packaged.  The Imperial rolls, 5-spice chicken, and garlic noodles is the best platter I've EVER ordered.  There was more than enough to satisfy and the tiny pickled vegetables that accompanied the platter were perfect.  Thanks, Yelp, for helping me find this fabulous restaurant!
author: Carolyn C.

description:
honestly this place is not bad. i like it but not a fan just yet.  lol

i think they own ppq pho and ppq dungeness island because perilla is essentially the both combined in one.  two birds with one stone!!!! so not bad, don't have to commute from irving to get pho and then clement for some garlic noodles.  haha

for the price you pay, its worth it.  the meals are filling and tasty!  only down fall for me it's a bit overly greasy but i'm still going to eat it.  lol  ordered the pho #1 and five spices chicken with imperial roll and garlic noodles.    the pho broth is yummmy~  i wanna say exactly like ppq but i could be wrong.  lol  wish the imperial rolls where bigger!  only because my first imperial roll were from tu-lans and they one is so much bigger!  lol  other than that i thought it was good.  the garlic noodles are yummy as well~ mmmm~
author: mea f.

description: Pretty good.  Nice staff.  i recommend the chicken and bun.  They also have really good vietnamese coffee.  honestly wish i could give 3.5 stars though, not sure if it is worthy of a full 4 stars, but the reasonable price makes it worth at least 3.
author: Donovan W.

description: Great place to grab bite. Much like the one on Mission, this place is scrumptious - and I agree with folks about the garlic noodles - quite yummy.
author: Johnson H.

description: Don't get the PHO, it was not good at all. The people next to us ordered the garlic noodles with chicken and that looked great.
author: Katie C.

description:
I love this place. So here are the pros:

1. Very tasty imperial rolls! They are the best rolls ever
2. Awesome garlic noodle!
3. Very friendly and nice owner. 
4. Quick service
5. Even though they don't serve alcohol, the best part is you can buy your beer/wine in the convenience store next door and drink it here. They will bring your glass and gladly open your bottle but don't nickel-and-dime you with a corkage fee-:)

I am so happy to find this place. It's one those small little interesting place that makes the inner sunset such a charming place to live!
author: Anirban A.

description: After 2 hours and still no food I called. He told me it was delivered. When I explained it wasn't and asked what he would do he said he would cancel the order. When I asked for a refund to my card he just said fine and hung up on me. Well it has been a week and after two request for refunds I am still out $45. Buyer beware.
author: Saralyn C.

description:
Though most people would label the highlight of this restaurant as the garlic noodle, I would say that the greatest part of this place is the owner/server. He stands just about 5'6'', but his short stature is compensated by his unbelievably welcoming and enthusiastic personality. And his effect is contagious, indeed. 

Upon walking in, the owner would welcome you as if you were his very own son/daughter -- and that is how I felt like, son/daughter. He makes no distinction between gender, age, nor race. To him, all that enters are hungry, and all will be treated as hungry.

Unlike the standardized conversation of how many restaurants follow, the owner is special in that he not only would ask how your day was, but would push a conversation making you feel that this is an interaction between two human beings, and not just two strangers -- albeit you had just met. He wears a grand smile on his face, and in effect you would have no choice but to be emotionally vulnerable throughout your whole time in the restaurant. I didn't feel like I was entering a business, instead I was entering my home after a long absence. I wanted to cry.

I ordered the garlic noodle, grilled pork, and imperial rolls. They were great.
author: alfred t.

description: Delicioso! Great place for take-out - guilty as charged. The owner/manager is always so friendly. Probably the best take-out Pho in the neighborhood. Garlic noodles = yummy.  I just moved from the Sunset and will miss this place!!
author: Jeannie C.

description:
perilla is pretty okay. vegetarian broth seems lacking in flavor and the rice noodles are often a bit overcooked.

not a lot of choices in this area though!
author: Lizzie O.

description: Have had the pork vermicelli several times. Always killer! Quick service, friendly folks.
author: Matt F.

description: i dig it! this place is hot! i end up gettin the garlic noodles with5 spice chicken and spring rolls. definitely not a dissapointment. large amt of food and the chicken was delish. although i've had much better fried spring rolls they gave you three full rolls for just a dollar more compared to the garlic noodles and chicken by itself. it's a quiet place and quite popular.
author: Jason W.

description:
Went for lunch the other day.  Of course I had to try the garlic noodles--very good.  Still not Thanh Long--maybe I had a few too many beers when at Thanh Long.

Lunch was very good but parking during the day is a pain in the a*#.

When my buddy told me we were going to Perilla, I was expecting Italian--what's up with the name?
author: benwa h.

description: good food for good price. :) the grilled pork vermicelli and grilled chicken vermicelli are absolutely my favorite. the vietnamese beef noodle soup is okay. this restaurant does more than satisfying my asian cravings.
author: Minh An P.

description: After six years I have a new favorite Vietnamese place, and I eat a lot of Vietnamese food. In particular, Perilla has the most delicious papaya salad I've had in along time (and served in a heaping mound). The pho? I almost cried after the first bite... Wow. Quality meats, friendly service - get it while its good!
author: Paulo M.

description: New place, so I think they aim to please.  They did!  Ordered for takeout the #47 imperial roll, five spice chicken and garlic noodles.  The noodles are wonderful, lots of garlic, just great.  Imperial rolls were good, maybe nothing spectacular, but anything deep fried and crispy is pretty much a win, right?  Chicken was tender and very tasty.  The portions were very generous.  These folks get a hearty thumbs up from me, and I will be back.
author: Claus C.

description: Came last night after the Alice Summerthing festival.  We were all hungry and ready to eat. Izakaya Sozai had a line down and around the corner so we opted for this newer place here.. I believe it used to be toasties... anyway, yelped it and saw that many enjoyed the garlic noodles and five spice chicken, which is exactly what I ordered (+ imperial rolls).  I made the mistake of going to the bathroom before I started ordering to eat and saw all the pre-made chicken thighs all in a bucket and the kitchen didnt' look too clean either. and neither was the bathroom.  Before I got my food, I tried to clear that image from my head.. and told myself I'd be ok... since I've been vaccinated against Hepatitis A and all.  IIt's hard to enjoy your food when you've gone to the back and seen the floor to be wet and kitchen to be dirty... but anyway, got our food, and noodles were garlicky and dryish.. nothing special, had very faint flavors .. couldnt' really figure out though... is it .. vietnamese or ...italian ... ?... It wasn't out of this world or anything, I ate it nevertheless..  They give you ALOT too.I guess that's a plus..  The chicken had a good flavor and the skin was nice and crispy too but still a bit oily for me.  The imperial rolls (and I'm surprised they gave me so much!).. were pretty decent.  Freshly made and fried nicely, meat based with some vermicelli noodles inside.  The imperial rolls were  the best part of the meal.  Decent prices , for 3 of us was about $30. Overall, you're typical  vietnamese plates with a few twists-- kinda fusion - y.   Typical asian service and cleanliness...  Think Chinatown with slightly higher prices.
author: Margie C.

description:
I'm on a new kick checking out the restaurants in our neighborhood that we haven't been to yet.  Why not start with a brand new one.

We were greeted very warmly and the service was friendly and attentive.  We weren't in the mood for meat so we had the veggie summer rolls and the veggie combo garlic noodles.  They were both very tasty, but I probably wouldn't order the same combo again because they had very similar ingredients.

And yes, Free Delivery for orders over $20.  Score.
author: L. J. C.

description: ...... is it weird that the next time i go to perilla i'm seriously thinking about ordering a five-spice chicken with garlic noodles........................ no chicken, extra garlic noodles?!?! no, it's not like the chicken is that bad... it's more like the garlic noodles are that good! i know they're just noodles, but those are some damn good noodles.......
author: Brian L.

description: Whenever I crave for garlic noodles (2-3 times a week) I always come here. There isn't a better spot here in San Francisco that beats it. #27 5 Spice Chicken and Imperial rolls on Garlic Noodles is the recommended order!
author: Tim P.

description: I really like the grilled pork at this place for lunch. It's sliced thin, but tender, lightly charred. The imperial rolls are ok, I've had much better. The garlic noodles garlicky good, but too oily for my taste. I'd go back and try the lemongrass beef.
author: Anni b.

description: meh. the pho here was underwhelming. the broth was missing that special something. the rare beef was gamey and left that funky flavor throughout the broth. i got to give it up to their imperial rolls though. They went fast. As for location, its in a fun area,(AMAZING FANTASY down the block) but if you are driving, good luck trying to get a spot. Then again, you will work up quit the appetite while battling others for the next available parking!
author: Marcus S.

description: I was feeling really sick for several days and when that's the case I usually crave Vietname Pho. So my husband suggested Perilla which is just minutes from our house. Once we got there we realized they were owned by the same people at PPQ, which we love. We ordered Fresh Spring Rolls and Pho. Both were delicious and I will definitely be back. And hopefully not just when I'm sick!
author: Roxy G.

description: The rice dishes and pho are pretty standard (3 to 3.5 stars); the low rating is for the service, which ranges from perfunctory to scary. Most recently, the waiter yelled at a patron for not explaining the order properly.  Personally, I find this kind of drama interesting to witness, so I'll probably return--but I'll do so alone: I'll certainly never drag any of my unsuspecting friends here: not everyone appreciates witnessing customer abuse as I do.
author: Anton W.

description:
a satisfying lunch

combo garlic noodle with five spice chicken and imperial roll hit the spot and was reasonably priced at i think $9. good hearty flavors, which a bit unfortunately made tasting the curry chicken soup vermicelli somewhat bland afterward. But really, I'd be game to try any of the other pairings just to eat the garlic noodle again.

Service was friendly and attentive without being cloying. I liked the bit of cucumber in the water.
author: R L.

description: So after sulking away from a long wait-list for ebisu, I was looking for a place to take my guests from Houston.  Perilla had a Grand Opening sign with free Thai iced tea and our spirits were lifted.  What can we say: oh Perilla's Vietnamese food is just as good as Houston's which has one of The largest Vietnamese populations.  What we liked were the garlic noodles b/c they tasted fluffy and garlicky.  The food tasted really clean and not greasy like most places.  Vegetarian roll was so good that i had one moment where I thought I could become vegetarian if I ate them everyday.  The wrap was soft and fresh.  Grilled Beef was very succulent and not burnt like most places, but tender on a medium well side.  Basically food was so flavorful that u didn't need the fish sauce at all!   Wait staff was friendly chatty and told us they are sister store to PPQ.  Thai ice tea is good.  Next time we are in Sunset we definitely are going here!
author: Lisa H.

description: Best noodles in the Sunset, hands down.  I don't care if it is authentic or not: they have much higher quality noodles and meat than the other guys.  My favourite is the Veggie Vermicelli.  My husband (who is not usually a big noodle fan) really likes the 5-spice chicken with Imperial Roll.  My mom (who is a big Pho fan) likes the wide noodle Pho with 5-spice chicken.  Note: the floor was incredibly clean (my son started rolling around on it, so I noticed).  We received a huge plate of bean sprouts and basil (more than we needed, frankly), so I don't understand Vlad's comment.
author: S-R N.

description: Had the #39- imperial roll and charbroiled beef. This was great, like most people know its all starts with the rice, nice and fluffy, giant scoop. Beef was flavorful and tender with a slight char on it which added to the texture. Owners were very nice and answered questions thoughtfully. One guy heading out even said 'thanks for coming to my neighborhood. I guess for the pho, its no go for some and ok for others. And I see they deliver.
author: Shelly T.

description: yummy! garlic noodles, choice of meat, and imperial rolls for 8.95! it was so good! also the papaya salad was amazing and they give u alot.
author: Karen H.

description: imperial rolls are good, but very thin.  service is really good.  the bun is a very important when evaluating a vietnamese place.  this one falls very short.  only lettuce for veggies=big mistake.  bigger mistake that the lettuce was brown.  the garlic noodles are where its at, but i have to say that all of the meat is underwhelming.  try sunflower or PPQ.  much better.
author: Timothy S.

description: for pho its all about the broth and this place is alright.def one of the best in sf.
author: dan e.

description: I love this place.  So tasty and not expensive.  Friendly service, lots of great food.  My mother-in-law had the  5 Spicy Chicken Pho! Out of sight broth and the chicken was cooked like a crispy duck!  I had the Imperial roll and charbroiled beef noodle bowl, fantastic!  Great place
author: K. R.

description: My new favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF! Love garlic noodles, love imperial rolls... what's not to love about this place?? The garlic noodles were a heaping pile of yum and weren't as oily as I've had them before (plus!) but I will say that they can never add too much garlic. I've had the above combo with 5 spice chicken, shrimp, and charboiled beef -- all very delish. This place is a tad tiny. I came with a party of 20 once and we took up more than half their venue. Also, a little pricier than other Vietnamese joints nearby but they make it up in cleanliness (granted, it is still relatively new) and service. In accommodating our huge party, quite near closing might I add, they were still very friendly and helpful. I came knowing they weren't known for their pho (per other yelpings) so yes, I wouldn't come here for their pho. But when I'm craving some garlic noodles and imperial rolls, which can be often, this is my place!
author: Cynthia W.

description: 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles!!! one of my favorite places. service can be a little bit slow though
author: David C.
